description: PARIS  Now that the Japanese have retreated, the French are saying with mixture of pride and alarm that they are standing alone in the front line against the dollar. Doubt is growing that the line can long be held.

title: JETS AND GIANTS LOSE;
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 9Seven touchdown passes, four by Terry Bradshaw and three by Bob Davis, dominated a 3521 victory for the Pittsburgh Steelers over the New York Jets tonight in the opener of the 10th annual pro football exhibition doubleheader before a sellout crowd of 82,710.

title: BLACK MIGRATION TO SOUTH IS URGED
description: NEWARK, Sept. 4.Dr. John Cashin, chairman of the predominantly Black National Democratic Party of Alabama, tonight urged a mass reverse migration of blacks from the North to the South. He said this would be the quickest way for blacks to take over political control of entire states.

title: Tornado Tops Lancers, 31, To Tie Soccer Playoff Series
description: DALLAS, Sept. 4 (AP)The Dallas Tornado evened its North American Soccer League playoff series with Rochester tonight, beating the Lancers, 31, before 6,131 fans at Franklin Field.

title: For Young Readers
description: The passes are almost impassable, the weather intolerable, the beans and rice uneatable after the first week, and all the gold in the world isn't worth what you have to go through to get it. En route to the Klondike, many give up, but in Evelyn Nevin's novel four don't. They are Chee Chee McNerney, a 14yearold halfIndian girl who was deserted by her Irish father, and her three peculiar companions  Jim Berne, a blunt, quicktempered redhead who claims to be her uncle; Old Maiden, a persnickety older man; and Peter the Pig, a 17yearold boy whose pinkandwhite face matches his nickname.

title: Pope Pius Said to Have Role in 1956 Peron Burial
description: ROME, Sept. 4Priests in the Vatican said today that the late. Pope Pius XII was personally involved in the secret burial of Eva Duarte de Pern, wife of Juan Pern, the former Argentine President, in or near Rome early in 1956.

title: Princess Anne Adds To Equestrian Lead
description: BURGHLEY, England, Sept. 4 (UPI)Princess Anne, on Doublet, increased her lead in today's second stage of the European threeday equestrian championship and now is on the verge of becoming the first royal winner of the title.

title: Marsha Witham Plans Wedding New Year's Eve
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Sept. 4The engagement of Miss Marsha Lynn Witham to Francis Chase Whitman Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Whitman of Norwalk and West Harwich, Mass., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Bertram H. Witham of Stamford.

title: Letters:
description: .. If youth is to have the privilege of traveling so broadly and inexpensively, why not extend it to the huge army of grandparents? We could fill up those empty seats if the air fares were more economical.

title: BacktoSchool Business: a Mixed Picture
description: In Miami, the resort economy has been soft and rather disappointing this year, but backtoschool business, which has opened up somewhat better than last year, may offset that as far as local stores are concerned.

title: Super Wave, $2.60, Takes National Pacing Derby by 2 Lengths at Westbury
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Sept. 4At no stage during the mileandaquarter National Pacing Derby at Roosevelt Raceway tonight, not even when Super Wave trailed the leader, Frank T. Ace, by 2 lengths, did the 3to10 favorite give his followers reason to fret.

title: Do Men Really Hate Women?
description: MAYBE shmuckdom is what you need to stay young and open, the impotent Jonathan (played by Jack Nicholson) says to his best friend, Sandy, a case of arrested development (played by Arthur Garfunkel) in Carnal Knowledge. This is one of the messages framed and set up on the screen for us by writer Jules Feiffer and director Mike Nichols, who are not young and Open, but who have achieved a kind of parallel malefemale shmuckdom in this grim satire about depersonalization. They have also achieved a picture in which the usual stereotypes are once again blown up on screen as the real thing: woman as wifemother figure; woman as vapid female Oblomov, helpless and suicidal; woman as tough, metallic bachelor girl, and woman as prostitute. They are accused of being castrators and are feared because, as Nicholson explains to Garfunkel, Women today are better hung Ulan the men. We all know that it is the male who is most terrified of women who is likely to come on like gangbusters: clicking the marbles in his wrinkled pouch with sham bravado!

title: Young Hoodlums, Scorning Tradition of Hard Work, Plague San Francisco's Chinatown
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 4The slender, middleaged Chinese man stood quietly the other night a few feet from two towering policemen who were leaning on a patrol car talking to a friend inside.

title: BUSING OPPOSITION STIFFENS IN SOUTH
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 4  After a week of relatively quiet school openings, resistance to integration through busing seems to be on the rise around the South.

title: SCHOOL BOARD MOVE ON BUS FARE SCORED
description: A Board of Education proposal to eliminate cutrate fares on public transportation for some school children was assailed yesterday by two City Councilmen.

title: IMMUNITY CASE DISTURBS MANY
description: Prosecutors are anxiously waiting for the Supreme Court to settle a constitutional controversy over recent laws designed to compel witnesses to testify by granting them limited immunity from prosecution.

title: M. S. Marmot to Wed Susan Smith
description: WEST B.LOOMFIELD, Mich., Sept. 4Miss Susan Elaine Smith and Martin S. Marmor, both 1971 graduates of Cornell University, plan to be married Jan. 1 in Risley Hall on the Cornell University campus in Ithaca, N. Y.

title: Giants Down Astros, 10, Behind ThreeHit Pitching of Carrithers
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 4 (UPI)Don Carrithers pitched the best game of his brief career in the major leagues today, shutting out the Houston Astros on three singles as the San Francisco Giants defeated the Astros, 10, and extended their winning streak to five games.

title: Sudden Death Is Not Remarkable
description: THEY are so very serious. The youngsters who have come trouping into the main plaza at Lincoln Centerfrom all of the neighborhoods of New York City, from Washington, D. C., and from as far away as Watts in Californiato perform the improvised plays and readings and rock musicals that now constitute the phenomenon known as Street Theater are of course ready on cue to thrust their heads forward from rhythmwracked shoulders, to let their hips lurch away from them in instinctive response to a beat, to lock their hands over their heads and prance ponystyle across the mall. It was to be expected that they could do these things, andhaving been born to the itchdo them well. But who would have guessed behave with such gravity?

title: Leaders of 3 States Back Bicentennial Site on River
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 4 (AP) Meeting in historic Congress Hall at Independence Hall, the leaders of three states have endorsed the Delaware River site for the bicentennial celebration and ordered an immediate feasibility study on the plan.

title: For the Very Rich, Summer's Last Fling on the French Riviera
description: CAP D'ANTIBES, Sept. 4The villas of the rich and the campsites of the poor are slowly being closed along the Riviera these days of approaching fall. Last night under a still balmy sky, 400 of the world's most prominent and not so prominent rich gathered in this relatively isolated point on the Mediterranean coast, to give a kind of coup de grace to the summer season in Europe.

title: Deportation Order Is Reversed In Dispute on War Protest Ad
description: MILWAUKEE, Sept. 4An Italianborn antipoverty worder here has apparently won her twoyear fight against deportation in what observers believe is a significant victory for aliens' rights of free speech.

title: Virginia Deeanne Newell Is Bride Of Paul Dwaine Payne in South
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., Sept. 4Miss Virginia Deeanne Newell, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. G. F. Newell, was married here this afternoon to Paul Dwaine Payne, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul D. Payne of Akron, Ohio. The ceremony in the First Baptist Church was performed by the Rev. Howard Cunningham, pastor of the United Church of Christ in Raleigh.

title: Marcia Brown Upstate Bride
description: MEXICO, N. Y., Sept. 4The marriage of Miss Marcia Jean Brown to Michael C. Madden, son of Mr. and Mrs. Roger C. Madden of Greenwich, Conn., took place here this afternoon.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  The crosscountry front runner is a sight to behold. He sets the pace, but loping behind and liable to overtake him at any moment are rivals who may possess bigger lungs, sturdier legs and greater stamina. The front runner can not be blamed for glancing frequently over his shoulder.

title: Reading Railroad Threatens To Halt Commuter Service
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 4 (AP) Officials of the Reading Railroad threatened today to discontinue commuter lines carrying 25,000 daily passengers unless the railroad can win higher subsidies from the Southeastern Pennsylvania Transportation Authority.

title: News of Dogs
description: The Rockland County Kennel Club long has contributed to worthy causes. Proceeds from its shows have gone to veterinary medicine and a nursing scholarship fund. Today, at its silver jubilee fixture, Rockland will also be contributing to its latest projectthe HiTor Animal Care Center.

title: Thorn in Cowan's Side Removed by Bee Sting
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Sept. 4 (AP)Gary Yohe, the caddie who aroused the ire yesterday of Gary Cowan in the Amateur golf championship, was stung by a bee today and taken from the Wilmington Country Club course in an ambulance.

title: Barbara Metzenbaum Plans Bridal
description: SHAKER HEIGHTS, Ohio, Sept. 4  Miss Barbara Jo Metzenbaum and James D. Bonner will be married here Sept. 18 at the home of the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Howard M. Metzenbaum, who have announced the engagement of the couple. Miss Metzenbaum's father was the unsuccessful Democratic nominee last year for the United States Senate seat from Ohio.

title: Engineer to Marry Josephine M. Vanni
description: HOHOKUS, N. J., Sept. 4Mr. and Mrs. Mario A. Vanni have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Josephine Marie Vanni, to John Edward Anderson. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John F. Anderson of North Brunswick.

title: DELAWARE STAKE TO GOOD COUNSEL
description: STANTON, Del., Sept. 4 (AP) Mrs. John W. Galbreath's Good Council won the $30,900 Rosemont Stakes at Delaware Park today under Bill Hartack.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The SmootHawley protective tariff of 1930 was greeted with joy by businessmen and the stock market. The stifling of international trade that followed deepened the Great. Depression.

title: The Greatest Trip in the Whole World
description: THE old Willys Jeep, burdened with people and baggage, rumbled through the main checkpoint and, accelerating past the sprawling, Military Assistance CommandVietnam headquarters, turned abruptly to pull up and park in front of Vietnam's only international airport. Tansonnhut was a familiar sight to me, but this time it somehow looked differentas Mecca would to the devoted Moslem or Lourdes to the hopeful cripple.

title: Muskie Sets Out Today on Trip To Solidify Political Support
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4Senator Edmund S. Muskie will set out tomorrow on a fourmonth quest for the issue, the political support and the campaign cash required to solidify his position as the frontrunning candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Cassie Red Is Victor
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 4 (AP)Cassie Red, who won last week's Chicago Handicap at 221, scored a threelength victory today in the $33,600 Sun Beau Handicap before 22,157 spectators at Hawthorne.

title: Sixkiller to Stir Big Wind in Pacific
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 4There's a big wind sweeping out of the northwest that could blow clear to the Rose Bowl.

title: Soviet, Increasing Attack, Says China Has Military Psychosis
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 4The Soviet Press today stepped up its campaign against China, charging Peking with militarizing society and forcing economic sacrifices on Chinese workers in order to divert resources to military preparations.

title: The Nation
description: The battle lines were drawn years ago. On one side, those who pointed to the serious and growing electric power shortage in the United States and insisted that only rapid expansion of nuclear power plants could fill the need. On the other, environmentalists who said that widespread ecological damage from the proliferation of atomic power plants would far outweigh the, benefits. An attempt to find some common meeting ground was made in the National Environmental Policy Act of 1970 which said that in licensing new nuclear power plants, the Atomic Energy Commission should take into account what effect such plants would the environment.

title: MEANY SUPPORTS EQUITABLE CURBS Al END OF FREEZE
description: George Meany, looking toWard the end of the national freeze on wages and prices, says that organized labor would cooperate in a voluntary plan of wageprice controls that were fair and equitable.

title: SummerSchool Record
description: GARDEN CITY, L. T., Sept. 4 A record total of 16,316 students attended Nassau Community College's summer sessions this year. The enrollment represented a 3.6 per cent increase over last year's figure. Day enrollment totaled 7,826, and evening attendance, 6,888. A total of 1,602 students took both clay and evening courses.

title: Con Ed to Miss Deadline For Davids Island Plant
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Sept. 4  Consolidated Edison has informed officials of this city that it cannot meet a deadline for an application to build four nuclear power plants on Davids Island, half a mile offshore here.

title: VIRGINIA BUSING PLAN IS UPHELD BY BURGER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. (UPI)  Chief Justice Warren E. Burger refused today to halt a school busing plan scheduled to take effect Tuesday in Arlington, Va.

title: Party for Senator Brooke
description: FRAMINGHAM, Sept. 4 (AP) Senator Edward W. Brooke, Republican of Massachussetts, is scheduled to be honored at a $100aplate appreciation birthday party Oct. 26.

title: The World Of Edward is HopperThe drama of light, the artificiality of nature, the remorseless human comedy
description: EDWARD HOPPER was a man of stubborn loyalties. During career that stretched back for nearly seven decades as a painterfrom 1900, when he began studying with Robert Henri, leader of the Ashcan School, until his death in 1967, at the age of 847Hopper remained dedicated to one wife (Josephine Nivison, a Henri student as well, whom he had married in 1924); one dealer (Frank Rehn, who had given him his first oneman gallery exhibition the same year); a style of painting that remained uncompromisingly realistic through every major movement and minor fad that shook the art world. (Hopper had lived past a good many of them: from Fauvism and Cubism, early in the century, to the American styles Abstract Expressionism, HardEdge, Pop Artthat dominated the international scene in his old age, when he was regarded as the country's foremost realist.)

title: Peronists Hall Move
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 4 (Reuters)Peronist leaders here today hailed the return of the body of Mrs. Pern to her husband as a step in the right direction In President Lanusse's hid to restore democracy in Argentina.

title: EWING LEADS GOLF BY 2 SHOTS ON 132
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn., Sept. 4Jack Ewing, a husky Bakersfield, Calif., professional who has not been able to break into the top 100 moneywinners on the golf circuit this year, scored a fourunderpar 67 today to lead the $110,000 Greater Hartford open with 36hole aggregate of 132, which is 10 under par.

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Memoirs Tie Bormann to Soviet
description: A manuscript described as the memoirs of Gen. Reinhard Gehlen, former head of the West German intelligence service, asserts that Martin Bormann, Hitler's top lieutenant, was a Soviet agent during World War II.

title: L.I. Diary of 2 Days in the Dark
description: Tropical storm Doria blustered through Long Island last weekend, knocking out power in 250,000 homes, many of which remained without electricity into the early part of the week. Here is one man's diary of what it was like to spend a couple of days in the dark.

title: Sebastian doesn't travel into middle age
description: Weeks after we had seen the movie version of Shane, my bantling pals and I were still aping the sullen, deadly moves of the fell gunfighter played by Jack Palance, and mocking the awshuckseries of the solemn, whitehatted hero, Alan Ladd, who shot our man down. We were too young to understand or much to care why, but our impulsive sympathy during those Eisenhower dog days was for the outlaw. A bit later, at the end of the fifties, our professors lectured to us about antiheroesbuzzbuzzand outside our readings lists we fetched up with the rogue of our dreams, the Ginger Man himself, name of Sebastian Dangerfield and the invention of J(ames) P(atrick) Donleavy.

title: Fatal Stabbing in Hotel
description: An unidentified man about 50 years old was found stabbed to death yesterday in the University Hotel at 673 Broadway, near Third Street, in Greenwich Village. The body, fully clothed, was found by a guest on the floor of a bathroom on the seventh floor of the hotel. Although there were no identification papers, according to the police, the victim had $40 in his pockets.

title: Haughton Is Grooming Another SuccessHis Son
description: The trim, grayspeckled man of 47 stood on the grassy bank of the last turn at the little track at the Carlisle (Pa.) Fair and shouted, Peter, you can't go three deep around this turn, don't do it.

title: Science
description: Of all the aspirations of man to control his environment, few compare in sheer chutzpa with the desire to pull the teeth of hurricanes, those careening, roiley whirlpools of air and water that equal the energy of 100 megatons of hydrogen bombs.

title: Dollar Selling in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Sept. 4 (Reuters)Active dollar selling continued on the Tokyo exchange market today as bankers and traders anticipated prolonged floating of the yen.

title: Private School Tuitions Set Records
description: The 60 nonreligious private schools in the city will reopen this week and next with record tuitions, generally full enrollraents, new courses in such fieldsas Asian studies and contemporary literature and droves of applications for few faculty vacancies.

title: EDWARD C. POTTER, WRITER ON TENNIS
description: Edward Clarkson Potter, a leading writer on tennis and a former partner in Georgeson & Co., financial consultants here, died yesterday in Coral Gables, Fla., where he lived. His age was 85.

title: HELMUTH WOLFES, CONDUCTOR, DEAD
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 4 (AP)Helmuth Wolfes, former conductor of the Berlin State Opera, died today at his home in suburban Cleveland Heights. He was 70 years old.

title: California Busing Foes Backed By Former Governor of Florida
description: OXNARD, Calif., Sept. 4The antibusing campaign in this small southern California town has become something more than a local issue as a result of the visit of Claude R. Kirk Jr. of Florida to a fundraising rally at the Oxnard Cominunity Center.

title: Defense for Sheik Mujib Reportedly Wins a Delay
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Sept. 4The treason trial of Sheik Mujibur Rahman, the Bengali nationalist leader, has been adjourned to allow the defense time to prepare its case, a highly placed source reported today.

title: Lisa Edsell Affianced to Thomas Evered
description: CEDARHURST, L.I., Sept. Mr. and Mrs. Ralph James Edsell Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lisa Jane Edsell, to Thomas O'Hara Evered, son of Mr. and Mrs. John O'Hara Evered of Cinnaminson, N.J.

title: REVENUE SHARING CANADA TRADITION
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 4Canada has had revenuesharing for 104 years, and she still has not settled on how to do it.

title: Coins
description: BURTON HOBSON'S Historic Gold Coins of the World, released recently by, Doubleday, has scored a first in the field of numismatic literature. The 192page hardbound volume is the first on coinage to carry all its illustrations in full color.

title: Confusion on Phase Two
description: Organized labor appears to be just as confused as the Administration on what kind of wageprice restraints should follow the present ninetyday freeze. George Meany, most vocal critic of President Nixon's new economic policy, seems to be moving more and more determinedly toward some carbon copy of the old War Labor Board as the ideal instrument for governing peacetime wages thirty years later.

title: Born Wild, $16.20, Wins Handicap Race at Del Mar
description: DEL MAR, Calif., Sept. 4 (AP) Westerly Stud's Born Wild rallied in the stretch to edge a 501 shot, Perpetual, by a neck today in the $27,200 Escondido Handicap at Del Mar race track.

title: Ottilie Sweet Engaged
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., Sept. 4  The engagement of Miss Ottilie Robin Sweet to Andrew Stuart Wile, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Wile of Willimantic and Bridgeton, Me., has been announced by the prospective bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Stephen S. Sweet of Middletown.

title: Allende Hints at Nonpayment
description: SANTIAGO, Sept. 4 (AP)President Allende hinted tonight that his Government might not pay compensation for nationalized United States copper interests.

title: Squires Sign Adrian Smith
description: NORFOLK, Va., Sept. 4 (AP) Adrian Smith, who played ten seasons in the National Basketball Association, was signed as a free agent today by Al Bianchi, coach of the Virginia Squires of the American Basketball Association.

title: OVION, FRANCE, WINS IN ROAD CYCLE RACE
description: MENDRISIO, Switzerland, Sept. 4 (AP)  Regis Ovion earned France its first world road cycling gold medal in six years today when he won the men's amateur race.

title: Chess
description: THE final match of the Candidates' series, between America's Bobby Fischer and exworld champion Tigran Petrosian of the Soviet Union will begin in a few weeks, but most people are not talking about what will happen in that match, but in the one after it. After I take care of Petrosian, Bobby himself has said, I go on to play Spassky, and indeed there isn't anyone in the chess world outside of Russiaperhaps outside of Petrosian's native Armeniawho doesn't think Bobby will take care of his next. opponent as easily as all that.

title: ALABAMA SCHOOLS SCORED ON BLACKS
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Sept. 4Sharp decreases in the number of black educators, particularly principals and coaches, in Alabama public schools over the last four years have led an education study organization to conclude that local school boards have a tacit policy aimed at the elimination of blacks from the educative process.

title: Coins
description: MAURITIUS, a beautiful island in the Indian Ocean, will issue its first gold coin in October commemorate the third year of its independence, it was announced by Spinks of London, world agent for the Bank of Mauritius.

title: Hickel Asks Morton to Keep Ban on Hunting Musk Oxen
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska, Sept. 4 (AP)Walter J. Rickel, former Secretary of the Interior, has asked Rogers C. B. Morton, his successor in President Nixon's Cabinet, to continue a ban on the public hunting of musk oxen on the Nunivak Island National Wildlife Range.

title: Royals Top White Soft
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 4 (AP)Gail Hopkins's tworun homer capped a threerun thirdinning outburst tonight that carried the Kansas City Royals to a 31victory over the Chicago White Sox.

title: CATHOLIC DIOCESES GET FISCAL ADVICE
description: The American Bishops of the Roman Catholic Church have released a set of guidelines for local dioceses on how to record and publicize their financial, status.

title: Vindicturn Takes Dash
description: NARRAGANSETT, R. I., Sept. 4 (AP)Vindictum, with a time of 1:11 1/5, won the $5,000 Providence Handicap today in the first running at Narragansett Park since the spring of 1970.

title: Panel Will Choose Head Of L. I.U. Brooklyn Unit
description: The chancellor of Long Island University said last week that he would appoint a screening committee within the next month to select a successor to Alexander Aldrich as president of the university's Brooklyn Center.

title: Devaluation by Agreement, Not Fiat
description: PERU, Vt.Internationally, President Nixon's new economic policy recalls one of F.D.R.'s worst mistakesthe London economic conference of 1933. We have proved that we can take Violent unilateral action, which may give transitory satisfaction to dome. But if devaluation was justified, we could have devalued at lesser risk by agreement and not by fiat.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR: It is most unfortunate that there is a large segment of our population that will read a motion picture review in your newspaper and, depending on the reviewer's comments, will either see or not see the film. I fully recognize that this is the purpose of having a motion picture critic; however, the results are not always justified.

title: U.S. Says Apollo 15 Data Are Shared With the World
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 4 (Reuters)The United States assured the United Nations today that the scientific benefits of the Apollo 15 moon mission were being shared with experts from many countries.

title: CHIEFS TIE CARDS ON STENERUD KICK
description: KANSAS CITY, Sept. 4 (UPI) Jan Stenerud kicked a 28yard field goal with no time remaining tonight, giving the Kansas City Chiefs a 1717 tie with the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: David's just wild about diction
description: Books by David Slavitt aren't actually reviewed. Critics seize upon them as opportunities to snipe at him for his histrionic disdain of them. Muggers, sex maniacs and murderers may find forgiveness, but there's no sympathy for Slavitt, who committed literary sacrilege by making fun of what he calls the Quality Lit Bizand, worse yet, making money by making fun. An accomplished poet, he frequently mocks the profession. An astute commentator on current literature and cinema, he has stated that most criticism is slightly refined gossip. A talented comic novelist, he tossed off (under the, pseudonym of Henry Sutton) a trio of bestselling potboilers that filled his enemies with outrage and envy, and his coffers with coin of the realm.

title: Donohue Skirts Talk of Plan in California 500 Today
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Sept. 4At the drivers' meeting this afternoon, the track announcer of Ontario Motor Speedway asked Mark Donohue about his plans for.running the California 500 tomorrow.

title: Oilers Tip Bears, 3717
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 4 (AP)A rookie quarterback, Dan Pastorini, sparked the Houston Oiler offense and the defensive unit victimized the Chicago Bears tonight for a 3717 victory.

title: Rehabilitation Plan for Venice Is Stalled by Local Bickering
description: ROME, Sept. 4Amid a controversy over the future of Venice, a top board of Government experts here is attempting to win enactment of a master plan for the city's survival. The plan is stalled by bickeirng local factions.

title: Costs Spur DoItYourself Moving
description: When Mrs. Macelue Henderson moved from New York to Detroit recently, her family considered having her possessions shipped by a professional moving company. The estimated cost was $600.To save money, her daughter and soninlaw, Mr. and Mrs. Ezekiel McKinney, decided to rent a truck and move the furniture for her. The cost: $157.

title: State Starts Crackdown On Blockbusters in City
description: The state government's in vestigation of blockbusting in four Brooklyn and Queens communities has produced evidence indicating the involvement of three real estate brokers in the campaigns in the areas to provoke panic selling by homeowners.

title: TEENAGERS WORKING IN A PARK PROGRAM
description: A group of teenagers have been digging up Central Park for the last couple of weeks and cutting bushes and pulling down trees. And they will keep on doing it for two weeks more or so under a program sponsored by the Parks Council, an independent citzens' group dedicated to promoting better use of the parks.

title: City Opera Performs Louise With Carol Neblett in the Lead
description: Since Charpentier's Louise hardly what one would call a hit as operas go, it was somewhat surprising that the New York City Opera gave it secondnight billing in the company's early fall return to the New York State Theater. Nevertheless, there it was Friday night, and a sizable audience turned out to see it. Or part of it anyway, for a good many people had left before the heroine left her lover, to come home again in Act IV.

title: Eagle on Last Hole Gives Cowan a 280 And Amateur Title
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Sept. 4 Gary Cowan, 32yearold insurance executive from Kitchener, Ontario, won the United States Amateur golf championship today, shooting a oneunderpar 70 for a 72hole total of 280 over the 6,872yard Wilmington Country Club course.

title: Lindajoyce Gordon, Teacher, Affianced
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., Sept. 4The engagement of Miss Linda Joyce Gordon to Stephen Berke Wurzel, son of Mr. and Mrs. David Wurzel of Newton, Mass., has been made known by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. S. Earl Gordon. The wedding is planned for next month.

title: New Air Force Museum Details History of Aviation
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Sept. 4 The Air Force VC137C Stratoliner with the numerals 26000 and the name Spirit of '76 made its first landing this week at its probable final resting place.

title: State Is Offering Trees To Protect Eroded Land
description: Long Islanders whose land Was eroded this year or battered by the tropical storm named Doria will be helped by the State Department of Environmental Conservation, it was announced last week.

title: HIGHLIGHTS
description: THE ECONOMY: The dollar floated a bit stronger against sterling, but lower against the yen, as the Bank of Japan continued heavy dollar buying to prevent strong yen rise. . . . Bank of England cut bank rate to 5 per cent to limit dollar depreciation. . . . Paul McCracken, chairman of Council of Economic Advisers, said the Nixon economic program would add $15billion to G.N.P. next year and create 500,000 jobs. . . Treasury ruled imports already at sea when program was announced Aug. 15 would not be subject to new 10 per cent surcharge. . . President Nixon widened wage freeze to 600,000 Federal bluecollar workers. . . . Officials indicated Phase II of the program could include controls on profits.

title: NONEMAKERS WIN 3 SHOW CROWNS
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., Sept. 4 In 1957, Mr. and Mrs. H. B. Nonemaker's Alta's Bomb won the American Horse Shows Associations' high point championship in the green working hunter division.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: There is a place in the fashion industry for a company that can make specialized apparel needed for quick delivery by department stores, and such a company need not be located in the garment district.

title: A Report From the Majority Of the World
description: A boy carries rice straw.

title: Foreign Notes
description: Pimpernel

title: The World
description: SAIGONWhatever suspense there may have been about President Nguyen Van Thieu's intentions to run alonein next month's Presidential elections evaporated last week. He knocked Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky's name off the ballotMr. Ky didn't want to run anywayand announced that the, vote would go on.

title: Wilson Warns Heath
description: LONDON, Sept. 4  Harold Wilson, leader of the Labor party Opposition warned the Conservative Government of Prime Minister Heath today against allowing factional policies to be imposed by the Government in Belfast.

title: Mrs. Gandhi to Visit U.S.
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 4 (Reuters)The Prime Minister, Mrs. Indira Gandhi, will visit the United States Nov. 7 through 10, it was announced today. She will be in Britain first and will then go to Washington at the invitation of President Nixon. She is also likely to visit the United Nations.

title: Five Philadelphia Policemen Suspended in Drug Inquiry
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 4 (UPI)  An investigation into narcotics traffic among officers in the city's 17th Police District has led to the suspension of five policemen and the resignation of another.

title: GROUP ASKS START OF INDIAN PT. UNIT
description: The city's sevenmember utilities planning group has declared that the anticipated needs for electricity here next summer cannot be met unless a new nuclear plant at Indian Point starts operation in sufficient time before then.

title: Peter Segal Marries Carole Williams
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4Miss Carole Elizabeth Williams was married here this afternoon to Peter Wyman Segal of Washington; The Rev. Dr. Lowell R. Ditzen, director of the National Presbyterian Center in Washington, performed the ceremony in the Mount Vernon Junior College Chapel.

title: 13 Weeks of Vacation
description: CHICAGO  George Powers, a steelworker here, spent three months traveling through Italy, Poland and Russia poking through steel mills and comparing notes with workers.

title: LEATHER IS VICTOR IN COW BAY SAILING
Tahiti Becomes a Sports Capital
description: PAPEETE TahitiFrom Fiji and Tonga and Samoa and the other romantically named islands of the South Seas below the equator, 1,500 athletes will gather, here In French Polynesia next week for the fourth South Pacific Games. These juniorstyle Olympics will open next Wednesday and run until Sept. 19.

title: Suspect Is Held in Murder Of Bronx Auto Repairman
description: A former paratrooper who was given a medical discharge after 33 years' service was arrested on a murder charge after he allegedly shot a man twice in the head and then twice ran a car over him in the Bronx.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4If you ask a man who works for you whether he has been stealing mail and he says no, and you say, nevertheless he will have to take a liedetector test, there is a good likelihood that you are going to hurt his feelings.This is the position the State Department has assumed in letting a number of Its officers be thrown to the lie detector in an F.B.I. investigation to find who leaked some classified information to the newspapers, and one of the men interrogated while wired to the polygraph writes that his feelings were very hurt indeed. An excerpt from his letter follows:

title: Times Rush Is Home First
description: SAN MATEO, Calif., Sept. 4 (AP)Times Rush won the sixfurlong feature at Bay Meadows today in 1:09.3 under Mel Lewis. The winner carried 113 pounds and paid $11.60 for $2 to win.

title: Law Communes Seeking Social Change
description: CARBONDALE, Ill., Sept. 3There is a new type of law practice emerging in large and small cities around the country and its practitioners want no part of wood  paneled offices, secretaries to type their briefs, or even big fees. It is called the law commune, or law collective, and its primary purpose is not even to practice law.

title: Winds Shaking Great Stone Face
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 (UPI)Government seismologiits reported today that the wind in New Hampshire is so strong that it shakes the Great Stone Face.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: Contracts for future residential construction in New York State that were signed in July totaled $228,360,000, an increase of 41 per cent over the previous July, according to the latest Dodge report.

title: HISPANIOLA OFFERS QUICKIE DIVORCES
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic  Haiti and the nominkcan Republic, which share the Caribbean island of Hispaniola, are competing for the quickie divorce business abandoned by Mexico.

title: BROWNS REGISTER 30TO7 TRIUMPH
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 4Those who hope things will improve for the New York Giants will have to wait another week at least. Tonight's 307 loss to the Cleveland Browns, in the second half of the annual exhibition doubleheader here, was no more encouraging than the four previous defeats at the hands of Houston, New England, the Jets and Philadelphia.

title: Los Angeles  la Sodom and Gomorrah
description: Diane Johnson apparently has hit upon the solution to all those kooks, cultists, junkies, bogus professionals, displaced Midwesterners whose innocence is awash, police, firemen, Chicanos, Negroes and social workers who inhabit the easy clich of Los Angeles: Simply burn the damn place down. At least this is what happens to an appreciable part of that sprawling metropolis toward the end of Burning, and once the Biblical wrath and apocalyptic quality of this great fire is certain, the reader will probably issue a sigh of relief. Not because our continued and restless suckling on various moral tenets is finally vindicated by the flaming purification of Diane Johnson's Los Angeles a la Sodom and Gomorrah, but simply because, the author has found the means to bring her book.

title: M. J. Ginesi Jr. Weds Miss Louise Taylor
description: In the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest here yesterday afternoon, Miss Louise Taylor, a 1971 alumna of Cedar Crest College, was married to Michael Joseph Ginesi Jr., a senior at Lehigh University. The Rev. Frances Creamer performed the ceremony.

title: The Nation
description: Soon after George Jackson was shot in San Quentin Prison last Aug. 21, his mother declared that he had been set up by the guards. They killed him and set him out in the yard and photographed him, and then said he tried to escape, she said. They've been trying for 10 years to do it and they did it. Later, 26 prisoners smuggled out an affidavit that claimed the guards had conspired to murder Jackson, one of three Soledad Brothers accused of killing a prison guard last year. The underground press called the official explanation of the incident ludicrous and absurd.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Alan S. Oser's article City Studying an Overhaul in Zoning Law [July 25] points out quite clearly one of the critical problems which face New York City and other American cities in their efforts to retain an economically and racially heterogeneous poulation.

title: Home Improvement
description: STATISTICS gathered by various governmental agencies and professional safety organizations indicate that the incidence of home fires has been increasing steadily in recent years, with the greatest number occurring between midnight and 6 A.M.  when most people are asleep and consequently when there is the greatest danger to the occupants of the house.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: HATTERAS, N.C.  A seething wall of rain met us 15 minutes after we had left Hatteras Harbor in the 43foot charter boat, the Early Bird, and Capt. Emory Dillon tucked her bow into a secluded cove on the Ocracoke Island side of Hatteras Inlet and waited for the squall to abate.

title: Georgia Kelly Engaged
description: VALLEY STREAM, L.I., Sept. 4The engagement of Miss Georgia Ann Kelly, a senior at Molloy College in Rockville Centre, to Edward P. Kane, a graduate of Paul Smith's College, has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. George W. Kelley of Valley Stream and Shelter Island, parents of the future bride. Mr. Kane, who is assistant banquet manager of the Americana Hotel in New York, is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas J. Kane of New York and Shelter Island. His father is general manager of the Roosevelt Hotel in New York. Mr. Kelly is a lawyer.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: State Environment Aide Is Named by Governor
description: George Humphreys, who was deputy director of Governor Rockefeller's reelection campaign last fall, has been appointed by the Governor as assistant Commissioner of Environmental Conservation for New York City Affairs.

title: Bills Trounce Lions, 3117
description: DETROIT, Sept. 4 (AP)Dennis Shaw scored one touchdown and threw for two more, including an 87yard touchdown pass to Marlin Briscoe, to lead the Buffalo Bills to a 3117 pasting of the Detroit Lions tonight.

title: Eagles Rout Saints, 340
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 4 (AP) The Philadelphia Eagles defeated the New Orleans Saints tonight, 340, in a game ended by lightning with 33 seconds left.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:We are two people who are lucky enough to have seen The Hellstrom Chronicle rather than being in the unfortunate plight of many other readers who have to depend merely on reading about it in Peter Schjeldahl's critique, Suddenly One Misses Walt Disney.

title: Italians Find Ancient Tribal Writings
description: MACCHIA DI ROSSANO, Italy  Now the Lucanians are beginning to talk, Dinu Adamesteanu, chief, superintendent of antiquities for the southern Italian region of Basilicata, declared, scanning inscriptions from a recently discovered ancient sanctuary on this wooded hill.

title: Y.A.F. SUSPENDS SUPPORT OF NIXON
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 4  Young Americans for Freedom, the conservative youth group that campaigned for Richard M. Nixon in 1968, voted overwhelmingly today to suspend its support of the President, principally for what it called his failures in foreign policy.

title: Navy Investigating Oil Spillage And Reason for Delay in Report
description: SAN DIEGO, Sept. 4The Navy began an investigation this week into the spillage of some 230,000 gallons of heavy oil from one of its tankers, which sent great patches of tarlike scum ashore along a 65mile stretch of the California coast.

title: COLUMBIA SHIFTING PUERTO RICAN UNIT
description: Columbia University has removed its Puerto Rican Student Program from the auspices of its Urban Center and given its development to the university's three main undergraduate officialsDean Carl Hovde of Columbia College, Dean Aaron W. Warner of the School of General Studies, and Martha Peterson, president of Barnard College.

title: Previous Crashes
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Sept. 4 (UPI)  The last big plane crash in Alaska occurred on Nov. 27, 1970, when a Capitol International Airways DC8 jet carrying 229 persons skidded off a runway at Anchorage and broke apart. Fortysix persons were killed.

title: Ondine Holds 6Meter Sailing Lead
description: With two racing series remaining for the Eastern United States SixMeter championship, Ondine holds first place. Ondine is the defending champion for the up, now in its fourth year of competition. She is owned and sailed by the brothersister team of George and Helen Stadel of Stamford, Conn.

title: Yale SeasonTicket Prices For Football Are Reduced
description: Yale University will offer season tickets at a reduced price this season.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Music
description: NO one pays much attention to the battered green Volkswagen pulling up to tie stage door of the Metropolitan Opera until one of Ahe company's leading ladies emerges from it swathed glamorously in white mink. Then the celebrityfreaks oooh and aaah. Word of the soprano's entrance spreads rapidly through the house. Did you see the ratty jalopy Miss White Mink arrived in? asks one young man of another. The medium Xeroxes this message which eventually reaches a young woman who is crestfallen to receive it. She is the owner and driver of the Volks, a vehicle voluntarily placed at the disposal of the diva. She realizes that a move must be made to halt the badmouthing of the prima donna and to safely secure her chauffeuring rights. So she purchases a new car.

title: Jill Fuiks Betrothed to Stephen R. Parker
description: Miss Jill Hyland Fuiks, an administrative assistant at Emerson College in Boston, and Stephen Randolph Parker, who is in the management training program in the Weymouth (Mass.) Savings Bank, will be married Oct. 23 in New York.

title: The London Scene
description: A BITTERLY vindictive detective  inspector, a Neanderthal judge and a climate of cloying conservatism have combined to, produce one of the most scandalous judicial decisions in the history of British law. The verdict against the underground magazine Oz for publishing obscenity blows the myth of the permissive society skyhigh. There may have been a period when London luxuriated in the kind of liberating anarchy one associates with Paris of the twenties, but it was long before the cleanup squads raided eindy Warhol's Flesh at The Open Space, prosecuted the exhibition of John Lennon's intimate lithographs, and swooped down upon International Times and the Running Man press (the former the East Village Other of London, the latter an independent underground publishing house).

title: MIAMI IS DIVIDED ON AIRLIFT'S END
description: MIAMI, Sept. 4It's a real tragedy. Many people will never see their relatives again, a Cuban refugee said here yesterday.

title: LONDON
description: LONDON, Sept. 4Flying across the entire width of the Soviet Union is a cinch these days. It is no shuttle ride, and fourteen hours of food and drink between Tokyo and London can be injurious to your health, but for anybody who likes to fly several thousand miles without seeing anything, it is a rare experience.

title: MARATHON IN PARK TO BE LIBERATED
description: The second annual New York marathon, 26 miles 385 yards over the bicycle paths of Central Park, will attract more than 200 runners Sunday, Sept. 19.

title: 6 Concerns. Face Queries on Increases in Dividends
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The heads of six corporations have been summoned to appear before the Cost of Living Council Tuesday to explain announced dividend increases above rates in effect prior to the Aug. 15 wageprice freeze.

title: ITALY SADDENED BY TITIAN THEFT
description: ROME, Sept. 4The theft this week of a Titian masterpiece from a church in northern Italy represents not only the painful loss of a major art work but also a sad reminder that the vast. Italian artistic heritage has become an easy and frequent prey to constant despoliation through burglary. The 39by55inch painting, which depicts Titian and relatives in the role of the Holy Family, was not a hard target, according to Rodolfo Siviero, Italian minister plenipotentiary for the recovery of art work. The thieves, he said, had only to hide before closing time in the church at Pieve di Cadore, the town near Venice where Titian himself was born.

title: Andorra Is Where You Load Up On LowPriced Goodies
description: ANDORRACitizens of this ministate high in the Pyrenees have been notified that their previous defense budget of $4.90 has been raised to $5 its largest in history. What may be the tiniest defense budget in the world belies the success of Andorra's army, which is doubtless the most successful army of all time, for it has never lost a war. Five dollars does not go a long way, even in Andorra, but as a military appropriation it will buy enough munitions for the fiscal yearbullets for the rifles of 20man firing squad called out for ceremonial salutes whenever a guest dignitary is present.

title: Knapp Unit Focuses on City Hall
description: The commission investigating alleged corruption in the New York City Police Department has questioned a number of highranking Lindsay administration officials about a reported sixmonth delay in acting against charges of widespread graft among policemen in the Bronx.

title: INTEGRATION FOES BOOMING WALLACE
description: MEMPHIS, Sept. 4Some of the South's elder statesmen of segregation led the Citizens Councils of America in convention here this weekend in whooping it up for racial separation and for Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama.

title: EKING STRESSING, PHYSICAL FITNESS
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 4 Sports and physical fitness are getting, major official emphasis again in China after a long period of neglect during the turbulent years of the Cultural Revolution.

title: Yellowstone Season Ending
description: YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK, Wyo., Sept. 4 (UPI)This week was the beginning of the end of the 1971 season at Yellowstone National Park. Several facilities in the park began closing Monday. Officials said Thursday that, while overnight accommodations, eating facilities and campgrounds were still available, they would be limited until the final closing in October.

title: Briton Wins Marathon
description: ENSCHEDE, the Netherlands, Sept. 4 (AP)Bernie Allen of Britain won the Enschede Marathon today with a record time of 2 hours 16 minutes 54.2 seconds for the 25mile race. John Vitale of New Haven, Conn., was third in 2:20.16.2.

title: WEST SAID TO ASK DEVALUED DOLLAR
description: PARIS, Sept. 4Pressure for an outright American devaluation of the dollar against gold was reported to be building up today as the monetary experts of nine major Western nations plus Japan ended two days of consultations on the trade and currency crisis.

title: Education
description: Manhasset and East Meadow, two bedroom communities in suburban Nassau County, are separated by a mere 15minute stretch of expressway, but the distance between what they spend on their children's education is measured in light years.

title: Sports of The gluing
description: Art Rooney is the admirable character who founded the Pittsburgh Steelers almost four decades ago. The only executive to outrank him in National Football League longevity is George Halas, the hardy perennial of the Chicago Bears. They have been riding the tail of the comet all the way upward, enjoying the spectacular ascent for the most part, but sometimes yearning for the comforting simplicities of the old days.

title: Pharmacist Ends Vow To Bar Cigarette Sales
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass., Sept. 4 (AP) A pharmacy that stopped selling cigarettes a year ago in the interest of public health is back in the tobacco trade.

title: Allende Ends 3Nation Tour, Faces Mounting Woes at Home
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 4President Salvador Allende Gossens, returning from a 10day trip to Ecuador, Colombia, and Peru, received a large public welcome today on the first anniversary of the election that led to his becoming President.

title: Auxiliary Policemen Aid In Brooklyn and Queens
description: Every evening at the 61st police precinct in Sheepshead Bay about 20 men dressed in regulation police uniforms but with sheriffstyle stars pinned on their chests, and a different patch on their shoulders, turn out to patrol the darkened beach area, shopping centers and streets in the neighborhood.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Countywide Bus Service Study Planned by Westchester Agency
description: WHITE PLAINS, Sept. 4 The bus business in Westchester County is something of a vicious circle. Service is inadequate, so the buses have few riders. Few people ride the buses, so it does not pay to improve service.

title: The Last Word: News From Unwithit Press
description: With all its heady promises of blockbusting new titles and freshminted genius, the fall publishing season is upon us. But I worry that the spring list of Unwithit Press will lost in the general clamor. I always look forward to Unwithit's spring list, even though it arrives in the fall. Unwithit's spring announcements always arrive in the fall as dohopefullytheir books; Unwithit is anything but on the dot. They seem to operate in some peaceful backwater, far from the maddening rush of deadlines and production pressures. Some of Unwithit's books, announced two or three years ago, will casually turn up again on the spring list, like old college friend you haven't seen in years.

title: Concorde Flies Atlantic At 1,120 Miles an Hour
description: CAYENNE, French Guiana, Sept. 4 (UPI)The AngloFrench supersonic airliner Concorde 001 flew from Europe to South America today in 4 hours and 28 minutes. It flew the 5,000 miles from Toulouse, France, at about 1,120 miles an hour in its first transAtlantic flight.

title: Religion
description: Ever since Constantine made Christianity the official religion of the Roman Empire, Christian churches have struggled with the problem of how to manage their worldly assets in keeping with their spiritual ideals. An answer or two may have been forthcoming over the last fortnight.

title: The World
description: One of the mysteries about the Soviet Union is the seemingly endless proliferation of samizdat, materials  clandestine manuscripts of books, magazines and articles that circulate among dissident Soviet citizens and often reach the West.

title: Editorial Cartoon 1  No Title
Sybil Maria Calhoun Is Affianced
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 4The engagement of Miss Sybil Maria Calhoun to Paul Lathrop Salembier has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Clay Joseph Calhoun, parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Harold Paul Salembier of New York and East Hampton, L. I., and the late Mrs. Salembier.

title: The Passengers and Crew
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Sept. 4 (AP)Following is a list of the crew and passengers aboard the Alaska Airlines jetliner that crashed into a mountain near here today. The list contains names of persons who boarded the plane at all stops but does not reflect those who might have debarked at Yakutat.

title: PatriotFalcon Game Won't Go Down Drain
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Sept. (AP)The Foxboro Board of Health tonight gave the New England Patroits a green light to play their scheduled National Football League exhibition with the Atlanta Falcons tomorrow in Schaefer Stadium.

title: Art Notes
description: WHEN it conies to traditional Chinese art, Americans have not exactly suffered from Communist China's 22 years of isolation. There are splendid collections in America and enough museum exhibits to keep scholars absorbed for years. And if that isn't enough, one can even go to Taiwan to see the fabulous treasures the Nationalists carted out from Nanking and Peking for their museum in Taipei.

title: SOVIET SAID TO FLY BIG NEW BOMBER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The Soviet. Union has reportedly testflown a swingwing supersonic strategic bomber that Western military intelligence specialists believe marks the emergence of an entirely new Soviet air weapons system.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: LAST night, my wife and I saw Carnal Knowledge, and I am now so disgusted with the state of the motion picture in the United States that I feel obliged to write this letter.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: I have a bone to pick with the creative leaders of our business. We've become so enraptured with our own importance we've forgotten how we got started.

title: Look Me Up Set for Plaza
description: A nineteentwenties setting for the New Plaza 9 Music Hall at the Plaza Hotel has been designed for Look Me Up, a musical revue with sang hits of the period, opening Oct. 6. Performances, nightly except Mondays, will be at 7:30 and 11. Previews will begin on Sept. 15. Lawrence Taylor wrote the book and Costas Omero will produce and direct. Lee Theodore will stage the dance and musical numbers, with Bob Tucker as associate choreographer.

title: Television
description: ON a recent publictelevision edition of William F. Buckley Jr.'s Firing Line, writer James Dickey observed that most of the language we encounter every day is manipulative language, geared in one way or another to selling the listener something  a can of dog food, a political image, a way of life.

title: 3 Children Die in Fire
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 4 (UPI)Three children were killed today and at least nine other persons were injured when fire swept a threestory apartment building on the city's west side.

title: The World
description: MIAMIListen, Chico, shouted a Cuban who arrived here last Tuesday on a refugee flight from Cuba, Antonio asked me to tell you that he and his family will come on tomorrow's flight.

title: Yearling Sales Bring Out Professeurs
description: DEAUVILLE, France, Sept. 4  At European race tracks there always seem to be men standing alongside the paddocks or in the enclosures who never talk about the horses on the day's program.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONJuly 26, 1948: President Harry S. Truman decrees that henceforth there will be equality of treatment and opportunity for everyone in the armed forces without regard to race or color.

title: Margaret L. Andrew Is Bride Of Elbert George Bellows Jr.
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Sept. 4 Miss Margaret Lynn Andrew and Elbert George Bellows Jr., candidates for Master's degrees at the Amos Tuck School of Business Administration at Dartmouth College, were married here this afternoon.

title: Before 2 A. M. My Son Was Dead
description: Robert J. Boutin Jr., 20 years old, of Stonington, Conn., died early one morning last month in the explosion of a powder magazine near his home, His mother, Hilda M. Boutin, wrote these two letters shortly after the young man's death:

title: PHILLIES WIN, 73, TO END METS' RUN OF VICTORIES AT 5
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 5Nolan Ryan, the wild man of the New York Mets, was turned loose in Philadelphia today and before he could be corraled the Phillies were far along the road to a 73 victory that ended two streaks.

title: 18 New Suhool Buildings Ready for Year's Opening
description: The Board of Education announced yesterday that 18 new school buildings, including another high school in Jamaica, Queens, would be ready for the official opening of school next Monday.

title: CANADA PONDERS ECONOMIC GOALS
description: TORONTO, Sept. 5Washington's emergency 10 per cent surcharge on imports, coming at a time of persistently high unemployment in Canada, has touched off what may become a new debate about national economic goals.

title: Red Sox Retain Kasko As Manager for 1972
description: BOSTON, Sept. 5 (AP) Kasko, manager of the Boston Red Sox the last two years, received a contract today to manage the club again next season.

title: Greek Dissidents Report Many Political Prisoners Are Young
description: ATHENS, Sept. 5A study of the approximately 340 men and women in Greek jails for political crimes or awaiting trial on such charges indicates that the number of young people actively opposed to the militarybacked Government here is increasing.

title: Miss Barbara Degenshein Is Married
description: Miss Barbara Degenshein, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. George A. Degenshein of Brooklyn, was married here last evening to Howard Berliner, son of Mr. and Mrs. Simon Berliner of Fort Lee, N. J. Rabbis Reuven Siegel and Joseph Singer officiated at the ceremony in the St. RegisSheraton. Mrs. Berliner's father is acting director of surgery at Maimonides Medical Center and a clinical associate professor of surgery at the Downstate Medical Center, both in Brooklyn. The bridegroom's father is the manager of the Brooklyn division of Martin's Apparel Stores.

title: Japan's Cabinet Officials Leave for Talks in the U.S.
description: TOKYO, Monday, Sept. 6Seven Japanese Cabinet minasters left today for highlevel discussions in Washington that the Japanese hope will soften the atmosphere of confrontation with the United States since President Nixon's decisions to visit Peking and to defend the dollar.

title: Italy Dollar Debate Stirs AntiU.S. Issue
description: ROME, Sept. 5While Italian leaders were discussing the problems, of the dollar with United: States and European officials yesterday and today, the government was strained by dispute over the alleged antiAmericanism of one of its components.

title: Bridge: Becker Brothers Display Form of Illustrious Father
description: Two brothers playing in partnership captured the open pair championship title at the Greater New York Bridge Association's Knickerbocker championships at the New York Hilton Saturday. Michael Becker of New York and Steve Becker of Greenwich, Conn., sons of a former world champion, B. Jay Becker, won the title ahead of Alvin Roth of New York and Barbara Rappaport.

title: Labor Day
description: Banks, stock exchanges, post offices and many department and retail stores and library branches are closed. There is no regular refuse collection, and Sunday parking rules are in effect.

title: Taylor Concert Postponed
description: James Taylor had to postpone the concerts he was to have given at Carnegie Hall this weekend for several weeks because an injury to his hand that required 12 stitches has made it impossible for him to play the guitar at this time. The Carnegie Hall concerts have been rescheduled for Nov. 29, 30 and Dec. 1. Tickets purchased for the Sept. 10 concert will be honored on Nov. 29, those for the Sept. 11 concert on Nov. 30 and those for the Sept. 12 concert on Dec. 1.

title: Gasoline Spillage Poses Fire Hazard In Oceanside Area
description: OCEANSIDE, LI., Sept. 5Between 80,000 and 100,000 gallons of gasoline seeped out of a leak in a pipe of an oil company distributing plant here early today, posing a fire hazard to the surrounding industrial and residential areas.

title: Osborne Upsets Richey in U.S. Tennis As Gonzales and Nastase Are Beaten
description: Jim Osborne worried about his pregnant wife, Bob Carmichael wondered when people would start thinking of him as a tennis craftsman not a carpenter, and Manuel Orantes said, yes, Pancho Gonzales was human after all.

title: MAN HELD IN ATTACK ON PATROLMAN AUG. 8
description: A 26yearold man was arrested yesterday on charges of having pistolwhipped a New York patrolman on Aug. 8. The injured patrolman, Warren Windram, still is on sick leave.

title: Leonard, Drivin a ColtFord, Captures Rich California 500 Race by a Lap
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Sept. 5 Joe Leonard won the California 500 today after three leaders had dropped out with mechanical failure and after Mark Donohue had lost an apparent victory by failing to see a signal calling him to his pit for refueling.

title: Young Conservatives Back Agnew Over Nixon in '72
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 5The Republican party's angry young conservatives disposed symbolically of their newest villain, President Nixon, shortly after midnight this morning, but they are still wondering how to handle him in real political life.

title: Gethin's BRM Wins by 3 Feet In 187Mile Italian Grand Prix
description: MONZA, Italy, Sept. 5  Peter Gethin of Britain steered his BRM over Monza course at 151.634 miles an hour today to win the Italian Grand Prix by only one onehundredth of a second from Ronnie Peterson of Sweden in a March. His margin was about three feet.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: OUTLOOK CHEERS SPECIALTY STEEL
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 5Specialty steel producers received some good news last week. First, there was the word that Japan's steel companies have indicated a willingness to reduce shipments of stainless and tool steel to this country.

title: 1,000 Have New Jobs Under U.S. Program
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (UPI)Secretary of Labor James D. Hodgson said today that more than 1,000 persons had gone to work under the Government's emergency employment program, well in advance of the Labor Day deadline that had been set for employing the first jobless person.

title: Affinity for Tennis Turned a Mansion Into a Showplace
description: LOS ANGELESMrs. Eugene V. Klein and her husband, the 49yearold West Coast conglomerateur (his National General Corporation is kneedeep in movie theaters, publishing and life insurance companies and other enterprises and he also heads such things as the San Diego Chargers football team and Seattle SuperSonics basketball team) live in a house that they didn't even want.

title: Roundup: Stennett Is a Hit With Pirates
description: Good field, no hit. That's the sad commentary on many a young ballplayer aspiring to a major league career. Thus tagged, they depart for home and an undistinguished career on the sandlots of semipro ball.

title: Experts Say Russia Plans Manned Landing on Moon
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 American and British space experts are convinced that the Soviet Union has launched four unmanned space vehicles in the last 10 months as tests of components for a manned landing on the moon.

title: Search for Murder Suspect Fruitless in Massachusetts
description: HUDSON, Mass., Sept. 5 (AP) More than 200 state troopers and town police from the area searched for several hours today for Stephen McDonough, 23 years old, of Connecticut, who is wanted for murder, robbery and the shooting of Massachusetts state policeman.

title: Chess: International Tournaments Consist of Several Events
description: Many international tournaments nowadays are actually only the main event in much larger chess congresses that consist of a number of separate tournaments all running concurrently. The top, or premier, section sometimes consists entirely of grandmasters, although more usually some other strong players are admitted.

title: BLACK GROUP MAPS POLITICAL ACTION
description: NEWARK, Sept. 5Leaders of the Eastern Regional Conference of the, Congress of African Peoples announced today that it would convene state political conventions to create statewide black political tickets in at least 12 states.

title: Sports of The Times
description: MONTAUK, L. I.,The first shark to hit was a small mako, a gutsy fighter that tastes like swordfish. The captain, Frank Mundus, whooped and ran barefoot to the stern, where his mate was already fitting the butt of the rod into a gimbal belt worn by 9yearold Tom Hoffman of Huntington, L. I. The boy's father, Harry, a regular aboard the Cricket II, caught a 644pound tiger shark earlier in the season, but he was silent and tense as Tom struggled with the bending rod.

title: Art: Museum Surprise
description: Having announced three exhibitions opening simultaneously tomorrow to initiate the art season, the Pierpont Morgan Library at 29 East 36th Street (the northeast corner of Madison Avenue) has slipped in a fourth without publicity, possibly because it is gorgeous enough the only wordto swamp the three others.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
3 Ulster Bombings Reported on Eve of Meeting
description: BELFAST, Northern Nreland, Sept. 5 (AP)A terrorist bomb blew up in a Belfast supermarket and injured two girls today on the eve of a meeting of the leaders of Britain and the Irish Republic over political and relipious violence in Northern Ireland.

title: Halt to Aerial Spraying Asked After Death of Boy
description: The death of a 9yearold boy who had been sprayed with insecticide from, an aerial crop duster prompted demands yesterday for: an immediate halt of all aerial spraying in New Jersey and an official investigation into the boy's death.

title: Poland Welcomes Accord
description: WARSAW, Sept. 5Premier Piotr Jaroszewicz today welcomed the Berlin agreement as the key to settlement of outstanding issues between East and West.

title: KENYANS DOMINATE PREOLYMPIC TRACK
description: MUNICH, West Germany Sept. 5 (UPI)Kenya's runners dominated the final days of the preOlympic track and field games today as Thomas Saisi. Kipchoge Keino and Ben Jipcho swept the 800, 1,500 and 5,000 meter runs, respectively.

title: ROBERT L. STRIDER
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 5 (AP)Robert L. Strider, dean of the arts and Sciences division of Johns Hopkins University, died of cancer at Johns Hopkins Hospital. He was 49 years old.

title: Storm Forms in Caribbean
description: MIAMI, Sept. 5 (AP)  A Tropical depression formed off the Windward Islands today and forecasters said it could intensify as it moved westward toward the open Caribbean. The National Flurricane Center said the depression was expected to produce heavy showers and gale force winds in squalls as it continued toward the Grenadine Islands, 1,500 miles southeast of here.

title: POLICE UNIT HEAD ASSERTS MURPHY WRECKS MORALE
description: Harold H. Melnick, chairman of the Police Department Superior Officers Council, accused Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy yesterday of weakening departmental morale by administrative innuendo and blanket indictment of the integrity and efficiency of commanders.

title: ZESTY WELK SHOW ATTRACTS 18,000
description: Why, are they saying all those terrible things about Lawence Welk?

title: Anniversaries
description: GITELSONMr. and Mrs. Paul Ash and family and Mr. & Mrs. George Milenki, children and grandchildren, happily announce the Golden Wedding Aniversary, Sept. 6th, of their beloved parents and Grandparents. ANNA & AARON GITELSON

title: Pope Deplores Slaying
description: CASTEL GANDOLFO, Italy, Sept. 5 Pope Paul V today referred to the death of a 17monthold girl in Belfast Friday when he addressed pilgrims at his summer residence here.

title: Unions Are Monopolies
description: Some fifty years ago the homespun humorist, Kin Hubbard, declared, If capital and labor ever do git together, it'll be Good Night fer the rest of us. Whenever a major union gets a hefty raise today and the companies pass it on through increased prices, some of us begin to wonder if Hubbard's fears have been realized. But the vast majority excuse the company and put the blame on the union; one constantly hears cries that the union demands are outrageous. Just why do any of us think them outrageous?

title: Miss Mathews Wed in Texas
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Sept. 5 Miss Susan Henri Mathews, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Mathews, was married here tonight to Michael G. Himoff, son of Mr. and Mrs. Dudley Townsend Himoff of White Plains, N. Y. The Rev. Dr. David Jacobson performed the ceremony at Temple Beth El.

title: Griffin Plans Pensions Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP) Senator Robert P. Griffin, Republican of Michigan, announced today that he would introduce legislation to set up a Federal insurance program to protect rights of employes in private pension plans. His bill would require that the plans provide full vesting for employes with 10 years or more service In plans in operation at least 10 years. Vesting means that those covered are guaranteed payment of their retirement benefits.

title: Michael A. Newton Marries Miss Carrie Mar Champlin
description: ROCHESTER, N. H., Sept. 5 Miss Carrie Mar Champlin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Hilton Champlin Jr. of Rochester, was married here this afternoon to Michael Aldace Newton, son of Mrs. Marie Luise Newton of New York, and Carroll P. Newton of Sarasota, Fla.

title: COLOMBIA LEADER URGES LATIN UNITY
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Sept. 5 The cold war has ended for Latin America, according to President Misael Pastrana Borrero of Colombia, and the countries of the area can hold their own in a changing world only by ignoring the ideological differences that once separated them.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Guard Dog Attacks and Injures His Handler While Both Are on Duty
description: A Doberman pinscher guard dog named Caesar attacked and injured his 52yearold handler while they were on duty yesterday. The 225pound security guard, Frank Cunningham, had to take refuge in a washroom and squeeze through the tiny window to a waiting police ladder.

title: A Festival in Brooklyn Salutes West Indians With Calypso Beat
description: For the more than 3,000 men, women and children, most of them West Indians, who assembled in Brooklyn's Lincoln Terrace Park for a carnival yesterday afternoon, it was simply a matter of letting go.

title: Pinscher Triumphs At Rockland Show, Beating 1,246 Rivals
description: SPRING VALLEY, N.Y., Sept. 5The smallest dog in the ring, an eightpound miniature pinscher, Ch. BoMar's Road Run ner, scored the biggest victory of his career today when he was named best of 1,247 dogs at the silver anniversary show of the Rockland County Kennel Club on the grounds of the Spring Valley High School.

title: Learning CoOp to Aid City Schools Planned
description: School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner will soon set up the city's first learning cooperative in an effort to generate educational reforms by the decentralized community school districts during the academic year that begins next Monday.

title: DAVE HILL IS TIED FOR LEAD WITH 201
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn., Sept. 5Dave Hill and J. C. Snead found the heat oppressive, but finished in a 54hole tie with 12underpar totals of 201 in the $110,000 Greater Hartford open golf tournament today.

title: Books of The Times
description: DR. MIRABILIS. By James Blish. 335 pages. Dodd Mead. $6.95.

title: $3Million in Gifts Adorn Center
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Shortly after President Kennedy appointed him to head the board of the national cultural center, Roger L. Stevens remarked to a man with influential Italian connections that Italy and other friendly foreign nations ought to offer contributions in support. When the visitor explained that it would be politically dangerous for the Italian Government to export either cultural treasures or money, Mr. Stevens commented facetiously: Then give us some marble. No Communist could say you were taking marble out of the mouths of babes.

title: 2 Sheiks Act to Spur Persian Gulf Federation
description: DUBAI, Sept. 1The Sheiks of Abu Dhabi and Dubai, with British backing, are dispatching a delegation to Iran and Saudi Arabia in the interests of the proposed, federation of six Persian Gulf emirates.

title: Sudan Denies That Nimeiry Met With Soviet Aide Egypt
description: KHARTOUM, Sudan, Monday, Sept. 6 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Sudanese Government last night denied reports by a Cairo newspaper that President Gaafar alNimeiry conferred Saturday with Soviet officials in Egypt.

title: Falcons Top Plunkett, Patriots, 4535
description: Jim Plunkett was the starting quarterback for the New England Patriots for the first time yesterday, but Jim Cannonball) Butler, a journeyman Atlanta Falcons' back, usurped the attention from last year's Heismen Trophy winner.

title: Amtrak Adding CapitaltoWest Virginia Train
description: Another train is being added to the nation's Amtrak passenger network with the start of service tomorrow over a scenic 350mile route between Washington and Parkersburg, W. Va.

title: Atlanta Kickers Gain Final of Soccer Playoffs
description: HEMPSTEAD, LI., Sept. 5The New York Cosmos were eliminated from the North American Soccer League postseason playoffs tonight, 20 by the Atlanta Chiefs.

title: Montana Beats So. Dakota In Football Opener, 14 to 7
description: GREAT FALLS, Mont., Sept. (UPI)The University of Montana kicked off the college football season last night by beating the University of South Dakota, 147.

title: Miss Wilson Becomes Bride
description: NEWTON, Mass., Sept. 5Miss Margaret Deil Wilson and Dr. Jeffrey David Nason, both of Cambridge were married here this afternoon at the home of Dr. and Mrs. Bernard Katz, friends of the couple. The ceremony was performed by Justice of the Peace William Mackay.

title: Yemen's Premier Resigns After TwoWeek Regime
description: ADEN, Southern Y men, Sept. 5The Yemen radio announced officially yesterday that Gem Hassan alAmri had resigned as Premier scarcely two weeks after forming his Cabinet, the shortest Government in Yemen since the republic was established nine years ago.

title: Mother Held in Child's Death
description: Mrs. Sylvia Maldonado, a 17yearold Bronx mother, was charged with homicide yesterday in the death of her monthold daughter. Bronx District Attorney Burton B. Roberts said the child, Jennie Maldonado, was reported dead at Lincoln Hospital after the police had investigated a report of child beating at the Maldonado apartment at 325 Crimmins Avenue. The child's father, Juan, 36, was arrested on a charge of endangering the welfare of the child, as was an uncle, Alberto Maldonado, 24.

title: A PAT ON THE BACK MAY STOP ULCERS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5A Rockefeller University psychologist suggests that it is possible to prevent stresscaused stomIach ulcers by giving the individual an occasional pat on the back when he acts to deal with stressful situations.

title: Miss Haberman Bride of Rabbi
description: BETHESDA, Md., Sept. 5Miss Deborah Miriam Haberman, daughter of Rabbi and Mrs. Joshua 0. Haberman, was married at home here today to Rabbi Mayer Isaac Perelmuter, son of Rabbi and Mrs. Hayim Goren Perelmuter of Chicago. The ceremony was performed by the fathers of the couple. Rabbi Haberman, spiritual leader of the Washington Hebrew Congregation, preached the sermon at the White House Worship Service on March 7. The bridegroom's father is spiritual leader, with Rabbi Simeon J. Maslin, of the newly merged K.A.M. Isaiah Israel Congregation in Chicago.

title: B52'S BOMB ENEMY ON BROAD FRONTS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 5 (AP)American B52 bombers attacked North Vietnamese positions across broad fronts of Indochina yesterday and today and the United States command announced the loss of two helicopters as a result of enemy fire. Two crewmen were killed and a third wounded.

title: Welfare Inspector General Aims To Implement Employment Plan
description: The state's new Welfare Inspector General said yesterday that one of his aims would be to see that relief recipients who were employable should be made to work.

title: Arts Abroad
description: LONDONSummer ends. Along Shaftesbury Avenue, the lines at box offices dwindle, theatrical seats become available, impresarios and actors and agents wait patiently for the Christmas rush and then, again, the summer.

title: Brandt Sends His Thanks To Big 4 on Berlin Accord
description: BONN, Sept. 5  Chancellor Willy Brandt has sent letters to the heads of Government of the United States, the Soviet Union, Britain and France to thank them for bringing about a fourpower agreement on Berlin, it was announced today.

title: Governor Draws a Field of 12 Today
description: Twice Worthy gets his chance for revenge against Never Bow today in the $100,000 added Governor Stakes at Belmont Park.

title: KY ADMITS THREAT BUT ASSAILS PRESS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept: 5Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky acknowledged today that he was the source of news reports that said that he had threatened to destroy President Nguyen Van Thieu in coup d'etat.

title: An Ottawa Embassy Serves Its Guests Green Tea and New China
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 2  There was a time when the average Ottawan would have considered the presence of a diplomat from Communist China a matter of interest and concern principally for the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

title: Survey Says U.S. Men Back Police Gun Use
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP)A new national survey indicates that more than 50 per cent of American men believe that the police should shoot, but not to kill, in controlling hoodlums, student protests and ghetto riots.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SNOW KILLS 2 MORE IN YOUTH PROGRAM
description: BEND, Ore., Sept. 5 (UPI)Two girls have died of exposure after 40 members of an Outward Bound survival hike were stranded for five days by a snowstorm in the Three Sisters wilderness area. An early season snowstorm, which hit the Cascade Mountains last week, trapped the girls, who were not immediately identified.

title: Leslie R. Stein Married on L.I. To Dane Long
