description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Sept. 5 Miss Leslie Rose Stein was married here this evening to Dane Mattos Long at the home of her parents, Dr. and Mrs. Aaron Stein. The bridegroom's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Albert E. Long of Alexandria, Va. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Herschel Levin.

title: OUSTED CITY AIDE WILL BE REHIRED
description: The city's former Relocation Commissioner who was suspended over a year ago because of a Federal indictment that was later dismissed will soon be appointed to a highlevel post in the Housing and Development Administration.

title: Finland Hoping to Prod U.S. Into Accepting Security Parley
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Sept. 5The Finnish Government will follow up the Big Four agreement on Berlin with a new attempt to persuade the United States to agree to the Soviet Union's longstanding proposal for a European security conference.

title: Miss Kraus Bride Of R. C. Schwartz
description: Miss Terry Jean Kraus was married last evening to Raymond Carl Schwartz at the Flushing (Queens) Jewish Center by Rabbi S. Gershon Levi, who was assisted by Cantor Julian Gabler.

title: MRS. RUTH FRIES
description: SOUTHAMPTON, I. I., Sept. 5Mrs. Ruth Hamilton Kerr Fries, a fashion publicist, died today in Southampton Hospital. She was 74 years old and lived in Wainscott, and at 34 Gramercy Park East, New York.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Shop Talk
description: Wives, who usually confine picking out their husband's neckties to Christmas time, have found a new way to get into the act. Now they're whipping up the ties on the sewing machine. As usual, there's more than one reason: Ties have become more expensive; with colored and patterned shirts in fashion, a far more extensive tie wardrobe is needed and, be sides, with the nostalgia for the way things used to be, almost anything made at home takes on a special aura.

title: Columbia to Stress Preventive Dentistry
description: When freshman dentistry students at Columbia University assemble for orientation on Wednesday, the first thing they will be taught is that cavities are now almost 100 per cent preventable and the second is how to clean their own teeth in a way that will realize that scientific potential.

title: Alison Lovitt Bride Of K. D. Reinfeld
description: WESTBURY, LI., Sept. 5 Miss Alison Carol Lovitt, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George H. Lovitt of Baldwin, was married at the Westbury Manor this afternoon to Kenneth Douglas Reinfeld, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Reinfeld of New York. Rabbi Bernard Zlotowitz performed the ceremony.

title: Jurgensen Breaks Left Shoulder
description: Sonny Jurgensen, the Washington quarterback, suffered a broken left shoulder Saturday night as the Dolphins beat the Redskins, 2710, in a preseason game in Miami's Orange Bowl. The 37yearold Jurgensen was injured while tackling Dick Anderson, the Miami safety, who had intercepted his pass late in the third period.

title: Personal Finance
description: The good old American dollar isn't what she used to be but if you're getting ready for a, trip overseas, there's really no reason to lose any sleep over it.

title: A 2d Day of Unrest By Hoboken Youths Leads to 13 Arrests
description: HOBOKEN, N. J., Monday Sept. 6Thirteen persons were arrested here last night and early this morning in the sec, and day of disturbances by bands of Puerto Rican youths who have been breaking windows and throwing garbage in the streets.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 Mayors and other officials around the country are angry because they are not getting as many jobs as they had expected under the new Federal program that will provide $1billion this fiscal year for public service employment.

title: Fall Kills Burglary Suspect
description: A 24yearold burglary suspect plunged seven stories to his death yesterday in the rear yard of a tenement in Harlem. The police said the electric wire he was using to lower himself into a rear apartment broks. He had attached the 18footlong knotted cable to an Ibeam on the roof of the house at 3694 Broadway, at West 153d Street. He was tentatively identified as Bernard Pleasant, with no known address. The police said he heroin addict.

title: Mobile Welcomes a Busing Plan
description: MOBILE, Ala., Sept. 5Gov. George C. Wallace was recently told by his Director of Public Safety to expect racial disturbances in two Alabama counties where schools were about to reopen under new court  ordered desegregation plans.

title: REV. LEO O'CONNOR.
description: WORCESTER, Mass. Sept. (AP)The Rev. Leo A. O'Connor, director of plant planning and assistant business manager at Holy Cross College, here, died today in the college infirmary. He was 68 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The fundamental constitutional issues involved in the President's new economic policies deserve public debate.

title: Giants Will Follow a NoRisk Policy
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 5  Perhaps the most meaningful aspect of the 307 drubbing the New York Giants took from the Cleveland Browns last night was the fact that Charlie Harper didn't play. Harper is the regular offensive tackle who is recovering from a hairline fracture of a bone in his ankle. He was scheduled to start against the Browns. But at the last minute, the coaches decided that there was no sense risking reinjury to a valuable man. They kept him out for another week.

title: Kennedy Center Primps For Washington Opening
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 Acres of red carpet were vacuumed clean again this weekend at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts. American holly trees were planted overnight on the entrance plaza, and this afternoon workmen were sodding the lawns.

title: DESPITE FREEZE, INDEX COULD RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept., 5Even if everyone complies fully with the present wageprice freeze, the Government's indexes of prices and wages could still rise in the months ahead.

title: Overcrowding of Tombs Worse Than at 1970 Riot
description: Nearly a year after inmates of the Tombs took over the prison to protest overcrowding and other conditions, it is more overcrowded than it was on the eve of the October riots, the worst in the city's history.

title: Sharon Springs Hopes to Escape Fate as Saratoga Backwater
description: SHARON SPRINGS, N.Y., Mordecai Yarkony, wagging a finger for emphasis and leaning forward in his chair, said:

title: NORTHERN LIGHT WINS YACHT RACE
description: Northern Light, 17th at the halfway mark, won the 37th annual Vineyard Race held by the Stamford Yacht Club.

title: South Korean Says Settlement With North May Take 10 Years
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. (AP)  Premier Kim Song Pit said today that South Korea would do everything possible to pursue its peaceful contacts with North Korea, but warned that it could take 10 years to reach a political settlement.

title: Melvyn Lowenstein Dies at 79; Was Specialist in Financial Law
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 5 Melvyn Gordon Lowenstein, a lawyer who specialized in business and financial law, died today in Greenwich Hospital. He was 79 years old and, lived here arid at 1035 Fifth Avenue In New York.

title: Carriers Warned on New Law Governing Insurance Renewals
description: Insurance companies must give the true and specific reason for nonrenewal of an auto or other liability and property insurance policy or face a $500 fine, under a state law that went into effect Sept. 1.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Have an Heir Escaped Jailby Air
description: DENVER, Sept. 5There is a world of international adventurers, of wouldbe soldiers of fortune who, for a price, can be hired to take on the most outlandish schemes from aerial bombing of a Latin  American capital to training a mercenary army.

title: News Analysis
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 5Relations between New Delhi and Washington have deteriorated seriously, in the last few months and although misunderstand ings between the Indians and Americans have, always been more the rule than the exeption, this time the rupture seems basic, bitter and deep, and unlikely to be smoothed over easily. The reawins for the Indian bitterness are obviousthe refusal of the Nixon Administration to publicly denounce the fivemonthold Pakistani military repression aimed at crushing the independence movement in East Pakistan, and the Administration's decision to continue some arms shipments to Pakistan under old licensing agreements despite, an implied embargo after fighting erupted in East Pakistan.

title: SAIGON REFUSES TO FREE WAR FOE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 5  A petition for the temporary release from prison of Mrs. Ngo Ba Thanh, a leading critic of the war and of the Saigon Government, has been refused by a court here.

title: Two Brothers Slain And Two Arrested In Families' Feud
description: A longstanding feud between nextdoor neighbors in Brooklyn's Canarsie section flared up yesterday, leaving two brothers in one family dead and two in another family charged with homicide.

title: YANKS STOP RALLY, DEFEAT TIGERS, 65
description: The Yankees, Tigers and paying crowd of 12,366 suffered through 3 hours 3 minutes of sweaty, brainy baseball yesterday as 11 Yankees outlasted 20 Tigers, 65, at Yankee Stadium.

title: MARCHI SAYS A RACE FOR MAYOR IS IN MIND
description: State Senator John J. Marchi said yesterday he was seriously considering running for Mayor in 1973.

title: Princess Wins a Crown In a Horse Show Ring
description: BURGHLEY, England, Sept. 5 (UPI)Princess Anne, riding Doublet, became the first royal rider to win the European threeday event chantpionship with a clear round in the final jumping for a decisive margin of 37.8 points.

title: CHANGES PLEDGED FOR STATE PRISONS
description: The state Commissioner of Correctional Services has outlined a series of major innovations for the state's 16 prisons, including furloughs for selected inmates and the establishment of law libraries for jailhouse lawyers.

title: Jan Flanzer Wed to Barry Lerner
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Sept. 5 Miss Jan Cynthia Flanzer and Barry Alan Lerner were married here this evening in the Jewish Community Center. Rabbi Max Gelb performed the ceremony, assisted by Rabbi Norton D. Shargel and Cantor William Wolf.

title: Settlement in Berlin
description: The new quadripartite agreement on Berlin promises to change so many of the irritating, frustrating and explosive factors leading the world repeatedly to the brink of war that an even more important element might easily be overlooked. The full text reveals that the changes demanded are less important, paradoxically, than the effort to codify and consolidate the status quo.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Eurobond Market, Weathering Storm, Regains Confidence
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 5  With a kind of we've made it again sigh of relief, business on the longterm international capital market has picked up after being scattered by the monetary upheavals and is moving on.

title: Manuel Kaplan Weds Doris Meyrowitz
description: At Temple Israel last evening, Miss Doris Ruth Meyrowitz and Manuel Robert Kaplan, graduates of the American University, were married by Rabbi Martin Zion.

title: Stevenson Denies Seeking Nomination for No. 2 Spot
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (UPI) Senator Adlai K. Stevenson 3d said today that he was not in the running for the Democratic VicePresidential nomination.

title: Float and Its Effect On Various Currencies
description: PARIS, Sept. 5Although most major foreign countries have allowed their currencies to float up against the dollar, the extent of that float has been controlled by government intervention in foreign exchange markets, exchange controls, interest rate changes and other restrictions.

title: U.S SEEKS RETURN OF SCHOOL BINDS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Dr. Sidney P. Marland Jr., the United States Commissioner of Education, disclosed today that the Federal Government was seeking to recover more than $5million in misspent funds from local communities in six states and the District of Columbia.

title: P.S.C. REPORT ASKS CURES ON GAS USE
description: Federal control of the use of natural gas has been urged in a staff report by the State Public Service Commission, which says the nationwide shortage of gas is growing worse.

title: TowedAway Car Yields Marijuana and a Pistol
description: A visiting college student from Manhattan Beach, Calif., was arrested yesterday when he tried to reclaim his towed away car. The police said there were 37 pounds of marijuana and a loaded pistol in the car.

title: CITY PLANS RULES FOR STORE SALES
description: A New York Store that might now adversite Sale today on blouses will soon have to change its pitch to Sale today on 25 per cent of all blouses if the city's Department of Consumer Affairs has its way.

title: News Analysis
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Sept. 5The frigid diplomatic gap that has existed since Marcn between Pakistan and the United States has been marginally reduced in the last few weeks, mainly because fear is Impelling the two nations together.

title: ARAB GUERRILLAS SPLIT ON JORDAN
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 5Nearly a year after the multiple hijacking of international airliners by Palestinian guerrillas and the subsequent civil war In Jordan, the guerrilla leadership is split sharply on the issue of reconciliation with King Hussein.

title: Latin Nations Ask U.S. to Soften Tax
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 5 (UPI)Latin America asked the United States today to exempt the Western Hemisphere from the recently imposed 10 per cent import tax and to restore South American continent.

title: FLOATING RATES ACCEPTED WARILY
description: PARIS, Sept. 5For years, there has been a vocal body of opinion lecturing the world on the simple virtues of floating exchange rates. The advocates ranged from Milton Friedman at the University of Chicago to The Economist, the penetrating London weekly journal.

title: Needham Gains Polo Final
description: TOUGHKENAMON, Pa., Sept. 5Butch Butterworth scored five goals to lead Needham of Middleburg, Va., to an 114 victory over Brandywine, the defending champion, today in a semifinal game of the Gerald Balding eightgoal memorial polo tournament. Needham will meet St. Louis for the championship tomorrow.

title: Sinking Kills 100 Pakistanis
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Sept. 5 (Reuters)  A hundred Pakistani Moslems were killed when their motor launch hit a rock and sank in Iraqi waters of the Persian Gulf, it was reported today.

title: Burger Won't Let Norfolk Bypass School Busing Plan
description: RICHMOND, Sept. 5 (AP)Chief Justice Warren E. Burger of the United States has refused to grant the Norfolk, Va., school board an injunction to permit the school system to bypass part of a school desegregation plan calling for additional crosstown busing, a lawyer said today.

title: Dr. Harold Blanchard, 80, Taught English at Tufts
description: FRANCONIA, N. H., Sept. 5 Dr. Harold H. Blanchard, Fletcher Professor and head of the English department at Tufts College from 1939 to 1964, who since then had continued as a professor of English literature at Franconia College, died yesterday at his home in Lyman. He was 80 years old.

title: BARNES BROOKFIELD
description: Barnes Brookfield, a proofreader on The New York Times, died Saturday in Hackensack N.J. Hospital after suffering a stroke last month. He was 67 years old and lived at 190 East Magnolia Avenue, Maywood, N.J.

title: Alabama Police Seize 200 In Cycle Gang at Race Site
description: TALLADEGA, Ala., Sept. 5 (UPI)Two hundred persons identified as members of a motorcycle gang called the Outlaws were arrested in a raid at dawn today on a campground at the Alabama International Motor Speedway. They were accused of assaulting and robbing race fans.

title: Tocks Island Squatters Resist Bulldozer Sweep
description: SHAWNEE  ON  DELAWARE, Pa., Sept. 5A group of 41 youthful squatters waited nervously in this lush river valley today for the return of bulldozers from the Army Corps of Engineers, which Friday razed six of their residences, two barns and a tent.

title: OGILVY VICTOR AGAIN IN 33D Y.R.A. SAILING
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Sept.  Stanley Ogilvy won with his Etchells22 sloop, Flame, for the second day in a row and the eighth time this season today as a fleet of 120 sailed under the Larchmont Y.C. in the season's 33d Yacht Racing Association championship regatta.

title: Thieu Promotes a General Named as Drug Trafficker
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 5 (AP)Maj. Gen. Ngo Dzu, accused by an American Congressman of being a principa trafficker in narcotics, has been promoted by President Nguyen Van Thieu to the rank of lieutenant general.

title: Small Business
description: Remember the old days when a was station ran gas, did lube jobs, washed an occasional car and did very little else? Well, industry sources will tell you that service stationsthey're sensitive about the term gas stationswould go broke if, that's all they did today. And may do go broke. Everyone knots of a service station that changes hands again and again as each new dealer finds the com petition too tough.

title: Teacher Pay Suit Hinted
description: BOSTON, Sept, 5 (AP)Dr, William Hebert, executive secretary of the Massachusetts Teachers Association; said today that the association may challenge in court any delay in teacher raises that results from President Nixon's wageprice freeze.

title: The BeachLaughter Is the Native Tongue
description: The waning sun laid tiles of light to where my daughters were swimming, and jeweled the water running off the tanbrown body of My little boy, who had just demonstrated the deadman's float he had learned this summer. A light wind dappled the Sound and stirred the sand near the blanket where my wife sat reading Bech: A Book. The tide was in, and I had taken what for me was a long swim. I looked at my family and then contemplated the insulated hamper filled with cornedbeefonrye sandwiches, potato salad, halfsour pickles, soda, nectarines and grapes. And I thought that some of the best moments of my life have been spent on beaches.

title: Science Fiction Fans Gather to Play and Prognosticate
description: BOSTON, Sept. 5Except for those who wanted to gafiat, the fen of science fiction fandom for whom fiawol descended on Boston this weekend for their annual worldcon to smof and to buy old fanzines.

title: Fairness in Stabilization
description: The advent of Labor Day brought two disturbing new indications of the distressed state of the economya steep jump in wholesale prices and a confirmation that unemployment is sticking at an unacceptably high rate. It was precisely these conditions, plus the now chronic deficit in this country's trade balance, that prompted President Nixon three weeks ago to abandon his donothing approach to the economy in favor of a temporary wageprice freeze, a devaluation of the dollar and a package of fiscal proposals designed to spur the economy while also putting the brakes on inflation.

title: City Hall Notes
description: Lindsay administration officials have long complained that inflation was responsible for soaring city budgets; which have increased to $8.5billion from $4billion in six years.

title: M'GLOSKEY TOURS NEW HAMPSHIRE
description: LANCASTER, N. H., Sept. Six months before the nation's first Presidential primary the issue of the war in Vietnam, which drew Paul N. McCloskey, a Republican Congressman, into the race, seems to many politicians to have virtually disappeared.

title: El Al Security Tightened
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 5  Israel's Cabinet today discussed intensified security measures taken on El Al after two reported bombing attempts by Palestinian guerrillas in the last week.

title: 3 Are Wounded by Shots At Rock Festival on Coast
description: SATSOP, Wash., Sept. 5 (UPI)Three persons suffered minor gunshot wounds in a confrontation today with members of motorcycle clubs who invaded a rock festival attended by about 65,000 young people on the Olympic Peninsula.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Dissident Priests Seek Union of Six Organizations
description: The Society of Priests for a Free Ministry ended its threeday annual convention yesterday with a call to five groups in the Roman Catholic Church to converge.

title: Puerto Rico's BestRead Story: Politics
description: SAN JUAN, P.R.Politics and politicians are important to Puerto Rico, and the bestread stories in any of San Juan's four dailies are about political personalities. Will Governor Luis A. Ferr, the 67yearold former Republican party leader, seek reelection next year, and if so, will he begin his big push for statehood? Will the oncedominant liberal Popular Democratic party attract enough middleclass voters to return to power? How much real strength will the resurgent proindependence parties show? In voting, how can we best retain our Puerto Rican identity? These questions asked all the time.

title: Feeding Hungry Children
description: The Administration, under pressure from critics of the Federal school lunch program, acknowledges that 1.9million needy children are still not being fed. No deluge of official statements about progress made and targets met can disguise the national disgrace involved in having so many youngsters go hungry.

title: Officials' Answers To Freeze Queries: Yes, No and Maybe
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Can a police department raise the charges for towing away illegally parked cars during the wage and price freeze?

title: Battle Faced With Being Jettisoned
description: Two experienced members of the New York Jets, Mike Battle and Lee White, appeared in jeopardy today as National Football League teams were required to reduce their rosters to 44 players. The Jets must trim five players. The most notable candidates are Battle, the reckless runback specialist who has been one of the most popular Jets the last two years, and White, the big running back, who was their firstround draft choice in 1968.

title: A Dubious Secret
description: President Nixon has chosen a potentially selfdefeating course in deciding to withhold longrange plans for foreign military aid from the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.

title: KAHANE APPEARS AT ZIONIST PARLEY
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 5The Zionist Organization of America today allowed Rabbi Meir Kahane, head of the militant Jewish DefenseLeague, to address a plenary session of its national convention.

title: Newspaper Official Moves
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Sept. 5 (AP)Edward L. Bennett, a New Jersey newspaper executive, has been named circulation director of The San Antonio Express and News. He comes here from The Newark News.

title: Barbara S. Meister Married to Student
description: SHORT HILLS, N.J., Sept. 5  The marriage of Miss Barbara Sue Meister to William H. Wahler, son of Mr. and Mrs. Karel L. Wahler of Livingston, took place here this afternoon in Temple Bnai Jeshurun. Rabbi Barry H. Greene performed the ceremony.

title: New York Five Wins Title
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 5 (AP)New York defeated Detroit, 8267, today and won the first national tournament of the Neighborhood Basketball League. Larry Fogel scored 21 points for New York and was named the most valuable player of the eightteam tournament.

title: Dock Strike Worries Wheat Men on Coast
description: PULLMAN, Wash., Sept. 4 Sodden clouds have been hanging over the hills these days, adding to the gathering gloom in the biggest wheatproducing county in the nation.

title: Congress Facing Tax Bills On Its Return Wednesday
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 When Congress returns from a summer holiday Wednesday it will find President Nixon's new tax proposals heaped on top of the heavy backlog of other politically and socially controversial issues it left behind just a month ago.

title: MEANY INDICATES LABOR WOULD GIVE NOSTRIKEPLEDGE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 George Meany said today he was quite sure that trade unions would agree to a nostrike pledge if organized labor had a part in setting up ground rules for economic restraints after the current freeze on wages and prices ends.

title: Joan Silverman Married to Alan Darnell
description: Miss Joan Silverman and Alan Mark Darnell were married here last evening at the St. Moritz by Rabbi Meyer H. Leifer.

title: Matthew M. Levy
description: State Supreme Court Justice Matthew M. Levy epitomized the qualities of wit, wisdom and compassion that are part of New York City's genius, though too often obscured by its brassiness and the many cruelties its citizens inflict on one another. He came to this city by way of BrestLitovsk in Czarist Russia and Savannah in the Deep South of the turn of the century. As an honor student at the Harvard Law School, he asked Samuel Gompers, founder of the American Federation of Labor, what place there was for a college man in organized labor. The answer was unhesitating: None. But that did not deter Matthew Levy from coming here just after World War I and becoming a labor lawyer in the democratic Socialist tradition of Meyer London, Morris Hillquit and Jacob Panken. Both as union attorney and as judge, he demonstrated a high regard for the reconciliation of conflicting interests on a basis of primary concern for the public good.

title: Frozen Labor
description: Not since union leaders were flaying the TaftHartley Act as a slave labor law nearly a quartercentury sto have Labor Day statements been so sulphurous in tone and obsessive in theme as are today's union attacks on the unfairness of President Nikon's wageprice freeze.

title: Analyst Scans Market With Optimism
description: Labor Day, the symbolic end of the long summer, is a traditional time for pulse taking in Wall Street for men like Calvert Dooman and his fellow executives. Mr. Dooman, 43, a Harvard graduate, acts as portfolio supervistor for the TriContinental Corporation, the largest Closedend investment company listed on, the New York Stock Exchange. He is also vice president and associate research director for the Union Service Corporation, which provides research and other services for TriContinental and the Union Service Group of four mutual funds. Assets for all five companies total approximately $2billion. The other day, Mr. Dooman talked with Vartartig G. Vartan of The New York Times financialbusiness news staff on the stockmarket outlook.

title: Jet Pilot Gave No Trouble Sign Before Alaska Crash Killing 111
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Sept. 5 (AP)The pilot of a jetliner radioed that he was beginning his landing approach and gave no indication, of trouble just minutes before the plane slammed into a barren mountainside, killing all 111 persons aboard, officials said today.

title: MET TO BEGIN SALE OF SEASON'S TICKETS
description: The Metropolitan Opera box Office will open tomorrow at 10 A.M. for the sale of tickets for the first two weeks of the company's season, which begins on Sept. 20.

title: ECONOMY HELPED IN SANTO DOMINGO
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican RepublicThe Dominican Republic's economy, apparently recovered from the disastrous effects of the 1965 civil war, is now adjusting to a reduction of direct assistance from the United States.

title: BURGLARY SUSPECT SLAIN BY POLICEMAN
description: A burglary suspect was shot and killed by a patrolman yesterday after he and the policeman struggled on the roof of a sixstory building.

title: KEISER IS ELECTED TO HEAD JUILLIARD
description: David M. Keiser has been elected chairman of the board of the Juilliard School, accordting, to Peter Mennin, president of the school. Mr. Keiser was associated with the New York Philharmonic for 24 years, serving as president from 1956 to 1963 and board chairman from 1963 to 1970. He was made honorary chairman in 1970.

title: Last of Sidewheelers In Farewell on Hudson
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N. Y. Sept. 6The Alexander Hamilton, the last of the Hudson River sidewheelers, made her final voyage on the river today.

title: Mine Bureau Links 55 Deaths To Burning Coal Refuse Piles
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (UPI) The Bureau of Mines said today that nearly 300 coal waste piles were burning throughout the nation, mostly in Appalachia, and, that they had caused scores of injuries and at least 55 deaths.

title: McCarver Is Ejected After Fight With Brock
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 6 (UPI)Tim McCarver of the Phils landed a couple of solid rights to the chin of Lou Brock in the fourth inning of the game with the St. Louis Cardinals tonight.

title: Big Protest in Michigan
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Sept. 6 (AP)  Several thousand persons marched through downtown today protesting a planned largescale school busing program. At a later rally, leaders spoke of a possible system of private freedom schools to avoid the busing.

title: Drug Issue Hits Home in Marseilles
description: MARSEILLES, France, Sept. 3This sun splashed port city, described by American authorities as a major supply and transit point for drugs entering New York is starting to worry about the possibility that in a few years it may have the same problem that the American city has.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Bridge:Solodars Prove Exception  To Rule for Tournaments
description: Married couples rarely win major championships, but the rule was broken Sunday at the Greater New York Bridge Association's Knickerbocker championships when John and Judy Solodar of New York captured the master pair title. Other winners were Dale Gilbert and Nancy Schwantes, both of New York, in Flight B of the master pairs, and Alan Schwartz and Mike Levinson, both of Scarsdale, N. Y., in Flight C.

title: Architecture: A Look At the Kennedy Center
description: An Appraisal

title: James E. Brodhead Dies; Executive in Cincinnati, 71
description: CINCINNATI, Sept. 6James E. Brodhead; a former executive with the Procter and Gamble Company, died here yesterday. His age was 71.

title: A Phone Snarl, a Murder, An Exiled Yemen Premier
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 6Maj. Gen. Hassan alAmri, three time Premier of Yemen, has been sent into exile by a crossed telephone line.

title: NIXON EXHORTS NATION TO ATTAIN NEW PROSPERITY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6President Nixon called upon all Americans today to dedicate themselves to a new prosperity without war and without inflation. He said the goal could be achieved through increased productivity and continued faith in the work ethic in American society.

title: Roundup: Lolich joins Blue at 23
description: At one point during his career with the Detroit Tigers, Mickey, Lolich suffered a pitching slump of preposterous proportions. The rotund lefthander hit a dreary low84 days without a victory.

title: Exchange Markets Cahn;
description: LONDON, Sept. 6European foreignexchange markets were in the doldrums today as dealers resigned themselves to a fairly long period of uncertainties and Controls in the floatingrate system.

title: Panel on the SpanishSpeaking Defended
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 6 (AP) A spokesman for the President's Cabinet Committee on Opportunities for Spanish Speaking People denied today allegations that the committee discriminates against Puerto Ricans.

title: Acton's Ensign Triumphs
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 6 Andrew J. Acton sailed Leprechaun to a onesecond victory in the Ensign Class today in the annual Stamford Light Trophy race of the Greenwich Cove Racing Association on Long Island Sound.

title: FURTHER ADVANCE SEEN FOR BONDS
description: Bond men, analysts and operatives alike, seem largely convinced that there is still room for improvement in the credit markets despite sharp advances of the last three weeks.

title: Power Failure Darkens Much of Toronto Area
description: TORONTO, Sept. 6 (Canadian Press)A major power failure blackened much of metropolitan Toronto tonight when a 230,000volt line on the eastern edge of the city failed. The cause of the failure was not known.

title: Humphrey Urges Fair Deal In Place of Nixon Program
description: BARBERTON, Ohio, Sept. 6 (AP)Senator Hubert H. Humphrey criticized President Nixon's wageprice freeze today as based on the theory that business prosperity will trickle down to the working man. The Minnesota Democrat proposed instead a new fair deal that would percolate up instead of trickle down.

title: LATIN MILITARY SEEN BY LAIRD AS STABLE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (UPI) Congressional testimony disclosed today that Defense Secretary Melvin R. Laird considers the military the only cohesive group in most LatinAmerican countries but denies that the Pentagon is encouraging military takeovers through its training programs.

title: Latin America Set To Test Trade Pact
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 6 The creaking 10yearold Alliance for Progress will have to weather yet another storm on Friday when the United States will face a united front of aggrieved LatinAmerican nations at the annual meeting of the InterAmerican Economic and Social Council in Panama.

title: At Last, the Performances Begin
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6After 171 years, the public finally heard the sounds of music tonight in the first proper opera house ever built in the capital of the richest nation on earth.

title: Productivity the Key
description: The themes of President Nixon's Labor Day talk were all straight out of Horatio Alger, a restatement of homespun truths about the importance and dignity of honest toil. But the evangelistic oversell that crept into the President's plea to keep America No. 1 through exaltation of the work ethic and the competitive spirit did not alter the force of his two basic messages. One was that expanded productivity is the only dependable route to higher living standards for all Americans. The other was that this country can never survive as a great industrial nation by hiding behind high tariff walls.

title: Six Seized Off Florida on Boat Carrying Load of Ammunition
description: MIAMI, Sept. 6 (AP)A 38foot fishing vessel carrying a large supply of ammunition and parts of a 50caliber machine gun was boarded and seized by the Coast Guard today in the Straits of Florida.

title: JURGENSEN IS LOST AT LEAST 6 WEEKS
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Sept 6 (UPI)  Sonny Jorgensen, the Washington Redskins' quarterback, will be out of action for at least six weeks, the surgeon who repaired a rare break in his shoulder said today.

title: TRAVELER TAKES JUMPING HONORS
description: CHESTER, N. J., Sept. 6Traveler, owned and ridden by Mrs. Diane Ward of Kinnelan; N. J. edged out Mrs. Linda Wycoff's Trademark today, to win the open jumper championship at the Chester Rotary horse show.

title: The Ambivalent Atom
description: U Thant's message to the fourth international atoms for peace conference which opened in Geneva yesterday illustrated how far opinion in this area has shifted from the ebullient optimism of a decade ago. The United Nations Secretary General's emphasis was on the ambivalence of nuclear technology, a technology that can be employed both for peace and for war. More generally, U Thant noted that optimism about what science can do for man has been somewhat tempered, because, he noted, its benefits have opened new vistas, but have also brought some unforeseen and unpleasant side effects. This was more sober rhetoric than that customary in the days when men imagined that the peaceful atom would bring limitless energy, a revolution in medicine, and other great benefits at small cost.

title: Councilman Protests Rejection By Police of Gift of 2 Scooters
description: A Brooklyn Councilman went to deserted City Hall yesterday to protest that the Police Department had rejected a constituent's donation of two motorscooters for what he called a high crime area.

title: SEA VER'S 2HITTER DOWNS EXPOS, 70
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 6It's the only name. I'm sure of, Gil. Hodges said as he wrote the name Hodges in the manager's slot on the New York Mets' lineup card tonight.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6This is Labor Day that marks the close of political recess as well as the end of summer. When the Democratic Congress gets back to town this week, it wilt face the formidable task of coping with President Nixon's socalled New Economic Policy.

title: Muskie, Opening Tour, Urges Tax Relief
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 6Senator Edmund S. Muskie called today for $7billion in consumer tax credits, increased unemployment benefits and emergency relief to state and local governments as an alternative to President Nixon's new economic policy.

title: Tupamaros Tunnel to Urugua.y Prison and Free 111
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept, 6 (AP)Members of the Tupamaro guerrilla organization freed 111 prisoners from a maximum security penitentiary today.

title: Miss Evert Tops Miss Durr And Reaches Quarterfinals
description: Chris Evert, the 16yearold darling of the United, States Open tennis championships, won her third straight stadium match yesterday, defeating one of the topranked women of the world, Franoise Durr of France, 26, 62, 63.

title: Dock Strike Hurting Hawaiian Business
description: HONOLULUAdvance accumulation of inventories and expanded use of airborne cargo have limited the impact on Hawaiian consumers of the West Coast dock strike, now in its third month. But the curtailment of mainland shipping is beginning to seriously pinch small and mediumsize businesses here.

title: Industries Are Showing Gains Under WagePrice Freeze
description: Businessmen in a wide range of industries are operating comfortably and for the most pari profitably under the wageprice freeze that was imposed by President Nixon three weeks ago, according to a survey by The New York Times.

title: Canada Breaks With U.S. on Atom Tests; Seeks Ban Without Requiring Inspection
description: GENEVA, Sept. 6  Mitchell W. Sharp, Canada's External Affairs Secretary, called here today for a ban on all underground nuclear tests without the provision of onsite inspections to verify compliance.

title: Erie Rebuffs Commuter Who Complains of Fumes
description: The president of the ErieLackawanna Railway has lectured a New Jersey commuter who complained that many lives were endangered by carbon monoxide fumes when diesel train was delayed In a tunnel.

title: Strike Shuts Israeli Airports
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 6Israel's airports were shut down this afternoon by a general strike of civil aviation workers, who seek raises and improved working conditions. Planes arriving at Lydda International Airport discharged their passengers but luggage remained on board. The strikers warned that they would not service planes leaving for Israel after the strike started.

title: PETER BELFER
description: Peter Belfer, an attorney in the trading, and markets division of the Securities and Exchange Commission, died yesterday in Danbury (Conn.) Hospital. He was 25 years old and lived at 799 Park Avenue.

title: Parochial Schools in Area Are Beset By Higher Costs and Enrollment Lag
description: About 860,000 students in the metropolitan area will return next week to parochial schools, where the crucial issue has little to do with traditional classroom work.

title: Brandt Vows Unbreakable Berlin Link
description: BERLIN, Sept. 6Chancellor Willy Brandt pledged unbreakable solidarity with West Berlin today as the East and West Germans met in two sets of negotiations to fill the practical details into the outline of the fourpower agreement on Berlin.

title: KY BACK IN SAIGON; SILENT ON THREAT
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 6Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky returned to Saigon last night from the Central Highlands of Nhatrang city after a weekend of controversy about his threats against President Nguyen Van Thieu during an informal news conference Friday.

title: Irving D. Karpas, Stockbroker And Philanthropist, 81, Is Dead
description: IrvingD. Karpas, who began work as a boy, achieved success. as a clothing manufacturer rind stockbroker and then devoted himself to philanthropy, died yesterday of a heart attack in Beth Israel Hospital. He was 8.1 years old and lived at 1 West 81st Street.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: One Killed, Dozen Hart At Coast Rock Festival
description: WATSONVILLE, Calif., Sept. 6 (AP)One person was killed and more than a dozen were injured in violence tonight after a rock festival attended by nearly 5,000 youths, the Santa Cruz County sheriff's office reported.

title: U.S. Says Bombers Destroyed Two Enemy Antiaircraft Sites
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Sept. 7 (AP)Enemy antiaircraft guns opened fire yesterday on an unarmed American recommaissance plane deep inside North Vietnam, provoking retaliatory strikes by its escorting fighterbombers, the United States command reported today.

title: No Danger of Rebellion
description: MANILA, Sept. 6 (AP)A report of an investigation, submitted to the Philippine Senate today, asserts that no clear and present danger of a Communistinspired ensurrection or rebellion exists as President Marcos had said it did.

title: Russian Blames U.S. War By THOMAS J. HAMILTON
description: GENEVA, Sept. 6A Soviet delegate told a United Nations group today that the dollar had weakened because the aggressive war in Indochina had created balanceofpayments difficulties for the United States.

title: Liberal Party Asks Rockefeller to Help Save 30Cent Fare
description: The Liberal party and Theodore, W. Kheel, the labor mediator, urged Governor Rockefeller yesterday to put the city transit question on the agenda of the special legislative session planned for the fall and to use his influence to save the 30cent fare.

title: Consumer Drive Spurs Reform in Food Labeling
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 Growing consumer demands for labels providing more information about the composition and nutritional value of processed foods are beginning to yield modest results.

title: Miss New a the Road to Success or Exploitation?
description: Tomorrow, Elisabeth May. Condon will step in front of the footlights in Atlantic City for the first time as MissNew York, 1971. But the 21yearold history major from Niagara University will represent much more than just the Empire State as she vies with other young women for the coveted title of Miss America.

title: YANKEES CONQUER RED SOX, 53, 30, SINOBODA EXCELS
description: Although Bobby Murcer, the team's leading hitter, was hospitalized with a kidney ailment, the Yankees experienced one of the few completely pleasurable days of a disappointing season yesterday by sweeping a doubleheader from the Boston Red Sox, 5.3 and 30, at Yankee Stadium.

title: Carolina Resort Seeks AllYear Status
description: MYRTLE BEACH, S. C., Sept. 6  Labor Day at a beach resort used to mark the last day of summer confusion before the long slide into the gray tedium of winter.

title: Doctor Reports Obesity Predictable in Child of 2
description: BETHESDA, Md., Sept. 6 (AP)A researcher at the National Institutes of Health says it is now possible to determine as early as the age of 2 if a child is going to be obese.

title: Pakistan Reports Release Of a Number Jailed in East
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Sept. A number of persons held in connection with the recent disturbances in East Pakistan were released yesterday from various detention camps and jails in Dacca, Comilla, Jessore, Chittagong, Natore and Rang pur in East Pakistan, the official press agency reported today.

title: ANTITRUST DRIVE URGED BY GELLER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (AP) A complete restructuring of the Government's antimonopoly machinery was recommended today as giant corporations came under fire from two influential Democrats in Congress.

title: Israel in Soviet Eyes: I
description: MOSCOWSuffering from operable. appendicitis in Peking is certainly going to extremes in the cause of journalism, but when my modest lumbago mike its presence felt again this summer I, too, looked on it as an opportunity.

title: Noon Rocks to Go Into Cold Storage For Future Study
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (AP) Moon rocks will be put into cold storage for the use of future researchers.

title: CARL SPRINCHORN
description: ALBANY, Sept. 6  Carl Sprinchorn, a retired artist, died today in the Albany Clinic Center. He was 84 years old and lived in Selkirk, N. Y.

title: C. RUXTON LOVE JR. OF STOCK EXCHANGE
description: Cornelius Ruxton Love Jr., a retired partner in the Stock Exchange firm of Josephthal & Co. and a well known art collector, died Saturday in Greenwith (Conn.) Hospital after a long illness. He was 67 years old and lived here at 651 Park Avenue.

title: CLARK DISPUTED ON PEACE DRUGS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 Four prominent psychologists challenged today the view of Dr. Kenneth B. Clark that new mindaffecting drugs should be developed to prevent political leaders from using their power in inhumane and unethical ways.

title: City Accuses State Of Failing to Block Pollution by Autos
description: Robert N. Rickles, the city's Commissioner of Air Resources, assailed the State Department of Environmental Conservation yesterday for failure to set up an autoexhaust pollutioncontrol program.

title: Strike in Egypt
description: Mystery surrounds the sitin strike last month Egypt's major Helwan iron and steel plant. President Sadat has not chosen to inform the world either of the date of this defiance of state authority or of the demands voiced by the workers. He contented himself with assailing the strike as an act of ingratitude, one that could have no justification because here the workers and the people themselves own the factories.

title: Senate Panel Holds Vast Subversives File Amassed by ExChief of Army Intelligence
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6  A secret collection of reports on 125,000 allegedly subversive persons and organizations, the product of an extensive but unofficial intelligence operation that ranged across the nation for 23 years, is locked away today in the office of the Senate Internal Security Subcommittee here.

title: Sayville Regatta Canceled On 3d Day by High Winds
description: SAYVILLE, L. I., Sept, 6Local storms accompanied by high winds, which reached gusts up to 30 knots, and fog caused the cancellation today of the Sayville Yacht Club's threeday Labor Day weekend invitation regatta.

title: Two Die in Plane Crash
description: PLYMOUTH, Mass., Sept. 6 (UPI)A singleengine plane crashed and burned today in a dense fog on heavily wooded Pine Hill, killing the pilot and a passenger, who were not immediately identified.

title: HENRI AUBERT
description: Henri Aubert, a concert violinist of French origin, died yesterday at his summer home in Cragsmoor, N. Y. He was 44 years old and lived at 145 West 55th Street.

title: Danish Women Keep Title
description: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 6 (UPI) The Danish national women's soccer team retained its world title by beating Mexico, 30, yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Coast Pier Talks to Resume
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 6 (UPI)A joint meeting of representatives of West Coast longshoremen and the Pacific. Maritime Associttion was set for tomorrow in the 68dayold strike. Negotiations broke off after a fourhour meeting yesterday. Key issues have been the responsibility for packing and unpacking container freight, wages, pensions and fringe benefits.

title: Ogilvy Posts 3d Sail Victory Of Weekend in Y.R.A. Regatta
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Sept. 6 C. Stanley Ogilvy won his third Etchells22 Class race of the weekend with Flame on Long Island Sound today. He triumphed in the season's 34th Yacht. Racing Association championship regatta held off Larchmont Yacht Club.

title: Federal Jury Investigating Wallace Reconvenes Today
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Sept. 6 (AP)A Federal grand jury investigating campaign funds of Gov. George C. Wallace and allegations of payoffs in his administrations, reconvenes tomorrow to wind up its work with little likelihood of indictments touching Governor Wallace or his administration.

title: New Timber Methods May Aid Profits and Forests
description: Can the forest industry improve its financial return in timber harvesting and at the same time satisfy ecologists?

title: FOOD PRODUCTION GAINING IN INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 6.India seems on her way to doing what many experts, only a few years ago, said she would never do: become selfsufficient in food.

title: Exodus Marks Fading Summer
description: WESTHAMPTON BEACH, L.I., Sept. 6From Speed's drugstore on the west to Hampton Stationery on the east, the cars were parked solidly along Main Streeta last hurrah for a summer season that, in the Hamptons as in other resorts, had been better than any Washington economist was likely to acknowledge.

title: COALITION FORMED TO SEEK RURAL AID
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., Sept. 6 (AP)A Coalition for Rural America, aimed at allowing rural areas to compete with urban groups for Federal aid, has beep formed with several for mer Governors among its 50 directors.

title: Shifting Census Appears to Aid Democrats in 1972
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 Shifting population trends revealed by the 1970 census had been expected to promote Republican gains in the 1972 Congressional elections, but it now appears they may benefit the Democrats instead.

title: LEAD IN AIR FOUND PERIL TO CHILDREN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 High levels of lead in the air of American cities pose health hazards to small children, according to a Federal report on the environmental problems of common metal released today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Archer Beats Graham abd J.C. Snead on First Hole of Hartford Golf Playoff
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn., Sept. 6  George Archer did some extra putting on the practice green today while waiting for his rivals to finish. Then the went out and holed an eightfoot birdie putt to beat J. C. Snead and Lou Graham at the first hole of a suddendeath playoff in the Greater Hartford open.

title: Couple Is Glad Nixon Read Their Letter to Nation
description: Mr. and Mrs. Paul H. Allen of Longview, Tex., won't be receiving the salary increases this month that they had hoped would help pay off their new Buick.

title: Prison Reform Starts With Respect
description: In the summer of 1970, correction officers staged a work slowdown in the city prisons, protesting the inhumane conditions that made their work both dangerous and meaningless. Weeks later, the explosion camethe Tombs riots.

title: Ticket Lost in Delivery
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Sept. 6 (AP)The Delaware State Police stopped Mr. and Mrs. Clifford Lyon of Newark, Del., today for allegedly speeding on Interstate 95 and then forgot to give them a ticket. The authorities said the attention of the unidentified patrolmen was diverted when they assisted in the delivery of a 6pound, 15ounce baby girl to Mrs. Lyon, 24 years old.

title: LYNCH AND HEATH CONFER ON ACTION TO CALM ULSTER
description: LONDON, Sept. 6  Prime Minister John Lynch of Ireland flew today to Britain, where he held crucial talks with Prime Minister Heath on the crisis in Northern Ireland.

title: Girl, 14, Killed in Londonberry
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sept. 6A 14yearold girl was shot to death in Londonderry tonight during a gun battle between British soldiers and snipers of the Irish Republican Army. She was the 100th person to be killed in sectarian violence in the province since 1969.

title: 2D ARREST IN ATTACK ON A POLICEWOMAN
description: A second suspect in the robbery and attempted murder of a policewoman was arrested yesterday in a tenement area of the Bronx known as Fort Apache.

title: Signs of the Jewish Past Fading in East Europe
description: WARSAW, Sept. 6  The synagogue at Secovce in eastern Czechoslovakia has been boarded up. It is used now as a warehouse, as are other synagogues in Slovakia. A notice on the Secovce structure says it will soon be torn down.

title: Yellowstone Visitors Down
description: YELLOWSTONE, Wyo., Sept. 6 (UPI)Yellowstone National Park, the nation's oldest; is apparently losing some of its appeal to the nation's tourists. Park officials said today that 1,839,705 visitors were registered at the park entrances during 1971, compared with 2,040,422 last year and 1,923221 the year before.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Sept. 6John Drowning completed at three race Shields Class weekend sweep today as 67 boats sailed in the holiday Cow Day area Yacht Racing ASsociatIOn of Long Island Sound competition.

title: Donohue Clinches Title
description: CAMBRIDGE JUNCTION, Mich., Sept. 6 (AP)  Mark Donohue wrapped up the TransAmerica sedan driving championship today as he captured the Wolverine race in his Javelin at Michigan International Speedway.

title: M'GOVERN ASSAILS FREEZE AS UNFAIR
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 6 (UPI)  Senator George McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota said today President Nixon's wageprice freeze was the most unfair economic pacitage ever designed by a President.

title: Dutch Elm Disease Spreads Westward
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 6  The Dutch elm disease has continued its slow, relentless movement westward this summer, killing thousands of elm trees in all but two of the states east of the Missouri River.

title: Malta Said to Accept Libyan Aid After Refusing a Russian Offer
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6Qualified diplomatic quarters said today that Malta accepted a $12million emergency loan from Libya last month after refusing a Soviet aid offer.

title: Mr. Kid Charge Wins
description: RUIDOSO DOWNS, N. M., Sept. 6 (AP)Mr. Kid Charge, a 2yearold from the stables of Will F. Whitehead of Del Rio, Tex., set a record of 19.65 seconds today in capturing the $502,000 AllAmerican Quarter Horse Futurity. The race, at 400 yards, was called the richest. in the country. The winner earned $200,841.

title: School Chiefs in South Perplexed on Busing
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 6  There Was once a time in Roy A. Alcorn's professional life when he defined his job as a public school superintendent in terms of the three B's: budgets, bonds and buildings.

title: Yen Off
description: TOKYO, Tuesday, Sept. 7 (Reuters)The yen declined moderately on the Tokyo exchange market today following tightening of exchange control overnight. The tighter control compelled exchange banks to buy dollars to adjust their positions.

title: BERTHA BORNSTEIN
description: Bertha Bornstein, a therapist, researcher and teacher at the New York Psychoanalytical Institute, died on Sunday at her summer home in Vinalhaven, Me., according to associates here. She was 71 years old and lived at 1148. Fifth Avenue.

title: BULLDOZING HALTS AT TOCKS DAM SITE
description: SHAWNEEONDELAWARE, Pa., Sept. 6The Army Corps of Engineers decided today to postpone further bulldozing of houses occupied by youthful squatters on the site of the proposed Tocks Island Dam and Recreational Area.

title: ROBERT T. GAYLORD
description: Robert T. Gaylord, a vice president of the Dry Dock Savings Bank here, died Saturday at the home of a son, Jeremy, in Pound Ridge, N, Y. He was 63 years old and lived in Pompton Plains, N. J.

title: Oliva to Get Surgery
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Sept. 6 (AP)Tony Oliva, the Minnesota Twins' outfielder, will undergo surgery to remove damaged cartilage in his right knee after the season. The American League batting leader hurt his knee diving for a ball on June 29.

title: French Cardinal Missing On Lourdes Mountain Walk
description: LOURDES, France, Sept. 6 (AP)  An 80yearold Roman Catholic prelate, Joseph Marie Cardinal Martin, has been miss134 since going on a solitary mountain walk yesterday.

title: Hobbs Captures Final Race Of Auto Series at Lime Rock
description: LIME ROCK, Conn., Sept, 6David Hobbs of England had little trouble today winning the final L & M Continental championship race of the season at Lime Rock's 1.5mile road circuit.

title: CATHOLIC YOUTHS IN ITALY GO LEFT
description: ROME, Sept. 6Informants in the Vatican said today that Pope Paul VI was examining a new, liberal platform for a Roman Catholic students movement that he served as a spiritual guide for many years.

title: A FOE OF MARCOS ACCUSES MILITARY
description: MANILA, Sept. 4A senator who quit the ruling Nationalist party last Tuesday says that the military, or men trained by the military, threw two hand grenades at an opposition rally on Aug. 21, and not Communists, as President Ferdinand E. Marcos has charged.

title: Advertising:
description: The Television Bureau of Advertising, which issues monthly, quarterly and annual reports on network and spot advertising, has for the first time come up with an estimate of local spending.

title: Downtown Renewal Gives Stamford Lift
description: STAMFORD, Conn.  An amalgam of steel, concrete and optimism is gradually replacing the once faltering heart of this pity on the Long Island Sound.

title: Recovery of Crash Vidtims In Alaska May Take 3 Days
description: JUNEAU, Aliska, Sept. 6. (UPI)Rescue workers began today to bring down from a mountainside the bodies of the 111 victims of the worst singleplane disaster in United States history.

title: CRIME SAID TO RISE IN VIETNAM'S ARMY
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam, Sept. 6  South Vietnamese infantrymen, underpaid and underused, are turning increasingly to murder, looting and highway robbery of other South Vietnamese, according to American pacification workers in all parts of the country.

title: SAIGON OFFERS AID IN HANOI FLOODING
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Sept. 7The South Vietnamese Government has offered food and money to the North Vietnamese victims of heavy floods in the area around Hanoi, the Saigon Foreign Ministry announced last night.

title: TWO WRITERS WIN JEWRY BOOK PRIZES
description: LONDON, Sept. 6Abba Kovner, an Israeli poet, and Nadezhda Mandelstam, the widow of a Russian writer, were named winners here today of the Remembrance Award of the World Federation of the BergenBelsen Associations.

title: GROWTH OF MONEY CALLED TOO FAST
description: The First National City Bank warned yesterday that unless the Federal Reserve system succeeded in slowing monetary expansion to a noninflationary rate, President Nixon's new economic policy would be likely to fail in its attempt to stabilize prices and interest rates.

title: CHARLES WALSH
description: HOLLYWOOD, Sept. 6 (AP) Charles Walsh, former general manager of the Cleveland Rams, died Saturday night at the age of 66.

title: Jerry Lewis Telethon Draws $8Million Pledges
description: Jerry Lewis concluded his latest annual television marathon for the benefit of muscular dystrophy research last night with contribution pledges totaling $8,125,387.

title: Pirates Topple Cubs, 41 and 105, Dropping Chicago 12 Games Out of First
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 6  The Pittsburgh Pirates moved, much closer to their second straight Eastern Division championship in the National League by sweeping a doubleheader from the Chicago Cubs today, 41 and 105.

title: The Talk of Disneyland
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Sept. 6 The Hunters looked like classic Disneyland visitors: handsome parents in their thirties, with two boys, ages 3 and 7. The younger child clasped a plastic copy of a familiar little mouse, which he called Donald Duck. Mom held a balloon. Dad held a wallet. The unusual thing about the hunters is that they are from Australie. This is the only reason we came to L.A.; we checked into a hotel and came straight here, said Steve Hunter, who still seemed a bit disoriented. This place is really well advertised overseas, through Disney's films and TV, and everybody said you can't go to North America and not see Disneyland.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Heath Yacht Runs Aground
description: BURNHAM ON CROUCH, England, Sept. 6 (AP)A yacht owned by Prime Minister Heath ran aground off the eastern coast last night. Mr. Heath was not aboard.

title: 10 PERSONS ON FARM IN AUSTRALIA SLAIN
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Sept. 6 (AP)Two women and eight of their children were slain at small farm 34 miles south of here today in what the police termed the worst mass killing in Australian history.

title: John Ford Honored as Venice Film Fete Closes
description: VENICE, Italy, Sept. 6The 1971. Venice Film Festival ended tonight with the official showing of a Soviet comedy, Naciala (The Debutante), about a peasant girl who becomes a movie starin Jean Seberg style, her initial, role being that of Joan of Arc. It was preceded by an American documentary, Directed by John Ford.

title: Psychiatry Journal Accused of Ban on Ad for SexExpose Book
description: Dr. Martin Shepard, a psychiatrist and author, has accused the American Journal of Psychiatry of imposing an arbitrary and outrageous ban on his book The Love Treatment, which deals with sexual intimacy between patients and therapists.

title: HUNT FAILS TO FIND GIRL LOST ON PEAK
description: EUGENE, Ore., Sept. 6 (UPI) Ground and air crews failed today to find any trace of 17yearold Massachusetts girl missing on a survival exercise in a cold, damp forest high in the Cascade Mountains.

title: 17% of Purchasers, Least in 8 Years, Expect Price Rises
description: Following the announcement of President Nixon's new economic policy, only 17 per cent of the purchasing agents polled last week by the National Association of Purchasing Management, Inc., expect industrial prices to rise in the balance of the year.

title: College to Be Erected on Historic River Site Upstate
description: A new $6.2million campus for a community college will soon begin taking shape at the foot of a hill dominated by Olana, a historic mansion overlooking the upper Hudson River valley south of Albany.

title: Japanese Describe New Car
description: TOKYO, Sept. 6 (Reuters)The Toyo Kogyo Car Company, which makes Mazda automobiles, today disclosed details of a new fiveseat family car with a rotary engine, the Savanna, intended for the domestic and export markets. It has a top speed of about 110 miles an hour and will be priced at $1,675 to $2,100 in Japan.

title: Luna 18 in Moon's Orbit
description: BOCHUM, West Germany, Sept. 6 (Reuters)  The Soviet Union's new unmanned lunar probe entered lunar orbit shortly after 7 P.M., Eastern daylight time, today, the Bochum space tracking station reported. Heinz Kaminski, director of the station, said the probe, Luna 18, went behind the moon and out of radio contact at 7:26 P.M. and left the shadow at 8:15 P.M.

title: MIN PIN SCORES 2D STRAIGHT DAY
Peking Says Taiwan Defector, A Financial Aide, Has Arrived
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 6The Chinese Communists announced today the arrival in Peking of a defector from Nationalist China.

title: Theater: Fiery Young Hamlet Emerges in London
description: LONDONWhat a piece of work is Hamlet! Almost every actor of distinctionas well as a few of no distinction whatsoever eventually plays Hamlet. Who have we had in the past few years? Nicol Williamson, Alan Howard, Richard Chamberlain on TV, and a couple I missed, Brian Bedford in Connecticut, and Alan Bates in London.

title: Japan Will Support U.S. in U.N. on Taiwan Issue
description: TOKYO, Sept. 6Japan told the United States today that she would support a resolution declaring the ouster of Nationalist China from the United Nations an important question requiring a twothirds majority vote for adoption in the General Assembly.

title: KITTIWAKE FIRST AT ATLANTIC CITY
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Sept. (AP)Kittiwake came from off the pace to win the first division of the Margate Handicap for fillies and mares and Cyalo, a $51.20 outsider, took the second division today at the Atlantic City race track.

title: Bobby Allison Takes Southern 500 StockCar Race With Petty Running Second
description: DARLINGTON, S. C., Sept. 6 (UPI)  Bobby Allison, rarely out of the lead, captured the Southern 600 stockcar race by more than a lap today.

title: Anyone for Cooking Lessons in the Long, Cold Winter Ahead?
description: Ballard School, Y.W.C.A., Lexington Avenue at 53d Street, 7554500.

title: NORFOLK PUTS OFF SCHOOLS' OPENING
description: A courtordered plan doubling the number of children bused to achieve racial integration has led to at least a week's delay in opening Norfolk, Va., schools for a new term.

title: U.S. Admiral in Singapore
description: SINGAPORE, Sept. 6 (Reu??ers)Adm. John S. McCain, ??nited States commander in be Pacific, arrived here today ??om Honolulu for a brief visit.

title: SAMUEL N. CORY OF BOLT CONCERN
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 6  Samuel Newbold Comly, former executive vice president Of Russell, Burdsall & Ward Bolt & Nut Company of Port Chester, N.Y., died yesterday in Greenwich Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived on Round Hill Road.

title: TV: Kuralt's On the Road Good C.B.S. Special
description: There are two things worth noting about On the Road With Charles Kuralt, being presented tonight at 10 o'clock on the Columbia Broadcasting System network: It's good; and it represents a television genrethe primetime news special or documentarythat is like ly to be in short supply this season.

title: Advertising:
description: Ad agencies that compete with Bozell & Jacobs for new business during, the coming year will find themselves up against a pretty rough crowd, thanks to the creative thinking of its chief.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6The history of labor is filled with many heroes and innovators in addition to George Meany and President Nixon, and now that those two have had their clay, how about a cheer and a half for some of the others?

title: City's Rent Offices Reopen To the General Public Today
description: The city's six district rent offices that were closed to the general public Aug. 2 to handle landlord applications for rent increases, will reopen today. They will be open from 9 A.M. until 5 P.M. on Mondays through Fridays.

title: Survey Shows 18 Jersey Fish and Wildlife Species Imperiled, Mostly by Man
description: The threatened extinction of the bald eagle in the United States has been highly publicized, but in New Jersey the big birdthe national symbol is only one of 18 species of fish and wildlife whose survival in the state is endangered, according to the New Jersey State Museum.

title: Year of Floating Is Seen
description: PARIS, Sept. 6  A long period of floating ratesperhaps a year or morewith the dollar finally devalued by Europeans in terms of special drawing rights, then the S.D.R.'s, or paper gold, becoming the new standard for the monetary system.

title: BURTIS'S GUACHERO TAKES SAIL HONORS
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., Sept. 6Billy Duals guided Guachero to Star Class honora today as 03 boats sailed in the 81st annual Hempstead Harbour Club's Labor Day regatta.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 6 (UPI)The Soviet Union's supersonic TU144 flew to Bulgaria today in its second trip outside the country, the press agency Tass said. The TU144 is Concorde's chief competitor.

title: Books of The Times
description: LIEUTENANT CALLEY. His Own Story. By John Sack. 181 pages, Viking. $4.95.

title: GEORGE DICKSTEIN, PROMOTED SOFTBALL
description: George Dickstein, a leading promoter of softball, died Sunday night of a heart attack at his home, 9819 84th Avenue, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Nixon to See Cabinet Unit
description: THURMONT, Md., Sept. 6 (UPI)President Nixon will meet at 8:30 A.M. tomorrow with his Cabinet Council on International Economic Policy to review foreign trade in advance of highlevel talks Thursday and Friday with visiting Japanese ministers.

title: Von Braun Sees Moon Visit
description: BREMEN, Germany, Sept. 6 (AP)Wernher Von Braun, the 158yearold Germanborn space scientist, said yesterday that he expected to visit a 50man United States research station on the moon within 10 years. Yes, it will be at the end of the nineteenseventies or beginning of the nineteeneighties, he said. I'll have to stay there at least eight or 10 days.

title: Senator Harris Asks Action To Break Up Monopolies
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (UPI) Senator Fred R. Harris challenged President Nixon today to back up his appeal to America's competitive spirit by taking antitrust action to break up monopoly corporations.

title: A Depoliticized Surrogate
description: Once again, conscientious voters in a primary are being asked to make a difficult decisionto pass judgment on the worth of competing judges for the patronageheavy post of Surrogate of New York County. The predominance of Democrats in Manhattan makes it probable that the man chosen to run on that party's line in the primary next Tuesday will, in effect, be getting fourteenyear hold on the Surrogate's chair. The fateful character of this primary illustrates what is wrong with a system that puts the burden on voters to make judicial selections, instead of leaving that responsibility to nonpartisan screening panels.

title: Puerto Rican Migration Dwindles in a Recession
description: Migration from Puerto Rico which has had a net exodus of nearly 800,000 people since 1940 and has been as high as 75,000 in one 12month period fell to 1,811 in the last year, according to the Puerto Rico Planning Board in San Juan.

title: JEWISH STUDENTS IN 5DAY SEMINAR
description: ZIEGLERVILLE, Pa., Sept. 4 No question was too abstruse or too practical for the group gathered here.

title: Women Who Are Tired of Being Harassed
description: Last month Janet Page, a consultant, in the city's Human Resources Agency, was walking to work at, 220 Church Street and was propositioned by a construction worker at the telephone building going up across the street.

title: M'CLOSKEY SAYS U.S. IS TESTING ECONOMY
description: NORTH CONWAY, N. H., Sept. 6 (AP)  Representative Paul N. McCloskey Jr., Republican of California, said today that the country was experimenting to try to find how to keep prosperity in peacetime.

title: Gimmler Is ReElected Head Of Fire Officers Group
description: The reelection of Raymond W. Gimmler to a oneyear term as president of the 2,600member Uniformed Fire Officers Association was announced yesterday.

title: Group Backs Black Teacher Training Centers
description: NEWARK, Sept. 6Proposals for teacher training centers and a national black educational system were adopted today at the final session of the Eastern regional Congress of African Peoples conference.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sports of The Times
description: Church music from a car radio drifted toward the horses, then the voice of a preacher touting John The Baptist as the greatest prophet of them all.

title: Farewell Party Belmont Victor
description: Victory is becoming a commonplace for Paul Mellon's Rokeby Stable, whose Farewell Party took the $114,100 Governor Stakes at Belmont Park yesterday to the surprise of many in the crowd of 50,574. But the success could not have been too surprising to the Rokeby, trainer, Elliott Burch, for on Saturday he sent out two good ones, a 2yearold named Key to the Mint at Belmont. Park and the winner of $33,850 KellyOlympic Handicap, Run the Gantlet, at Atlantic City.

title: Elizabeth Hawes Dress Designer, Is Dead at 66
description: Elizabeth Hawes, the dress designer, newspaper columnist author, union organizer and women's liberationist died of cirrhosis of the liverlast night at the Chelsea Hotel on west 23d Street. The police listed her age as 66.

title: Jackson, Columbia Passer, Gives Holiday Aerial Show
description: LAKESIDE, Conn., Sept. 6 For most of those who took advantage of the holiday yesterday to visit Camp Columbia, the Lions' preseason football camp, the main attraction was Don Jackson, the quarterback, who put on a fine passing exhibition in the fullgear workout.

title: They've Got a Secret
description: For the first time since the heyday of the late Senator Joseph McCarthy, State Department personnel are being grilled by F.B.I. agents, reportedly equipped with liedetectors. The procedureparticularly inappropriate, would seem, for people trustworthy enough to have been hired for sensitive work in the first placeis prompted by a suspected leaking to the press of stories harmful to the national interest.

title: Transcript of the President's Labor Day Address
description: Following is a transcript of President Nixon's Labor Day address broadcast from his Camp David retreat yesterday, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: 35 Puerto Ricans Freed, Ending Hoboken Strife
description: HOBOKEN, N.J., Sept. 6There was calm but considerable resentment in this Hudson River port town today after a predawn meeting of Puerto Rican youth leaders and authorities produced an informal agreement on ending two nights of bottle throwing, window smashing and looting.

title: WILLIAM J. HENNIGAN
description: William John (Jack) Hennis gan, a copy editor on The Morning Telegraph who previously was a reporter, copy editnt and rewrite man for The New Yerk Mirror and The Long Island Star Journal, died Sunday in Jamaica Hospital after a short illness. He was 53 years old and lived at 24929 Mayda Road, Rosedale, Queens.

title: Foe Strikes in Laos
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Sept. 6 (Agence FrancePress)  Sharp North Vietnamese counterattacks have put nearly 100 Laotion soldiers out of action since Saturday, military sources here said today. The most serious clash occurred in, southern Laos, where about 10,000 menmore than onethird of them Thaishave been conducting a powerful offensive for the last six weeks.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: On the Pier
description: Although angling for the more exotic species off North Carolina's coastwhite and blue marlin and sailfishattracts more national attention, most fisher. man who Journey to that state's seashore spend their time on pier or beach.

title: 20 Killed in German Jetliner Crash
description: HAMBURG, Germany, Sept. 6 (AP)A West German charter jetliner carrying vacationers to Spain crashlanded today shortly after takeoff. At least 20 of the 120 persons aboard were reported killed.

title: CONCORDE, IN BRAZIL ENDS ATLANTIC TRIP
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Sept. 6The BritishFrench supersonic airliner Concorde landed here today completing its first transAtlantic trip.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Chad to Try Correspondent
description: FORTLAMY, Chad, Sept. 6 (Agence FrancePresse)  The correspondent for Agence FrancePresse in Chad, Bernard Nicholas, is to be tried in court here, President Frangois Tombalbaye announced today. He implied that the French journalist's arrest had, nothing to do with a recent abortive coup but he did not elaborate.

title: Registration for School Opens in City Tomorrow
description: Registration for students new to the city's public schools will open tomorrow and run through Friday, according to an announcement by the Board of Education. Classes are to begin Monday.

title: Balloonist Burned in Flight
description: BLUE HILL, Me., Sept. 6 (UPI)A balloonist was reported in fair condition today after being burned at the Blue Hill fairgrounds last night, when his propane balloon burst into flames while descending. The balloonist was Benjamin Rogers, 31 years old, of East Alstead, N. H., a professor at Franklin Pierce College.

title: 17 More Freed in North
description: SAN MIGUEL DE TUCUMAN, Argentina, Sept. 6 (AP) A band of leftwing guerrillas attacked a prison this afternoon in this northern city, freed 17 prisoners and killed. five prison guards with machine gun fire. The police said that 14 prisoners are suspected members of The People's Revolutionary Army, a Marxist urban guerrilla organization.

title: Labor Day Crowds Jam Parks; Traffic and Rain Clog Highways
description: The nation bade an unofficial farewell to summer yesterday with the traditional Labor Day round of beachgoing, cookouts, political speechmaking and traffic jams.

title: MARKET EXTENDS ITS WINNING WAYS
description: Stock prices advanced yes terday in their first session after the Labor Day holiday a move that most observers said augured well for the market.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: PRISON HEAD RESIGNS IN URUGUAY ESCAPE
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 7, (Reuters)  Uruguay's Director of Prisons resigned to day as troops and the police continued a hunt for 111 pris oners, 106 of them Tupamaro guerrillas, who escaped from Punta Carretas Prison here through a tunnel yesterday.

title: ALBERT AND BOGGS CALLED OUT OF STEP
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (UPI) The National Committee for an Effective Congress today ac cused House Speaker Carl Al bert and the majority leader, Hale Boggs, of being out of step with their Democratic col leagues. It said that they rep resented the old coalition of Southerners and G.O.P. con servatives rather than the emerging liberal majority.

title: 3d AirBag Delay Possible
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (UPI)  The Transportation Depart ment is considering granting the automobile industry a third delay on implementing the con troversial air bag safety device, industry sources said today. It would postpone installations of the device until 1975 models.

title: NASA Fills Pollution Post
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP) The National Aeronautics and Space Administration today named James J. Kramer, an ex pert on silentrunning engines, as chief of the newly formed noise and pollutionreduction branch of its aeronautical pro pulsion division.

title: Cornucopia of Events in First Season
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 For its opening fortnight the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts is offer ing a gala festival of music and dance, and the premieres of major contemporary works such as Leonard Bernstein's Mass and Alberto Ginastera's opera Beatrix Cenci and a new production of the rarely heard Handel opera Arlo dante guarantee that the first two weeks will be im pressive.

title: Bus Crash Hurts 18 Youths
description: FORESTVILLE, Md. Sept. 7 (UPI)Eighteen junior high school students were injured to day when a bus carrying them to class for the start of the school year struck a utility pole and overturned. The police said that 21 other students aboard the bus had not been hurt. An ankle fracture was the most se rious injury reported.

title: 7 Chefs Cook Dinner of CenturyWere There 6 Too Many?
description: BIARRITZ, France, Sept. 7 Seven renowned chefs put their bonnets together here last night to prove that French culinary art was as gloriousand Biarritz society as glitteringas when their forefathers were stuffing the likes of Empress Eugenie and Edward VII.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7The Bureau of Labor Statistics re ported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Aug. 31.

title: WILLIAM L BINGHAM, EXHARVARD AIDE, 82
description: DELRAY BEACH, Fla., Sept. 7William J. Bingham, a for mer track star and director of athletics at Harvard University from 1926 to 1951, died today. He was 82 years old and in recent years had made his home here.

title: MORRIS ROSENTHAL, PHYSICIAN, 91, DIES
