description: Dr. Morris Rosenthal, a phy sician who as chairman of the economics committee of the New York County Medical So ciety was credited with a major change in the workmen's compensation system here 40 years ago, died Saturday in a Martha's Vineyard, Mass. hos pital of complications follow ing a stroke. He was 91 years old and had lived for the last decade in West Tisbury on the island.

title: O.E.O. Nominee Says His Goal Is a Bigger Voice for the Poor
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (UPI)  Phillip V. Sanchez, the third Federal antipoverty director in less than a year said today that his goal was to give the poor a stronger voice in shap ing the programs that are in tended to help them climb out of poverty.

title: Tanner's Contract Extended
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 7 (AP)The Chicago White Sox announced tonight they have extended Manager Chuck Tanner's con tract three years for a sub stantial raise following the 1971 season. Tanner originally was signed to a twoyear con tract for the 197172 seasons.

title: Emergency Board to Meet
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (Reu ters)  The Emergency Loan Guarantee Board, which is con sidering a $250million loan guarantee for the Lockheed, Aircraft Corporation, has sched uled a second meeting at the Treasury Thursday.

title: Building Emptied by Fire
description: Firemen evacuated a build ing at 1123 Broadway, near 25th Street, yesterday morning after a blaze broke out in an elevator shaft at the 11th floor. No injuries were reported. Fire officers at the scene reported that the blaze apparently be gan when sparks from acety lene torches being used by workmen on the roof fell through an elevator shaft and ignited waste material.

title: RIFT BREAKS OUT ON STOCK QUOTES
description: A dispute broke out yester day between the two principal companies that supply, auto mated stockmarket quotations and other computerized servites through the securities industry to the nation's investors.

title: Israel in Soviet Eyes: II
description: MOSCOWMany prospective Rus sian emigrants are still unrealistic about the circumstances which await them in the promised land of Israel. As I found on my recent visit, when they discover there are prostitutes and thieves in Israel, too, and that the working conditions are harder than in Russia, they are disappointed.

title: 3 Packers Out of Hospital
description: GREEN BAY, Wis., Sept. 7 (AP)Mike McCoy, Charlie Hall and Dave Livingston of the Green Bay Packers hospi talized yesterday for treat ment for what was believed to have been food poisoning were released today and told to report for practice the ill ness hit abut 30 players.

title: Vatican Denies Role ln Moving the Body Of the Wife of Peron
description: ROME, Sept. 7The Vatican declared today that it had not been involved with the disposi tion of the body of Eva Pern, which was returned to her ex iled husband, former President Juan D. Perlin of Argentina, in Madrid last Friday. However, Vatican sources have indicated privately that the late Pope Pius XII had had a role in the bizarre sequence of events.

title: Notes on People
description: The new president of the National Organization for Women, Mrs. Wilma Scott Heide, foresaw a brave new world in which feminist, humanist values will prevail.

title: Picketing Fails to Block School Buses in Pontiac
description: PONTIAC, Mich, Sept. 7 (AP)  Courtordered busing of school children got under way here today amid much shouting ing and picketing but with only a few minor incidents. Attend ance was low In some schools.

title: RUSSIANS SAY CHINA PREPARES FOR A WAR
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 7 (AP)The Soviet Union said today that the Chinese Army was mdlitari zing all aspects of life in China in preparation for war with the Russians.

title: MRS. A.T. GARDINER
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Sept. 7Mrs. Nancy Gardiner, the widow of Archibald T. Gardiner, senior vice president of Roy S. Dur stifle, Inc., a New. York adver tising agency, died on Friday at the home of her son, Archibald T. Gardiner Jr. She was 90 years old.

title: Me Nobody Knows Back
description: The Me Nobody Knows, the Jeff Britton musical produc tion, reopens with a new schedule at the Longacre Theater next Wednesday. It will play four matinees and four evening performances week. Matinees will be on Wed nesday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday and evening per formances on Tuesday, Wed nesday, Friday and Saturday.

title: Anniversaries
description: ELIE25 years Is a step on the way to our wedding pledge of forever and a day. I love you. (husband) JAY.

title: Books of The Times
description: Anthony Powell may be the last great novelist to deal at firsthand with the Eng lish aristocracy, which is disappearing much as the lions, elephants and rhinos are disappearing from Africa, leaving each country the poorer for it. The manners of the English upper classes were a cornu copia of incongruities that furnished at least two centuries of novelists with mate rial even the best of them could not have invented. It took hundreds of years to de velop these lordly eccentrics, who were not casual cranks but a crystallization of the best and the worst in English history and culture. Though their personalities were often integrated around absurdities, they were integrated and they were personali ties, which is a great deal these days. The choice vaudeville of the lower classes, the gentry were blessed in having novelists, not sociologists, for biographers. Ford Madox Ford, Evelyn Waugh, Henry Green, Anthony Powellwho could ask for any thing more? Authors like these have seen to it that the last of the aristocracy have not fallen as apples fall, without astron omy. There is grandeur in these ruins, and even the most grudging egalitarian ought to grieve for their antic dignity.

title: CANADA CAUTIONS ON ATOMIC SPREAD
description: GENEVA, Sept. 7Canada warned at the Geneva disarm ament conference today that unless the nuclear powers agreed promptly to a ban on underground nuclear tests other countries might be able to acquire atomic weapons of their own.

title: RADIO AND TV TIME FOR POOR IS SOUGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP) The Office of Economic Op portunity asked the Federal Communications Commission to require radio and television stations to allot 3 per cent of prime time between 6 P.M. and 11 P.M. and between 3 per cent and 5 per cent of all time to informational services for the poor.

title: Purity on the Right
description: The biennial convention of Young Americans for Free dom proves once more that the young, whatever their ideology, take their politics neat, undiluted by notions of consensus or the need to compromise. The youthful conservatives who moved to Dump Nixon at their Houston gathering are not only the counterparts of the liberal Dump Johnson enthusiasts of four years ago; they are dead ringers for those purists of the left who traditionally trouble the lives of their liberal elders simultaneously outraging them and making them feel sheepish about their concessions to reality.

title: P. E. NEBLETT
description: Paul Edward Neblett, general manager of the White Castle System hamburger chain for the New YorkNew Jersey area, died apparently of a heart at tack on. Sunday at his home, 6721F 193d Lane, Fresh Mead ows, Queens. He was 60 years old.

title: 7 Killed as a Minnesota Television Tower Collapses
description: SHOREVIEW, Minn., Sept. 7 (UPI)Seven men were killed today when a new, 1,375foot television tower collapsed and crashed through part of a transmitter building below.

title: LONDON
description: LONDON, Sept. 7These are hard days on Uncle Sam. In Asia, the Old Gentleman is denounced as en im perialist and in Europe as an isola tionist. One place it is said he is too rich and powerful, the other that he is too poor and tired to play his his toric role in the world.

title: Slower Growth of Money Supply Voted by Reserve Unit in June
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7  The Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee voted unan imously in early June to con duct monetary policy with the aim of slowing the rapid growth of the monetary aggregates such as the money supply, it was disclosed today.

title: King Olav in Sailing Series
description: OYSTER BAY, L.I., Sept. 7 (UPI)The world champion ships of the 5.5meter yacht class open at the Seawanhaka Yacht Club tomorrow with 68 yearold King Olav V of Nor way as a contender.

title: Soviet Orbits Cosmos 436
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 7 (UPI)The Soviet Union today launched the 436th in its Cosmos series of unmanned earth satellites, the official press agency Aass reported. Cosmos 436 had an initial orbit period of 95.2 min utes and an orbital inclination of 74 degrees, Tass said, and it was a maximum of 341 miles and a minimum of 317 miles from the earth's surface.

title: Israeli Group Says Emigration Is Not Goal of Most Soviet Jews
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 7A spokes man for an unofficial delega tion of prominent Israelis said yesterday that hunger for con tact with Jews abroad was a greater concern of Soviet Jews than emigration to Israel.

title: Foreign Executives Back Expanded Business Role
description: Foreign executives are in agreement with their counter parts in the United States that business must develop new initiatives to expand its social role and improve communica tion with the public.

title: Cambodians in New Drive
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 7 (AP)  The Cambodian Army announced, a new drive on the northeastern front 42 miles north of the capital.

title: SCHOOL STRIKE DUE IN LEVITTOWN TODAY
description: LEVITTOWN, L. I., Sept 7 The 800 members of the Levit town Teachers Association de clined to accept a 6 per cent wage increase offered by the school board and voted today to strike when the schools open tomorrow.

title: McCloskey Sure He Can Win Primary in New Hampshire
description: GORHAM, N. H., Sept. 7 (AP)Representative Paul N. McCloskey Jr., Republican of California, said today that he could beat President Nixon in the New Hampshire Presiden tial primary in 1972 if the vot ers are given a fair shot at understanding the issues.

title: Esposito Scores AgainIn Contract
description: BOSTON, Sept. 7 (UPI) Phil Esposito officially joined the National Hockey League's exclusive $100,000ayear club today when he announced he had agreed to a fouryear con tract with the Boston Bruins.

title: Tidal Flooding Harasses The East Coast of Japan
description: TOKYO, Sept. 7  Kamei chiro Hanashima's lovebird was drowned Sunday because it would not leave its eggs when the sea began to flow over the wall of the spillway in front of the house.

title: 5 Stolen Paintings Valued at $65,000 Recovered by F.B.I.
description: A former convict was arrested at Fifth Avenue and 59th Street yesterday by Fed eral agents who seized five stolen paintings, including a twosided work by Picasso.

title: Amex Posts 4th Straight Gain As Index Rises by 0.11 to 25 .62
description: The American Stock Ex change posted its fourth con secutive advance yesterday in steppedup trading.

title: Many Pupils Losing Subsidy on Carfare; $12.5Million Saved
description: Transportation fare subsidies for tens of thousands of New York City children in public, private and parochial schools were eliminated yesterday by the Board of Education, which said the move would save it $12.5million.

title: Murphy Is Very Impressed by Financial Statements From Police Officers
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy said last night that the financial statements sub mitted in the last two weeks by more than 150 highranking police officers had showed no impropriety.

title: The Jesus Bag
description: Such views are symptomatic of the split between the world of a great many black folk and the black intelli gentsia. For the black folk have de veloped a strong institution in their churches, and, though it may cause some to smile or sneer, it is well to remember that during the 1960's the church was the headquarters out of which the activists went forth to the sitins; and where the plans for the registration drive and the boycott were made. The darksuited deacons gave protection to visitors from afar and the good sisters cooked the tons of fried chicken and made the moun tains of potato salad that the Freedom Army marched on during the thirteen year trek from Montgomery to Memphis.

title: RED TRAIL SEEN HERE DURING NASA TEST
description: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration said that the brilliant red streak observed by thousands in the metropoli tan area and along the entire East Coast last night was caused by an experimental rocket sent aloft to test upper atmosphere wind direction and speeds.

title: SANTA FE'S FIESTA ENDS IN DISORDER
description: SANTA FE, N. M., Sept. 7 (AP)  Santa Fe's annual fi esta ended in disorder last night as state and city police men used tear gas to disperse a disorderly crowd of young persons in the downtown Pla za.

title: Two for Tonight
description: The first note of Leonard Bernstein's Mass ended, in effect, the long preliminary controversy over the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts. In that debate some of the country's foremost architectural critics com pared the style of the project with everything from the Moscow subway to a concrete candy box. But now that the $70million Center is officially open, it is too late to cry over spilt concrete. The important thing at this stage is to make certain that it becomes a vital part of the Washington scene for many years to come.

title: 611 Star Stays in College
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Sept. 7 (AP)Tom McMillen, who last week reportedly was interested In quitting school in favor of a pro basketball career, regis tered for the 197172 academic year at the University of Mary land today. Coach Letty Driesell said McMillen, a 6foot11inch sophomore, had returned to his Mansfield, Pa., home after scheduling his classes.

title: Believe It or Not, That Garden Was Once Called Mud Flats
description: Every building should have someone like Bob, said a tenant at 333 West 57th Street.

title: DIAMOND REBUTS RICKLES'S CHARGE
description: Henry L. Diamond, the State Commissioner of Environmen tal Conservation, asid yester day that the state was at work on two programs for testing au tomotive pollution emissions.

title: Latin Aid Bank to Borrow $50Million From Japanese
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7The Inter  American Development Bank announced today that it had arranged to borrow more than $50million in three sepa rate loans from Japan.

title: 2 Corporations Rescind Increases in Dividends
description: In response to President Nixon's call for voluntary re straints on dividend increases for stockholders, two compa nies that had planned to give shareholders an increase in divi dends announced rollbacks yesterday.

title: Tandy Sets Marks in Year
description: Record sales and earnings were achieved by the Tandy Corporation in the fiscal year ended June 30, according to the company's report issued yes terday from its Fort Worth, Tex., headquarters.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CARBIDE DEVELOPS COOKING HEAT SEAL
description: The Union Carbide Corpora tion announced yesterday that it had developed a process to seal by heat polyester film used in food packaging that, the company implied, will make things easier for housewives.

title: Theater: Acting Dominates a Fine London Season
description: LONDONThis is my find report this year of the Lon don theatrical scene, and it might be as well to stress what a very good season Lon don has had. There Is almost a superfluity of fantastic act ingafter a time It becomes So good that you almost take it for granted, and this is a pity.

title: An Attempt to Kill U.S. Envoy in Pnompenh Fails
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia Sept. 7 (AP)Terrorists pushed a bombladen bicycle today into the path of a limousine carrying the United States Ambassador, Emory C. Swank, but the ex plosive failed to go off.

title: Sniping in Londonderry
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, Sept. 7 (AP)British troops came under persistent sniper fire today In London derry.

description: To the Editor:

title: METS BOW, 9 TO 3, AS STAUB EXCELS
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 7Mrs. Joan Payson flew over from Maine tonight to watch her New York Mets in Canada and had a sensationally unreward ing trip as the Montreal Expos shellacked her boys, 93.

title: Record 991Pound Tuna Caught as Tourney Opens
description: YARMOUTH, Nova Scotia, Sept. 7 (Canadian Press) Two tuna, one a record weight for the competition, were boat ed today as the 22d Interna tional Tuna Cup Tournament opened off southwestern Nova Scotia. This raised match offi cials' hopes that the bluefin might have returned to their old grounds in significant num bers.

title: $99 FARE APPROVED FOR COAST TO COAST
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board authorized American Airlines and Trans World Airlines yes terday to fly the wives and children of businessmen coast tocoast for $99 round trip, plus $7.92 tax. The new rate, which goes into effect Oct. 1, will be the lowest in history for a transcontinental, jet round trip.

title: 6 Corporations Pressed on Dividend Increases
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 The Administration sought today to bring pressure to bear on six corporations that reportedly raised dividends in defiance of a Presidential request. The ef fort produced no immediate results.

title: U.S. Physical Fitness Council Widening Programs
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 The professionals who took over the President's Council on, Physical Fitness and Sports almost a year ago are start ing a wide range of new programs.

title: Catskill Resorts Bid State License Gambling Casinos
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., Sept, 7 (UPI)Representatives of the major Catskill resorts today urged the state to set up Las Vegas type gambling casinos.

title: L. I. Couple's Adoption Case Heard by Court of Appeals
description: ALBANY, Sept. 7 (AP)The lawyer for a Long Island cou ple pleaded today with the Court of Appeals to order the return of a 3yearold Chinese girl to the couple to permit adoption,

title: Opening of Marcus Garvey School in Newark Reflects Growing Blackness of City
description: NEWARK, Sept. 7  When the public schools reopen here Thursday, the Robert Treat School, named for the dissident Puritan who founded Newark in 1666, will officially become the Marcus Garvey School, in honor of the founder of the black nationalist movement.

title: Travel Record at Kennedy
description: Customs officials processed a recordbreaking total of 26,962 air travelers returning from overseas Monday at Ken nedy International Airport. Fred R. Boyett, regional customs commissioner for the New York area, said the previous high of 26,082 for clearing passen gers at the airport was set on Aug. 29, 1970.

description: Production or steel last week climbed 8.6 per cent from the preceding week's total, the American Iron and Steel Insti tute reported yesterday in Washington. The gain reflected the continued normalization of industry operations.

title: Jets Confront City With Stadium Plan, But Make No Gain
description: Philip H. Iselin, president of the New York Jets, received a cold turkey lunch from Mayor Lindsay yesterday and little en couragement for his proposal to expand Shea Stadium.

title: MARX GROUP SEEKS TO HELP LINES BROS.
description: LONDON, Sept. 7 (Reuters) An American group made an offer today to rescue Britain's biggest toy manufacturer from the bankruptcy court.

title: Train Collision Kills 2
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Sept. 7 (AP)Two men were killed and four others were injured today when two trains collided on the Grand Trunk Railroad tracks on Pontiac's east side. The dead were identified as Charles M. Logsdon, 64 years old, of Battle Creek, Mich., and Clarence G: Smith, 43, of Lake port.

title: CABINET UNIT SET UP ON DRUG CONTROLS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP) The White House announced today the creation of a Cabinet committee on international nar cotics control. Secretary of State William P. Rogers, the chairman, termed it the most major effort ever undertaken to control international drug traffic.

title: POLL SAYS 73% BACK WAGEPRICE FREEZE
description: The Harris Poll reported yes terday that 73 per cent of the American people favored Presi dent Nixon's wagepricerent freeze, although many re mained skeptical of its impact on the economy.

title: Roundup: McNally Homer Guns Down Indians, 3 to 1
description: It cost the Baltimore Ori oles $80,000 to sign Dave McNally, an American Legion star pitcher from Billings, Mont., to a contract in 1962. The lefthander was almost a bargain buy considering his accomplishments since.

title: Battle of Jets Reaches Point of no Returns
description: The short, happy Jet, career of Mike. Battle ended yesterday when he was placed on waivers and nobody in the National Football League picked him up.

title: 10,000 Bused in Kalamazoo
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., Sept. 7 (AP)  The public schools opened today without incident with 10,000 of the 16,400 pu pils being bused under court orders to bring about what the court said would be racial bal ance.

title: Racing Season Is Getting To Be Endless Summer
description: About Motor Sports

title: Youth, 15, Shot as Blacks And Dominicans Clash Here
description: A 15yearold youth was shot in the knee and four other per sons were also injured when large group described by the police as Negro and Dominican youths engaged in a fight in the vicinity of Amsterdam Avenue and 160th Street last night.

title: JOSEPH P. MORAN
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., Sept. 7 Joseph P. Moran, who had been a patent counsel for the Bab cock & Wilcox Co., manufac turers of power equipment and other products, for 23 years at his retirement in 1967, died yesterday. He was 69 years old and lived at 220 Wychwood Road.

title: 2 Japanese Navy Ships Here on Goodwill Tour
description: A training squadron of the Japanese Navy consisting of the destroyer Yamagumo, and the training ship Katori docked here yesterday during a, goodwill tour.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: TUCUMAN, Argentina, Sept. 7 (Reuters)  The police today caught 4 to 14 leftwing extrem ists who were freed from pris on in this northern city last night in a guerrilla raid.

title: Soggy Section in Queens Says the City Is All Wet
description: Bureaucracy and red tape have opened floodgates that people in Little Neck, Queens, thought they had closed by commonsense engineering.

title: No Agenda on Itinerary
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 7Premier Kosygin's visit is unlikely to lead to any tangible results, in the opinion of Canadian sources.

title: Elementary Schools Show Another Drop In Pupil Enrollment
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP) The number of children in elementary school this fall will decline for the second consecu tive year, in another note of bad news for aspiring teachers.

title: Bridge: Michael Becker Outstanding In Knickerbocker Play Here
description: The outstanding perform ance in the Knickerbocker Championships played during the holiday weekend was by Michael Becker of New York.

title: Dollar Posts Some Gains; Technical Pressure Cited
description: PARIS, Sept. 7The dollar moved up in value against sev eral European currencies today, going in the opposite direction to that intended by President Nixon in his efforts to improve the American competitive situ ation abroad.

title: Cites Competitors' Link
description: MIAMI, Sept. 7 (AP)L. B. Maytag Jr., president of Na tional Airlines, Inc., said today that his airline faced a threat to its existence if the proposed merger of Northeast Airlines and Delta Air Lines was ap proved by the Civil Aeronautics Board.

description: To the Editor:

title: Barber Sees Giscard
description: PARIS, Sept. 7 (Reuters) British Chancellor of the Ex chequer Anthony Barber dis cussed the world economic crisis and British entry into the Common Market with French Finance Minister Valery Giscard d'Estaing today, and both men agreed that their views had much in common.

title: Pincay Rides $47.40 Belmont Winner
description: When they hung up $47.40 on Goin' Sparkin after the first race at Belmont Park yesterday, hindsight took over.

title: Many East Midtown Plaza Buyers Cancel Out as Charges Rise, H.D.A. Says!
description: More than onequarter of the original purchasers of apart ments in a cityaided Mitchell Lama apartment development in east midtown Manhattan have canceled their contracts to buy as monthly maintenance charges have soared above orig inal estimates.

title: Film: 'Swords of Death':Uchida Pits Samurai Against Able Foes
description: "Swords of Death," which opened yesterday at the Bijou Cinema, is an incomplete film, its director, the veteran Tomu Uchida, having died before he finished shooting it. As it stands it is an interrupted anecdote, a private post-script to a part of the early career of one Musashi Miyamoto, the samurai hero of several Japanese movies. I don't know how "Swords of Death" might have ended, but I think it would have remained small-scale, a moral interlude in a life that is, like the lives of most epic heroes, commonly understood as historic necessity.In the film, Musashi (Kinnosuke Nakamura), hoping to extend his knowledge of the techniques of personal combat, visits the home of Baiken Shishido (Rentaro Mikuni), a bandit who has developed a highly unorthodox way of fighting with ball and chain in one hand and a small very sharp scythe in the other. Musashi first comes upon Baiken's wife (Hideko Okiyama), also adept in her husband's methods, training her baby not to fear the whirling iron ball or the cries of an advancing warrior.He spends a night with Baiken, and in the morning finds that his host is in fact an enemy, sworn to avenge a brother-in-law whom Musashi had killed in battle. So begins a fight involving Musashi and the warlike husband and wife, and even the little baby, that is long and intensely interesting, and unfinished when the movie ends.When the movie does end, it ends in a freeze frame, a device that it uses often before it ends, in order to stop the action and allow time for a brief monologue. The device may have been Uchida's, or it may have been added to the uncompleted footage, but in "Swords of Death" it seems a reasonable addition to an esthetic that uses the mist for magic, equates fire with rage, and literally transforms its bandit's face into a demonic mask when he decides to put a dead man's honor above his son's life.Such simple, almost crudely direct ways of making a point seem very much in keeping with the meaning of "Swords of Death," which takes at times the imaginative license of folk tale or of the lesser adventures in Spenser's "Faerie Queene." Baiken might be some human relation to the iron man Talus, or a veritable allegory of anger, in Rentaro Mikuni's violent characterization. And as his wife, Hideko Okiyama projects fierce loyalty or love by turns, as if each emotion had for its time taken possession of her. These are fascinating performances not simply for themselves but because they help build another worldin which wishes are stronger, responses are simpler, dangers more immediate, and perception cleared for an education that proceeds not by subtle argument but by force of feeling.

title: I.B.A. PLANS LINK TO STOCK GROUP
description: The Investment Bankers As sociation of America and the Association of Stock Exchange Firms, Wall Street's two lead ing trade groups, announced merger plans yesterday.

title: J. BUFORD CHISHOLM

title: Registration of New, Young Voters Is Light

The grant was announced yes terday by Governor Rockefeller.

description: BONN, Sept, 7Chancellor Willy Brandt announced today that he had accepted an invita tion to meet the leadership of the Soviet Union, probably at the end of the month and pos sibly outside Moscow.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
CARL FARRINGTON, GRAIN MERCHANT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7  Carl C. Farrington; a leading grain merchant and. Federal agriculture official, died, yes terday of a heart attack while playing golf in Maryland. He was 66 years old.

title: Hearing on Freeze Set
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP) The House Committee on Small Business announced to day that it would hold hearings this month on the impact of the current wage and price freeze on the nation's five mil lion small businessmen.

title: Disabled Stage Saigon Protest
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 7The Vietnam Veterans Organization staged a small demonstration at the Ministry of Veterans Affairs today but failed to make many political points for its patron, Nguyen Cao Ky, when the Government granted most of its demands.

title: SUFFOLK WILL GET 440 HOUSING UNITS
description: PATCHOGUE, L I., Sept. 7 The Brookhaven Town Board cleared the way today for the first federally subsidized low income housing to be built in Suffolk County under the Fed eral Housing Act of 1968.

title: Seven Flights to London Delayed by Bomb Threat
description: Seven passenger flights to London  three from Boston's Logan International Airport and four from Kennedy Internation al Airportwere delayed last night because of a telephoned bomb threat from a man who identified himself as a member of the Irish Republican Army.

title: New Sweep Brings Saigon Troops Within 8 Miles of Laotian Border
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 7  South Vietnamese troops pushed toward the Laotian border south of the demilitarized zone today on the second day of a new operation but reported no contact with the North Viet namese. Some of the Saigon force advanced to within about eight miles of the fron tier. Officers said there was no plan to cross into Laos in force, Objectives of the new sweep are to destroy North Vietnamese supply bases and to stem troop and supply movements into the north west corner of South Viet nam over outlets of the Ho Chi Minh Trail, The South Vietnamese force, totaling about 12,000 infantrymen, marines and rangers, is backed by United States heli copters, artillery and B52 bombers. The United States command said a Cobra helicopter gunship sup porting the operation was shot down on the first day of the drive but the crew was unhurt. The operation is cen tered to the northeast of Khe sanh, which was a major United States operating base in the drive by the South Vietnamese into Loas in Feb ruary and March. It was aban doned in April after the South Vietnamese pulled out of Laos.

title: MONY Deal Is Backed
description: Merger News

title: Israeli Airport Strike Ends
description: TEL AVIV, Sept, 7 (UPI) Employes at Lydda Internation al Airport called a sudden end to their 10hour wildcat strike today, saving the Government the prospect of having to in voke emergency means to help stranded travelers.

title: Missing Hiker Found Dead In Oregon Wilderness Area
description: EUGENE, Ore., Sept. 7 (UPI) Searchers recovered late to day the body of Lorene La rhette, 17 years old, the second victim of a character train ing survival hike through the snowcovered wilderness.

title: Gunman Sought in Burning Of 2 Men in Roxbury, Mass,
description: BOSTON, Sept. 7 (UPI)  A gunman tied up two men early today, doused them with gasoline and set them afire, killing one and seriously in juring the second.

title: Soothsayers, Goodby
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7The season of the pollsters is again upon us. Dr. Gallup, Mr. Louis Harris and their many competitors are busily at work all the time, but it is in the year lead ing up to a Presidential election when they buzz most persistently into the public consciousness. Is it too much to hope that this time they will be ignored or, at least relegated to the periphery of the political scene?

title: ExPostal Clerk Accused of Bilking Apartment Seekers
description: A former postal clerk ac cused of bilking black and Puerto Rican residents in Har lem, and the Bronx out of fees ranging from $3,50 to $650 on worthless promises to obtain apartments for them in city housing projects was indicted yesterday by a Bronx grand jury.

description: A 13yearold boy is bound to remember this sort of day.

Is lands after bargaining all sum mer over contract renewal. The Commissioner of Education, Harold Haizlip, ordered all schools to be kept open and offered police protection to stu dents.

description: A study commissioned by Ac tion for Children's Television has found that 23 per cent of the viewing time on commercial television programs for chil dren is taken up by commer cials, that the presentation of commercials averages out to one every three minutes and that 71 per cent of the creative fare contains at least one in stance of human violence fre quently accompanied by laugh tracks).

description: LONDON, Sept. 7  The British Broadcasting Corpora tion has barred television show ings of Sesame Street, say ing that the popular American children's program has author itarian aims.

title: AtomWaste Ruling Upheld
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 7 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit ruled to day in a Minnesota case that the Federal Government has the sole authority to regulate radio active wastes from nuclear power plants. In a 21 decision, the court upheld a lower court's ruling that the Northern States Power Company was hound only by Federal regulations on radioactive wastes at its nuclear power plant at Monticello.

title: Prosecutor's Aides In Passaic Called In a Union Inquiry
description: TRENTON, Sept. 7Federal and state authorities have be gun investigating alleged labor union corruption involving or ganized crime and the Passaic County Prosecutor's office.

title: Small Audience Urged
description: WATSONVILLE, Calif., Sept. 7 (AP)  Rock festivals that lure thousands of fans to small towns should be banned, a sheriff said today, after a Labor Day rock festival ended with one motorcyclist dead and 10 more wounded.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: RIGHTS UNIT SHUNS DISPUTE IN HOSPITAL
description: The chairman of the city's Commission on Human Rights said yesterday that the com mission had no jurisdiction in a dispute involving community groups in Harlem and a white physician at Harlem Hospital who was accusedand offi cially clearedof spitting at a black dietary aide.

title: NonPickups of Welfare Checks Are Continuing at a High Level
description: For the fourth successive semimonthly cycle in which welfare checks are issued, more than a fifth of relief recipients classified as employable have failed to pick up their checks at state employment offices.

title: Advertising:
description: Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn has resigned the B. F. Goodrich account be cause it was unable to re solve a fundamental differ ence of opinion on creative matters.

title: 5 PAINTINGS STOLEN FROM VENICE CHURCH
description: VENICE, Sept. 7Five paint ings by two 15thcentury Vene tian masters were today report ed stolen from the Roman Catholic Church of SS John and Paul here in the second ma jor art theft in Italy in eight days. The missing paintings were two panels of a sixsection altarpiece attributed to Giovan ni Bellini and a triptych by Bar tolomeo Vivarini. The police described the paintings as priceless.

title: New United Jersey Bank
description: United Jersey Banks, a Hack ensackbased holding company, disclosed plans yesterday to create a new bank in Camden County to be known as the United Jersey National Bank of Cherry Hill.

title: The Subways Can't Sleep
description: Every time the city has a problem no one has the courage to solve, the way out always seems to be: Give the citizens less service. With local politicians dead locked over a formula for averting a disastrous year end increase to 50 cents in subway fares, the chairman of the City Council's special committee on public transpor tation, Bertram Gelfand of the Bronx, has proposed that the subways be shut down from 1:30 A.M. to 6:30 A.M.

title: COMPETITION LAG IN NAVY BIDS CITED
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7  The General Accounting Office said today that an absence of competition among shipbuilders was increasing the Navy's bills for construction and repairs.

title: Evansville Defies Order
description: EVANSVILLE, Ind. Sept. 7 (AP)  The EvansvilleVander burgh County public schools opened quietly today, with pu pils going to the same buildings they attended last year in spite of a Federal order to submit a racial balance plan. Today was the deadline.

title: Inadequate Job Program
description: As Congress begins its examination of President Nixon's program for economic recovery, the law passed earlier this year to establish public service jobs for the unemployed deserves reappraisal. In the light of the high priority Mr. Nixon wants assigned to restoring full employment, it is plain that the new program is much too small to make much impact in reducing the army of jobless. Moreover, Congress in drafting the law and the Administration in drawing up guidelines have failed to establish priorities to direct aid where it is most needed.

title: Jam Handy Trimmed Down for Fresh Start
description: DETROIT, Sept. 7One of the most fortunate men in the United States business world this year must surely be Wil liam H. Sandy, 42 years old. About 10 weeks ago his boss handed him some $5million worth of business, gave him the pick of the company's 70 best employes, advanced him a loan on ridiculously low terms and told him to start his own con cern, the Bill Sandy Company, Inc.

title: Cyclists Leave Alabama
description: TALLADEGA, Ala., Sept. 7 (UPI)  About 200 members of the Outlaws, a motorcycle gang, rode out of Alabama last night after being released by state and local authorities on agreement that they would leave the state.

title: Vatican II Is Reaching Grass Roots
description: WHITE PLAINS  Two hundred and twentyfive members of St. Bernard's Roman Catholic Church turned up at a parish meeting one night recently and spent 35 minutes debating whether to dismiss the physical edu cation teacher in the paro chial school and hire instead someone to teach music, art and reading.

title: Arms Talks Session Held
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Sept. 7 (AP)The strategicarms limi tation talks went into their 18th session today at the United States Embassy here with a onehour meeting and a 30min ute informal exchange. United States and Soviet delegates will meet again Friday at the Soviet Embassy.

title: SUCH GOOD FRIENDS WILL OPEN DEC. 22
description: Otto Preminger's Such Good Friends will have its world premiere Dec. 22 at two Man hattan film houses, the new (Reade Theater at Broadway and 44th Street and at the Baronet Theater, Third Avenue and 59th Street.

title: Ulster Victory Seen
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sept. 7The inconclusive out come of the talks between Mr. Heath and Mr. Lynch was seen here as a victory for the North ern Ireland government.

title: Drugs for Leaders?
description: In recent centuries the scientific revolution has pro vided much warrant for the notion of the technical fix, the idea that scientists or technologists can find an appropriate solution for every problem. The disap pearance of such killing diseases as smallpox, polio and cholera from modern industrial societies is the product of technical fixes ranging from vaccines to the pro vision of safe water and milk. The agricultural revolu tion that underlies much of this country's prosperity is the product of technical fixes from hybrid corn to modern pesticides and fertilizers. The list could be extended indefinitely, though an equally long one could be compiled of new problems created by many of these same boons.

title: Realty Syndication Plan By Bank America Barred
description: The Federal Reserve has blocked the BankAmerica Cor poration, at least temporarily, from setting up and selling partnership interests in real estate syndications.

title: White House Services Set
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP) President Nixon will open a fall series of church services at 11:30 A.M. Sunday at the White House. The guest minister will be Rev. Ben Haden of the First Presbyterian Church in Chatta nooga, Tenn. The guest soloist will be Norma Zimmer, who sings with the Bill Graham Cru sade and appears on the Law rence Welk show.

title: Body Search Is Halted
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Sept. 7 (AP) The recovery of bodies from the mountainside where 111 persons died Saturday in an Alaska Airlines crash was halted today when bad weather again closed in over the area.

title: Thant Gets Soviet Request
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 7The Soviet Union to day submitted to Secretary General Thant a memorandum that was understood to propose a world disarmament ocnfer once to be called by the Gen oral Assembly this fall.

title: 2 Tropical Storms Gaining Force
description: MIAMI, Sept. 7 (UPI)Two tropical stormsFern and Edithdeveloped today, Fern in the Gulf of Mexico and Edith in the Central Carib bean.

title: Lie Test Said to Back Officer Who Told of Reporting Atrocities
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 7  A lie detector examination of Lieut. Col. Anthony B. Herbert was reported today to conclude that he was truthful in saying he personally reported Vietnam war crimes to a colonel and a general in 1969.

title: A Drive Against Illegal Parkers Opens in Bronx With 45 Tickets
description: It was educational enforce ment day in scattered areas of the Bronx yesterday as task force of four city depart ments began a campaign against illegal parking, but there was some doubt as to who was being educated.

title: New Luxury Cars to Join Amtrak Fleet in the East
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7  Railroad passengers in the East will reap the benefit of a sharp contraction of train service the West under the National Railroad Passenger Corpora tion's equipment buying plan announced today.

title: 300 ATTEND RITES FOR JUSTICE LEVY
description: State Supreme Court Justice Matthew M. Levy was de scribed yesterday at his funeral as a man of steel tempered with grace, humanity and dig nity.

title: HIGH COURT IS ASKED TO HEAR SMITH CASE
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., Sept. 7 (AP)  The State Attorney General's office asked the United States Supreme Court today to review lowercourt rulings that overturned the 1957 conviction of Edgar H. Smith Jr., who has been on Death Row since then.

title: LACK OF STARTERS CANCELS RICH PACE
description: WESTSURY, L. I., Sept. 7 A lack tit owners willing to race their horsed over 1 miles forced the cancellation today of Saturday's scheduled 20th edition of the $50,000 Nadsau Pace at Roosevelt Race War.

title: Rarely Heard Herodiade Given at Concert in Park
description: The sweetly passionate Sa lome of Massenet's Hrodi ade is a far cry from the depraved sensualist in the opera Richard Strauss made from Oscar Wilde's play. Mas senet's Music is just as dis tant in quality and theatrical power from Strauss's, which probably explains why the French work is rarely per formed today, although it was once very popular. The sear ing, glittering Strauss score overwhelms, in memory's ear, any other treatment of the story of Salome, her love for John the Baptist and the lat ter's beheading at the instiga tion of the vengeful Herodias.

title: ExFoes and Supporters Of Aid to Arts Hear Mass
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 The Congress of the United States, which long frustrated the dream of a national cen ter for the performing arts in this capital, was honored tonight at the almost com pleted building.

title: CHICAGOAN IS NAMED TOP S.E.C. COUNSEL
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8G. Bradford Cook Sr., a Chicago Lawyer, was named today as general counsel of the Securi ties and Exchange Commission, the post that is generally con sidered the commission's most important staff job.

title: U.S. ALLEGES A PLOT TO RAID DRAFT UNITS
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Sept. 7 (UPI)  Federal attorneys said today that they had uncovered plans by antiwar activists to raid Government offices in nitre states. The discovery was made, they said, during their investigations of an alleged plot to kidnap Henry A. Kissinger, adviser to the President.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 7 (AP)The United States command said today it was ex tending its urinalysis drugtest ing program, beginning today, to include American service men who take oneweek rest andrecreation leaves outside South Vietnam.

description: SAN RAFAEL, Sept. 7 (AP) Angela Davis's lawyer said today that he would ask for change of venue on the grounds that recent violence at San Quentin Prison would pre vent her from getting a fair trial in Marin County.

title: BRITISH SUPPORT OF DOLLAR SHOWN
description: LONDON, Sept. 7A large measure of British support for the beleaguered American dol lar is shown in a report on the secondquarter balance of pay ments released by the Treasury today.

title: Peking Signs Accord to Give Arms Aid to North Koreans
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, Sept. 8 (AP)  Communist China has agreed to provide North Korea with an undisclosed amount of free military aid, the Chinese press agency, Hsinhua, reported today.

title: Mitchell and Hoover: Focus Differs on Crime data
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 For the last year, the office of Attorney General John N. Mitchell has been rewriting the Federal Bureau of Inves tigation's interpretations of the nation's crime statistics, which for four decades had been within the sole control of J. Edgar Hoover.

description: SPARTA, Ga.Horrie Rives, who is 82 years old, sat with his 52yearold son, Noel, on a wooden bench on the shaded front porch of the red brick Hancock County courthouse building and caught the cool breezes that blew along wind ing, sundrenched Route 15.

description: The Yankees' brief hopes of taking over third place in the American League Eastern Divi sion almost completely disap peared last night in the midst of a madcap sixrun rally by the Red Sox that led them to a 93 triumph at Yankee Sta dium.

title: G.I. at Mylai Recalls Colonel's Query
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Sept. 7 An infantry sergeant who participated in the assault on Mylai 4 said today that Col. Oran K. Henderson had briefly questioned him about the inci dent two days after the slay ing of civilians there.

description: NYACK, N. Y., Sept. 7 Julian Bond, the. Georgia legis lator, declared today that black Americans are actually worse off now than we were 10 years ago.

title: Order and Tension Mark Southern School Openings
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 7  The final round of Southern school openings started today with a minimum of disruption but with an air of tension in dis tricts where integration through busing was introduced or expanded.

title: EGYPT WILL ASK U.N. TO DEBATE MIDEAST
description: CAIRO, Sept 7 (Reuters) Egypt has decided to bring up the Middle East crisis at the next session of the United Na tions General Assembly, the authoritative newspaper Al Ahram reported today.

title: 21 Killed in the Philippines In Communal Violence
description: MANILA, Sept. 7 (Reuters) An opposition politician was killed and his house burned to the ground Sunday in the Lanao del Norte province in the south ern Philippines in continuing violence between Moslems and Christians, police sources said today.

title: Soviet Lana 18 in Moon Orbit
description: MOSCOW, Sept, 7The So viet Union announced today that its unmanned Luna 18 craft had gone into lunar orbit, increasing the expectation among Western specialists that the Russians were about to attempt another moon landing, possibly to retrieve more geo logical samples.

title: KOSYGIN TO VISIT CANADA, WIDENING DIPLOMATIC HIVE
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 7The So viet Union added Canada today to the growing list of countries its leaders will visit in the next few months as part of what appears to be a major diplomatic campaign to direct attention to its foreignpolicy objectives.

title: 2 '68 RIOT VICTIMS ARE UNIDENTIFIED
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7The ashes of two unidentified vic tims of the Washington riots of April, 1968, rest in small, rectangular metal boxes in this city's morgueunclaimed.

title: M'GOVERN SCORES PUPIL LUNCH PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7  Senator George McGovern, chairman of the Senate Select Committee on Nutrition and Human Needs, accused the De partment of Agriculture today of bowing to pressure from the Office of Management and Budget to cut overall costs of the school lunch program. The South Dakota Democrat agreed with school officials who have charged before the nutrition committee that newly revised rules for funding the program will bar the inclusion of 1.9 million needy children.

title: Rates Continue to Drop in Corporate Bond Sales
description: The corporate bond market continued yesterday to experi ment with lower interest rates.

title: LYNCH AND HEATH END ULSTER TALKS IN DISAGREEMENT
description: LONDON, Sept. 7The Prime Ministers of Britain and Ireland, sharply divided over policies ir Ulster, ended two days of talks today.

title: SameDay Payoffs Begun at Four Offtrack Shops
description: Sameday payoffs, which are expected eventually to increase sharply the daily offtrack bet ting handles, were begun yes terday on thoroughbred racing at the four shops serviced by Ticketron, a subgldiary of Control Data Corporation.

title: Typhoon Kills 38
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, Sept. 8 (Reuters)At least 38 per sons were reported killed and 10 more missing today after a typhoon called Virginia lashed central Japan's Pacif is coast and headed into the ocean. The police said that at least 22 persons had been injured.

title: CANADA PLANS AID TO HER EXPORTERS
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 7The Ca nadian Government outlined to day a plan to help exporters who are forced to lay off sig nificant numbers of workers be cause of the United States's 10 per cent surcharge on imports imposed by President Nixon, as part of his New Economic Pol icy.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Power. That was Gordie Howe's nickname, bestowed on him by players who wore the Detroit Red Wing uniform over the last 25 years. Twentyfive years is such an absurd length of time for anyone to be playing a game that becomes virtually meaningless. The statistics that Howe amassed are so astonishing they cannot be comprehended at first reading. Now we'll all have time, finally, to sit back and look at the record, for tomorrow, Howe will announce his retirement.

title: Eugene S. Root, ExOfficial Of Erie Lackawanna, Dies
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 7 Eugene S. Root, retired vice presidentcontroller of the Erie. Lackawanna Railway Company, died of a heart attack Thursday. He was 70 years old and lived in Shaker Heights.

description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Sept. 7 (AP)The Ohio Supreme Court today upheld two lower courts that had ordered extradition to Pennsylvania for three persons accused in the slaying of Joseph A. Yablonski. The rul ing came on appeals to bar extradition for Paul Eugene Gilly; his wife, Annette, and Silous Huddleston, her father.

Mrs. Webster was a member of national repertory compa nies in Chicago and New York in the late 1920's and early 1930's.

description: Indianapolis, Sept. 7 (AP)  The first fullscale integration of the Crispus Attucks High School was put into effect to day with no problems report ed.

title: Tainted Vichyssoise Fells American Visitor in Israel
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP) An American in Israel has been in a coma since Friday after consuming contaminated vichyssoise prepared by Bon Vivant, the Food and Drug Ad ministration said today.

title: Jordan's Reorganized Army Puts Stress on Armor
description: RAMTHA, Jordan, Sept. 4 A year ago Jordan had a large ly infantry  dominated army, and Israeli forces on the west ern flank and 10,000 guerrillas within the country were re garded as the principal threats.

title: MUSKIE DEPLORES NIXON BUSING VIEW
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 7 Senator Edmund S. Muskie joined President Nixon today in voicing distaste for the busing of children to desegregate the public schools, but he sharp ly criticized the President for attempting to prohibit the use of Federal funds to acquire buses.

title: Ezequiel Padilla Dies in Mexico; Foreign Minister During War
description: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 7 Ezequiel Padilla, who was For eigit Minister throughout World War II, died last night at the age of 80. He suffered from hepatic cirrhosis.

title: Hiker Survives Park Fall
description: YOSEMITE, Calif., Sept. 7 (AP)A young hiker, apparent ly jolted by lightning, survived a fall of almost 200 feet down Half Dome, a granite monolith in Yosemite National Park, rangers reported. Steve McRae, 20, years old, of Lakewood, Calif., was descending a steep 400foot section of the dome yesterday when he fell during an electrical storm, a park spokesman said. His fall was stopped by a clump of boulders.

title: Executive Changes
description: Lazard Frres & Co., the investment banking house, announced yester day the appointment of Robert Ellsworth as a vice president and as head of Lazard. Frres (New. York) Internation al, a new affiliate. Mr. Ellsworth, United States Ambassador to NATO for the last two years, served previously as assistant to President Nixon and as a member of Congress from 1961 to 1966. He also has been with the Department of Commerce. A lawyer, Mr. Ellsworth received his doctorate from the Uni versity of Michigan in 1949 and was with the Navy for two tours of active duty during World War II and the Korean War. He ended his tour as lieutenant commander. Last week Frederick L. Deming, who had been Under Secre tary of the Treasury for Monetary Affairs in the Johnson Administration, resigned as a Lazard part ner to form a bank holding company.

title: Master MoneyRaiser Roger Lacey Stevens
description: Man In the News

title: Bartered Burmese Rice Will Aid Pakistanis
description: LONDON, Sept. 7  John Brown Engineering, a big Brit ish engineering company, has won an order for a power sta tion in Burma to be built at cost of $7.7million. The con tract said that Burma would make part payment in rice  $2.4million worth.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Protest in Boston
description: BOSTON, Sept. 7 (AP)The police were called to restore order at a meeting of the Bos ton School Committee today as 100 demonstrating parents registered their anger over a new racial balancing plan. There were no arrests.

title: In Suburbia, Too, the Cooking School Phenomenon Grows
description: The same centrifugal force that created the New York suburbs has spread the gourmet rev olution throughout the greater metropolitan area. Few towns are without their own cooking school. This year, as usual, more suburban schools than ever have provided information about their pro grams for the roundup that appears on this page. The list is not intended to show evaluation of the classes but only to catalogue them as completely as possible.

title: Advertising:
description: It looks as if the Interpublic Group of Companies will be acquiring Dodge & Delano, merging it into its Tinker Pritchard Wood Associates and calling the resulting agency Tinker, Dodge & Delano.

title: New Garbage Plan For Westchester Is Sent to Board
description: WHITE PLAINS, Sept. 7 The Westchester County Ad ministration proposed today that the county contract with the State Environmental Facili ties Corporation for manage ment and disposal of its solid waste for the next 20 years.

title: Bonn Seeks First National Speed Limit, of 62 M.P.H., Excluding Autobahns
description: BONN, Sept. 7West Ger many's Minister of Transporta tion, Georg Leber, announced today that he would ask Parlia ment to approve West Ger many's first general speed limit, 100 kilometers (about 62 miles) an hour on all twolane high ways and country roads.

title: Carolina Father Charged With Murder of 4 Children
description: LELAND, N. C., Sept. 7 (UPI) A father of five children, who said that his wife had deserted him because they had so many children, beat four of them to death with a crowbar today and critically injured the fifth, the police said.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES ADVANCE IN PRICE
description: Prices of soybean futures ad vanced almost 4 cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday. There, were inany more buyers of soybeans than sellers during the trading ses sion.

title: Holding Company Disposes of 500,000 Of Pennsy Shares
description: The International Utilities Corporation announced yester day in Philadelphia that it has disposed of its 500,000 shares of common stock in the Penn Central Company. The dis closure was made in a report to stockholders.

title: Notes on People
description: Peter Lawford, taping a television interview in Los Angeles, casually mentioned that he planned to marry Mary Rowan, the 21year old daughter of Dan Rowan, star of the Rowan and Mar tin Laugh In show on TV.

title: NIXON GETS PLEA ON WELFARE SHIFT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  Fifty major civic, labor and political organizations called on President Nixon today to put full Presidential power be hind final passage of welfare reform legislation this year.

title: Dollar Trading
description: Following are closing quotes for leading foreign currencies in the New York market. The prices do not necessarily cor respond to those in other fi nancial centers but generally indicate market trends.

title: Housing Official Is Named to New State Welfare Post
description: A longtime state housing ad ministrator and management expert, William F. Meyers, was named yesterday as deputy by the state's new Welfare Inspec tor General, George. F. Ber linger.

title: News of Dogs
description: The Jeffords family long has been associated with thoroughbred racing. Last No vember, the pink and yellow silks were carried to victory by Eggy in the $188,360 Gardenia at Garden State.

title: M'CLOSKEY CLOSES A 5DAY CAMPAIGN
description: CONCORD, N. H., Sept. 8 (AP)  Representative Paul N. McCloskey Jr., Republican of California, running on a truth in government campaign to oust President Nixon in 1972, charged the Administration to day with concealment of the facts and deliberate deceit in its economic policies.

title: Bernstein's New Work Reflects His Background on Broadway
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 There were heated arguments about the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts even before it opened. Tonight, the big palace on the Potomac was officially inaugurated, with a perform ance of Leonard Bernstein's Mass in the Opera House. Because of the nature of the music, still one more ele ment about the center will be controversial. Indeed, the arguments had started with the first public rehearsal last Sunday.

title: Key Word in Sportswear  Blazers
description: Last year it was the midi. A few months ago it was hot pants. Now the magic word in fashion is, sports wear.

title: Man in the News
description: TOKYO, Sept. 8  Have you met the Foreign Minister yet? Premier Eisaku Sato asked a newsman who inter viewed him recently. Well, you should. He is a very solid man.

title: $508,000 Yearling Pays Owner First Dividend
description: DONCASTER, England, Sept. 8 (AP)  Crowned Prince, the world's most ex pensive race horse as a year ling, redeemed his reputation today by winning the seven furlong Champagne Stakes.

title: Miss Evert Reaches Semifinals
description: It will be Chris Evert against Mrs. Billie Jean King tomorrow in the latest chapter of Cin derella in sneakers at the Unit ed States Open tennis cham pionships.

title: Expos Rout Mets, 102, as Staub Drives In 4 Runs
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 8  Tug McGraw hit his first big league home run tonight, but other wise the New York Mets were no match for the Montreal Ex pos, Rusty Staub and Carl Mor ton's ripped pants.

title: Lebanon Seeking A Missing Official Of Jewish Council
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 8 Lebanese authorities are inves tigating the disappearance of prominent member of this country's Jewish community.

title: SOVIET BIDS U.N. CALL ARMS TALKS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 8Foreign Minister An drei A. Gromyko of the Soviet Union, in a memorandum sub mitted to Secretary General Thant yesterday, expressed the hope that the United Nations General Assembly would call world disarmament conference on both nuclear and conven tional weapons, to be attended by all nations.

title: U.S. Role Is Confirmed
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (Reu ters)United States forces supporting the South Vietnamese drive are playing a security role that is consistent with Vietnamization, a spokesman for the Defense Department said today. The spokesman, Jerry W. Friedheim, confirmed reports from Saigon that Amer ican troops had taken up posi tions in artillery bases aban doned by South Vietnamese forces in the area of the of fensive.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 8 Four PresidentsEisenhower, Kennedy, Johnson and Nixon have played a direct part in creating the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts. The man whose me morial the center has become had such an institution partly in mind when he said a few weeks before his death: I look forward to an America which commands respect through out the world not only for its strength but for its civiliza tion as well. I see little of more importance for the fu ture of our country and our civilization than full recogni tion of the place of the artist.

title: OTB Opens Astoria Shop
description: The Offtrack Betting Cor poration opened its 22d Shop yesterday at 2815, Steinvvay Street, Astoria, Queens.

title: BareFooted Australian Views From Choice Seat
description: Among all the rich and powerful and famous people at the opening was Georgina Lingertwood, a young Aus tralian tourist dressed in a purple Tshirt, blue jeans and bare feet.

title: Filipinos Flee Province Where Terrorism Has Taken 70 Lives
description: ILIGAN, the Philippines, Sept. 5Most of the 300,000 people of Lanao Province on the Philippines, southernmost island, Mindanao, have lived in terror for months.

title: Saigon Announces a Drive Against Enemy Near Laos
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 8The South Vietnamese command, announcing some what grudgingly that about 10,000 men had launched an attack on enemy infiltration routes adjacent to the demili tarized zone and near the Lao tian border, said today that no significant contact had been made with the enemy so far.

title: Tokyo Spurs Drive for an Improved Image A broad
description: TOKYO, Sept. 8The idea that nice people ride on Hondas is not good enough anymore. Now, the Japanese are prepar iing to tell the world, especial ly Americans, that the people who make Hondas are good guys too.

title: Yanks Win in 11 on Long Out, 21
description: Mel Stottlemyre, pitching for the first time since he pulled a muscle in his left side on Aug. 29, combined with Jack Aker and Roger Hambright to set down the Boston Red Sox on five hits while Ron Swoboda and Johnny Ellis provided two long balls that brought the Yankees a 21 triumph in 11 innings yesterday at Yankee Stadium.

title: Utilities Plan Two Power Plants With Total Cost of $800Million
description: A Southern and two mid Atlantic utilities announced yesterday plans for two power facilities with a total cost of some $800million. At the same time, the Atlantic Richfield Company confirmed in Phila delphia that it has can celed its plans for building a $60million plant for reprocess ing nuclear fuel elements.

title: Times Declares Dividend
description: Directors of The New York Times Company declared yes terday its regular quarterly div ident of 15 cents a share on the class A and class B common stock. It is payable Sept. 28 to stockholders of record Sept. 20. The regular quarterly dividend of $1.37 a share was also voted on the 5 per cent cu mulative prior preference stock, payable Oct. Ito holders of rec ord Sept. 20.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  For at least a year past, and maybe two or three  memory is not reliable in matters like this  an unlikely new group of performers has been turning up regularly in the repertory company that performs daily in the newspapers. They are welldressed men carrying briefcases, and their milieu is the por nography shop.

title: New Blasts in Carolina City
description: AYDEN, N. C., Sept. 8 (AP) Two more explosions rocked the racially troubled Ayden area today, and Gov. Bob Scott offered a $2,000 reward for in formation leading to the con viction of the persons responsi ble. The new incidents brought to eight the number of bomb ings since the start of a three week protest by blacks over the fatal shooting of a black by a state trooper.

title: National City Alters Credit Card Links
description: The First National City Bank has curtailed sharply the serv ice that it is willing to per form for its correspondent banks that offer its Master Charge credit card to their customers.

title: Calm Restored in Utica
description: UTICA, N. Y., Sept. 8Rela tive quiet reigned throughout the city tonight after two days of racial disorders that culmi nated last night in a wave of fire bombings and vandalism to business property.

title: Cabbies Accused of Fleecing AbortionCase Women
description: A growing number of women and girls coming to New York for abortions are being victim ized by cab drivers who charge exorbitant fees for rides from the airports to hospitals in and around the city.

title: Miss Myerson and Panel on NoFault Insurance Clash
description: Bess Myerson, the city's Con sumer Affairs Commissioner, came out strongly yesterday for nofault auto insurance and Immediately found herself un der repeated attack from mem bers of a legistative commit tee who considered her illpre pared to answer questions on the subject.

title: Action on Yen Awaited
description: FRANKFURT, Sept. 8 (Reut ers) Restoration of the yen quotation on the Frankfurt for eign exchange market will not be possible until the Japanese authorities take steps to alter the effects of their present ex change control measures im posed to curb the rise in the floating yen, foreign exchange market officials here said to day.

title: Jersey Plan May Limit Containers
description: TRENTON, Sept. 8  An Assembly committee will hold a public hearing this month on a bill to outlaw the sale of nonreturnable beverage containers in the state.

title: SEAL HARVESTING TERMED HUMANE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8A special panel of veterinarians reported today that the annual harvesting of seals on the Pri bilof Islands was highly ef ficient and humane.

title: FARM AGENCY PLANS FOOD STAMP CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI) The Agriculture Department said today that it planned to cancel a policy whereby needy persons can now get up to 49 cents in change when they use food stamps at stores.

title: Haile Selassie to Visit China
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Sept. 8 (UPI)Emperor Haile Selassie will pay a state visit to China from Oct. 6 to 12, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs an nounced today.

title: Reynolds Securities Plans 1.2MillionShare Offering
description: Reynolds Securities, Inc., leading brokerage house, an nounced plans yesterday to go public with an offering of 1,2 million shares through the First Boston Corporation and Blyth & Co.

title: An Authentic Bit of Japan Rises to House Society on East 47th St.
description: One of the newest Japa nese imports to Manhattan architecturewas previewed yesterday as the new head quarters of the Japan Society were unveiled at 333 East 47th Street.

title: U.S. Consulate General Planned in West Berlin
description: BONN, Sept. 8Ambassa dor Kenneth Rush disclosed today, that the United States plans to open a consulate general in West Berlin after the fourpower treaty on Ber lin is completed.

title: Navy Plans Dome at South Pole To Shield Buildings From Snow
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8An aluminum dome, 52 feet high and 164 feet in diameter, will be built at the South Pole by the Navy between Nov. 1 and Feb. 15 next year, Rear Adm. Leo B. McCuddin, commander of the naval support force in Antarctica, announced today.

title: Kluger Resigns as Chief Editor Of Atheneum, Assails Publisher
description: Richard Kluger, editor in chief of Atheneum Publishers, resigned yesterday because of what he called a basic dis agreement over what consti tutes effective book publish ing.

title: No Incidents in Nashville
description: NASHVILLE, Sept. 8Gram mar school children registered without incident today in Nash ville, where a Federal court order has set up a massive bus ing pattern. But antibusing sentiment held attendance levels below those of yesterday, when junior and senior high students registered.

title: Soviet Steps Up AntiChina Campaign
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 8Moscow stepped up its campaign today to discredit China's policies by reviving the assertion that Pe king was seeking to emerge as the world's leading power by pushing the United States and the Soviet Union into a nuclear war.

title: U.S. to Press Japan on Yen At Meeting Starting Today
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8State Department officials said today that the United States would seek to persuade Japan, at Cabinetlevel talks beginning here tomorrow, that she has a major responsibility to help bring world trade and pay ments into better balance.

title: Duryea Resigns Utah Post To Manage Nassau Coliseum
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Sept. 8 (AP)Earl Duryea resigned to day as manager of the Salt Pal ace, a $17million convention sports complex; and said he had been named to manage the new Nassau Coliseum complex near Garden City, L. I.

title: COMMON MARKET SHIFTING TACTICS
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 8Bowing to the inevitable, the six Com mon Market countries have de cided to abandon for the mo ment their laborious search for a common position on the. Im mediate problems posed by the American decision to float the dollar. They will concentrate instead on seeking to estab lish a Joint position on the reform of the international monetary system.

title: Those Were the Days
description: The spectacle of British impotence in the world today is a painful one, not only for an Englishman like myself, but for many Americans.

title: Wenzel. Schubert, ExAide Of. Fairchild Camera, 82
description: MIAMI, Sept. 8Wenzel J. Schubert, former vice president of the Fairchild Camera and Instrument Corporation, died Sunday. He was 82 years old and had lived here since his retirement in 1957.

title: Ben Feder Marries Miss St. John
description: Miss Kathleen A. St. John, who has been personal secre tary to Mayor Lindsay for the last four years, was married at the SherryNetherlands Hotel yesterday afternoon to Ben Feder, who is a painter and president of Ben Feder, Inc., a graphic design concern. Starte Supreme Court. Justice. Arnold G. Fraiman performed the ceremony before a small group of family and friends.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company an nounced yesterday in Akron, Ohio, the election John H. Gerstenmaier, Richard A. Jay and Charles J. Pilliod Jr. as executive vice presidents. The lead ing tire manufacturer also announced the retire ment of Walter H. Rudder, executive vice president and director after 42 years of service. For the past four years he has been Goodyear's top production executive. Mr. Gerstenmaier, a director, formerly vice president of production, joined the company in 1938 and is the past president of Goodyear's Motor Wheel Corporation subsidiary. Mr. Jay was elected vice president of general products in 1964 and was made a director earlier this year. Mr. Pilliod, who continues as president of the Good year International Corporation, was also elected to the board of directors.

title: Republic Steel Sets Close Of Upstate IronOre Mine
description: The Republic Steel Corpora tion said yesterday that it was shutting down its ironore mine at Port Henry, N. Y., on the shore of Lake Champlain, put ting about 400 people out of work.

title: WILLIAM ROSENSON, PEDIATRICIAN, DEAD
description: Dr. William Rosenson, a re tired pediatrician and coauthor with Dr. Bela Schick of Child Care Today, died Monday night in a White Plains nursing home of a heart ailment. He was 81 years old and lived at 155 East 93d Street.

title: Pittsburgh Given Federal Grant For Automated Transit Project
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 8  A $60million Federal grant was awarded to the Allegheny County Port Authority today to help finance construction of an innovative transit system that has become one of Pittsburgh's most controversial political issues.

title: Court Hears Story of a Soldier's Life With Drugs
description: Luther Sanford, who was twice wounded while with the Army in Vietnam, became a heroin addict there, He was dis charged, but joined the Marines to get back to Vietnam so he could buy heroin at onefourth what it cost him in New York City.

title: Personal Finance: Deductible Costs
description: On your way to visit your broker or your trust officer? As you drive your own car or sit back relaxed in a taxi seat, ponder the fact that you may be able to deduct the cost of the trip on your incometax form when you file it next April. Anyway, it's worth the effort to jot down in a notebook the date of the visit, the name of the broker or trust officer you saw, the reason for the trip and the roundtrip cost.

title: Networks Will Televise Nixon's Address Today
description: President Nixon's address to the joint session of Con gress from 12:30 to 1 P.M. today will be carried live on television by, the American Broadcasting Company, the Columbia Broadcasting Sys tem, the National Broadcast ing Company, and by WPM TV, Channel 11.

title: Pan Am Cuts Singapore Run
description: SINGAPORE, Sept. 8 (UPI) Pan American World Airways said today it would reduce its San FranciscoSingapore jumbo jet flights from three to two a week. A spokesman for the airline said a majority of the passengers from San Francisco got off in Saigon and only, 15 to 20 on each flight went to Singapore.

title: Animated Ailey Troupe Infuses Piece With a Ritualistic Power
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  There is, after all, no busi ness like show business, and the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts has apparently opened its pro ceedings with a Broadway musical. It is by Leonard Bernstein, and is called Mass, but that will deceive few.

title: Leonard Ginsberg Dies at 77; Led Hearn Department Stores
description: Leonard Ginsberg, a former president of Hearn Department Stores and a leader in char itable causes, died Tuesday night in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived at 480 Park Avenue.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Last Saturday, a grain of sand inside one swim fin ground out a shallow, dimesized hole in my big toe. Band aged now, the raw spot is only a nostalgic sting, and soon it will be gone, too. The season is over, the sun has lost its savage lick and the night's edge has sharpened.

title: Drift Toward Chaos in Ulster
description: On the face of it, only one conclusion is possible from the futile London conference of British and Irish Prime Ministers on the crisis in Northern Ireland: Neither Edward Heath nor John Lynch has yet realized how rapidly Ulster is drifting toward civil war, with all the terrible consequences that could bring for everyone.

title: Revisions of Antipoverty Bill Are Rejected by the Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP) The Senate today turned back Republican efforts to re vise a $6billion antipoverty bill to put it more in line with President Nixon's recommen dations.

title: Jets' White Is Claimed by Rams
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Sept 8  Lee White, the running back who will be remembered as the man whose fumble last month put Joe Namath in the operat ing room again, was placed on waivers by the Jets and claimed for $100 by the Los Angeles Rams today.

title: Advertising:
description: Six highly competitive mag azine publishers, spurred by alarming declines in indus trial advertising, have joined forces to advertise for the common good.

title: Murphy Hails Police in MoraleLifting Broadcast
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy, apparently striving to thwart any decline in police morale stemming from his cam paign to root out police cor ruption, commended the city's policemen yesterday for their loyalty to the best interests of the department and dedi cation to the welfare of the people of this city.

title: U.S. AND RUSSIANS WILL OPEN PARLEY ON SEA INCIDENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8The United States and the Soviet Union will open highlevel dis cussions in Moscow next month on how to avoid incidents in volving their warships and air craft.

title: 7 Members of Jewish Defense League Accused in a Plot to Bomb Soviet Offices
description: Seven members of the Jew ish Defense League were ac cused yesterday of conspiring to bomb the Soviet Union's trade agency here last April and to plant a bomb on June 12 at the Soviet Mission's es tate at Glen Cove, L. I.

title: Woman, 62, Fights Off Bear
description: BELGRADE (AP)A brown bear took after Kobilka Kote ski's grandchildren and she took after it with a seytbe, the daily newspaper Pelitika reported. The 62  year  old woman wrestled with the bear, stuck it in the eye with the seytbe blade and drove it off.

title: Bloomingdale's Branching Out
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Sept. 8In a contemporary struc ture with arched, exterior niches on the main thorough fare in this affluent Long Island community, Blooming dale's opened today the first store in a new venturea chain of homefurnishings specialty stores. For decades the New Yorkbased company has concentrated on operat ing fullscale department stores.

title: $171,000 in Gold and Silver Is Hijacked From REA in Jersey
description: An REA Express truck load ed with $171,000 in liquid gold and silver and 243 other items was stolen by masked bandits in Clifton, N.J., on Tuesday night in a precision hijacking worthy of an Alec Guiness movie.

title: Advertising:
description: Young & Rubicam, which several years ago created the first fourwheeled, motordriven sponge for a client, Manufacturers Hanover Trust, has gone back to the draw ing board to produce the ForChevAmChrysVagen.

title: Insiders' Stockholdings
description: The American Stock Exchange yesterday issued its latest report on changes in stock ownership by major shareholders, directors and officers of its listed companies. The New York Stock Exchange did not publish such a list this week.

title: LUCIAN CARY, 85, NOVELISTEDITOR
description: Lucian Cary, novelist, short story writer, editor and author ity on guns, died Tuesday, ap pakently of a heart attack, in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 85 years old.

title: ADVANCE HALTED ON BOND MARKET
description: The bond market's recent ad vance sputtered to a halt yes terday.

title: HURRICANE FORMED OFF COAST OF TEXAS
description: BROWNSVILLE, Tex., Sept. 8 (UPI)  Tropical Storm Fern stalled more than 200 miles from Texas in the warm waters of the Gulf of Mexico today and erupted with stunning sud denness into a hurricane with peak wnds of 90 miles an hour.

title: Globe Suit Dismissed
description: BOSTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)  A suit against The Boston Globe by the Justice Department in volving publication of the Pentagon Papers was dismissed in United States District Court here today.
