Noted that the Gov ernment had not answered the Globe's petition for dismissal, filed the day after the United States Supreme Court upheld newspapers' right to publish the secret material in cases involv ing The New York Times and The Washington Post.

title: KY SAID TO SUGGEST NEW ELECTION PLAN
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Sept. 9 (Reuters) Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky has suggested that he take over the presidency and organize new elections in which he would not take part, several Saigon newspapers reported to day.

title: YONKERS STUDIES A NORETURN BAN
description: YONKERS, Sept, 8The City Council here is scheduled to vote next Wednesday on a bill that would effectively ban the sale of soft drinks and beer in nonreturnable cans or bottles.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: President Nixon's refusal to furnish to the Senate Foreign Relations Com mittee the Pentagon fiveyear plans for military assistance rests on exec utive privilege. [News story Sept. 1.]

title: Wyatt of Condors Has TB
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept 8 (UPI)  The Pittsburgh Condors of the American Basketball As sociation said today that Levi Wyatt, their No. 2 draft choice was suffering from a rare form of tuberculosis and would not play this season. Dr. A. J. Cipriani, team physician, said Wyatt's ailment was 100 per cent curable and he possibly could progress to a point where he may play ball again.

title: 2 CHURCHES REACH EUCHARIST ACCORD
description: WINDSOR, England, Sept. 8 (AP)  Progress toward the eventual unity of the Anglican and Roman Catholic churches is reported by an international commission set up by Pope Paul VI and the Archbishop of Canterbury.

title: U. S. Terms Gravel Not Immune From Subpoena
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI) The Justice Department has said that neither Senator Mike Gravel, Democrat of Alaska, nor his aides are immune from being compelled to testify be fore a Boston grand jury in eonnection with disclosures from the Pentagon papers.

title: 8% RISE ESTIMATED IN 1971 COTTON CROP
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP) The Agriculture Department today estimated the 1971 cot ton crop at 10,952,400 bales, up only slightly from August in dications but 8 per cent more than last year's output of 10.1 million. This was the depart ment's second monthly estimate of this year's cotton production, and it reflected field conditions as of Sept. 1.

title: U.S. Diplomat Held in Death Of Embassy Aide in Africa
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (Reuters)  An American dip lomat has been charged with the murder of a colleague who was found dead in the Ameri can embassy in Santa Isabel, Equatorial Guinea, the United States attorney's office in Alexandria, Va., announced to day.

title: LEVITTOWN STRIKE DISRUPTS SCHOOLS
description: LEVITTOWN, L. I., Sept. 8 A strike by the Levittown Teachers Association on the opening day of school today forced the closing of several schools.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Glittering Audience Attends Kennedy Center's Opening
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8The capital of this nation finally strode into the Cultural Age tonight with the spectacular opening of the $70million John F. Kennedy Center for the Per forming Arts.

title: JAMES S. GOLDEN
description: PINEVILLE, Ky., Sept. 8 (UPI)  Former Representative James S. Golden, Republican of Kentucky, who served in Con gress from 1949 to 1955, died on Monday at the age of 79.

title: Denial of Immunity Pleas Hampers Bombing Inquiry
description: DETROIT, Sept. 8 (AP)A grand jury investigation of the March 1 Capitol bombing and May Day demonstrations suf fered a setback today when a Federal judge refused a Justice Department request that two reluctant witnesses be granted prosecution immunity.

title: Plan for Central Market Gets Casey Endorsement
description: William J. Casey, chairman, of the Securities and Exchange Commission, gave a qualified endorsement yesterday to the concept of a broad central stock market that might replace the existing system of markets in the United States.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8Following the bloody outburst of violence at San Quentin prison last month, I wrote in this space that many persons prob ably would not believe the official ex planation of George Jackson's death, but would assume with his mother that he had been set up. I wrote also that the wanton destruction of humanity exemplified by the life and death of George Jackson, if allowed to go on, would consume us all.

title: Exacta Returns $1,687.40 In Sixth Race at Belmont
description: The versatile Wustenchef of the Augustin Stable added the $34,550 Brighton Beach Handi cap to his list of victories yes terday, taking the Belmont Park feature by two lengths over Sigmund Sommer's Big Shot IL Third was June McKnight's for midable 5yearold mare, Prin cess Pout.

title: McGovern Voices Surprise
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 Senator George McGovern said today he was surprised at Senator Muskie's statement.

title: Hanoi Terms Saigon Offer Of Aid Shameless Dupery
description: TOKYO, Sept. 8 (AP)Hanoi today denounced South Viet nam's offer to send aid to flood victims in North Vietnam as a farce and shameless dup ery, designed to distract at tention from inhuman war crimes against the South Viet namese people.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Australians Cancel a Tour Of South African Cricketers
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Sept, 8 The Australian Cricket Board of Control tonight canceled a tour of Australia by the South African team, scheduled to start next month, because of the difficulty of protecting the matches against persons dem onstrating against apartheid, South Africa's policy of racial separation.

title: Oil Heir Fined in Tax Case
description: Prescott H. Pettibone, a 33 year  old oil heir, was fined $2,500 in Federal Court here yesterday for failure to file an incometax return on his 1965 income of $43,900. Judge Ed ward Weinfeld imposed the fine and placed the defendant on probation for one year. The Louisiana oil heir maintained that an accountant's error had caused the tax violation.

title: Andrew Newell, Expert, 62, On Installment Finance Law
description: Andrew F. Newell, an au thority on installment finance law, died, Monday In Kings County Hospital of injuries re ceived in an accident in a building he owned in Brook lyn. He was 62 years old and lived at 148 Washington Ave nue, Garden City, L.I.

title: SENATE UNIT SAYS COSTLIER WEAPONS MAY CUT DEFENSE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 The Senate Armed Services Committee warned today that the Pentagon's reliance upon ever more costly weapons could imperil the national se curity by forcing dangerous re ductions in the size of the mili tary forces.

title: Tuesday Night Fight
description: Stateline, Nev.Denny Moyer, 161 potinds, Portland, Ore., out pointed Eugene Honey Bear Bryant, 158, Henderson, Nev., 10 rounds.

title: Police Act to Calm Washington Heights
description: About 40 Tactical Patrol Force policemen helped men from the local precinct to pa trol Washington Heights last night to forestall a repetition of the violence between Do minican and Negro youths that flared there the previous two days.

title: Problems Besetting Community Planning Board 7 on West Side
description: Dirty strets. Urban renew al. Crime. Vestpocket parks. Noise. Nursing hoiries. The meeting was to be pot luck the chairman had said as he called the group to order, and this was what came out these items, and more.

title: Questions and Answers About Freeze
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 Following is the 15th set of official questions and answers issued by the President's Cost of Living Council on specific issues in the 90day freeze on wages and prices:

title: Bridge: Mrs. Solodar a Bright Star In Recent Tournament Play
description: Perhaps the brightest new star in the feminine firma ment in the last two years has been Mrs. Judi Solodar of New York. As Judi Fried enberg, she won a series of championships in the Mid west before moving to New York early this year to marry John Solodar, an established expert.

title: Market Place: Bought at $5.50, Now Bid at 2c
description: The trouble with being a troubled shareholder in a dying company is that no body ever tells you anything That's the plaint, anyway, of Jack Berman of Elizabeth, N. J.

title: DIRECTOR RESIGNING APPALACHIAN POST
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 Ralph R. Widner, executive di rector of the Appalachian Re gional Commission and one of the founders of the sixyearold Federalstate economic recov ery program, announced his resignation today.

title: Wood Field and Stream
description: Upstate New York's duck hunting this year (excepting the Lake Champlain area) will involve a 60day split season, Oct. 11 to Nov. 29 and Dec. 24 to Jan. 2. The basic bag limit will be three ducks daily and six in pos session.

title: Pan Am Cuts Singapore Run
description: SINGAPORE, Sept. 8 (UPI) Pan American World Airways said today it would reduce its San FranciscoSingapore jumbo jet flights from three to two a week. A spokesman for the airline said a majority of the passengers from San Francisco got off in Saigon and only, 15 to 20 on each flight went to Singapore.

title: New Products Are Announced By 5 Technology Companies
description: A flurry of newproduct an nouncements was made yester day by technologically based companies.

title: Sales of Litton Industries Achieve Record as Earnings Decline
description: Litton Industries, Inc., achieved record sales in the quarter and year ended July 31, but profits fell 11.6 per cent and 17.3 per cent in the respective periods, it was re ported yesterday from the West Coast headquarters.

title: Muskie Rules Out a Black Running Mate
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 8 Senator Edmund S. Muskie de clared today that he would not campaign for President with a Negro running mate because both the ticket and efforts of black Americans to gain full equality would thus be de feated.

title: RUSKIN REPORTS NEW LOAN FRAUDS
description: Commissioner of Investiga tion Robert K. Ruskin reported yesterday that the city had paid $95,300 more than was neces sary for municipal loans on six projects to renovate slum housing.

title: Rev. Elias Denissoff, Taught At Illinois Benedictine, 78
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 8 (UPI) The Rev. Elias Denissoff, a former professor of philosophy at Illinois Benedictine College, died yesterday while swimming at a health club. He was 78 years old.

title: ELLSBERG DEFENSE COMBATS SUBPOENA
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 8 (AP) The defense for Dr. Daniel Ellsberg has filed a motion to block a Federal grand jury sub poena for records stored under Dr. Ellsberg's name.

title: Congress and the Economy
description: President Nixon will go before Congress today explain and defend his new economic policy, but Secre tary of the Treasury Connally provided the curtain raiser yesterday by urging the House Ways and Means Committee to approve the Republican tax cuts without major change.

title: ABRAM GOTTLIEB
description: Abram Gottliebl, a horticul turist specializing in orchids, died yesterday at his home. He was 84 years old and lived at 169 Arthur Kill Road, Rich mond Town, Staten Island.

title: Three in Yablonski Case Extradited to Pennsylvania
description: WASHINGTON, Pa., Sept. 8 (UPI)  The last three of five suspects charged in the murder of a United Mine Workers of America insurgent leader, Joseph A. Yablonski, and his wife and daughter, arrived here today from Ohio, ending an 18 month extradition fight.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Prices of soybean and grain futures dropped yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, stemming from heavy profit taking that encouraged short selling.

title: Mrs. Logan Married
description: MOHEGAN LAKE, N. Y., Sept. 8The marriage of Mrs. L. Gwendolyn Logan, town clerk and tax collector of Putnam Valley, to Paul W. Stouffer Jr., a New York ad vertising executive, took place here today in St. Mary's Epis copal Church. The Rev. David E. Eylers performed the cere mony. The bride was the widow of E. Warren Logan. Mr. Stouffer's first wife, the former Edith Roberta Ross, died.

title: 53 in Japan Die in Storm
description: TOKYO, Sept. 8 (AP)A typhoon headed out of Japan into the northwest Pacific to day, leaving in its wake 22 inches of rain and 53 persons dead, 3 missing and 27 injured, the National Police Agency said. The agency attributed most of the casualties to land slides.

title: TASS SAYS RORMANN WAS NOT SOVIET SPY
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 8The offi cial Soviet press agency to night attacked allegations that Martin Bormann, Flitlees top lieutenant, was a Soviet spy during World War as a fab rication.

title: Film Pact Talks Progress
description: Some progress was reported yesterday in contract negotia tions between five New York movie studios and Local 52 of the International Association of Theatrical Stage Employes and Moving Picture Operators. Harold S. Klein, a lawyer for the movie companies, said that both sides would meet again at his offices at 375 Park Avenue. Previous talks had ended Aug. 28 after which Paramount Pictures announced the removal of two movies from production here.

title: Three Arrested as Suspects In Murder of Bohack Manager
description: Three men were arrested yesterday and accused of kill ing a Brooklyn supermarket manager two weeks ago be cause he was too slow in open ing a safe.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Lindsay Takes Part In Democrats' Drive
description: Mayor Lindsay joined two dozen Democratic leaders yes terday to kick off a state legis lative campaign at the Na tional Democratic Club, but he did not receive the mantle of party leadership.

title: Soviet Silent on Luna 18
description: MOSCOW, Sept, 8 (AP)The Soviet Union maintained silence today on its unmanned moon probe, which is in lunar orbit. Newspapers, radio and televi sion had nothing beyond last night's terse announcement that Luna 18 had swung into orbit about 60 miles above the moon after a fiveday journey from earth.

title: She's Come a Long Way From Goulash
description: Women's liberationists would prob ably take one look at Mrs. Robert Get tinger and start muttering epithets like oppressed, or enslaved. A mother three times in nearly five years of mar riage, Erica Gettinger spends as much if not more time in her Scarsdale kitch en than her husband does in his Man hattan law office.

title: DORIS CAESAR DEAD; SCULPTOR WAS 78
description: Doris Caesar, a sculptor, died yesterday at her home on North Street, Litchfield, Conn. She was 78 years old.

title: 9 STUDENTS HURT IN PONTIAC CLASH
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Sept. 8 (UPI)  Protesters carrying American flags and daring buses to run over them demon strated today against a court ordered school busing plan. A leader of the opposition de maned, unsuccessfully that all schools be closed until they can be made safe for our chil dren.

title: WITNESS ON CRIME IN JERSEY IS DEAD
description: TRENTON, Sept. 8  Peter Policastro, the star witness in the state crackdown on gambling and official corruption in Hudson County, died yester day of a brain tumor at an undisclosed hospital.

title: Cahill, I.R.A. Chief, Deported From U.S. To Irish Republic
description: Joe Cahill, leader of a mili tant faction of the Irish Re publican Army, was deported by United States immigra tion officials yesterday, a week after he was detained at the direction of the State Department.

title: Regional Housing Bill Gains in House
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  While cities across the nation were embroiled in controversies over school busing, a House committee gathered support to day for a bill that could relieve the problem by attacking segre gation in urban housing patterns.

title: Americans Now Are Phoning China, but Chinese Don't Call U.S.
description: TOKYO, Sept. 8Telephone service between the United States and China via Tokyo has gone into effect.

title: Squatters Holding Apartments In a Building in Williamsburg
description: Squatters moved into newly rehabilitated apartments in the Williamsburg section of Brook lyn over the Labor Day week end in a dispute with the de veloper over the alleged exclu sion of local residents of the Puerto Rican community.

title: Impact of Nixon's Proposals on Groups of Taxpayers
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8The following tables, prepared by the Treasury Department's Of fice of Tax Analysis, show the impact of President Nixon's tax, proposals on different groups of individual taxpayers.

title: LYNCH AGREEABLE TO 3SIDED TALKS
description: LONDON, Sept, 8  Prime Minister John Lynch of Ireland indicated tonight that he was willing to accept an invitation by Prime Minister Edward Heath of Britain to attend conference with Northern Ire land's Prime Minister, Brian Faulkner.

title: VIOLENCE FLARES IN HOBOKEN AGAIN
description: HOBOKEN, N.J., Thursday, Sept. 9A new wave of vio lence, including firebombing and windowsmashing, was touched off last night after scores of law and order ad vocates marched through this city's Puerto Rican community protesting what they said was police leniency.

title: Merger News
description: A $314million merger was proposed yesterday as Textron, Inc., one of the nation's first conglomerates, agreed with a group of large stockholders of the Kendall Company on a plan to acquire that corporation.

title: U.S. Court Bars Penn Central From Closing Its Chatham Line
description: The United States Circuit Court of Appeals in Philadel phia granted a stay yesterday that will keep the Penn Cen tral's New YorktoChatham line running at least another two months.

title: FORD MOVES TOWARD NOEMISSION ENGINE
description: DETROIT, Sept. 8 (AP)The Ford Motor Company said to day that it had made progress toward developing a virtually emissionfree experimental en gine for the Army. However, the company said it was a long way from adapting such an en gine for everyday highway use.

title: Central Park Rapist Slays Man And Shoots Holdup Accomplice
description: A gunman raped a teenaged girl in Central Park early yes terday and killed her boy friend when he tried to defend her, the police reported. He also wounded the man who had been with him when he accost ed the young couple.

title: FILM SERIES TO AID MODERN ART STAFF
description: A special series of lateeve ning screenings in six Man hattan theaters, starting to night, will benefit the fund of the Professional and Adminis trative Staff Association of the Museum of Modern Art. The association represents employes involved in the recent museum strike, which was settled last Friday. Regular boxoffice prices will be charged, with the theater owners providing the facilities.

title: News Analysis
description: LONDON, Sept. 8The clear est trend among the nations to day is toward some kind of new world order none of them can define. In the words of the old song, they don't know where they're going but they're on their way.

title: PRIEST SURRENDERS TO F.B.I. AGENTS HERE
description: The Rev. Edward J. McGow an, a 36yearold Jesuit priest who was one of 28 persons in dicted In connection with the destruction of Selective Service files in Camden, N. J., on Aug. 22, surrendered to the Federal Bureau of Investigation yes terday.

title: Defiance in Boston
description: BOSTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)  Parents of about 300 children scheduled to attend opening day classes at a new racially balanced elementary school re fused to comply today and took their children to their old neigh borhood schools.

title: FIRE AIDE SCORES SAFETY PROGRAM
description: The Commerce and Industry Association was charged yester day with reaping large profits by improperly using Fire De partment officers to train fire safety directors in highrise buildings.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Sept. 8Frank Waring, Minister of Sports, said today that Australia's decision to can cel the tour by South African cricketers was a surrender to anarchy and threats.

title: Spring Byington, Actress, Is Dead at 77
description: HOLLYWOOD, Sept. 8 (UPI) Spring Byington, the fluttery, motherly character actress in 75 movies and the popular December Bride television series, died in her home yester day at the age of 77.

title: Henry Gordon Weds Mrs. Willems
description: Mrs. Ruth Raffelsberger Willems, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Erwin Raffelsberger of Salzburg, Austria, was mar ried in Salzburg Tuesday to Henry S. Gordon, an associ ate editor of Chemical Engi neering magazine, a McGraw Hill publication. He is the son of Mrs. Bertha Gordon of New York and the late J. Morton Gordon, who was president of the National Brokerage Corporation.

title: East Harlem Residents Given Tour of Police Station
description: The doors of the new and airconditioned 25th Precinct station opened yesterday to the East Harlem community it serves, and more than 300 adults and children accepted the invitation.

title: CALLEY TO APPEAR AT MEDINA'S TRIAL
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Sept. 8First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. has been called as a defense witness in the court martial of Capt. Ernest L. Medina. He will be brought here Friday or next week from Fort Benning, Ga., where he has been confined to his bachelor apartment pending final appeal of his conviction for murdering civilians at Mylai.

title: Celler Opposes Air Mergers
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 Representative Emanuel Caller, chairman of the House Judici ary Committee and its antitrust subcommittee, urged the Civil Aeronautics Board and the Jus tice Department today to block all pending airline mergers.

title: Report of Botulin Poisoning In Israel Is Branded a Hoax
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP) The Food and Drug Adminis tration described as an appar ent hoax today a report that an American had been made criti cally ill in Israel by soup con taining botulism toxin.

title: Anaconda Indicted by U.S. In Hudson Pollution Case
description: The Anaconda Wire and Ca ble Company was indicted in Federal Court here yesterday on charges of dumping indus trial waste into the Hudson River from the company's mill at Hastings on  Hudson, in Westchester County.

title: F.D.A. Plans No Soup Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI) The Food and Drug Admin istration has no plans to prose cute the. Campbell Soup Com pany for shipping canned soup contaminated with botulism. All the evidence we have indi cares that Campbell has acted responsibly in trying to track down and eliminate this prob lem, a spokesmen said yester day. Prosecution had been sug gested in a letter by Peter H. Schunk of the Center for the Study of Responsive Law.

title: Vignettes of the Opening: Rich and Unrich Mingle
description: SOMEWHERE IN THE JOHN F. KENNEDY CENTER FOR THE PERFORMING ARTS, Washing ton, Sept. 8Rivers of people moved tonight through the val leys called entrance halls here as the rich, the famous and the mighty came thronging in for the premiere. Liberally mixed among them were the unrich, the unknown and the curious.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE CONDOR PASSES. By Shirley Ann Gram 421 pages. Knopf. $7.95.

title: Miller Has a New Play for Broadway
description: Arthur Miller has written a new play, The Creation of the World and Other Business, which Robert Whitehead will produce on Broadway in Janu ary or February.

title: Trial Is Told a Helicopter Pilot Protested to Superior on Mylai
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Sept. 8 A helicopter pilot who flew missions near Mylai 4 during the infantry attack on the hamlet on March 16, 1968, said today that a fellow pilot had made an angry and emotional report to his superior officer, about the killing of civilians.

title: ULTRONIC TO REGAIN QUOTATION SEVICES
description: The BunkerRamo Corpora tion, the Ultronic Systems Cor poration and the National As sociation of Securities Dealers announced jointly yesterday that they had reached an agree ment under which certain stock market quotation services would be restored to Ultronic.

title: Northwest to Omit Its Dividend Again; Cites Nixon Request
description: Northwest Industries, Inc., which had been thinking of paying the first cash dividend on its common stock in almost two years, said yesterday it had decided not to do so, be cause of President Nixon's re quest that corporations avoid dividend increases.

title: Pope Paul VI Prays for Success of Synod
description: SUBIACO, Italy, Sept. 8  Pope Paul VI made a 100mile pilgrimage from his summer residence at Castel Gandolfo to the Benedictine shrines near this hill town today to pray for the success of the forthcoming synod of bishops at the Vatican.

title: Hey, There Goes Merninger of the Knicks
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N. J., Sept. 8  Dean Meminger changed jerseys today at Mon mouth College. Off came a powder blue shirt with the let tering Sports Foundation, Inc. College Interns and in its place he put on the white uniform of the New York Knicks with No. 7 and Mem inger lettered on the back.

title: U.S. Natural Gas Reserves Drop for 3d Straight Year
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8The Federal Power Commission re ported today that the nation's natural gas reserves declined by 17.8 trillion cubic feet in 1970.

title: Tubman Memorial Set
description: A memorial service for Presi dent William V. S. Tubman of Liberia, who died July 23, will be held on Friday, Sept. 17, at 5 P. M., at the New York Cul tural Center. 2 Columbus Circle. Dr. Peter Sammartino, president of the center, will preside. The Liberian Ambassador, S. Edward Peal, will deliver the eulogy.

title: Transportation Agency Backs Easing of Regulation
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8In a longdelayed statement of over all policy, the Department of Transportation endorsed today a substantial relaxation of the regulatory rules that had told truckers, airlines and railroads whether they could operate, where they could travel and how much they could charge.

title: Primary Choices
description: Although most voters in New York City can be forgiven for not being aware of it, both the Republican and Democratic parties are holding primary elections next Tuesday. There has been little hoopla because the races are few compared with other recent primaries and the offices to be filled are hardly at the top of the American political order. Nonetheless, some have a significance that merits voter attention.

title: SIOCKS EDLE UP AS TRADING DIPS
description: Stock prices edged higher yesterday as investors and traders appeared to be watch ing developments in Washing ton as closely as the ticker tape.

title: AMEX SHARES UP AS TRADING SLOWS
description: The American Stock Ex change finished somewhat high er yesterday in slower trading.

title: A Slight Rise in Pupils Reported by the State
description: ALBANY, Sept. 8 (AP) The State Education Depart ment said today that an esti mated total of. 4,274,800 youngsters would be attend ing public and nonpublic elementary and secondary schools in the state this year, an increase of only 1,500.

title: Chess: Andersson Victory Signals Arrival of New Young Stars
description: Ulf Andersson, a 20year old Swedish afar, gained the biggest triumph of his career by tying for first place at 82 with Grandmaster Vllastimil Hort of Czechoslo vakia at the international tournament recently conclud ed at Goteborg, Sweden. Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union, the world champion, was third, half a point be hind.

title: METS, YANKS PLAY FOR MAYOR'S PRIZE
description: Nolan Ryan will be pitching for the home team against Stan Bahnsen and Steve Kline when the New York Yankees invade Shea Stadium to play the Mets tonight in the ninth annual Mayor's Trophy game beginning at 8 o'clock.

title: Smaller Businesses Are Expected to Suffer the Most
description: TOKYO, Sept. 8As seven Japanese Cabinet ministers pre pared to sit down in Washing ton tomorrow with their United States counterparts for eco nomic talks, major industries here are undertaking a detailed assessment of the effect that the floating of the yen and the 10 per cent American import sur charge will have on their ex ports to the United States.

title: Miami News Names Editor
description: MIAMI, Nov. 8 (UPI)James R. Whelan, a foreign correspon dent and a former Nieman fel low at Harvard University, was appointed today assistant man aging editor of The Miami News.

title: ARAB UNIT ASSAILS TALK WITH JORDAN
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 8 The Popular Front for the Lib eration of Palestine, the Marx ist guerrilla organization; said today it would not be bound by any decision, adopted at the projected conference be tween commando and Jordania Government representatives.

title: NIXON MAY CANCEL ALEUTIANS ATEST
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  President Nixon, according to officials in the White House and the State Department, is giving serious consideration to canceling or postponing the underground test of a fivemeg aton antimissile warhead sched uled for next month on Amchit ka in the Aleutians.

title: Pirated Recordings Are Seized By Detectives in 4 Raids Here
description: More than 30 detectives from the office of District Attorney Frank S. Hogan of New York County carried out a series of raids yesterday in a continu ing investigation of stolen and counterfeit recordings.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Rogers Promises Senators Will Get ForeignAid Data
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  Secretary of State William P. Rogers promised today to pro vide Congress with longrange estimates of planned United States foreign aid after key Senators threatened to block the Administration's request for funds for economic and mil itary assistance this year.

title: No. 140 Believed Safe in Draft For the Year, New Law or Not
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  Knowledgeable Government of ficials said today that men with draft lottery numbers above 140 were almost certainly safe from the possibility of induc tion this year, even if Con gress passes a new draft law this month.

title: Giants Obtain Randy Johnson From Falcons
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Sept. 8 In one of those frequent pro football trades that involve more than meets the eye, Randy Johnson, a quarterback for the Atlanta Falcons, was dea4 today to the Giants.

title: Xerox to Grant Workers Leave for Social Service
description: The Xerox Corporation yes terday announced a $500,000 ayear social service leave program. The photocopier manufacturing company said 20 or more employes would be granted up to 12 months leave of absence at full salary to participate in a social program of their own choosing.

title: Yorkville Attacks Plan for Housing on Ruppert Site
description: Political arid community lead ers in the Yorkville section de nounced the city's plan to build housing on the site of the former Ruppert brewery, at public hearing of the City Plan ning Commission yesterday.

title: POLICEMAN HEED IN ROBBERY PLOT
description: A Brooklyn police lieutenant with 12 years' service was suspended yesterday following his arrest on charges of solicit ing a criminal to rob a Queens amusement center.

title: People of Mobile Shun Wallace Plea to Oppose Busing Actively
description: MOBILE, Ala., Sept. 8  Ignoring Gov. George C. Wal lace's suggestion to oppose busing orders from a Federal court, Mobile today quietly put into effect a massive busing plan for its schools.

title: Jersey City Reform Group Names Physician, 30, to Run for Mayor
description: JERSEY CITY, Sept. 8 Contending that the people are fed up with the rotten image that has made Jersey City a national joke, Dr. Paul Jordan, a New Jersey drug abuse ex pert, today became the 44th person to announce his candi dacy for mayor.

title: Superfecta Replaces Westbury Triple
description: WESTBURY, L I., Sept, 8 Harness racing punters who have been trying to beat the game at Roosevelt Raceway through various forms of multi ple bettingdaily double, ex acta, tripleshortly will be striving to hit the jackpot an even harder way, via the super fecta.

title: NADER CRITICIZES NIXON'S TAX PLAN
description: Ralph Nader attacked Presi dent Nixon's economic plan yes terday as a bonanza to indus try and the biggest tax cut in history for corporations.

title: Cambodians Tell of Terrorism by Saigon's Soldiers
description: PRASAUT, Cambodia, Sept. 8Scores of Cambodian peas ants have gathered in this bombedout village on Route 1 seeking protection from what they describe as pillaging and wanton attacks by South Viet namese soldiers operating in Cambodia.

title: Israel Hoping to Assure Cairo on Suez
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 8Israel will try to reassure Egypt in the coming weeks that an in terim settlement to reopen the Suez Canal would not be al lowed to become permanent but would instead pave the way for broader accords.

title: Man Is Charged in Attempt To Bribe Two Policemen
description: A man was arrested here last night and charged with offer ing two police officers at the East 51st Street station a bribe to drop pickpocketing charges against his wife.

title: INVENTORY FORECAST SEES A SLOWER RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP) Manufacturers expect to add $400million to inventories in the third quarter and $1.2 billion in the final three months of 1971, the Commerce Depart ment said today.

title: Berrigan Ends Fast
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mo., Sept. 8 (AP)The Rev. Philip F. Ber rigan, imprisoned for destroy ing Selective Service records, has ended a monthlong hunger strike in protest against Fed eral parole policies, a spokes man for the priest said today. The spokesman, Sister Mary Elizabeth McAlister, a co defendant with Father Berrigan in an alleged plot to kidnap Henry A. Kissinger, said there would be further protests against the parole system Oct. 2 at Federal penal institutions in Springfield, Danbury, Conn., and in California.

title: Britain Extends Deadline On RollsLockheed Contract
description: LONDON, Sept. 8 (AP)The British Government has extend ed for a third time its dead line for a contract to be reached between Lockheed Aircraft Cor poration and RollsRoyce Ltd. for purchase of RollsRoyce's RB211 engines for the Lock heed TriStar airplane.

title: Another Democrat to Travel
description: CONCORD, N. H., Sept. 8 (AP)  Representative William R. Anderson, Democrat of Ten nessee, who has been mentioned as a Presidential aspirant, will make a foray this month into New Hampshire, the state with the nation's first Presidential primary. Mr. Anderson, who spent three days in the state in June, will return for a four day visit beginning Sept. 22.

title: U.S. Flammability Standard For Mattresses Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP) The Government proposed to day a flammability standard for mattresses in an effort to prevent one of the most com mon forms of home and hotel fires.

title: Roundup: Tigers Win, 53, Continue Stalking Orioles
description: Belatedly, the Detroit Tigers are making a run at Balti more's Eastern Division lead ers. Is it a salary drive for 1972 contracts? Or is it a realization that, as a team, the Tigers might have done better throughout the season?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The freefare idea has within it the possibility of reversing the deteriora tion of New York. The subways are the arterial system without which the city could not exist. The city was built and integrated with the help of the nickel subway ride. As the subway fare rose, the city was increasingly fragmented.

title: Guerrillas in Uruguay Say They'll Free British Envoy
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 8 (Reuters)Tupamaros urban guerrillas said tonight they would free the British Ambas sador, Geoffrey Jackson, be cause there is no longer any reason to hold him.

title: Western Orders 3 Jets
description: SEATTLE, Sept. 8 (Reuters) Western Airlines, of Los An geles, which operates 69 Boeing Company jets, ordered three more 727 longbody Trijets to day for $22.5million.

title: Fallout Shelters Domesticated as Fear of War Fades
description: COMMACK, L. I., Sept. 8  Ten years ago, James Hamilton, four of his neigh bors and all their families banded together and built a 39footlong fallout shelter under his backyard.

title: $50Million Coal Pact Set
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 8 (Reu ters)The Eastern Associated Coal Corporation, a subsidiary of Eastern Gas and Fuel As sociates of Boston, said today that it had signed a $50million contract with the Brazilian Na tional Steel Company to deliver more than 5 million net tons of metallurgical coal over 11 years.

title: Dr. Koch Service Tomorrow
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  A memorial service for Dr. Adri enne Koch, historian and politi cal scientist, who died Aug. 21, will be held at 2 P.M. Friday, at the Georgetown Presbyterian Church. Tributes will be paid by Sidney Hook, professor of philsophy at New York Uni versity; Julian P. Boyd, profes sor of history at Princeton; W. McNeil Lowry, vice president of the Ford Foundation, and the Rev. Russell Cartwright Stroup of the Georgetown Pres byterian Church.

title: KING OLAV IS 4TH IN WORLD SAILING
description: CENTRE ISLAND, L. I., Sept. 8Which one is the King? a man on a spectator boat asked today before the start of the world 5.5Meter sailing cham pionships.

title: Dispatcth of The Times, London
description: VIENNA, Sept. 8For the first time in 1,500 years, theologians of the Roman Catholic Church and the old Oriental churches are holding a sixday conference here.

title: Fanny May Yields Drop To Average of 7.910%
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 Mortgage  interest yields de clined in the latest auction of the Federal National Mortgage Association, though the figures are not strictly comparable to those of prior auctions, the as sociation disclosed today.

title: New Violence Erupts
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, Thursday, Sept. 9 (AP) Gun battles erupted here last night, bringing to a climax hours of fierce riots after the funeral of a 14yearold girl killed two days ago in between the cross fire British soldiers and snipers. Stonethrowing mobs roamed the streets.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The recent speech of President Anwar elSadat of the United Arab Re public is disturbing for a number of reasons.

title: BRONX MERCHANT KILLS A SUSPECT
description: One alleged holdup man was killed and another was wounded by merchants in two separate incidents in the Bronx yester day.

title: 2 Robbery Suspects Arrested By Inspector and 2 Policemen
description: A deputy police inspector, a sergeant and a patrolman teamed up yesterday in the Bronx to arrest two mcn who, minutes earlier, allegedly robbed a Brooklyn man of $140 while posing as policemen.

title: What Went Wrong at San Quentin?
description: PORTLAND, Ore.What a tragic wastel In the smoky sunlight of Cali fornia's advanced penology and highlytouted research, what went wrong?

title: Col. Vernon Burge Is Dead; First EnlistedMan Pilot, 82
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Sept 8 (AP)Col, Vernon L. Burge, Air Force, retired, who in 1912 became the first Army enlisted man to win his pilot's wings, died Monday. He was 82 years old.

title: CONNALLY WILLING TO ACCEPT SHIFTS IN TAX PROPOSALS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally asked Congress today for fast action on Presi dent Nixon's new tax program and indicated a willingness to see Congress make at least some limited changes in the plan.

title: State University to Open a Labor College in City
description: A new Labor College Divi sion of the State University of New York, providing degree op portunitles for working adults, is scheduled to open at 25th Street and Lexington Avenue this fall.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT

title: Model Tests Battery Park City Landfill Plan
description: VICKSBURG, Miss., Sept. 8 William Maley of the Bat tery Park City Authority in New York stood like Gulliver today with one foot in the Bronx and one in Queens.

title: PANTHER RAID CASE GETS A NEW JUDGE
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 31The case of Edward V. Hanrahan, Cook County's chief prosecutor, and 13 other law enforcement of ficers, was assigned today to another Cook County Circuit Judge and entered a new phase in its disputed movement to ward a trial.

title: Shell Oil Ends Allowances
description: The Shell Oil Company an nounced yesterday that it has withdrawn all competitive price allowances granted to dealers and jobbers in depresssed areas of its Eastern and Central mar keting regions.

title: 30 Members of East Side Club Robbed by Band of Masked Men
description: A band of masked robbers last night walked into a private East Side club, the Town Club, and held about 100 members at gunpoint, robbing more than 30.

title: Amex Names New Board Member
description: The American Stock Ex change announced yesterday the appointment of Burke Marshall to its 32man board of governors.

title: U.S. Ending Gas Transfer
description: TOKYO, Aug. 31 (AP)The Government of the Ryukyu Islands said today that the United States Army planned to complete the transfer of poi sonous gas to Johnston Island from Okinawa by Sept. 10, the Kyodo news service reported. It said American military authorities had told the Ryukyu Government that they still had to remove 700 to 800 tons of lethal nerve gas from Okinawa.

title: U.S. Aide Is Found Dead In Embassy in West Africa
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 (AP) Donald Leahy of Chicago, a State Department employe at tached to the embassy in Santa Isabel, Equatorial Guinea, was found dead in the chancery yesterday, the State Depart ment reported today.

title: YIELDS POST DROP IN CREDIT MARKET
description: The credit markets were called on by business and gov ernment yesterday to absorb a flood of new, fixedincome se curities, and the response, by and large, was enthusiastic enough to push most interest rates down.

title: Boston Police Sue
description: BOSTON, Aug. 31 (AP)The Boston Police Patrolmen's As sociation filed a civil suit in Federal District Court today asking to have the wageprice freeze declared unconstitu tional.

title: Dun & Bradstreet Revises CommercialPaper Ratings
description: Dun & Bradstreet, Inc., which earlier this month transferred its rating of commercial paper to its Moody's Investors Service subsidiary from its National Credit Office division, an nounced yesterday a new rating scale for such unsecured corpo rate notes.

title: GoldDollar System Favored
description: TOKYO, Aug. 31 (Reuters) Japan would like to see the international monetary system restored to the dollargold ba sis on which it operated before President Nixon suspended the dollar's convertibility to gold. Multilateral parity adjustments would he made to accomplish this, Finance Ministry officials said today.

title: Poll Shows Both Old and Young Are Cool to Contemporary Art
description: PARIS, Aug. 31Young peo ple dislike contemporary art almost as much as do their el ders, according to a new study.

title: Reston, Interviewed on TV, Gives Views on China Trip
description: Communist China is making a concerted effort to bring out what is best in man, accord ing to James Reston, vice presi dent and columnist of The New York Times.

title: Economic Analysis
description: Out of the distress that gripped Wall Street last year have come some strident calls for reform and it is only logical that the Securities and Exchange Commission, the Street's chief Government regu lator, should be come deeply in volved in what ever reforms come about. Neverthe less, some leaders of the secu rities industry are frankly sur prised at the extent to which the Federal agency has prom ised to delve into affairs and issues that traditionally have been left to the purview of the New York Stock Exchange and other selfregulatory bodies.

title: Sports of The Times
description: By the end of the first quarter, even the most optimistic Jet fan had banished from his mind every fanciful idea he once had of planning a trip to New Orleans in January in order to watch his beloved heroes perform in the Super Bowl. He was already muttering despairingly, Is this trip necessary? while deciding that it wasn't, because the Jets obviously would not be involved in any postseason festivity.

title: Parasitic Foes of Gypsy Moth To Be Bred for U.S. in Jersey
description: TRENTON. Aug. 31New Jersey has been given the task of supplying parasites to com bat the gypsy moth in all areas of the country where the forest pest has become established.

title: More Money Discovered In Cache in Illinois Garage
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Aug. 31 (AP)  Twelve more boxes stuffed with uncashed checks and money orders made out to Paul Powell, the late Secretary of State, have been discovered in the garage of an apartment building in Springfield, a spe cial Illinois Assistant Attorney General announced today.

title: Western RollerCoaster a Hit in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 31In this land of dancing bears, expert gymnasts and champion weightlifters, ordinary Rus sians came by the thousands today for a final Western style fling at the interna tional carnival in Gorky Park before school starts tomor row.

title: Night Protection for Schools Asked After Ocean Hill Attack
description: In the wake of an early morning rampage through public school by a mob in the Ocean HillBrownsville school district in Brooklyn, As semblyman Samuel D. Wright, the president of the district school board, called; for the hiring of nighttime guards.

title: Refusals on Insurance Narrowed by New Law
description: New Yorkers can no longer be refused insurance policy renewals without a specific reason in writing under a new law that goes into effect today.

title: GLADYS DICKASON, EXUNION OFFICIAL
description: Gladys Dickason, a retired vice president of the Amalga mated Clothing Workers of America, A.F.L.C.I.O., died yesterday in New York Hos pital. She was 68 years old and lived at 305 West 13th Street.

title: Merger News
description: The First Florida. Bancorpora tion and United Bancshares of Florida, Inc., both important holding companies in that state, announced yesterday, that they were negotiating a possible merger. The mer ger proposal as sumiog the terms are finally agreed to by the com panies, would be the first involving substantial bank holding concerns in Florida to be presented to the regulatory authorities for ap proval.

title: JOHNSON'S DANCE, AMBIT, ENDS FETE
description: Anyone familiar with the in novative summer arts program that Trinity Church started in the Wall Street area two years ago would not be surprised that Ambit, a dance piece commissioned by the church from the young dancerchoreog rapher Raymond Johnson, was chosen to close this year's fes tival.

title: Roundup: Yastrzemski Quiets Orioles, Hooters
description: There was a time Cart Yastrzemski was a hallowed name in Boston baseball. No one would have thought to boo the 32yearold three time American League bat ting champion and young sters were proud to wear Yaz Tshirts and purchase anything he endorsed.

title: Trading In Issue Suspected
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 (Reuters)The Securities and Exchange Commission said to day it had ordered suspension of overthecounter trading in the common stock of the Na tional Tape Corporation of Maywood, N. J., through Sept. 9.

title: Greek Premier ls Planning To Develop New Leaders
description: ATHENS, Aug. 31.  Premier George Papadopoulos, who last week cemented his personal control over Greece, appears to have embarked upon a slow process of producing his own elite.

title: KOREANS' PARLEY SET FOR SEPT. 20
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 37The South Korean Red Cross agreed today to hold pre lithinary talks with the North Korean Red Cross on Sept. 20 to arrange a conference on the problem of families separated in the two parts of Korea.

title: Paramount Cuts Off Filming in City
description: Paramount Pictures has canceled plans to film two major movies in the city and will shift the projects to other, undisclosed cities, at tributing the action to a deadlock in contract negoti ations with a local trade union. Pending contract agreement, the company will schedule no further local production.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I would like to voice my discontent over President Nixon's wageprice freeze.

title: Israeli Envoy Criticizes the U.S. for Delaying Decision on Jets
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 31Yit zhak Rabin, Israel's Ambas sador to the United States, said today that Washington was committing an error in post poning a decision on Israel's request for Phantom fighter bombers.

title: Bridge:
description: Defenders occasionally de part from the normal rules of defensive play, through ignorance, from motives of low cunning or for the sheer hell of it gut the declarer who is constantly suspicious of his opponent's plays will be a loser in the long run.

title: Catholics Struggling to Prevent New Closings in School System
description: DETROIT, Aug. 31St. Mar tin de Porres High School has come to mean a great deal to black people on the West Side of Detroit, sending 90 per cent of its graduates to college last year. To keep it open, the peo ple are selling bread and milk and candy and shares in an insurance plan.

title: Johnson Testifies 3 Hours in Bid to Get His Angel Pay
description: DETROIT, Aug. 31 (UPI) Alex Johnson testified for 3 hours today before a threeman arbitration board in his bid to collect half his $52,500 salary from the California Angels.

title: MURPHY RELIEVES 6 POLICE CAPTAINS FOR LAXITY ON JOB
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy announced yesterday that he had relieved six cap tains of their commands be cause investigators had found repeated instances of police men under their supervision sleeping on duty. Five of them headed precincts.

title: 5.5METER TITLE CAPTURED BY FAY
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 31 Ernest Fay of Houston cap tured the national 5.5meter sailing championship with his Sundance today.

title: Football Injuries Are Linked to Synthetic Turf
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 31Just before the University of Washington football team be gins practice these days. groundskeepers soak the ar tificial grass with hoses to minimize the risk of knee and head injuries to play ers on the synthetic turf.

title: 9 SINGERS TO MAKE CITY OPERA DEBUTS
description: Nine singers will make their debuts with the New York City Opera during the company's fall season at the New York State Theater, which begins tomor row.

title: Ugandans and Tanzanians Said to Continue Fighting
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Aug. 31 (UPI)  Uganda's armed for ces were placed on full alert today, and unofficial reports said fighting continued on her troubled southern border with Tanzania.

title: Ingarfield Named Coach
description: REGINA, Saskatchewan, Aug. 31 (AP)The Regina Pats of the Western Canada Hockey League signed Earl Ingarfield today as coach for the 1971 72 season. He succeeds Bob Turner, who resigned.

title: Titian Among 14 Paintings Stolen From Italian Church
description: PIEVE DI CADORE, Italy, Aug. 31 (AP)Thieves stole a painting by the Renaissance master Titian and 13 other pre cious works from the church here overnight. The Titian was the only one in the town, where the 16thcentury artist was born. Experts valued the works together at above $1.6million.

title: Newcombe Opening US Tennis Today
description: The defections of top pro fessionals, the return of Gor geous Gussie, a picket line and some promising new faces mark the start of the United States Open tennis championships to day at the West Side Tennis Club in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: How World War Two Began: III
description: MOSCOWBy Aug. 15, 1939, the tripartite negotiations had reached a deadlock because of Prime Minister Chamberlain's and Premier Daladier's hostility to the Soviet Union.

title: Letters to the editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The Perils of Face Peeling'Some Have Been Scarred for Life
description: An experimental medical procedure, employed by surgeons to erase super ficial wrinkles, is being used by non medical practitioners in this country and abroad who are promoting the tech nique as a miraculous discovery that produces baby fresh skin.

title: Ackley Calls for Compact On PayPrice Stabilization
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 Gardner Ackley, a former chair man of the Council of Economic Advisers, called today for a social compact among labor, business and other groups to support a permanent system to stabilize wages and prices after the 90day freeze expires.

title: Police Deride and Fear Investigators
description: They are called shooflys by policemen, usually with deri sion, but sometimes with fear of what these undercover po lice officers with wideranging powers might discover.

title: Where They Encourage Squeezing the Tomatoes
description: WASHINGTONThe old fashioned stall markets here, which seemed so lifeless just a few years ago, are bus tling these days as shoppers wander from stall to stall to comparison shop and greet friends.

title: Teachers and Friends Recall Bingham: A Strong Social Conscience but Politically Naive
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 31 Stephen Mitchell Bingham was arrested in Clarksdale, Miss., in 1963 while helping blacks to register to vote.

title: Fund Will Aid Children Of Slain City Policemen
description: The Patrolmen's Benevolent Association today amounced the creation of a fund to be administered by city Council men to provide scholarships for the children of police men killed in the line of duty.

title: Budget Expert Named to Direct State's City Inquiry
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Mayor Lindsay, on hearing that an other grocer, policeman or luncheon ette owner has been shot, reiterates with the mindless regularity of cuckoo clock, What we need is Federal guncontrol law.

title: Yonkers Furrier Shot Dead By Woman Taking a Coat
description: YONKERS, Aug. 31  The 62yearold owner of a South Broadway fur shop was shot three times and killed this aft ernoon by a woman who then escaped with at least one fur coat which he had been show ing her, the Yonkers police re ported.

title: 57.7% Under 21 in City Have Registered to Vote
description: By the end of the eight month registration period this week, 57.7 per cent of New York City's newly enfranchised youths 18, 19 and 20 years old had taken advantage of their eligibilitya percentage that almost exactly matches that of their elders in registering to vote.

title: I.A.T.A. EXTENDS DATE FOR ACCORD ON FARES
description: MONTREAL, Wednesday, Sept. 1 (Canadian Press)The International Air Transport As sociation last night extended to Oct. 15 the deadline for Luft hansa to lift its veto of a new fares package for the North At anitic route.

title: Hall Gains in Mallory Racing
description: SOUTH DARTMOUTH, Mass., Aug. 31Graham Hall, a New York schoolteacher and yacht writer, moved closer to the lead in the regatta for the Clifford D. Mallory Cup off Padanaram Harbor and the New Bedford Yacht Club today.

title: Financial Structure Cited
description: Instead, the story concluded, adequate protection for cus tomers might be achievedand with a less serious impact on the financial structure of brokersif brokers were to be permitted to continue to use customers' funds for the tempo rary financing of other custom ers but not to finance invest ments or other activities of the firm itself.

title: 50Story Building to Rise By St. Patrick's Cathedral
description: A $30million, 50story build ing with retail stores, office space and 240 cooperative apart ments will be built on Fifth Avenue between 51st and 52d Streets.

title: TOKYO
description: TOKYO, Aug. 31The top political and business characters in Tokyo are playing down the AmericanJapanese financial crisis. Their nightmare seems to be that the dollaryen problem, with elections coming up in both Japan and the United States next year, will cre ate political and psychological prob lems of the most serious nature.

title: MRS. MORRIS MILLER
description: Mrs. Bessie Miller, widow of Morris Miller, a real estate owner and fabric manufacturer, died yesterday at her home in Long Beach, L.I. She was 93 years old.

title: Extra Shirt Pocket Is Allowed as Basis For Price Increase
description: ARLINGTON, Va., Aug. 31 A manufacturer who adds a pocket to a shirt or who sews a monogram onto a garment will be permitted to raise prices, the Office of Emergency Preparedness told a meeting of producers and retailers here today.

title: DOLLAR STRONGER AGAINST STERLING
description: LONDON, Aug. 31  The dollar strengthened in relation to the floating pound sterling today as Britain's new exchange controls came into effect. This meant that the trading advan tage from a devalued dollar being sought by the Nixon Ad ministration was somewhat re duced.

title: Interim Mayor of Jersey City Is Receptive to a Draft to Run
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 31  Mayor Charles K. Krieger, who said when he was appointed interim Mayor here 26 days ago that under no cir cumstances would he seek election in November, began talking like a possible candi date today.

title: CIVILIAN TO RULE EAST PAKISTANIS
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Wed nesday, Sept. 1The Pakistani Government this morning an nounced the appointment of civilian governor to take over administration of wartorn East Pakistan, which has been ruled for the last six months by Lieut. Gen. Tikka Khan.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Hiatt's Nose Broken; Operation Necessary
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 31 (AP) Jack Hiatt, Houston Astros catcher whose fight with Willie Crawford of the Los Angeles Dodgers started sev eral other bouts between, members of the teams last night, suffered a broken nose and a blocked nasal passage and will undergo surgery Thursday.

title: A Backwash of Bitterness Follows Police ShakeUp
description: There was disgust, bitterness and resignation. But mostly in the precincts that lost their captains yesterday, in Commis sioner Patrick V. Murphy's latest shakeup, there was anger.

title: Man in the News
description: A week ago last Friday, a tall, portly, baldish man sat in Governor Rockefeller's office on West 55th Street and listened as the Gov ernor continued to outline a job proposal he had broached the previous day on the tele phone. As the Governor's visitor recalls the conversation: He went right to the heart of the matter, saying that there are eight million people and they are damned important and we have to determine what, if anything intelligent, we can do to better their lives and to provide better serv ices for them and so forth.

title: Apprentice Has a Day to Forget
description: It wasn't Nathan Plotkin's day at Belmont Park yester day.

title: CENTER SETS SERIES OF RUSSIAN SILENTS
description: A festival of Russian classics of the silent screen, many of them seldom shown here, will be presented from Sept. 9 to Oct. 31 at the New York Cul tural Center, 2 Columbus Circle. Screenings will be held at 4 Fand 6 P.M., Wednesday through Sunday. Admission is included lin the museum's general en trance fee of $1 (50 cents for students).

title: Steel Men Go to Capital To Study Japanese Plan
description: Senior executives of the American steel industry will be in Washington today to study a new proposal by Japanese steel companies that would limit their shipments to this country for three years, begin ning Jan. 1, 1972.

title: 1,537 on State Welfare Placed in Jobs
description: More than half of the state welfare clients who reported themselves available for work were referred to jobs in the private sector during July, the first month under a new law requiring employables to pick up relief checks at state job centers.

title: SCHOOL BOARD GETS DRUGS PLAN TONIGHT
description: The Board of Education is expected to approve tonight contract to receive $4,731,000 from the Addiction Services Agency of New York City for the purpose of developing drugabuse prevention program vin 94 public high schools.

title: OffTrack Littering
description: A week ago the Mayor's Council on the Environment asked for stern measures against business firms which, by illegal distribution of advertising throwaways, con tribute to littering the city's streets. The Council's pre scription: Maybe we should fine corporate executives who authorize the campaign. They are the environmental criminals.

title: Profit Is Increased By Seaboard Coast
description: Seaboard Coast Line Indus tries, Inc., raised its consoli dated earnings in this year's first half to $22,393,000, or $2.31 a share before extra ordinary charges, from $16, 418,000, or $1.81 a share, in the first six months of 1970 when there were no extra charges, W. Thomas Rice, chair man and chief executive re ported yesterday from the com pany's Richmond, Va., head quarters.

title: MRS. PAULINE G. PAUL
description: Mrs. Pauline Gleicher Paul, director of allday neighbor hood schools in the city's school system, died in an auto mobile accident in Tours, France, on Aug. 21. She was 56 years old and lived at 261 East 66th Street.

title: 2.14% Average Rise Listed In Retail Prices for July
description: Prices advertised by repre sentative department, specialty and general merchandise stores were on the average 2.14 per cent higher in July than in the yearearlier month, the Bureau of Advertising said yesterday, continuing a trend of the last few months.

title: South African Banks to Give Equal Pay to Nonwhite Staff
description: JOHNNESBT,JRG, South Af rica, Aug. 31The Standard Bank of South Africa and Bar clays, South Africa, announced today they would give nonwhite employes the same rates of pay as whites. The move will affect nonwhite tellers and clerks employed mainly in nonwhite branches.

title: ABRAM MATTES
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Aug. 31 Abram Mattes, who retired in 1966 as deputy commissioner of Purchase after 50 years with the New York City administration, died today in Memorial Hospi tal. He was 76 years old.

title: LEMUEL A. HULL
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., Aug. 31 Lemuel A. Hull, retired vice president of Air Reduction Com pany and president of the Na tional Carbide Corporation, one of its subsidiaries, died here on Monday. He was 83 years old and lived in nearby Belleair.

title: JERSEY AREA GETS ACCORD ON SEWAGE
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 2The; city and nine Morris County communities are preparing or dinances aimed at creating a regional sewerage authority to rid the Rockaway River of pollution.

title: Executive House, Inc., Files Plan for Paying Creditors
description: Executive House, Inc., said yesterday that it has filed with the Federal District Court in Chicago a plan that has been approved by the committee of its unsecured creditors and the majority, in claim amounts, of all its unsecured creditors.

title: Postal Unions Ask Court to Bar Freeze On Members' Pay
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 Postal unions asked a Federal District Court today to prohibit the United States Postal Service from holding back scheduled wage increases in accordance with the 90day wageprice freeze imposed by President Nixon.

title: Rogers Defends New Nixon Policy
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 31 (AP) Secretary of State William P. Rogers defended President Nixon's new foreign policy today as necessary to meet the changing conditions of the world in the nineteenseven ties.

title: STOCKS RETREAT FOR SECOND DAY
description: Stock prices staged their sec ond retreat in a row yester day in sharply reduced trad ing. Several glamour issues dis played sizable declines.

title: Campbell Also Recalling Batch Of Vegetarian Vegetable Soup
description: The Campbell Soup Com pany, which is recalling chick en vegetable soup in 16 states because of contamination by deadly botulin toxin, announced yesterday that it was recalling a batch of another kind of soup  vegetarian vegetable because it too may be con taminated.

title: Codd, Discussing Kahane, Warns on Carrying Rifles
description: Chief Inspector Michael J. Codd warned yesterday that anyone carrying a loaded rifle or a shotgun either in a car or on foot would be arrested.

title: STATE TO STUDY WELFARE IN CITY
description: State Welfare Inspector Gen eral George F. Berlinger yester day advised Jule M. Sugar man, the city's Human Resour ces Administrator, that he would shortly begin an inves tigation of the city's failure to prosecute welfare frauds.

title: Executive Changes
description: The New York Life Insurance Company an nounced yesterday the election of Joseph C. Sibigtroth as senior vice president and chief ac tuary, and Edward H. Sweetser as senior vice president. Mr. Sibigtroth, formerly vice president and actuary, succeeds Lowell M. Dorn, who is retiring. Mr. Sibigtroth, 55 years old, joined the company in 1952 after 12 years at the Metro politan Life Insurance Company. He will be in charge of all functions of the company relating to individual life insur health insurance and annuities. Mr. Sweetser, 51, was formerly vice president in charge of underwriting. He joined New York Life, the fourth largest life insurance com pany with assets of about $11billion, in 1937 and has spent his entire business career with the com pany. Mr. Sweetser will be in charge of depart ments handling the issuance of policies and pay ments of claims, the life underwriting department and the medical department.

title: Service for Lou McGarity
description: A memorial service for Lou McGarity, the jazz trombonist, who died tin Alexandria, Va., last Saturday, will be held Sept. 12 at 7:30 P.M. at St. Peter's Lutheran Church, Lexington Avenue and 54th Street. The service will he conducted by the Rev. John G. Gensel, asso elate pastor.

title: Letters to the editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Superstar and On the Town Start OutWith a Past
description: Jesus Christ Superstar land On the Town, the two biggest musicals of the season, went into re hearsal this week. The two shows, poles apart in concept and design, have one main thing in common: a past. Superstar is based on a record. On the Town is a revival of the 1944 musical. In each case the show has a smash hit to live up to.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Books of The Times
description: THE BOOK OF NIGHTMARES. By Galway Kinnell. 75 pages. Houghton Mifflin. $4.50.

title: Census Bureau Finds Lost River's Not Lost
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 (AP)Lost River, Idaho, is no longer lost, the Census Bureau acknowledged to day.

title: John Leary Jr. Dies at 64; Columnist in New Haven
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 31 John J. Leary Jr., newspaper columnist and retired city of ficial, died of a heart ailment early yesterday in the hospital of St. Raphael. He was 64 years old and lived here.

title: Egypt Said to Get More Russian Piloted Squadrons
description: CAIRO, Aug. 31  The So viet Union is increasing the number of Russianpiloted jet fighter squadrons in Egypt, ac cording to wellplaced sources here.

title: Fire at Amusement Park
description: SALISBURY, Mass., Aug. 31 (AP)Robert's Surfside, an ocean front amusement park, suffered heavy damage from a general alarm fire early today. The fire, discovered shortly after midnight, apparently started in the fun house and spread to other sections, offi cials said. Damage was esti mated at $35,000.

title: British Give Version
description: LONDON, Aug. 31The Min istry of Defense maintained to night that the two British army vehicles had been fired on by machine guns and rifles from within the Irish Republic.

title: N.F.L. FRANCHISE SOUGHT FOR CITY
description: Assemblyman Andrew Stein has joined with three promi nent Wall Street figures to ex plore the possibilities of at tracting a professional football team to New York City to re place the Giants, moving to New Jersey in 1975.

title: Manufacturer Inventories Dropped Slightly in July
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31  Manufacturers' inventories de clined slightly in July but ship ments dropped even more, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Poor Medical Care Is Blamed in Jail Deaths
description: Inadequate medical care in the city's overcrowded jails was described at a public hearing yesterday as a key factor do some of the 25 deaths of in matesincluding eight suicides this year.

title: Rondon Risks Title Oct. 16
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 31 (AP) Vicente Rondon of Vene zuela, the World Boxing Asso ciation lightheavyweight cham pion, agreed today to defend his title on Oct. 16 against Gomeo Brennan at the Miami Beach Convention Hall.

title: BURGER CAUTIONS LOWER TRIBUNALS ON BUSING ORDERS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31  Chief Justice Warren E. Burger said today that judges in lower courts were misreading the Su preme Court's opinions if they were ordering busing of pupils in the belief that the Court required racial balance in every school.

title: Lynch, in Statement on Border Incident, Accuses Britain on Incursions
description: DUBLIN, Aug. 31Prime Minister John Lynch said today that the British had failed to control movements of their troops along the border with Northern Ireland and that sol diers had made at least 30 Incursions into the Irish Re public in the last two years.

title: Chance to Help the City
description: Hope that the new state commission investigating New York City will apply itself constructively to solutions for the city's monumental problems, rather than to sterile attacks on the city administration, has risen substantially with announcement of key appointments to the com mission's staff.

title: Charles M. Sternhell, 55, Dies; An Executive of New York Life
description: Charles M. Sternhell, execu tive vice president of the New York Life Insurance Company, died of cancer yesterday at the Memorial SloanKettering Can cer Center. He was 55 years old and lived at 187 Canter bury Gate, Lynbrook, L. I.

title: PRESIDENT DENIES ARMSAID PLANS TO SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 President Nixon refused today to disclose to the Senate For eign Relations Committee the Administration's long  range plans for foreign military assist ance.

title: WIDE IMPACT SEEN IN SCHOOLS RULING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31  The United States Commission er of Education said today that a California Supreme Court de cision on public school financ ing may mean a very funda mental breakthrough in the con cept of equity in state educa tional systems.

title: Mansfield Defends Moves
description: OSLO, Norway, Aug. 31 (Reuters)Senator Mike Mans field defended today President Nixon's measures to protect the dollar and said the United States economy could be fur ther helped by cutting down the United States defense com mitment in Europe.

title: Pontiac to Integrate, Despite Bus Bombings
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Aug. 31 Pontiac school officials said to day they would carry out a courtordered integration school busing plan despite bomb explosions that de stroyed 10 school buses last night.

title: Liberia Molds Farm Worker In Death of Peace Corpsman
description: MONROVIA, Liberia, Aug. 31 (ReutersA farm worker, Robert Toe, has been arrested in the murder of an American Peace Corps volunteer, Marsha Lynn Ragno, 22 years, old, of Winthrop Harbor, Ill.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Yacovelli Said to Succeed Colombo in Mafia Family
description: Joseph Yacovelli is giving the orders in the Mafia fam ily said to have been headed by Joseph A. Colombo Sr., ac cording to underworld inform ants and Federal and state agents.

title: The Mikheyev Case
description: Thousands of Soviet citizens from diplomats and scientists to ordinary seamen have defected in the last halfcentury. Normally the Soviet press ignores these flights, except when a person of unusual prominence such as Stalin's daughter is involved.

title: Cerf Rites Draw Friends of 2 Worlds
description: Many of the sober people of publisher's row allowed a smile and the funny people of show business cried a little in a sub dued goodby to Bennett Cerf, the man who relished life in the two worlds.

title: Cabinet Units Split On Plan to Merge 2 Major Airlines
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 The Nixon Administration was split today over the proposed merger of American Airlines and Western Airlines.

title: Yanks and Mets Beaten By Single Runs in Ninth
description: After staging a valiant four run rally in the eighth inning to tie the Washington Senators, the Yankees lost their series opener against the Senators last night, 65, when Frank Baker booted a ground ball that enabled Washington to score the winning run.

title: Why Europe Is Shocked
description: BRUSSELSFew expressions have been used more widely to describe the effects of President Nixon's new eco nomic policy than that America's part are shocked and stunned.

title: Policewoman, Saved by Misfire, Promoted to Detective by Murphy
description: A 28yearold policewoman, attacked and threatened with death in a Bronx alley by three men, during an undercover narcotics investigation Monday night, was promoted yesterday to the rank of thirdgrade de tective.

title: British Aircraft to Lay Off 1,500 Over Next 2 Months
description: BRISTOL, England, Aug. 31 (AP)The British Aircraft Cor poration announced today that it planned to lay off 1,200 workers over the next two months, including members of the production staff of the su personic Concorde.

title: London Stage: Fun of Sartre's Kean
description: LONDONThe theater is a place where ill humor all too often poses as wit, and farce is frequently the merest contemptuous excuse for a comedy's lack of life or credibility. It is as a conse quence a special pleasure to encounter a comedy of style and breeding, and, most difficult of all, a period play at that.

title: WOODALL OF JETS SUFFERS FRACTURE OF HIS LEFT WRIST
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 31 The Jets now have two in jured quarterbacks, but at least Al Woodall is expected to be available soon, surely for the National Football League sea son opener.

title: Payments Surplus In Japan Declines; 495Million in July
description: TOKYO, Aug. 31 (Reuters) Japan had a $495million sur plus in her balance of interna tional payments for July, the Finance Ministry said today.

title: Britain's Penny Loses Status
description: LONDON, Aug. 31 (AP) Britain's bronze penny, in cir culation since the 18th century, will no longer be legal tender after midnight tonight, nor will the octagonal threepenny piece, introduced in 1937. Both are victims of Britain's switch to decimal currency.

title: FMC IS DISCUSSING COALGAS VENTURE
description: The FMC Corporation an nounced yesterday that it was discussing the organization of a consortium to develop and engineer a plant for the pro duction of synthetic natural gas and crude oil from coal.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF IN SLOW TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange posted their second consecutive decline yesterday in continued slow trading.

title: U.S. Banker Expected to Get U. N. Development Post
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 31Rudolph A. Peterson, former president of the Bank of America, was reported today to be virtually certain to re place Paul G. Hoffman as direc tor of the United Nations De velopment Plan when Mr. Hoff man retires at the end of the year.

title: G.M. CHIEF DEFENDS PRESIDENT'S POLICY
description: DETROIT, Aug. 31No sin gle segment of society bene fits from President Nixon's new economic policy, the chair man of the General Motors Corporation said today.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: ISTANBUL, TurkeyWhen things go wrong in Turkey, the army inter venes. Even a hundred and fifty years ago, if the fanatical Janizary Corps upset its regimental cauldrons, this betokened a change of administra tion.

title: Yen Floats Higher Against the Dollar
description: TOKYO, Aug. 31The yen floated slightly higher today and was quoted at 339 yen to the dollar, representing a 5.8 per cent upward revaluation of the yen.

title: OTB Opens Short Cut to Belmont With New Times Square Shop
description: Howie the Horse galloped into Times Square yesterday, giving a retired seaman named Fred Trench and hundreds of other Broadway horseplayers an immediate short cut to Bel mont Park.

title: San Francisco's Chinese Resist School Busing
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 31 The old Sun Sing Theater on Grant Avenue, the gaily lighted, touristchoked heart of Chinatown, was jammed. Its 800 seats had filled up early, mostly with serious faced Chinese women and squirming youngsters. Scores of latercomers stood patient ly in the aisles and along the walls.

title: BINGHAM CHARGED IN PRISON DEATHS
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., Aug. 31 Stephen M. Bingham, a 29 yearold lawyer, was formally charged today with murder in the deaths of two convicts and three guards at San Quentin Prison.

title: Richardson Says He Agrees With Nixon on Busing
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 31Elliot L. Richardson, the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, asserted today that he was in total agreement with President Nixon's policy of limited school busing. He denied that he had considered resigning his post after Mr. Nixon publicly repudiated a desegregation plan drawn up by Mr. Richardson's own agency.

title: GROUND FIGHTING IN VIETNAM DROPS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 31 (AP)Ground fighting diminished across South Viet nam today, but United States bombers pounded the country's northern front and inside the demilitarized zone.

title: Cuba Is Halting Refugee Airlift to Miami
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 The State Department an nounced today that Cuba has advised the United States of her desire to terminate the air lift that in the last six years has brought nearly a quarter million Cuban refugees to this country.

title: KY, OUT OF RACE, BUSY IN POLITICS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Sept. 1Vice Pres ident Nguyen Cao Ky moved yesterday to get hack the $7,300 he had posted to run in the presidential election. Oct 3, em phasizing that he was out of the political scene.

title: WHEAT FUTURES DECLINE IN PRICE
description: Heavy selling near the close of the trading session pushed wheat futures prices down al most 3 cents a bushel yester day on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Stockholders on the Bench
description: Presidents are always urged to fill vacancies on the United States Supreme Court as quickly as possible not only because of the heavy workload on the justices but because possible tievotes are undesirable. Now we have the prospect of at least five major cases, all involving big business, having to be decided by less than a full complement of justices because members holding stock in the affected companies are withdrawing for reasons of possible conflict of interest.

title: Leg Of North Sea Oil Race Over
description: OSLO, NorwayThe first phase of the international race for North Sea offshore oil will end today when prospecting groups turn back 25 per cent of the acreage granted them by the Norwegian Government.

title: Pentagon Broadens Religious Guideline For War Objectors
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 (AP) The Pentagon revised its directive on conscientious ob jectors today to include deeply held moral or ethical beliefs as grounds for dis charge as specified in a 1970 Supreme Court decision.

title: GEORGES L. PEISSEL
