title: C. E. Hambrick Weds Miss Stowe And They Become HambrickStowes
description: Miss Elizabeth Anne Stowe and Charles Edwin Hambrick, who are studying for the ministry and working for women's liberation, were married here yesterday and became Mr. and Mrs. HambrickStowe.

title: Secrets of The Great Pyramid
description: The Great Pyramid of Gizeh was constructed some 4,500 years ago as a tomb for the Pharaoh Khufu, whom the Greek historian Herodotus preferred to call Cheops. This is what most modern archeologists believe, anyway, andto get my own bias on the record right awayI believe it too.

title: CounterTradition
description: Discovering wellknown radicals and undiscovering others

title: Tigers Beat Red Sox, 10, on Coleman's 31litter and Gates Brown's Horner
description: DETROIT, Sept. 11 (AP)Joe Coleman pitched nohit ball for seven innings and finished with a threehitter as Gates Brown's ninth home run of the year gave the Detroit Tigers a 1.0 victory over the Boston Red Sox today.

title: Meredith, Once a QB, Makes It as an LL.D.
description: ALFRED, N. Y., Sept. 11 Don Meredith, television sports broadcaster and former quarterback for the Dallas Cowboys, was awarded an honorary degree of doctor of laws at Alfred University last Thursday.

title: Canadians Sign Two
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 11 (UPI)  The National Hockey League's Montreal Canadiens signed two more players today from last year's Stanley Cup winning team. Terry Harper, a defenseman, and Pete Mahovolich, a left wing, signed oneyear contracts. General Manager Sam Pollock said that all players were now under contract.

title: Ox Ridge Sets Dressage Show For First Time in Club History
H. NOEL ZELLEY, 60, A MARINE ENGINEER
description: McLEAN, Va., Sept. 11 H. Noel Zelley, executive vice president of the Stanwick Corporation, marine  engineering concern, died Thursday of cancer in the Arlington Hospital. He was 60 years old.

title: Steady Star Scores Easily In Feature at Freehold
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Sept. 11 Steady Star made the watersoaked Freehold Raceway appear fast today when he won the $10,000 Cardigan Bay Pace in 2:01.2. The 4yearold son of Steady Beau was under a tight hold by Joe O'Brien as he passed under the finish line a threelength victor.

title: The Berlin Agreement Is No Gift
Navy Surge in 3d Period Defeats Virginia, 10 to 6
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Sept. 11A determined Navy football team put together, two scoring drives in the third period today and posted a 1061 victory over a University of Virginia eleven, which did about everything except score a touchdown.

title: REVEALING ALL
description: To THE EDITOR: I agree, as your two writers obliquely suggested in their articles on nudism, that public nudity would be humbling and leveling. Accordingly, I've long maintained that diplomacy should take place in the nude and, I think lying down, with the diploa mats / politicians / negotiators facing each other on chaises. Hats may be worn, if wished. The reason is it seems harder to dissemble when you're naked and lying down, stripped as you are of superficial pride, dignity and distinctiveness. Just think about the Congress, the Security Council, the courts, and the Paris peace negotiations! Similarly, to democratize the occasion, I think that opening nights of the Metropolitan Opera should be nude. Again, hats will be allowedas a concession to the formality of the occasion and to afford a degree of the superficial dignity and distinctiveness (poses and disguise) that attendees so dearly value and maintain.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  C. Fred Bergsten is not only a man respected for his thoughts on international monetary matters but a man recently accustomed to power. Until last June, he was in the White House dealing with these things.

title: The Mediterranean
description: Et Al.

title: The CourtMartial Of Lt. Calley
description: Whole seas, one feels, could not contain the tears that humanity must shed at the knowledge of the horror at Mylai. As one goes over the event yet another timeas one rereads Seymour M. Hersh's brilliant, pitiless account My Lai 4, published last, year one has to try to insulate one's self from the details of the massacre, protectively conjuring up visions of other atrocities, saying to one's self: Keep thinking of Bengal, of the murder of the Huguenots, the sack of Magdeburg, of Lidice, Malmdy. Isn't this only what men have always done to other men?

title: Muskie's Waterloo?
description: It was supposed to be a quiet, offtherecord meeting, but at week's end there were some who were calling it Edmund Muskie's Waterloo. On a nationwide swing to pick up support for his still unannounced bid for the Democratic Presidential nomination, the Maine Senator met in the Watts ghetto of Los Angeles last Tuesday night with 35 black community leaders. If Senator Muskie were to win the nomination, he was asked, would he accept a black as his Vice Presidential running mate? The Senator said no. I said that in my judgment such a ticket was not electable, that therefore it would not serve the purposes which we were discussing, Mr. Muskie told reporters later when word of the meeting got out. What we needed to do, he said he told the black leaders, whose support he was attempting to enlist, was to elect a ticket that would be committed to dealing effectively with questions of racial inequality.

title: How Do You Hear a Dancer Dance?
description: MERED1TH MONK, important experimenter in dance, cuts a record. That fact alone is interestingdemonstrating as it does the trend against specialization that has been going on in some vanguard circles of art. Choreographer Mame Cunningham conducts a John Cage score; in turn, during a Cunningham dance Cage reads stories that he has written; artist Robert Morris presents dances at the Whitney museum.

title: NICKERSON LEADS IN NOROTON SAIL
Egypt Shifts Stress to Internal Affairs
description: CAIRO, Sept. 11Although President Anwar elSadat has vowed that 1971 is the year of decision in the conflict with Israel, the Egyptians appear to be shifting their attention toward internal economic and social development.

title: Kansas's Defense Stands Out In 340 Defeat of Wash. State
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., Sept. 11 (UPI)Kansas turned three interceptions into touchdowns today and used the running of Dan Heck, Steve Conley and Jerome Nelloms to defeat Washington State, 340.

title: SERBIAN GYPSIES
description: To THE EDITOR: As one who has been to Yugoslavia year after year and loves the country and its people, I enjoyed Taking This Photograph Got Me Locked Up (Travel section, Aug. 29) in which Alan Linn described how he was arrested after photographing some Serbian gypsies. I found that in addition to military sections, such as the coastline near Albania, gypsies and their undernourished horses were not to be photographed under any circumstances. A few ambitious German photographers had placed pictures of emaciatedlooking gypsies in German newspapers with such captions as: This is the way the Yugoslav people are looking today. I know that this was resented terribly by the Yugoslav people, and can well understand why such photographic restrictions were imposed.

title: Colorado Downs L.S.U.
description: BATON ROUGE, Sept. 11 (AP)  Charlie Davis sped through Louissiana State's defense for 175 yards and two touchdowns tonight to lead Colorado to a 3121 victory.

title: CON EDISON PLANS STIR EAST SIDERS
description: This shows that welltodo people can be mobilized about an issue just like someone from Harlem or BedfordStuyvesant, William Diamond, chairman of Community Planning Board 8, said as community members crowded into a sweltering auditorium on Manhattan's East Side.

title: Brooklyn Crusader Fights for Italian Achievements
description: Most historians now agree that in 1524before Henry Hudson was bornGiovanni da Verrazano, a Florentine in the service of France, discovered the mouth of what we erringly call the Hudson River.

description: COLUMBUS, Ga., Sept. 11 (AP)John Miller clung to his Southern open lead today despite a courserecord round of 62 by Bobby Mitchell.

title: Miller Develops New Turf Horses With an Old Method: Trial and Error
description: MacKenzie Miller, trainer for Cragwood Stable, has been noted for his success with horses in turf races. This year, he has attracted attention with his 2yearolds.

title: The World
description: SAIGONThe South Vietnamese command has launched a new sweep in the country's precarious northwestern corner of Quangtri Province, hard against the demilitarized zone and the border with Laos. It is the biggest operation in the area and the closest to the borders since last winter's equivocal attack on the Ho Chi Minh Trail in Laos, and, like the Laos fighting, it is being closely watched here for auguries of success for the Vietnamization program.

title: REP. STAFFORD SEEN SUCCEEDING PROUTY

description: INDIANAPOLIS, Sept. 11 (AP)Al. Unser won the Hoosier Hundred race for United States Auto Club dirttrack cars today, but George Snider finished second and captured the first championship. of the new circuit.

description: HENDAYE, France  The writer Pierre Loti once described the Bay of Chingoudi, where France meets Spain, as a mirror a bit more luminous than the sky, reflecting all the constellations above and all the Spanish mountains on the other side.

title: Lisa Neva McGrath Is Married to Johnston. Evans
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Sept. 11 Miss Lisa Neva McGrath, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gordon Randolph McGrath of Brookville, was married here today to Johnston Livingston Evans, sun of Mrs. Paul Gordon Evans of New York and Fishers Island, N. Y., and Mr. Evans of La Jolla, Calif. The ceremony was performed in the Episcopal Church of the Advent by the Rev. Herbert H. Beardsley.

description: DAYTON, Ohio, Sept. 11 (AP) Gary Kosins, who shared the nation's collegiate football scoring lead last season, ran for two touchdowns as Dayton downed Cincinnati, 163, tonight.

title: This is a Tree
description: It requires food and water just as we do. It gets its food and water from the soil in which it is planted. It cannot travel in. search of food and water elsewhere.

description: Bilbao, SpainJos Manuel Ibar (Urtain), 198 pounds, Spain, drew with Marian() Echevarrie, 213, Spain, 12 rounds, Urtain retains Spanish title.

description: NORTHPORT, L. I., Sept. 11When Dexter C. Seymour opened his boatyard on Northport Harbor 48 years ago, he could gaze at huge, graceful yachts that sailed in from Long Island Sound and see the gently sloping hills of Centerport.

description: Miss Jane Evans, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. John A. Evans of New York and Shelter Island, L. I., was married here this afternoon to Gerard Carreyrou, son of Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Carreyrou of Paris.

description: NORWALK, Conn., Sept. 11 Miss Madeleine Prendergast, executive assistant to the Superintendent of Schools here, died today of cancer at Norwalk Hospital. She lived at 9 Jarvis Street.

description: FAIRMOUNT, N. J., Sept. 11Miss Cristin Ayn Delker and Albert W. Merck Jr. plan to be married on Oct. 23, a week after the wedding of Mr. Merck's cousin, Miss Josephine Amy Merck, to Peter McAdoo Coy.

description: PLAYERS who should know better often squander their assets in dummy without sufficient thought. An elementary example is this:

title: Fitts Wins by a HalfMile In U.S. 25Kilometer Run
description: DEDHAM, Mass., Sept. 11 (AP)Bob Fitts, 28 years old, a former Cortland State crosscountry star now studying for a doctor's degree at the University of Wisconsin, won the National Amateur Athletic Union 25kilometer championship run today by more than a halfmile. He covered the 16 miles in one hour 21 minutes 39 seconds.

title: URUGUAY'S LEADER WARNS ON REBELS Pacheco Tells Nation He'll Take a Tougher Stand
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 11President Jorge Pacheco Areco, whose Government was undermined this week by successes of the urban guerrillas called Tupamaros, today promised to become even tougher in his battle against them.

title: West Side Highway Plan Causes Chagrin
description: The statement by Urban Development Corporation officials that their plans for a new West Side Highway [New West Side Highway Above River Proposed, Aug. 29] have met with general approval is somewhat startling. At the meeting I attended, the West Villagers present raised many questions and expressed some grave doubts, most of which were glibly brushed aside.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: In Peter Schjeldahl's review of the Brooklyn Museum's show, Pride and Prejudice, he refers to an engraving after the selfportrait of one Louise Elizabeth Vige Le Brun . . . who seems to have been a member of the French Royal Academy of Painting. It is astonishing to find this critic seemingly unaware that Vige Le Brun was one of the most notable artists of her time, a competent painter and the favorite portraitist of Marie Antoinette.

title: Wagner, Montclair State and Post Rated Area's Best SmallCollege Elevens
Chatting Via Computer
description: JERICHO, L.I.Computers can talk with people in clear; audible words these days, according to Edward J. Garrett, chairman and president of the Instrument Systems Corporation here.

title: VILIANOVA DOWNS MARYLAND, 2813
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Sept. 11 (UPI)Daryl Woodring, a quarterback, passed for three touchdowns, two of them to Mike Siani, a tightend, today as Villanova beat Maryland, 2813.

title: RangersOpen Largest Camp With 81 Men at Kitchener
description: KITCHENER, Ontario, Sept. 11Rod Gilbert and Ab DeMarco were the last players to report today as the New York Rangers opened the largest training camp in their history.

title: Graham Greene At 66
description: Driving along the Riviera coast from Nice, caught in the slow crawl that passes for traffic each summer, I had lots of time to think about the man I was going to see. I recalled that Graham Greene had not been in America for years, and vaguely I remembered a fitful sniping back and forthMr. Greene squeezing off bursts of disenchantment with America's imperial role, and an occasional defender of the transAtlantic faith returning the fire.

title: 40,000 FRESHMEN IN CITY U. CLASSES
SPAIN'S DOCTORS PROTEST SYSTEM Seek Reforms in Medicine and Health Administration
description: MADRID, Sept. 11 Two weeks ago, 17 doctors in the psychiatric wards of the Francisco Franco Medical Center refused to go home when their tour of duty was over.

title: If You Go to Socialize or Get High . . .
description: THE morning after the Newport Jazz Festival was closed by the city two months ago  it was a Sunday and it was the Fourth of July  a slight, redbearded young man was reflectively sweeping the debrislittered stage, mute evidence of the invasion that had taken place the night before. At that time he had been one of the hill people packed together several thousand strong on a hill overlooking Festival Field where they were hearing and, distantly, seeing the festival for free until a small group broke through the chainlink fence surrounding the field. Once the fence went down, some of the hill people began flooding through the openings and the city council ordered the evening's concert, and eventually the remaining two days of the festival, halted.

PROTEST

CLEMSON BEATEN BYKENTUCKY,I310
LUNA 18'S SIGNAL IS LOST ON MOON
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 11 The Soviet Union's latest effort to explore the moon's surface with an unmanned spacecraft ended in failure today, as Luna 18 lot contact with the earth upon landing.

description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 11 (Reuters)Three Negroes described by the police as known Black Panthers were wounded in a gun battle in the Newton district of Los Angeles late last night.

title: As I Listened to Archie Say Hebe. . .
description: I HAVE a most peculiar complaint about the bigotry in the hit TV comedy, All in the Family. There's not enough of it.

description: LE CASTELLET, France, Sept. 11 (UPI)Graham Hill of Britain driving a 3liter Ford Capri, took an early lead over a field of 40 sedan racing teams today following the start of the 24hour Castellet Endurance Race.

description: About 3,000 Western Union employes in the New YorkNew Jersey area have voted overwhelmingly to return to work starting at 10 P.M. today, a union official announced yesterday.

description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 11 In the Round Hill Community Church here today, Miss Edith Gaye Taylor, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William James Taylor of Armonk, N. Y., and Paget, Bermuda, was married to Thomas David Fletcher, sort of Dr. and Mrs. John C. Fletcher of Carlisle, Pa.

title: Radio Liberty Reporting To Soviet on Khrushchev
description: Starting at 9:20 A.M. yesterday, Radio Liberty began reporting to the people of the Soviet Union news of Nikita S. Khrushchev's death from its transmitters in Munich, West Germany, and the Costa Brava in Spain.

title: Bus Companies Will Seek Exemption
description: Operators of school buses that carry 116,000 children here15,000 of them handicappedagreed yesterday to run the buses tomorrow and Tuesday while Administration officials in Washington consider a request the operators will submit for an exemption from controls that would allow them to increase their charges.

title: RENT OFFICIAL FAILS TO SELL 2 BUILDINGS
description: The city's rent director for lower Manhattan, who was told almost two years ago to sell four rentcontrolled buildings he owned that were under the jurisdiction of his office, still owns two of the buildings and has an interest in a third one.

title: Hanoi Says Heavy Hoods Have Damaged Industry
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam (AP) Sept. 11Hanoi indicated today that rampaging floods had caused widespread damage to North Vietnam's industry and wiped out thousands of acres of farm lands.

title: The World
description: The Soviet Union, in recent months, has watched with concern as its Communist rival, China, accelerated a global drive for prestige and world recognition. The Russians have been particularly worried over United StatesChinese rapprochement, President Nixon's forthcoming trip to Peking and China's effort to strengthen her position throughout the world and weaken that of Moscow.

title: Mayhem on the hitchhiker circuit, necrophilia in Maine
description: Walter Sturdivant, by birth a Southerner, is a Southern Writer by choice. In The Trip Back, his first novel, he openly honors many of the conventions of the school, among them a peelback (as opposed to a flashback) technique, in which past events are revealed bit by harrowing bit, some involuted prose, some rare dialogue and the elevation of words to conceptsWas, Wait, Knowingthrough capitalization. Also, there is violence past, present and impending.

title: Hope and Planning
description: When Galileo and the other fathers of modern science began swinging their wrecker balls at the threestory universe and in the process challenging the authority of the Bible, most enlightened churchmen responded by declaring no contest. Science and religion dealt with different spheres. There was nothing that science could discover that could prove or disprove the spiritual content of the Bible and faith.

title: YANKS TRIUMPH;
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 11 Although 77,000 fewer people saw them, the Yankees displayed a more explosive attack and executed a stronger goalline stand in Cleveland Stadium today than the two New York football teams that played here last Saturday.

title: Vice Avenged
description: Gad, sir what have we here? A naughty historical novel, by Harry, of the school that used to flood the flaccid fifties. The rape of a young lady of quality, engineered by a clique of English fops and rakes, evokes sundry 18thcentury types of violenceuntil the French Revolution provides a convenient dens ex machina.

title: Curfew Lifted in Lubbock, Tex., After 2 Nights of Race Violence
description: LUBBOCK, Tex., Sept. 11City officials lifted today a dusktodawn curfew that had been imposed on this city of 150,000 people in northwestern Texas after an outbreak of racial violence last Thursday.

title: George Jackson's Soledad Book Hailed by Negro Arts Academy
description: George Jackson, the black inmate of San Quentin Prison whose violent death last month sparked a widespread controversy, has been named winner of the first nonfiction book award by the Black Academy of Arts and Letters.

title: Clothed in a Nudist Camp
description: TO THE EDITOR: There was a major discrepancy in Judy Klemesrud's informative article on the popularity of nudism, Don't Forget to Pack Your Birthday Suit'? (Travel section, Aug. 29). When she decides to go on a oneday venture into the land of the nudist [to a nudist camp in New Jersey], she is told that a female reporter need not take off her clothes. That is understandable. But when she claims that an encounter with one individual made her sick to my stomach because of the violence involved, she is demonstrating a hypocritical innocence. [Miss Klemesrud described how, after being given permission by the camp owner to take photographs of campers, who gave their approval, a youth threw a croquet mallet at her and then used the hit her camera.]

title: Letter to the Editor 4  No Title
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: REAGAN'S APPEAL DIPS IN HIS STATE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 10  Ronald Reagan's name leads the list of politicians whom California voters do not want to have running for Vice President.

title: And We Never Planted A Thing!
description: WHEN we bought a couple of summer cabins in northern Connecticut some years ago, they were almost completely smothered in second growth forest. The first thing we did was to have a few acres near the cabins (once farm and pastureland) cleared of most of the trees. Then we thought we would hire a bulldozer to clean out the remaining undergrowth so that we could have a proper lawn and garden.

title: The Rights of Americans
description: The Rights of Americans is a superb collection of 31 essays written by some of the nation's leading civil  liberties lawyers and law professors. Edited by Norman Dorsen, professor of law at New York University and general counsel of the American Civil Liberties Union, it has been published to celebrate the A.C.L.U.'s 15th anniversary. Its contributors include Thomas I. Emerson, Leonard B. Boudin, John de J. Pemberton Jr., Harry Kalven Jr., Michael E. Tigar, Edward F. Sherman, and Anthony G. Amsterdam. In plain fact, it is a serious and scholarly call to arms.

title: Colombia Expects to Lose $20.3Million on Surcharge
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Sept. 11 (AP)Colombia is to lose $20.3million from the recent economic measures ordered by President Nixon, Government officials reported today.

title: Europe's Howard Johnson
description: The Wienerwald restaurant chain, the Howard Johnson of Europe, is planning to betome one of the largest restaurant operators in this country.

title: Memphis State 300 Victor
description: MEMPHIS, Sept. 11 (UPI)Ray Jamieson scored two touchdowns tonight to lead Memphis State to a 300 Missouri Valley Conference victory over West Texas State. Memphis State's defense limited the Buffaloes to 112 yards rushing and 26 yards passing.

title: STANFORD TRIMS MISSOURI BY 190
description: COLUMBIA, Mo., Sept. 11 (UPI)Don Stance emerged as Jim Plunkett's successor today as he steered Stanford to an easy 190 victory over Missouri.

title: UTAH STATE DEFEATS KANSAS STATE, 107
description: MANHATTAN, Kan., Sept. 11 (AP) Mickey Doyle kicked a 43yard field goal midway through the fourth quarter to give Utah State a 107 victory over Kansas State today.

title: Syracuse Sophomores Star
description: SYRACUSE, Sept 11 (AP)Sophomores scored four of the eight touchdowns in Syracuse University's intrasquad scrimmage today. A split end, Gary Sweat, shagged touchdown passes of 57 and 34 yards.

title: Lake Forest College Drops Varsity Football
description: LAKE FOREST, III., Sept. 11 (AP)Lake Forest College announced today it had suspended varsity football because of an insufficient number of players.

title: Announcements 5000
An 11YearOld Minnesotan Proves Boys Will Be Girls
description: AUSTIN, Minn. (AP)Last year, a Grand Meadow, Minn., boy won a blue ribbon at the Mower County fair in the baking division. This year, he won the top prize as a seamstress.

title: Mrs. Anne von Ziegesar Wed To John S. Zinsser Jr., Editor
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Sept 11Mrs. Anne Cheney von Ziegesar was married here today to John Sharman Zinsser Jr., a senior editor of the Reader's Digest Book Club.

title: DRUG MAKERS VOW NARCOTICS ATTACK
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 (AP) Twentyeight top executives of America's major drug makers have assured Congress that they support a proposed research pool to attack narcotics abuse.

title: Dressedup for leisure
description: There is irony in the fact that while the rules governing their business attire have been relaxing, men's leisure clothes have acquired a dressup treatment. Encouraged by comfortable new knitted fabrics, it was inevitable that there would be a middle ground on which the two categories would meet. Knitted sport suits like the six shown here, while definitely weekendinclined, may well be it. The question now arises: how much of today's leisure wear will turn up as business apparel tomorrow?

title: Who's at FaultFilms or the Beaumont?
description: LET us not mourn too soon. The Board of Estimate has now given permission, and provided funds, for the City Center takeover of the Vivian Beaumont at Lincoln Center, which means that backstage space at the Beaumont proper will be reduced, the small experimental Forum Theater will be moved from its present position to the space thus freed (and maybe altered in design in the process), and three festivalstyle film houses will be incorporated into the remodeled structure.

title: Mutual Funds Face Crisis
description: The mutual fund industry, beleaguered and beset by critics on many sides, is facing a new and fundamental crisis.

title: Like a Border Between Nations
For Councilman Silverman, It's a Case of Avocation Turning Into Vocation
FORMULA 3 RACE WON BY A BRITON
description: SYDENHAM, England, Sept. 11 (AP) Roger Williamson of Britain, in a March, won the International Forward Thrust Formula 3 race at the Crystal Palace today. He took the lead two laps from the finish when a threecar pileup eliminated the three leading cars.

title: Thieu Promotes Generals to Counter Foes
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 11  President Nguyen Van Thieu has taken a number of steps to neutralize opposition by army generals and national police officials to his oneman election Oct. 3.

title: BRAVES WIN, 54; AARON SOCKS 41ST
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 11 (UPI) Hank Aaron hit his 41st home run of the season, doubled and scored the winning run on a single by Earl Williams tonight as the Atlanta Braves defeated the San Francisco Giants, 54.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: Back to work. . . . Move evergreens anytime from now until early October. They have first priority. Deciduous material can be moved very late, until the ground freezes. Fruit trees can be set out now, but many prefer to wait until spring. . . . Do not prune earlyblooming shrubs such as forsythia, fothergilla, magnolia, etc. as you will cut off the flower buds. Postpone rosebush pruning until spring,. too.... Mow the new lawn.

title: Abele Is Named Acting. Crew Coach at Columbia
description: John Abele, who coached Columbia University's varsity lightweight crew to a secondplace finish in the Eastern championships and into the quartetfinals of the Henley Royal Regatta this year, has been named the Lions acting head crew coach.

title: Mrs. Khrushchev a Familiar Figure
description: Mrs. Nina Petrovna Khrushchev was at her husband's bedside when he died, remaining close to him, as she had ever since their marriage in 1924.

title: Rain Postpones Tennis; Men's Semifinals Today
description: Rain, a familiar doubles partner of previous United States Open championships, poached into yesterday's program and washed out both men's semifinal matches at the West Side Tennis Club in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: 1858 OneRoom Suffolk School Nov a Museum
description: EAST PATCHOGUE, L. I., Sept. 11School opened here this week, but no students reported for classes at the Swan River Schoolhouse.

title: Duryea's Roots of Power
description: MONTAUK, LI., Sept. 11  The vice chairman of the East Hampton Town Republican Committee, whom some of the people out here call Junie because he was named after his late father, was entertaining a couple of visitors from the city the other day by showing them how to tell the sex of a lobster.

title: Massacre At Malmdy
description: The Battle of the Bulge again, here with the focus on Col. Jochen Peiper and his lite SS group, who were later implicated in the Malmdy massacre. Peiper, at 29 the youngest division commander in the German Army, was a hardbiten, swashbuckling soldiera sort of junior Patton. His armored division penetrated U. S. lines but was eventually cut off and decimated. The postwar trial of Peiper and his men is handled rather scantily. Whiting's description of battles, however, is superb, often correcting errors in previous histories.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: MAY I add just a brief raven's croak of disapproval to the shrill chorus of approval that has greeted the advent of Robert Altman's McCabe and Mrs. Miller?

title: The Happy Mediocrity
description: Modern American manners and morals in historical perspective. Miss Kendall writes easily and moves with agility between past and present. On food, for example, she starts with Puritan eating habits and follows through to today's fast foods (the MacDonald hamburger). She considers clothes, sex, mobile homes. leisure cities, architecture. The overall trend, she thinks, is toward standardization and atrophy of choicethe new happy mediocrity. Maybe. The writing is witty, the observations on the contemporary scene very sharp.

title: Iona in 2 Golf Tourneys
description: The Iona College golf team will compete in two championship tournaments this fall. The Gaels are entered in the Middle Eastern Collegiate Athletic Association's annual fall tournament in Albany on Oct. 8 and the next day will compete in the Eastern Collegiate Athletic Association tourney at Bethpage, L. I.

title: Cubs Down Cards, 70
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 11 (UPI) Paul Popovich hit his first career grandslam homer today following an error by Joe Torre to help the Chicago Cubs and Juan Pizarro beat the St. Louis Cardinals, 70.

title: The Gypsy Moth on the Wing
description: Man has been locked in bitter struggle with the insect ever since he scratched his first mosquito bite. And despite the increasing sophistication of his weapons, he is barely managing to hold his ground. Witness the gypsy moth.

title: Mind Over Body, Mind Over Mind
description: AT a meeting of the Biofeedback Research Society in New Orleans last November, an eminent Detroit physiologist let it be known that a patient in his clinic had conquered the symptoms of hypertension through mental processeswithout drugs. The man was not young. His treatment had been a form of education in bloodpressure control, along with behavior therapy. Though one case does not make a medical revolution, there was a crackle of excitement as the doctor spoke, for the announcement may have marked the beginning of a new treatment for a wide variety of diseases, from psychiatric complaints to stress ailments him colitis and gastric ulcers, that will rely for its efficacy on the education of the nervous system.

title: R52'S PRESS RAIDS; NO MAJOR FIGHTING
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 11 (AP)The tide of war receded in South Vietnam today, with only minor fighting reported. The heaviest activity once again involved renewed raids by B52 bombers below the demilitarized zone.

title: Central Connecticut Eleven Sets Back Springfield, 210
description: NEW BRITAIN, Conn., Sept. 11 (AP)Central Connecticut opened its football schedule with a 210 victory over Springfield today. The Blue Devils scored after taking the opening kickoff and marching 67 yards in eight plays with Bill Tinlin plunging over from the 2yard line.

title: U. S. Steps Likely
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 The Nixon Administration is likely to seek a Federal district court order requiring the state to show why it should not be required to release funds to Jackson schools, a Justice Department source said today.

title: Male Chauvinist Spock Recants
OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 For months President Nixon had been urging his countrymen to moderate their criticism of the country's flaws by matching the harsh word with a pat on the national back. As we correct what is wrong in this nation, let us always speak up for what is right about America, he had been urging everyone, including the Congress.

title: World Scientists Term Nuclear Energy Clean
description: GENEVA, Sept. 11 Leading nuclear scientists agreed yesterday that nucleargenerated power was clean, safe and necessary but that the people of the world needed to be convinced.

title: Many Californians Leaving as Glamour Wanes
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 11 Thirteen years ago, Ardis Evans came to California when her father was transferred here from Minneapolis. In time she got married and had three children. Her husband's dental laboratory thrived and they bought a fourbedroom house in the suburbs.

title: There's a small palazzo by a Grand Canal
description: In her renovation of an ancient palazzo facing the Grand Canal in Venice, designer Carla Venosta has effectively spanned the centuries. The first floor of the building, which is situated between the Rialto and Accademia bridges, dates from the 14th century. Sometime in the 1600's upper floors were added and the building enlarged to house branch of the illustrious Dandola family, which had produced four Doges of Venice. Evidences of the ancient splendor survived in the grand hall, the arched windows, and ancient terrazzo floors. The present owners, Baron and Baroness Mico Parisi were anxious to preserve as much as possible of the original palazzo. Despite the use of modem art and furnishings, punctuated with an occasional dramatic antique, the mood is one of grandeur befitting the building's history.

title: Train Collision in Spain Kills at Least 10 Persons
description: CORDOBA, Spain, Sept. 11 (AP)  A speeding express train ran into the rear of a slow freight 40 miles northeast of here today, killing at least 10 persons and injuring more than 50.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: LONDON, Sept. 11Prime Minister Heath was reported to be delighted with the news and to be pressing for the meeting to take place as early as possible, preferably before the House of Commons is recalled from vacation for an emergency debate on Ulster on Sept. 22 and 23.

title: Wall St. Watches and Hopes, as Bache Offers Shares
description: Bache & Co., the nation's secondlargest brokerage house, will go public very shortly and virtually everybody in the securities industry will be watching closely and rooting for the firm.

title: Sterilization Scored
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 11  Regulations requiring unwed mothers on welfare to undergo sterilization, and legalized abortions except for health reasons were condemned by delegates to the National Baptist Convention, which, has been meeting here this week.

title: O'Brien Says a Black Could Be Nominated
description: MIAMI BEACH, Sept. 11 (Reuters)  The Democratic National Chairman, Lawrence F. O'Brien, said today that he believed his party had reached the stage where a black would be welcome on the national ticket.

title: A POINT MISSED?
description: Movie Mailbag:

title: RULING IS SOUGHT ON INDIAN LANDS
description: SANTA FE, N. M., Sept. 11 New Mexico has asked the Federal Courts to determine whether it has the right to tax and control the growth of residential subdivisions on Indian land.

title: Ginsberg Play Gets Academy Booking
description: The Brooklyn Academy of Music will have an international theater and dance festival this season with the American premiere of a play by Jean Genet, Allen Ginsberg's playwrighting debut, and the first American appearances of dance companies from Cambodia, Senegal, Morocco and Iran.

title: Miss Geddes Has Nuptials
description: LONDON, Sept. 11 Douglas Blair Turnbaugh, a descendant of President James K. Polk, was married today to Miss Lindsay Geddes in the country town of Market Harborough, Leicestershire.

title: Swaparamas a New Sunday Pastime for L.I. Bargain Hunters
description: WESTBURY, L.I.Just a few days before, Mrs. Marilyn Brown of Roslyn had bought an old German stein for $250. But in the sprawling parking lot of the Westbury DriveIn, she shouted to her husband: Warren! Look at this mug. Would you believeit cost me a quarter.

title: CLINTON SHEPPERD
description: WHITE PLAINS, Sept. 11 Clinton Shepperd, who retired as administrative assistant to the president of the Nestl Company in June, died today in White Plains Hospital. He was 65 years old and lived at 15 Oakwood Avenue.

title: Deborah Rinehart, Student, Married
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Sept. 11Miss Deborah Doran Rinehart and Michael Frederick Chmaj were married here this afternoon at the St. Luke Roman Catholic Chapel. The Rev. Cornelius Looney officiated.

title: FASCINATING
description: To THE EDITOR: As one who spent several fascinating days viewing Thomas Wilfred: Lumia when it was at the Corcoran Gallery this past spring, I hope readers will not be put 6ft from seeing the scaleddown version now at the Museum of Modern Art by the peculiar reaction to it expressed by John Canaday. He felt as if the sound track had gone dead and that lumia's fatal weakness was the absence of sound accompaniment. He was impressed with the science, but wondered whether the end result was worth it.

title: A GREEK TOUR
description: To THE EDITOR: I enjoyed William H. Honan's article on Greece, Contemplations Upon Fallen Marble (Travel section, Aug. 29). However, I hasten to defend the island cruising out of Piraeus. We visited Poros, Hydra and Aegina on the.MN Meltemi II and found the vessel immaculate in every way. The Romantica, which the author described as an old tub, is not typical.

title: Gardiner Fights Move To Make Island Public
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 Representative Otis G. Pike didn't find much swordfish as he bobbed about in his boat off Long Island during the Congressional recess but he may have hooked a potential issue  Gardiners Island.

title: THE NUCLEAR FAMILY REVISITED
description: A friend of mine recently told me of a conversation she had had with her parents when she was 16. The family had just watched the movie Born Free on television. My friend explained to her parents how she identified with the lion. The owners, although they loved their pet, were depriving it of the independence it needed to survive. Their unselfish love for the animal enabled them to willingly give the lion its freedom. My friend was not demanding that her parents give her total freedom. Instead, she wanted them to acknowledge her growing need for independence.

title: Riggins to Start in Snell's Place
description: John Riggins, the big rookie running back from Kansas, looms as a starter for the New York Jets in their National Football League season opener next Sunday against the Colts at Baltimore. Riggins will replace the ailing Matt Snell.

title: An Open Letter to the I.M.F. and Group of 10
description: By cutting the dollar loose from gold convertibility in midAugust, the President has moved forward by at least a decade the timetable that many members of the International Monetary Fund had implicitly been following toward this fundamental change in the structure of the international monetary system.

title: Criminals At Large
description: What would we do without the Russians? Newspapers would probably fold for lack of copy. The C.I.A. would go out of business. Bill Buckley would become a professor of polemics at Harvard. Spy novels, which by now have approached the status of a minor but thriving industry, would instantly dry up. So bless the Russians.

title: Sports of The Times
description: A year out of Cornell, Ned Harkness sits atop the Detroit Red Wings, a lastplace club preparing a National Hockey League comeback in training camp. The Harkness story is one of the strangest of a sports year filled with confrontation, psychiatrists, and lawyers.

title: MISSISSIPPI CHIEF CUTS SCHOOL AID
description: JACKSON, Miss., Sept. 11 Gov. John Bell Williams of Mississippi challenged a Federal courtordered busing plan today and issued an Executive order cutting off all state funds to the Jackson city schools.

title: Catmousam Road Wins
description: SALEM, N.H., Sept. 11 (AP) Peter Fuller's Catmousam Road moved to the front at the top of the stretch and charged to a twolength victory in the $11,075 Granite State Stakes before a crowd of 12,944 today at Rockingham Park.

title: An Old Seadog's Tips On the Art Of the Cruise
New York
description: Welfare reform is dead. These were the words of Congressman Herman Badillo last week as the New York City Democrat, long in the front ranks of those battling for increased welfare benefits, surveyed the battlefield. In the country at large, and most specifically in New York, evidence was rapidly mounting that a critical turning point had been reached in the fortunes of the welfare movement.

title: U.S. Women Set 2 Swim Records
RESENTMENT RIFE IN ATTICA HOMES
description: ATTICA, N. Y., Sept. 11  Richard W. Miller is the Mayor of this quiet upstate village, and he is a guard at the prison where so many of his friends and relatives were still being helt hostage today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: If the purpose of the Urban Development Corporation is to transform our urban core areas into decent places in which to live and work I fear that we are only in for a massive boondoggle that will make the farce of the World Trade Center look like the wisest move of the century,

title: The Common Market Is Torn by dollar Crisis
description: PARISThe European Common Market's fragile unity, periodically fractured and then patched up over two decades of turbulent history, faces perhaps its greatest threat as a result of the dollar crisis.

title: Ibis Thriving in Jamaica Bay
description: The glossy ibis, a onetime rarity from the tropics and subtropics, has been finding a home awayfromhome in the Jamaica Bay Wildlife Sanctuary  relatively safe from man and his gun, realestate development and pollution.

title: Job Scramble Is Under Way in Federal Public Service Program
description: WASHINGTON Sept. 11In Milwaukee a few days ago, a group of unemployed laborers who had been turned down for jobs under the new Federal Public Service Employment Act decided to stage a public protest.

title: Psss! I Have Bootlegged Norma for Only . . .
description: IT used to be that anyone who craved a complete recording of Goldmark's Knigin von Saba, Weber's Euryanthe or Respighi's Belfagor would have to go hungry. Thanks to a phenomenon known as pirated, private, unauthorized or underground recordings (the terminology changes according to the whim, pride or ire of the person referring to them), this is no longer true.

title: Movie Mailbag:
description: To THE EDITOR: Congratulations and thanks on Ellen Holly's fine piece on racist practices of the film industry, For Me, the Most Wildly Romantic Figure.

title: The Last Word: Wild Men
description: We must have been a bizarre sight, a Heyerdahlian prehistoric monstercraft, three pontoon rafts lashed together, surmounted by a mound of scruffy people and their duffle in the shade of a makeshift canopy as we lumbered down the Colorado River out of the Grand Canyon into the heat and crystalline deadness of Lake Mead. We had a whole day of this artificial sea in which to claim some meaning for the incredible 10 days past, literally out of this world, before stumbling into the plastic of Las Vegas and points home. I had taken with me copy of Desert Solitaire, by Edward Abbey, a journal that describes wilderness in a leathery sculptured style as threedimensionaland as pricklyas a cactus. Annoyed by a passage in a bitter, even sarcastic tone, I turned to a chapter titled Havasu.

title: Janice Sawyer Bride of James Hanlon
description: MADISON, N.J., Sept. 11 Miss Janice Lunn Sawyer and James Arthur Hanlon were married here this morning in Grace Episcopal Church by the Rev. William Nieman and the Rev. John Corr of New Vernon.

title: ILLITERACY FIGHT LACKS MOMENTUM
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11In October, 1969, the Office of Education made improved reading skills of the nation's morethan20million functionally illiterate children and adults one of its eight top priorities. But to date there has been more talk than action.

title: Sly and the Family Stone Plays To a SellOut Crowd at Garden
description: How does the old story go? When your girl friend's late, you flatter her by explaining that one waits 15 minutes for an ordinary date, a halfhour for a beauty queen and, ah, 45 minutes for a goddess. Well, using that as a point of reference, Sly and the Family Stone after keeping a sellout audience waiting happily for nearly an hour at Madison Square Garden Friday nightmust be developing a pretty Olympian view of themselves.

title: For Roche of G.M. Happiness is a 10% Surcharge
Helwig and Miss Aulisi Win Jersey ProWoman Golf Title
description: BLOOMFIELD, N. J., Sept. 11Russ Helwig of Green Brook, a professional just two years, and 16yearold Janet Aulisi of The Knoll won the 24th New Jersey prowoman championship at the Forest Hill Field Club today.

title: DOUBLE DELTA WINS BELDAME, WITH SHUVEE SECOND
description: Double Delta was able to make a lead in the stretch hold up long enough to beat Shuvee in the $82,850 Beldame at Belmont Park yesterday.

title: Blue Bulbs for Spring
description: BLUE flowers in the spring garden are a promise of summer skies. Plant some of them in September for a cool contrast to the predominance of yellows and pinks.

title: Westchester Lists 120 Breeds Among Its 2,673 Entries Today
description: Westchester, staging its 54th annual fixture at Croton Point Park, CrotononHudson today, affords an opportunity to see breeds not frequently on the circuit.

title: My Lives
description: Et Al.

title: Two Democrats Are in Contest for Manhattan Surrogacy, Only Countywide Race in Tuesday's Primary
description: When urged to vote for Family Court Judge Millard L. Midonick for the Democratic nomination for Manhattan surrogate in next Tuesday's primary the woman in a radio commercial asks, Judge who?

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: In his tongueinchic essay (it is most certainly not a review) on the role of women in art, Peter Schjeldahl has proved himself nearly as inept in art and literary criticism as the Brooklyn Museum has at mounting a feasibly worthwhile exhibition. It is obvious that the museum has failed in its low intentions, and only more apparent that he has failed to discern why.

title: He Meets the Enemy and They're His
description: CHATHAM, Mass.Dwight Macduff, a retired advertising executive who switched from a hilltop house in Peekskill, N.Y., to a shorefront home in Chatham Port without a fight, has become a natural enemy of bluefish.Macduff seemed optimistic as he loaded gear onto his sterndrive Chavela, a Bertram sport fisherman, at the Ryder's Cove marina operated by Jack Summers. But the size of the fish box, which required two men to put it aboard, made him appear absolutely ebullient.

title: F.D.A. Asks Reduced Use Of a Popular Food Coloring
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 (UPI) The Food and Drug Administration has suggested reduced use of one food coloring and has ordered animal tests with others because of a Soviet study indicating reproduction problems.

title: What's At the Movies?
description: SEE NO EVIL, a suspense movie directed by Richard Fleischer, stars Mia Farrow as a blind girl trying to escape a wouldbe murderer. For perhaps 30 minutes out of a total hour and a half, See No Evil has its share of thrills,. says Roger Greenspun. Cheap thrills, to be sure, but thrills nonetheless and everything in the rest of the movie encourages us to value small favors. Attempting on the one hand to mean something and on the other hand trying to crank up the terror, Fleischer keeps suggesting confrontations between the rich and the poor, the old and the young, families with daughters to protect and men with warped desires. See No Evil is better with its mindless terror than with its witless meaning., And although everything becomes far too much long before it is over, the movie is generally at its most ridiculous precisely where it hopes to makes sense. What interest the film does have comes from the performance of Miss Farrow, who plays her blind patrician with exactly the right small depth of pathos and vulnerability. At the Music

title: THE GALBRAITHKUHTHUROW PLAN
description: To THE EDITOR: I was delighted with Professor Galbraith's suggestions for forcing a balanced ticket on the American corporations (The Galbraith. Plan to Promote the Minorities, by John Kenneth Galbraith, Edwin Kuh and Lester C. Thurow, Aug. 22). Since no one can be expected to address himself to every problem at once, I assume that in the near future Professor Galbraith will turn his attention to another and similar problem which bodes ill for the future of the Republicthe absence of certain ethnic and religious groups from the faculties of lite American universities. This absence is no doubt in part responsible for the tension between ethnics and the university world, a tension which will grow worse unless something is done to eliminate the virtual monopoly that WASP's and Jews have on senior professorial positions in America's best universities. If white males have no right to hold all the important positions in large corporations, then WASP's and Jews have no right to hold all the full professorships in the great universities.

title: NEW YORK REVISITED
description: To THE EDITOR: Recently, we went back to New York City on vacation from the West Coast and gathered a few impressions. New York is as kinesthetic as ever. You wonder how the people can keep their serenity amid this crowding and staccato, but they do somehow. They are a durable bunch and very proud. They deserve a better break than they are getting from their administrators.

title: Orioles Game Postponed
description: BALTIMORE, Sept 11 (UPI) Tonight's scheduled contest between the Washington Senators and the Baltimore Orioles was postponed because of wet grounds.

title: I Have Met Him
description: This short autobiographical volume from France is one of great importance at many different levels, religious, psychological, sociological, historical and even political. The style is as elegant as it is terse. Andr Frossard tells us that the most formative influence on his youth, after the works of Homer, was the writing of Voltaire. It is a pity that the title denies in some measure the clarity and Gallic lucidity of the content.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Meeting Energy Deeds

title: The Grand Old Lady of Eastern Parkway
description: My love affair with the Brooklyn Museum did not begin at first sight. Nor, in this case, has love been blind. The attractions of this extraordinary institution have grown steadily over many years, as much because of the plucky fight it has had to keep up with drastic changes as because of any success it has had in remaining beautiful at the same time.

title: Bus Terminal Extension Is Seen Easing Traffic
description: The Port of New York Authority is hopeful that two of the city's more annoying traffic problems will be solved when the extension of the authority's bus terminal at Eighth Avenue between 40th and 41st Streets is completed.

title: Boulez Returns Parsifal to Its Pristine State
Renne Jarrett, John Stauffer Are Wed Here
description: Miss Renne Gail Jarrett, who appeared as a child actress on Broadway and played the title role in Nancy, a television series last year, was married here yesterday to John Rothery Stauffer, an actor appearing on the TV program All My Children.

title: Inflation Hits Bettors; They Have Less to Lose
description: WESTBURY, L.I.,  Inflation has hit the race tracks.

title: Movie Mythographer
description: To the Editor: May I commend Leo Braudy for his fine essay on Parker Tyler and his books (Movie Mythographer)?...

title: Class of '67: Where Are They?
description: In a funny way it's like starting a new agency, said George Lois, the unchainnanlike chairman of Lois Holland Callaway, as he recently welcomed four major creative talents from Young & Rubicam into his shop.

title: Bridge Players to Aid Neediest Cases Fund
description: A special charity tournament scheduled for tonight will give bridge players in the metropolitan area an early opportunity to contribute to the New York Times Fund for the Neediest.

title: Eaton Expresses Regret
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 11 (AP) Cyrus S. Eaton, the industrialist who has maintained contact with Communist nations for many years, expressed regret today at the death of Mr. Khrushchev.

title: Home Improvement
description: ANEW allsynthetic shag carpet is now available that is specifically designed for simple, doityourself installation  and that can be used in any room in the house, including bathrooms, 1 asemente and other areas where dampness might cause a problem with conventional carpeting. Made of continuous filament nylon fiber, the carpet has a builtin pad of foamed latex on the back side, thus eliminating the need for a separate pad. In addition, the carpet has a primary backing (the surface that is seen when the tufts are spread apart) of woven polypropoylene so that, combined with the foamed latex underside, the carpet will not shrink or mildew in damp locations, and it can be shampooed repeatedly without the seams separating or edges curling.

title: Tickets for Ali Bout on Sale
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Sept. 11 (UPI)  Tickets went on sale today for Muhammad Ali's next fighta 10round match against Alberto Lovele, an Argentine heavyweight, which will take place next Friday.

title: All the habitats were queerily still and locked
description: Fred Gordon's autobiography is not paginated, which is why I haven't given the number of pages above. There are other eccentricities in the book's design that Fred Gordon has made, according to a list of credits on the last page. For example, the jacket copy is printed on the underside of the cover rather than the flaps, which are taken up by a full lengthwise photo portrait of the author from the tips of his extended left hand fingers to the tips of his rickety toes, a portrait that takes up the whole cover. None of these oddities contributes to the book particularly, nor do they add up together to any single idea, good or bad, but separately they compete to define a book that refuses an easy image.

title: Atlantic Brief Lives
description: Intended to inform us in referencebook fashion about leading figures in the arts and to illuminate and delight through additional appreciative essays by gifted writers, this large volume turns out to be a hitandmiss affair. The criterion of choice of subjects seems to be editor Kronenberger's enthusiasms, with no underlying system of period, place or school. The data provided can be found in numerous other reference works. The selected essays are disappointing: a few brilliant, most slight.

title: 4 Southeast Asian Nations Are Reported Exempt From Nixon's Order to Cut Foreign Aid by 10%
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 South Vietnam and three other Southeast Asian countries are being quietly exempted from the 10 per cent cut in foreign economic aid ordered by President Nixon last month, authoritative Administration officials said today.

title: Petty Earns No 13 Spot For Capitol City 500 Race
description: RICHMOND, Va., Sept. 11 (AP) The final 20 positions for the $25,400 Capitol City 500 stock car race tomorrow were filled today with the defending champion, Richard Petty, qualifying 13th.

title: Feeding Meat To the Lions
description: WASHINGTON  President Nixon's New Economic Policy on trade and the dollar have done little to assuage the new protectionist sentiments in the American tradeunion movement.

title: Martin Report
description: The report by William McChesney Martin Jr. about reorganization of the stock trade impressed me by the effort of Mr. Martin to improve the present situation, especially to the benefit of the benefit of the small investor.

title: Housing the Elderly
description: I am a senior citizen, past 80, and would like to make my opinion on singleroom occupancy known [SingleRoom Occupancy Dwindling, Aug. 29].

title: Letter to the Editor 7  No Title
description: To the Editor: Edwards's review is a personal and political attack on a writer whose blackest sin (aside from being widely read) is apparently not being with it. Or, as Edwards puts it, serious about life and art as they are now.

title: Mae Cavanagh Is Wed To William H.Siegel 3d
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Sept. 11 Miss Mae Angela Cavanagh, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Francis Cavanagh Jr. of New York and Glen Cove, was married here today to William Henry Siegel 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Siegel Jr. of Millbrook, N. Y.

title: Tokyo Is Combating Pockets of OxygenDeficient Air
description: TOKYO, Sept. 11Most of the world's cities are polluting the air by putting things into it. Tokyo, long a leader in this category, has discovered that it can create equally perilous air by taking things out of itspecifically oxygen atoms.

title: U. S. OFFICIAL CITES NEED FOR MINERALS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 11 (UPI)The United States, with 6 per cent of the world's people, uses one third of the world's minerals, and is running out of some of them, a high Interior Department official said this week.

title: Pollution Suit Settled
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 11 (UPI)Mrs. Amanda Ramos, who said in a lawsuit that air pollution was so bad in her neighborhood that it made her six children mentally ill and damaged the kidneys of three of them, said this week that she had settled out of court for $175,000. Mrs. Ramos had filed the suit against Lead Products Company, Inc., asking $5.29million from the effects of lead poisoning. All of her children, ranging in age from 10 to 15, are mentally retarded.

title: Dance
description: ALMOST every dance company in the world has a reason; indeed most of them even have a function. But there is one major company whose whole purpose and artistic definition seems lost in the vagueness of one of those London fogs that even London doesn't have any more. The company is London Festival Ballet. It has just survived for 21 years, and although it has not been seen in the United States since 1955, it nevertheless has a very respectable European reputation.

title: Religion
Gardening Courses Offered Adults at Queens College
description: Courses in bonsai, the Japanese art of dwarfing trees, and the growing of plants indoors and outdoors will be offered this fall in the Queens College adult education program.

title: City Committee Urges Fireproof Furnishings for Off ice Building
description: Fire officials and others intent on preventing the hardtofight fires in new highrise office buildings yesterday issued recommendations for fire safety, emphasizing the use of proper furnishings.

title: Digitalis Tablets Recalled On Drug Agency's Orders
description: DETROIT, Sept. 11 (AP) ParkeDavis & Co. is recalling 106,000 digitalis tablets on orders of the Food and Drug Administration although the drug company says its scientific tests show no consumer health hazard.

title: In Brooklyn, Fraternities of Faith
description: Visitors in the fifthfloor walkup apartment of Angel Reyes stood and embraced each other in a kiss of peace the other night after singing Gloria, gloria aleluya with a gusto that prompted 4yearold Luicito Reyes to march quickly back and forth in the center of the room.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: President Nixon's daring turn to a 90day wage and price freeze shows a a recognition that what we have is not a demandpull inflation due to too much total spending in the economy but a costpush inflation due to an established expectation of rising prices. Labor protects itself by raising wages, business raises prices to cover the costs, and Government is forced to bring about minimal increases in spending in order to avoid intolerable unemployment.

title: Engagement Terminated
description: Mr. and Mrs. William Farnum Sanford of Greenwich, Conn., have announced that the engagement of Mrs. Sanford's daughter, Miss Ann Hollingsworth Wheeler, to Paul Henry Harwood 3d, son of Dr. and Mrs. Harwood Jr. of Fairfield, Conn., has been terminated by mutual consent.

title: ...and Lag Can Be Costly
description: The impact of delay on housing costs during an inflationary period was illustrated dramatically last week when it was announced that 90 apartments remain unsold in the East Midtown Plaza development in Manhattan.

title: The Paper Chase
description: Writing a novel about Harvard Law School while attending Harvard Law School puts Mr. Osborn in a category with Dr. Johnson's lady preacher; the astonishing thing is that he was able to do it at all. Judging from the experiences of his protagonist, a senior student from the Midwest named Hart, there is more than enough homework to keep a fellow busy.

title: U.S. and Japan: The Trouble Was Not Just a Matter of Translation
Veterans of World War I Elect National Officials
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 11 (AP)J. B. Kock of Norman, Okla., has been elected national commander of the Veterans of World War I.

title: MUCKRAKERS SET TARGETS IN JERSEY
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Sept. 11 Some of New Jersey's more dramatic problems eventually come to the surface in a thirdfloor walkup across the street from Princeton University.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: Bernard Denenberg, the art dealer, has purchased the fivestory limestone house at 1020 Madison Avenue for about $750,000.

title: Michigan Topples Northwestern, 216, Getting Touchdown on FieldGoal Try
description: EVANSTON, Ill., Sept. 11 (UPI)  A futile field goal try turned into a freakish touchdown for Michigan today as the fifthranked Wolverines swept over the Northwestern Wildcats, 216.

title: S. CAROLINA TOPS GA.. TECH1 24 TO 7
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Sept. 11 (UPI) South Carolina's quick defense took advantage of numerous Georgia Tech errors tonight and scored with a punt return, two safeties and a blocked punt and triumphed, 247. It was South Carolina's first game as an independent team.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 11 (AP)  Tulane choked off a Texas Tech drive in the final seconds and preserved a 159 victory tonight.

title: Cornell Ties Massachusetts In Preseason Game, 2727
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Sept. 11 (AP) Cornell Uinversity and the University of Massachusetts fought to a 2727 tie today in a preseason exhibition football game at Cornell's stadium.

title: BETTER BEE HIP WINS BY A HEAI
description: STANTON, Del., Sept. 11 (AP) Dillon G. Smith's Better Bee Hip, longest shot in the sixhorse field, took the Mambo Dancer Purse at Delaware Park today by a head over Parasol Pete.

title: Thresholds
description: In the camera lens of the years, Dorothea Straus writes, memory makes fixed pictures, not necessarily true, but more endurable than fact. This volume of reminiscences about her GermanJewish forebears  who emigrated to Brooklyn in 1848, to found the Rheingold Beer fortune  might best be compared to a family album. As in any album, the pictures are uneven in quality. Some are overexposed, with adjectives and adverbs heaped up. Not all are ovenfresh, and images don't always come quite clear. But there are also many that delight the eye and jog the memory of one's own family past.

title: The Monthly Agenda
description: LAWN and Flower Field Day for Nassau County will be held Saturday at Eisenhower Park, East Meadow, N.Y. Rain or shine, homeowners will be able to see displays on lawn care, weed identification, air pollution effect studies and flower variety trial beds. Hours will be from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. Lawn samples, one foot square, for examination may be brought to the question and answer booth. Visitors will find the Turf Research area just behind the Park's Administration Building near the Hempstead Turnpike entrance. Park in lots near the Administration Building or behind the Maintenance Building. The field day is sponsored by the Nassau County Cooperative Extension Association, Cornell University and the Department of Parks and Recreation.

title: Peterson Tops Time Trials For European Auto Race
description: VIENNA, Sept. 11 (AP) Ronnie Peterson of Sweden achieved the fastest trial time today for the eighth European Formula Two Trophy car race at the TulinLangenlebarn airport course and established an unofficial lap record.

title: PENNSYLVANIA BACKS COLLEGETOWN VOTE
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Sept. 11 (AP)  Attorney General J. Shane Creamer has ruled that college students may vote in the locality where they attend school.

title: Unfinished Symphonies
description: The author, alive and in touch with the afterworld, first saw Liszt when she was 7. Today Liszt is the organizer and leader of a group of famous composers who visit me at home and give me their new compositions. There are twelve at present in the groupLiszt, Chopin, Schubert, Beethoven, Bach, Brahms, Schumann, Debussy, Grieg, Berlioz, Rachmaninov and Monteverdi. Albert Schweitzer and Mozart appear briefly and give me a little music and then don't seem to return. Looney Tunes.

title: PRESIDENT URGED TO BACK BUSING
Mind Control: Can a Pill Be Mightier Than the Sword?
description: When psychologist Kenneth B. Clark proposed to his colleagues last week that scientists be mobilized to develop a peace pill that all powercontrolling leaders would be required to take, there were many outside his field who scoffed. They called the idea politically unrealistic and technically impossible.

title: Foam on the Crime Wave
description: Attorney General Mitchell has found a politically satisfactory solution to the crime wave. His Justice Department began fifteen months ago to edit the Federal Bureau of Investigation's quarterly reports on crime statistics to make them sound less frightening.

title: Halfway Between Dropping Out and Dropping In
The Battle of the L.I. Sound Bridge
description: BAYVILLE, L.I., Sept. 11Six years ago, when Robert Moses described his proposed bridge from here across Long Island Sound to Westchester County, he made it seem like a pearl necklace by moonlight.

title: The Black Panthers Of Israel
description: THE young, darkskinned demonstrator, wearing sneakers and bellbottomed jeans, shook his fist at a row of policemen guarding an entrance to the Jerusalem Town Hall. The policemen, most of them darkskinned as well, all of them mailed and shielded like a bunch of medieval knights and visibly embarrassed by a duty not very common in Israel until now, perspired uneasily in the sun.

title: TEACHERS BRIEFED FOR SCHOOL START
description: Orientation sessions held during the week for grade school teachers who will go to classes tomorrow on the first day of school showed that many of them are confused, some are enthusiastic and others feel that the system needs a complete reevaluation to straighten it out.

title: West Va. Routs Boston College, 4514
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Sept. 11 (UPI)  Pete Wood gained 214 yards in 24 carries and scored two touchdowns today in leading West Virginia to a 4514 opening football victory over Boston College.

title: Coast Guard 216 Victor On Howard Scoring Aerials
JERSEY RACE WON BY AMAZING MAN
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Sept. 11 (AP)Aisco Stable's Amazing Man scored a neck victory over Maribel Blum's Hold Your Peace in the 26th running of the $28,725 World's Playground Stakes at Atlantic City today.

title: AntiSemitism Without Jews
description: To the Editor: In connection with Vladimir Dedijer's comments on AntiSemitism Without Jews: Communist Eastern Europe, I would like to put the record straight. He creates a totally wrong impression of what my book attempts to offer: a dispassionate study of a complex subjectpolitical antiSemitism in countries that claim to be socialist.

title: New York
description: ATTICA, N. Y. A world unto itself, the prison rises among the green hills of northern New York state22 buildings set on a 55acre site . . . a school, a chapel, a metalworking shop . . . a population of 2,254 men governed by 396 correction officers . . . the whole surrounded by 30foothigh, 6footthick concrete walls.

title: Sheila Burke Is Betrothed
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Sept. 11 Mr. and Mrs. Mack Burke of La Jolla, formerly of New York, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sheila Anne Burke, to Clive Gordon Page of Colchester, Essex, England.

title: The Politics of Mexican Development By Roger D. Hansen. 267 pp. Baltimore: The Johns Hopkins Press. $11. The Theory of Moral Incentives in Cuba Robert M. Bernardo. 159 pp. University: The University of Alabama Press. $7.50.
description: No two countries in Spanish Axnerica represent policies of economic development more opposed in style and objectives than Cuba and Mexico. Fidel Castro speaks for a puritan socialism practiced only by the Chinese, while Mexico's Luis Echeverria heads a Gilded Age society. Ironically, the two countries, with perhaps the exception of Bolivia, are the only former Spanish colonies to boast of social revolutions.

title: What's Become Of Screwloose?
description: This latest collection of Ron Goulart's servomechanistic horror stories deals mainly with the world that Norbert Wiener made. The author's characters fight a rearguard action against homicidal household appliances, android schoolteachers, and in one instancea fully automated, talking and libidinous house. My favorite is a gem entitled Into the Shop, which tells what happens when law enforcement is automated. (With the lLawmobile on patrol, justice is truly blind.) Mr. Goulart oils each mechanical debacle with strategically placed drops of wit.

title: Report Says GATT Members Are Entitled to Take Counteractions Against the U.S. Surcharge on Imports
description: GENEVA, Sept. 11A report stating that members of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade are entitled to take counteraction against the United States surcharge on imports was submitted today to the GATT Council.

title: Alabama Upsets U.S.C., 1710; 3 Late Drives by Trojans Halted
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 11Bear Bryant's 200th football coaching victory was one of his sweetest. His Alabama team upset favored Southern California last night, 1710, to avenge a rankling 1970 defeat by the Trojans.

title: REV. FELIX HACKETT
description: The Rev. Felix Hackett, a member of the Congregation of the Passion and for the last 15 months retreat preacher at the Cardinal Spellman Retreat Center in Riverdale, the Bronx, died Friday in St. Vincent's Hospital. His age was 69.

title: Fordham Football Tickets To Go on Sale Tomorrow
description: Season and individual game tickets for Fordham's fivegame home football schedule this fall will go on sale tomorrow morning at the Rose Hill campus.

title: Soviet Envoy Transferred
description: BERLIN, Sept. 11 (AP) Pyotr Abrasimov, Soviet Ambassador to East Germany, will leave his East Berlin post, the East German press agency A.D.N. announced. There have been reports Abrasimov will be named Soviet Ambassador to France.

title: Spell It Out for N.D.S.
description: Mailbox:

title: MOTOR RACING
description: To THE EDITOR: The otherwise enjoyable article on motor racing at Lime Rock in Connecticut by Grace Lichtenstein (Travel section, July 18) was marred by a couple of factual errors possibly denigratory to other roadracing facilities in this part of the country. The article said that Bridgehampton Race Circuit is flat (it's actually hillier than Lime Rock, with overall track elevation differences of about 100 feet) and ugly (not if you enjoy eastern Long Island's sand dunes, scrub pine woods, meadowlarks bobwhites, and views of sailboats on Noyack Bay). It also implied that Lime Rock is unique in running short races with an interesting variety of cars. All roadracing circuits (as opposed to oval tracks) book as many of this kind of event as they can to help fill out their calendars between professional races. Not only the Sports Car Club of America but also the Eastern Motor Racing Association put, on many such racing days every year. The E.M.R.A., in fact, has stopped using Lime Rock because of oppressive local ordinances requiring mufflers on racecars in most nonprofessional events there. You can still get the sounds along with the sights, however, by taking in E.M.R.A. racing at Bridgehampton or at the new Pocono International Raceway in Long Pond, Pa.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: PETER SCHJELDAHL'S Still a Man's World for this Woman Artist surprised me because my own experience has been so different. I have known many women who take their art seriously and many whose art Is up to the level of that done by men. Some are reluctant to exhibit their work and enter into competition, perhaps because, whether or not it, has been put to them openly, they may feel their work will not be taken seriously.

title: Nassau Probation Agency Seeks Relief
description: MINEOLA, L.I.,  An increase in crime, a new criminal procedure law, the addition of judges to the Family and County Courts and the empaneling of a second grand jury have added pressures this year to the already overburdened Nassau County Probation Department.

title: Southampton Zoning Furor
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Sept. 11A comprehensive and controversial proposed zoning ordinance of the Town of Southampton  implementing that town's master plan for development  will be rewritten as a result of a stormy three  hour public hearing this week.

title: TO THE EDITOR:
description: Perhaps the explanation for Mrs. Roiphe's writing such an article can be found in the photograph of her family accompanying the piece. Though this is her story, the picture clearly places her husband in the center as the focal point and the dominant person. Is Mrs. Roiphe unconsciously defending maledominated family units when she writes about the nuclear family?

title: Cowboys Beat Chiefs, 2417
description: DALLAS, Sept. 11 (AP)  Gloster Richardson, a former Kansas City Chief, hauled in a 70yard touchdown pass from Craig Morton tonight with four minutes left in the game to give the Dallas Cowboys a 2417 victory over their former crosstown rivals and an unbeaten exhibition record.

title: A Major in Vietnam Gives All He's Got to the War on Heroin
description: CAMP CRESCENZ, South Vietnam, Sept. 4 Maj. John O'Brien, a 41yearold career officer in the infantry, came to this compound two months ago and found an unexpected enemy.

description: LONDON, Sept. 11 (Reuters)English cricket will go pop next Saturday to retain solvency.

title: Bells That Don't Ring
description: CAMPANULAS (little bells) are the most delightful and useful of the hardy perennial bellflowers. In height, the plants vary from tufted mounds, four inches high to sixfoot spires. Some species form mats two inches thick.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Businessmen who may have been grumbling about inefficiences of state governments have been recruited and pressed into service to attack these problems in a number of states in recent years.

title: Pitt Uusets U.C.L.A., 2925
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 11 (UPI) Dave Havern drove Pittsburgh to a fourthperiod touchdown tonight for an upset 2925 victory over the University of California, Los Angeles in the opening game for both teams.

title: Sewall Trophy Sail Halted By Lack of Wind on Sound
description: NIANTIC, Conn., Sept. 11The first race in the annual Atlantic Class interclub regatta for the Sewall Memorial Trophy was halted off Niantic Bay Yatch Club today when a light southeasterly wind subsided. No boat was able to complete the 10mile race on Long Island Sound within the time limit.

title: Tortilla Priest Aids Strikers on Coast
description: SAN YSIDRO, Calif., Sept. 11 The tortilla is taking its place alongside the Aztec black eagle as a symbol of Cesar Chavez's efforts to organize the several thousand Mexicans who come across the border here each day to work as stoop laborers on California farms.

title: Gillian Joins E. Stroudsburg
description: Ray Gillian, former Ohio State football player, has joined the coaching staff at East Stroudsburg (Pa.) State College. Gillian will be an assistant coach in both football and track and field. He is assigned to the freshman team in football, but he also will help the varsity. The native of Uniontown, Pa., a threeyear letterman at Ohio State from 196769.

title: LACK OF UNITY LAID TO PUERTO RICANS
description: A Fordham University sociologist says New York City's Puerto Ricans have found it difficult to achieve community solidarity, but suggests they may work out adjustment In very new ways differing from those of past immigrants.

title: Detroit Mayor Asks Statewide Drive to Ban Handguns, Possibly Through an Amendment to Constitution
description: DETROIT, Sept. 11Mayor Roman Gribbs called today for a statewide campaign to ban handguns, probably by a petition drive to amend Michigan's constitution.

title: L.I. Migrants Who Stay
Nebraska Victor Over Oregon, 347
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Sept. 11 Nebraska completely dominated Oregon as the defending national champions rolled to a 347 victory today in a football opener for both teams.

title: Looking for New Works?
Red Parties Report the Death, But With Almost No Comment
description: In the first comment from any Cominunist source on the death of Nikita S. Khrushchev, a masscirculation newspaper owned by the Italian Communist party said that his downgrading of Stalin had unleashed Democratic forces of dissent with the old paternalistic and repressive methods that reemerged also in the practice of the Khrushchev era.
