title: Eastern Air Sees No 1971 Profit
description: Floyd D. Hall, chairman and chief executive officer of Eastern Air Lines, said yesterday that he believes his company has an outside chance of breaking even this year.

title: Grand Circuit Card Canceled
description: DELAWARE, Ohio, Sept. 20 (UPI)Heavy morning rain caused cancellation of today's opening Grand Circuit harness acing program at the Delaware County Fairgrounds.

title: LAW SCHOOL JOINS WITH PAUL, WEISS
description: An unusual partnership between a law school and a private law firm has been formed here, joining Columbia University School of Law and Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison.

title: LIONS LOSE, 1643, TO VIKINGS
Soybeans and Corn Are Weak; Pork Bellies in Second Decade
description: Trading in soybean futures opened strong on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday, but buying support waned and the futures prices closed unchanged to off  cent a bushel.

title: SCHOOL POSTS PUT ON AN ACTING BASIS
description: Federal Judge Walter R. Mansfield issued an order yesterday making all vacant supervisory positions in the New York City school system available on an acting basis to candidates meeting standards set by state law and by the Chancellor and the Board of Education.

title: Text of 2 U.S. Draft Resolutions on China.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 20The following texts of two American draft resolutions on China have been circulated here by the United States. The recipients were advised that there might be minor revisions in the wording as a result of consultations but that no significant changes were expected.

title: Daley Denies Wife Induced Stores to Bar Book Boss
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 20 (UPI)Mayor Richard J. Daley denied today that his wifehad exerted pressure on a supermarket chain to removing the book BossRichard J. Daley of Chicago from its shelves.

title: Barium Cloud Created 20,000 Miles Aloft
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (UPI)  A fourstage scout rocket rose to an altitude of 20,000 miles tonight and then ejected a payload of barium gas, creating a glowing white cloud visible throughout the Western Hemisphere.

title: Senate Votes Pact on Rights Of Coast Nations in Oil Spill
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (AP) The Senate approved, 75 to 0, today a treaty establishing the right of a coastal nation to take whatever action it deems necessary to prevent, ease or end the threat of oil pollution from an accident at sea.

title: $2.75MILLION BAIL SET IN HEROIN CASE
description: Five suspects accused of smuggling 200 pounds of heroin into the United States from Europe were held by Federal authorities here yesterday in lieu of bail that ranged from $250,000 to $1million. The total was $2.75million.

title: Dollar Trading
PILOT TELLS TRIAL OF MYLAI REPORT
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Sept. 20 The helicopter pilot who first reported the slayings of civilians at Mylai 4 to his superiors said today he had been interviewed by a colonel several days after the incident.

title: Plea for Birth Research
description: Fears expressed only a few years ago for worldwide famines in this decade because of the runaway growth in population have been substantially alleviated by recent breakthroughs in food production. Yet the green revolution has merely bought time for proliferating mankind, according to Dr. Norman E. Borlaug, the Nobel laureate who pioneered in developing revolutionary new strains of wheat, rice and other new grains. Within twenty or thirty years, Dr. Borlaug warns, the growth of population will outstrip man's best efforts to continue increase food output.

title: Muskie Against Regional Choice
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Sept. 20 (UPI)Senator Edmund S. Muskie said here today that the selection of a new Supreme Court Justice should not be limited to the South.

title: Man in the News
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 20  Tran Van Huong, the unopposed vice presidential candidate in the October election, would clearly prefer to spend time with his books, birds and plants.

title: BIRTH CERTIFICATES AVAILABLE QUICKLY
description: Any person born in New York City since 1905 may now obtain a copy of his birth certificate within 48 hours, thanks to a newly automated recordretrieval system.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20Ronald L. Zeigler, the White House press secretary, denied for the third consecutive day reports from Japanese press agencies that President Nixon would fly directly from Anchorage to Peking. Mr. Ziegler said the President would return to Washington the next morning, Sept. 27, and aides said that Mr. Nixon would maintain a full schedule on Sept. 28, 29 and Oct. 1the three days when, according to Japanese papers, he is supposed to be in Peking.

title: Eagle Measure Endorsed
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (AP) An Interior Department official said today that the Nixon Administration favored increased penalties for killing bald and golden eagles. Nathaniel P. Reed, Assistant Secretary of Interior for Fish and Wildlife, told a House Merchant Marine and Fisheries subcommittee that he endorsed a measure that would increase maximum penalties to a $5,000 fine and a year in prison for the first violation and $10,000 and two years for subsequent offenses. Present penalties are $500 or six months imprisonment or both.

title: TWO N.B.C. NEWSMEN SIGN WITH PUBLIC TV
description: Public television has signed two former National Broadcasting Company correspondents for a new weekly public affairs program that will be seen on its network, including Channel 13 here, starting in January.

title: The Opera: Don Carlo
Air Force to Try Sergeant
description: MANILA, Sept. 20 (UPI)The United States Air Force announced today that M. Sgt. Raymond G. De Champlain of Lisbon, Conn., would go on trial before a courtmartial on charges of passing secret military information to the Soviet Union while based in Bangkok. He was arrested in July. No trial date was set.

title: A Disorder in New Orleans Jail Is Quelled
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 20 (UPI)Prisoners Staged a protest against conditions inside the Orleans Parish prison tonight by burning_ mattresses, chanting obscentities and waving Black Panther flags.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Zambian President Orders 20 in Opposition Arrested
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Sept. 20More than 20 leading members of the Zambian political opposition were detained today on the orders of President Kenneth Kaunda.

title: POLLUTION WITNESS REBUKED AT HEARING
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (AP) A water transport representative told a House committee today that water pollution Jaws that allowed citizens to collect money for turning in polluters were creating a Castrotype of government.

title: F.T.C. URGED TO BAN SALES MALPRACTICE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (UPI)  The Administration urged the Federal Trade Commission today to ban the common installment sales practice, under which consumers often must keep paying for shoddy goods.

title: Sony Earnings Rose 98% in Quarter
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: JOANNA AUCHINCLOSS
description: Joanna Russell Auchincloss, a former head nurse at Presbyterian Hospital and trustee of Union Settlement House, died of a heart attack on Sunday in Maine Medical Center, Portland. She was 82 years old and lived at 176 East 77th Street.

title: DELTEC PROTESTING MOVES IN ARGENTINA
description: Clarence Dauphinot, president of Deltec International, Ltd., multinational holding company, protested yesterday against determined harassment being encountered by the company's meatpacking subsidiary, Swift de la Plata, in Argentina.

title: Higher Rents Ahead
description: The rent increases facing families in New York City's 1.3 million controlled apartments may not prove quite so dismayingly extensive as initial reports have indicated, but they will be bad enough at the start of a national postfreeze effort to hold the line against inflation.

title: Orchestra Caste System Held Archaic
description: Rafael Druian, the new concertmaster of the New York Philharmonic, is an orchestral Brahmin, but he deplores the caste system that prevails in symphonic organizations. It's archaic, the 49yearold violinist said in Philharmonic Hall's Green Room during a break in rehearsal for tonight's opening of the orchestra's 197172 season.

title: Australia to CoSponsor U.S Move to Provide Dual Representation
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 20Australia became the eighth nation today to sign as cosponsor of two draft resolutions by which the United States hopes to preserve membership in the General Assembly for Nationalist China while admitting Communist China and giving it a vetowielding seat in the Security Council.

title: George Seferis Dies at 71; Poet W on '63 Nobel Prize
description: ATHENS, Sept. 20  George, Seferis, Nobel Prizewinning poet, died tonight in a hospital here. He was 71 years old.

title: HOUSE UNIT BACKS SINGLE TAX CREDIT TO SPUR BUSINESS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20The House Ways and Means Committee agreed tentatively today to reinstate the special tax credit for business investment in new equipment, but in a simpler form than that proposed by President Nixon.

title: 2 in Jewish Defense League Seized at Soviet Embassy
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (AP) Secret Service policemen arrested two Jewish Defense League members and dispersed 25 others in what the militant organization termed a New Year's memorial service today at the Soviet Embassy.

title: Diamonds Still a Girl's Best Friendand a Good Hedge
description: Diamonds are still a girl's best friend and a very good hedge against inflation, according to Walter Gilbelin, vice president of Giibelin, Ltd., the Swiss jewelry company.

title: Phosphorous Curb Asked
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (Reuters)Legislation to mandate a 30 to 40 per cent reduction in the phosphorous content of many highphosphate detergents was introduced today by Senator Robert P. Griffin, Republican of Michigan, the minority whip. He said an outright ban would not be justified at this time in light of recent Government statements.

title: Latins Ask Surcharge End
description: PANAMA, Sept. 20 (AP)The InterAmerican Economic and Social Council, which is part of the Organization of American States, approved today a resolution calling for the elimination of the 10 per cent import surtax announced by President Nixon in August. The resolution was approved by 22 LatinAmerican members of the council, the United States abstained from the vote.

title: Texas Now Rates No. 1 In the Fattening of Cattle
description: HEREFORD, Tex., Sept. 20In the Randall County feed yard today, 65,555 steers and 613 heifers chomped their way through 1.5 million pounds of milo, rice hulls, hay, barley, wheat, vitamins and molasses.

title: Msgr. William Hemmick Dead; First U.S. Canon of St. Peter's
description: ROME, Sept. 20Msgr. William Hemmick, the first United States priest to be named a canon of St. Peter's Basilica and a familiar figure in Roman ecclesiastical and diplomatic society, died at his home today after a long illness.

title: The Dangerous Illusion
description: The United Nations General Assembly convenes here today with a blunt warning from Secretary General Thant that the U.N. must very soon face the fact that it is a bankrupt organization.

title: Preliminary Talks Begun by Koreans
description: PANMUNJOM. Korea, Sept. 20  The North and South Korean Red Cross societies opened preliminary discussions today for a conference on the problem of divided families in the two Koreas.

title: LACK OF SUPPORT IN UPRISING CITED
description: The first convict to be paroled from the Attica Correctional Facility since the revolt there was crushed a week ago said last night that a majority of the inmates did not support the rebellion and that it would probably have collapsed in a few days.

title: Two Arrested in a Protest Over State School Closing
description: WILLARD, N. Y., Sept. 20 (AP) troopers cleared kicking and screaming protesters from the entrance to the Sampson State School for the mentally, retarded today and made a path for two buses carrying school residents to other institutions. Two persons were arrested.

title: Catholic Schools Teach Islam To Moslems on Philippine Isles
description: JOLO, the Philippines, Sept. 10  At Notre Dame of Jolo College and the seven high schools associated with it, Moslem religious leaders are teaching to Moslems a required twoyear course in Islamic theology, and a Roman Catholic priest is conducting an educational project to help young Moslems establish their cultural identity within their faith.

title: Seller Can Pass On Rise Due to Currency Changes
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20The Cost of Living Council ruled today that increases in the costs of imported goods due to higher rates of foreign currencies may be passed on in the form of higher wholesale and retail prices.

title: Notes on People
description: The 34th Treasurer of the United States will be Mrs. Romana A. Banuelos, a banker and businesswoman from East Los Angeles, Calif.

title: CORRECTION AIDES AT WORK IN TOMBS
description: A new prison program that will employ young men, some with arrest and drug records, as correction aides was announced yesterday by Correction Commissioner. George F. McGrath.

title: 900 Soviet Jews Petition for Aid to Go to Israel
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 20More than 900 Jews have signed an open letter to the Soviet leaders and to the United Nations General Assembly demanding assistance in emigrating to to Israel.

title: Proxmire Calls for Recall Of C5A Planes as Unsafe
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (Reuters)  Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, chairman of the Joint Economic Committee of Congress, said today the safety margin of the C5A cargo plane was dangerously inadequate although costs had doubled.

title: TURNER WINS CUP IN 5.5METER SAIL
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., Sept. 20 Ted Turner's Tiger, representing the United States, defeated David Forbes's Cerebella from Australia in the fifth and deciding race of the Scandinavian Gold Cup 5.5meter series today.

title: U.S. Reportedly Issues Ultimatum to 4 Asian Nations on Textile Exports
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 20 The Nixon Administration has issued a secret ultimatum to four Asian countries, warning them to cut back on textile exports to the United States by Oct. 1 or face stiff border controls two weeks later, the Common Market's Council of Ministers was told today.

title: ANGELA DAVIS: SEEKS SAN FRANCISCO TRIAL
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., Sept 20 (UP)  Angela. Davis's lawyers asked today that her murder trial be moved across the bay to San Francisco the only, county in which she has some chance, albeit slight, of receiving a fair trial.

title: 3 Inmates Slain by Slashing at Attica Are Identified
description: ATTICA, N. Y., Sept. 20All three inmates Whose throats were slashed a day or two before the police retook the Attica Correctional Facility were officially identified today. According to various morticians and medical personnel who saw the bodies, all three were white.

title: Munich Looks Good for the Olympics
description: Germany presented two different kinds of Olympic good news here yesterday during a briefing for next year's Games in Munich.

title: Philip Berrigan Is Returned To Danbury Cell After Fast
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mo., Sept. 20 (UPI)The Rev..Philip F. Berrigan and six other prisoners, pronounced fit after their monthlong fast to protest the prison parole system, were returned to Danbury, Conn., Federal prison today to serve out their sentences.

title: Bigger Role Sought
description: Ralph D. DeNunzio, chairman of the board of governors of the New York Stock Exchange, disclosed yesterday that plans had been made to spin off the exchange's Central Certificate Service.

title: 7 COMPANIES CITED IN WATER POLLUTION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 20 (UPI)The Justice Department filed charges today against seven companies, including two steel concerns, accusing them of polluting waterways in the Chicago area.

title: Aide Tells How Hirohito Uses His Powers
description: TOKYO, Sept. 20A senior chamberlain of the Japanese imperial court depicted Emperor Hirohito today as an attentive monarch who exerts a subtle influence on the affairs of government.

title: MRS.HAROLDMEDINA; JUDGE'S WIFE WAS 83
description: WESTHAMPTON, L. I., Sept. 20Mrs. Ethel Hillyer Medina, wife of Senior Judge Harold R. Medina of the United States Court of Appeals, died today in Central Suffolk Hospital in Riverhead after suffering a stroke on Friday. She was 83 years old and had homes here land at 14 East 75th Street in New York City.

title: U.S. DENIES 2 BIDS TO DRILL FOR OIL
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (AP) The Interior Department denied permission today for two new oil production platforms off Santa Barbara, Calif., despite assurances from the department's own Geological Survey that a major oil spill would be highly improbable.

title: Amex Stock Prices Are Marked By Small Shifts in Slow Trading
Civil Suit Against Alioto Comes to Trial on Coast
description: VANCOUVER, Wash., Sept. 20 (UPI)The $2.3million civil suit against Mayor Joseph Alioto of San Francisco came to trial today. The trial began with haggling over the selection of, jurors.

title: U.S. IS PREPARING PENTAGON PAPERS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20The Pentagon is preparing to send to Congress shortly a declassified version of the Pentagon papers on the history of the United States involvement in Indochina, according to the official Defense Department spokesman.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Treasurer: The President appointed Mrs. Romana Banuelos, a MexicanAmerican, to be Treasurer of the United States. Mrs. Benuelos, 46, now is chairman of the board of the Pan American Bank of East Los Angeles.

title: Slain Attica Leader Is Eulogized
description: FOCHESTER, Sept. 20Elliott James Barkley, one of the slain leaders of the Attica, prison revolt, received a hero's funeral here today and was hailed as a martyr to end man's inhumanity to man.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Preparatory Committee for Conference on Human Environment10:30 A.M.

title: British Say Dumdum Bullet Hit Soldier in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sept. 20 (UPI)A British soldier was shot in the back and wounded critically today by what the army said was a dumdum bullet. The outlawed Irish Republican Army said that one of its snipers had shot the soldier but denied that a dumdum bullet had been used.

title: Heath Calls U.S. and NATO Still Vital to West's Defense
description: LONDON, Sept. 20 (AP)Prime Minister Heath said today that growth of the Common Market would solidify the defense of Western Europe, but the United States and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization would remain essential to face the Soviet Union.

title: Brezhnev Due in Belgrade Tomorrow for 4Day Visit
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Sept. 20Yugoslav officials announced today that Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party chief, will arrive in Belgrade Wednesday for four days of talks with President Tito.

title: Goldman's Par 72 Leads U.S Senior Qualifiers
Governor Approves the Hiring Of 107 More Prison Employes
description: Governor Rockefeller has authorized the state's Department of Correctional Services to hire new employes in the aftermath of the Attica riot, despite a freeze on state hiring imposed nine months ago because of budget deficits.

title: Views of Mood Differ
description: ATTICA, N. Y., Sept. 20Differing versions of the mood and conditions of prisoners inside the Attica. Correctional Facility here were offered today by their lawyers and by members of the Governor's committeeto safeguard inmates' rights.

title: Death of Legislator's Wife Delays EqualRights Action
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (UPI)Because of the death of a House member's wife, the leaders of the House postponed today, for at least a week, action on a constitutional amendment to guarantee equal rights for women.

title: BRONXLIEUTENANT FINED BY MURPHY
description: The commander of the detecI tives assigned to the office of Bronx District Attorney Burton B. Roberts: has been found guilty of department charges of failing to take proper action on allegations of corruption brought against a detective under his command.

title: Egyptian Forces Are Reported on Maximum Alert for Defense
description: CAIRO, Sept. 20The Egyptian armed forces were reported on maximum alert today in the wake of recent shooting along the Suez Canal, but official emphasis was put on defensive, not offensive, preparedness.

title: Egypt Plans I.M.F. Purchase
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (Reuters)The United Arab Republic will purchase the equivalent of $32million in West German and Canadian currencies from the International Monetary Fund to reduce inflationary pressures and strengthen its balanceofpayments situation, the I.M.F. announced today.

title: 18 Films and an Innovation Set for Festival
description: Don't ask Richard Roud, who helps choose the movies for the New York Film Festival at Lincoln. Center, to name his favorites. If you do, you will only get a question for your question.

title: 2 HARVARD POSTS CREATED BY BOK
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Sept. 20 (AP)President Derek C. Bok of Harvard has announced the resignations of three deans and the creation of two new administrative posts.

title: Dunne Gets Convict Side Of Police Attack at Attica
description: STORMVILLE, N. Y., Sept. 20 Inmates of Attica who were transferred to cells in the Green Haven Correctional Facility here gave their version today of what happened in the yard of Attica's cellblock D before, during and after the police assault seven days ago.

title: N.A.S.D. TO EXPAND LISTEDISSUE STUDY
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo., Sept. 20 (AP)The National Association of Securities Dealers voted today to expand its study of listed securities in its automated quotations system, NASDAQ.

title: Sales of MutualFund Shares Topped Redemptions in August
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20Sales of mutual fund shares ex ceeded redemptions in August, the Investment Company Institute reported today.

title: GRETEL SYNDICATE NOT TO SEEK CUP
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Sept. 20 Sir Frank Packer, millionaire newspaper and television station owner, said tonight that the Gretel syndicate would not challenge for the 1974 America's Cup series.

title: EgyptianIsraeli Tensions Spur JordanGuerrillaPeace Talks
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 20The rising tension between Egypt and Israel has spurred efforts at reconciliation between the Jordanian Government and Palestinian guerrillas.

title: An Appraisal
description: In the agony of the Attica aftermath, the one fact universally agreed on by penologists and sociologists is the need for prison reform. The events at Attica took place at one of the newer and better New York State maximumsecurity prisons, completed in 1931. For the 40 years since it was built, Attica has been considered out of date by these experts, along with most of the country's other penal institutions.

title: A BOMB EXPLODES AT CONGO MISSION
description: A pipe bomb exploded in the entrance to the United Nations mission of the Democratic Republic of the Congo yesterday. and a 3yearold girl on the street outside was severely cut by flying glass.

title: Soviet Atom Blast Reported
description: UPPSALA, Sweden, Sept. 20 (UPI)The Soviet Union apparently set off an underground nuclear explosion in European Russia yesterday, possibly to change a river's course.

title: Garbage Crisis in Tokyo Reflects New Affluence
description: TOKYO, Sept. 20On a corner near a bus stop sits a battered sofa. In a pile on another street are an old television set, two lampshades, stack of magazines and two sleeping mats.

title: Nixon Criticized on Flight
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (AP) Representative Charles A. Vanik, Democrat of Ohio, accused President Nixon today of a gross abuse of discretion in flying Senator Robert T. Stafford, Republican of Vermont, from Vermont to Washington last week for a key draft bill vote. A Government plane was made available for the flight to the Senate. The vote to table the draft bill lost 47 to 36.

title: PAPERS STILL HALTED IN A BRITISH DISPUTE
description: LONDON, Sept. 20 (AP)Millions of Englishmen were without their daily newspapers today as the Newspaper Publishers Association shut the presses over a pay dispute. The only available paper in London was The Morning Star, organ of the Communist party.

title: MarketPlace:OliphantBullish On the Airlines
description: There is no question that some Wall Streeters, sensing a turnaround, have been taking a flier in the airline stocks. But the question is: Have the stocks discounted the future so much that they are currently overpriced?

title: 23 Die in Bombay Collapse
description: BOMBAY, India, Sept. 20 (UPI)  Twentythree persons were killed and 17 injured when a 100yearold, threestory building in the city's dock area collapsed early today. The collapse came about 4 A.M. while 33 families were asleep inside, the police said. They said the structure had been undergoing repairs. One family of six was buried.

title: Governor Asks Nixon for Storm Funds for City
description: Governor Rockefeller yesterday requested President Nixon to provide the city with about $2.8million in Federal disaster funds to repair damages to public facilities caused by recent storms including tropical storm Doria.

title: Advertising:
description: McCannErickson will soon be promoting Exxon gasoline in six cities. Exxon? Exxon?

title: Senators Make Bid Today for Shift to Texas
News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20The traffic at the White House, where labor, business, farm and Congressional delegations have been consulting with the President on the second stage of his wage and price program, has slowed down. With the sundry points of view now heard, Mr. Nixon and his Administration are ready to prepare strategy and tactics for controlling wages and prices after the current 90 day freeze expires at midnight Nov. 13. His decision will be announced within the next four weeks.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION RISES 6.2% IN WEEK
Books of The Tittles
description: THE TENANTS. By Bernard Maiavnud. 230 pages. Farrar, Straus and Giroux. $6.95.

title: Bomb Threat at Albany
description: ALBANY, Sept. 20The police closed down the 20story building where the State Department of Correctional Services offices are situated for almost six hours today after a bomb threat. No bomb was found. The threat, made by telephone to the city desk of The Albany Knickerbocker NewsUnion Star at 7:18 A.M., came three days after an explosion ripped through two lavatories and an elevator shaft about 200 feet from the office of Correction Codimissioner Russell G. Oswald on the ninth floor of 99 Washington Avenue.

title: Governor Sargent Vetoes Massachusetts Lottery Bill
description: BOSTON, Sept. 20 (UPI)Gov. Francis W. Sargent of Massachusetts vetoed a state lottery bill today, saying he doubted that a lottery would be a significant revenueraiser.

title: State's Joblessness 5.7% August, Off From 6.1%
description: The unemployment rate in New York State was 5,7 per cent in August as against 6.1 per cent in July, according to figures released yesterday by the State Department of Labor. However, the unemployment rate last month was considerably higher than that of August, 1970, when it was 4.5 per cent in the state.

title: 300 G.I.'s Quit Vietnam, Slowing Pate of Pullout
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 20 (UPI)The pullout of Americans from South Vietnam slowed last week, with 300 soldiers withdrawn, leaving 215,500 troops, the United States command repored today.

title: Soong Chingling Very Ill,' Visitor to Peking Reports
description: A freelance journalist who returned Friday from a 10day trip to Peking at the invitation of Soong Chingling, the widow of Dr. Sun Yatsen, founder of the Chinese Republic, said yesterday that Mrs. Sun was very ill with a painful skin disorder.

title: Art in the Capital: A Burst of Exhibits
description: WASHINGTON  Among the opening burst of art exhibitions in Washington, the National Gallery's John Sloan centennial retrospective, which opened to the public Saturday, is one of the major exhibitions of the season, and will travel to museums in Athens, Ga., San Francisco, St. Louis and Columbus, Ohio, before winding up at the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts in Philadelphia a year from now. The retrospective has been put together in very solid fashion, giving a survey not only of Sloan's painting but also of his graphic work, including some surprising very early and unfamiliar Art Nouveau drawings. But because it is such a sound survey  irreproachable as an exhibitionit reveals Sloan as a lesser artist than he has seemed.

title: Advertising:
description: Because of the tremendous outpouring of reader reaction to yesterday's column on a new anti perspirant, special efforts were made to bring you another column today of the same genre.

title: Another Susan B. Anthony Now Speaks Her Mind
description: Susan B. Anthony was in town yesterday, talking, among other things, about women's rights and her fear that liberated women were too easily accepting the values of the malecreated society.

title: Diplomats in Ottawa Say It Insists on Call for Nationalists Ouster
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 20Peking reportedly informed a number of foreign governments last week that it rejected any softening in the resolution calling for its seating in the United Nations and the simultaneous expulsion of the Chinese Nationalist Government on Taiwan.

title: Mon Dieu! Will the Suburbs Down the Flageolet?
description: ARPAJON, FranceAs they do after every fall harvest, tens of thousands of Frenchmen came to Arpajon this weekend to celebrate the shell bean known as the flageolet.

title: Washington Optimistic
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (AP) The State Department expressed increasing confidence today that its resolutions concerning Chinese membership in the United Nations were heading for success.

title: Bomb Interrupts Services In a Great Neck Temple
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Sept 20 (UPI)  Rosh haShanah services in Temple Israel here, were interrupted today when the police found a bomb in the wash basin of a first floor lavatory.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Thrasyvoulos Kamarineas, Director of the Greek Consulate General's Press Service, in his recent letter seeks to discredit without really denying my statement that the cruiser Elli, under his command, was a place of torture for political prisoners. He does this by asserting that the Elk was dismantled ten years ago and auctioned for scrap last year.

title: WESTBURY BEGINS SUPERFECTA BETS
Merger News
description: The American Financial Corporation said yesterday that it had acquired 285,000 additional shares of The Cincinnati Enquirer, Inc., increasing its ownership in the newspaper to 94 per cent.

title: LOUIS A. GEBHARD
description: EASTHAMPTON, Mass., Sept. 20 (AP)Louis A. Gebhard, retired head of the mathematics department at Williston Academy, died at his home here yesterday, He was 69 years old.

title: Football Escapes Philadelphia School Ax
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 19When the financially hardpressed Board of Education here announced a range of serious spending cuts last May, including an end to 600 teaching jobs and all extracurricular activities this year, the statement was met with a citywide chorus of cynical yawns.

title: NANCY SHADE MAKES CITY OPERA DEBUT
description: Nancy Shade, a tall and handsome young soprano with a voice worth investigating in more damatically demanding roles, made her New York City Opera debut on Sunday night as Musetta in the season's fourth performance of La BoMme. Miss Shade, perhaps responding too well to a director's broad and shallow conception of the grisette, concentrated on projecting her brassy vigor. While that is surely necessary as contrast with Mimi's fragility, there are subtler aspects to Musetta that should emerge in the thirdact quartet besides that of the shrew.

title: Fixed Fees Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 Richard W. McLaren, the head of the Justice Department's antitrust division, has informed Congress that he still believes sales commissions on stock transactions should not be fixed.

title: News Groups Appeal to High Court Against Subpoenaing of Reporters
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20Widely differing elements of the news industry have filed friendofcourt briefs with the Supreme Court in the past few days, warning that the increasing issuance of subpoenae to the news media is threatening press freedom but disagreeing as to what the courts should do about it.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Hudson Bay Mining and Smelting. Company Ltd., of Toronto announced that William A. Morrice, formerly executive vice president, has been appointed president. Mr. Morrice succeeds Eric S. Austin who has retired after 38 years of service but remains a director. He has been president since 1966. Joseph S. Warick was appointed vice president of mining and John L. Carpenter was made a vice president. Harold A. McKenzie continues as executive vice president and is now responsible for all mining and industrial operations as well as development projects.

title: Treasury Bills Yields Fall at Weekly Auction
Two Athletes Arrested
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Sept. 20 (UPI)The team captain and another member of North Carolina State University's basketball team were arrested today and charged with possession of marijuana. Paul Coder, the team captain, and Bob Heuts. a forward, were arrested in a park next to the campus.

title: Beacon Press Is Visited
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (AP) The Pentagon acknowledged today that, it had sent two officials to the offices of Beacon Press of Boston but denied trying to censor the publishing company's version of the secret Pentagon Vietnam war papers.

title: BOYD PRICES DROP ON A BROAD FRONT
Thieu Explains to the Vietnamese How They Can Vote Against Him
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 20  President Nguyen Van Thieu, in the second speech of his reelection campaign, today repeated his arguments for a hard stand against the Communists and, for the first time, told the people how to cast a no confidence vote against him.

title: City to Resume Negotiating With Sanitationmen Today
description: The city is scheduled to resume contract negotiations with the Uniformed Sanitalionmen's Association at 10 A.M. today in the union offices, 25 Cliff Street.

title: Specious, $80, Triumphs At Belmont by 3 Lengths
description: Handicappers who resorted to specious logic, at Belmont Park yesterday had little trouble piclking the winner of the $57,900 Lawrence Realization. The 79th running of the 1mile race produced a booming payoff of $80 when Elmendorf Farm's Specious tore up the turf course in the final run to the wire and scored a threelength triumph.

title: Park Group Scores City on Razing of Pavilion
description: A group dedicated to the preservation of Central Park charged yesterday that city park officials were indirectly to blame for the destruction of the Ladies Pavilion by vandals.

title: $200MILLION AID FOR JOBLESS SET
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20The Department of Labor disclosed today how it would allocate $200million for emergency public service jobs to areas with high unemployment.

title: MARKET ANALYSTS LAUD RCA'S MOVE
description: Investors and market analysts seemed to agree yesterday that the RCA Corporation had made a good move in getting out of the computermanufacturing business.

title: Evonne Goolagong Rejects $56,000 Tour Offer
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Sept. 20 (UPI)Evonne Goolagong, the Wimbledon champion, has turned doWn a $56,000 offer to play on the American indoor circuit this year, her coach, Vic Edwards, said today. He said if Miss Goolagong accepted an offer, she might have been banned by the Lawn Tennis Association of Australia.

title: Inform ality Marks Crimea Parley
Summer's Urban Violence Stirs Fears of Terrorism
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20The United States has passed through another summer without massive urban riots, but group and political violencefrom civil disorders to the ambushing of policemenhas become so widespread and persistent that some authorities find this more troubling than the concentrated upheavals of the nineteensixties.

title: Mrs. Eisenhower Aids Korea
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa., Sept. 20 (AP)Mrs. Dwight D. Eisenhower, widow of the former President, donated an Angus bull yesterday to the American Korean Foundation to be used to improve breeding of cattle in Korea.

title: End Comes To AlHoda, Arab Paper
description: The older generation of Arabspeaking immigrants is dwindling, their eyesight failing now, and AlHoda, the oldest privately owned newspaper in Arabic in the world, went to press here for the last time last week. The semiweekly had been published since 1898.

title: Met Opera Opens 87th Season
description: The curtain went up last night on the final act of The Bing Years, one of opera's longestrunning productions as the Metropolitan Opera opened its 87th season with Don Carlo. Sir Rudolf Bing, the company's 69yearold general manager, whose turbulent regime began 22 seasons ago with a production of the same Verdi work, stole several big scenes in spite of a supporting cast that included such celebrities as Mayor Lindsay, Maria Callas, Goeran Gentele, who succeeds him as head of the Met next season; Rafael Kubelik, the incoming musical director, and other spotlightwise celebrities.

title: 2 Funerals in Bronx
description: Santiago Santos, a 29ybarold Attica.,prisoner who had told his family a fortnight ago that he was writing a book on his finding God again,, was mourned yesterday in a Presbyterian funeral service in the Bronx.

title: Birth Control Advocate Cleared Of All Charges by Suffolk Court
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Sept. 20 All charges against William Baird Jr., the birth control advocate, were dismissed in Suffolk County District Court here] today after the District Attorney argued that we have no right to impose any personal feelings of morality one way or another upon society.

title: STUDY OF CITY BANK AND TREASURY URGED
description: The chairman of the House Banking and Currency Committee called yesterday for an investigation by the General Accounting Office, the Congressional watchdog agency, of transactions involving the First National city Bank and the United States Treasury.

title: Parity for Federal Employes
description: The Administration effort to build a special refrigerator to freeze the wages of Federal employes has suffered a merited rebuff at the hands of the House Post Office and Civil Service Committee. Whatever rules are established by President Nixon to curb the wageprice spiral after the present overall freeze expires Nov. ought to apply to Government workers, but there is no justification for imposing, upon them an arbitrary sixmonth delay in the 6 per cent pay increase they are scheduled to get next Jan. 1.

title: RABBI KLEIN ASKS FOR NEW FOCUSES
description: As worshipers filled temples and synagogues yesterday for Rosh haShanah services, a Reform rabbi pleaded for the cessation of the immoral, bloody, senseless war in Vietnam, that has divided the American people.

title: General in Charge Voices Doubt On '73 Shift to Volunteer Army
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (AP)  The general who is in charge of the Army's effort to raise an allvolunteer force says the Nixon Administration's mid1973 deadline is impossible to meet under current conditions.

title: Republic National Offering
description: The Republic National Bank of New York has announced plans to sell 447,972 new common shares through an offering to stockholders on a 1for4 basis. M. A. Schapiro & Co., Inc., and CBWLHayden Stone, Inc., have been named underwriters.

title: Testing a Cure
description: American correspondents recently in China have repeatedly sent back astonishing reports about the use of acupuncture in that country. This is a very ancient form of Chinese traditional medicine which seeks to cure illness by sticking needles into patients, the points of insertion being determined by the ailment being treated.

title: CHINA CLAIMS GAIN FOR THE ECONOMY
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 20Peking has claimed a steadily rising standard of living for the Chinese people as a result of state policies and of rising agricultural and industrial production.

title: Foiled Burglary at Cowles Estate Puts Westchester Police on Alert for Gang
description: NEW CASTLE, N.Y., Sept. 20The attempted burglary at the estate of Gardner Cowles, the publisher, over the weekend here has led many local lawenforcement officials to believe that a group of highlyorganized, professional thieves has returned to northern Westchester County after an absence of some months.

title: FOOTBALL GIANTS ON FINER GROUND
Woodcock Scores Program
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (UPI) The head of the United Automobile Workers Union, Leonard Woodcock, said today that President Nixon's economic progrom reflected a perverse sense of national priorities that would make the rich richer at the expense of the poor.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MRS. SALVATORE BIAGGI
description: Mrs. Mary Campari Biaggi, mother of Representative Mario Biaggi, Democrat of the Bronx, died yesterday in St. Clare's Hospital. She was 78 years old and lived at 2332 33d Avenue, Astoria, Queens. Her husband, the late Salvatore Biaggi, was a marble setter.

title: Common Market Is Urged To Join War. Against Drugs
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 20.The French Foreign Minister, Maurice Schumann, called on the Common Market and the four countries seeking to join it today to cooperate on a drive against drug abuse. He said later that the, reaction had been very favorable.

title: Head of Auto Group Says Nader Hurts Safety Effort
description: William Bachman, president of the American Automobile Association, which has 14 million members, charged yesterday that Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, is doing the cause of safety a dangerous disservice, United Press International reported.

title: Louis J. Schweitzer Dead; Founder of Vera Institute
description: Louis J. Schweitzer, who as founder of the Vera Institute of Justice was instrumental in obtaining reforms of the bailbond system and other court procedures, died of a heart attack Sunday aboard the liner France while returning from Europe. He was 72 years old.

title: Investment Bankers Ask End to Stock Certificates
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (AP) Governors of the Investment Bankers Association of America have urged the Nixon Administration and Congress to abolish use of stock and bond certificates in interstate commerce by 1975.

title: Wife Slain, Washington Lawyer Held
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (AP)A member of a socially prominent Washington family was killed last night at the family estate in suburban McLean, Va., and her estranged husband has been charged with murder.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ORIOLES'
description: The New York Yankees had an opportunity to bring their season play with the Baltimore Orioles all even last night, but the Yanks could not stand the prosperity of three leads and they wound up on the short end of an 84 score at the Stadium.

title: Cambodian Fuel Depleted
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Tuesday, Sept. 21 (AP)Officials here estimated that as much as 40 per cent of Cambodia's civilian fuel supply was destroyed yesterday when enemy demolition men fired rockets into big storage tanks on the outskirts of Pnompenh.

title: WAGNER UNIT URGES CHANGES AT CITY U.
description: The Wagner Commission studying the future of the City University of New York recommended yesterday that the state assume the burden of the university's operating costs because city residents are bearing a disproportionate share of the cost of higher education throughout the state.

title: Bankers to Meet With Connally Today
description: At 2 o'clock this afternoon, a delegation of 27 leading bankers is due to sit down, with Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally to discuss phase two" of President Nixon's new economic program.

title: Dupre to Fight Quarry
description: Jimmy Dupre, thirdranking lightheavyweight from Jersey City, andMike Quarry of Bellflower, Calif., winner of 30 straight bouts, will meet Oct. 29 at Anaheim Stadium in California.

title: Bridge: ?? For Slam Made by K antar
MARKET DECLINES IN SLOW TRADING
Rise in Smoking Predicted
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (Reuters)Americans, on average, will smoke more cigarettes this year than they did in 1970, halting the decline in cigarette smoking evident in recent years, according to Agriculture Department estimates that were released today.

title: Like the Greeks, Child Guides at Museum Have a Word for It
description: The Sardis column is what habitual visitors to the Metropolitan Museum of Art call it, and they use it as a meeting place because it stands by itself in the center of a room near the restaurant.

title: Murphy Modifies Accountability Rule
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy yesterday clarified his repeated warnings that superior, officers will be held accountable for the acts of their men, saying they will only be held responsible for a condition [they can] realistically affect.

title: DOLLAR PLUNGES TO A 22YEAR LOW
description: LONDON, Sept. 20 (UPI)Speculators acting on what dealers said was renewed American pressure for an upward revaluation of the West German mark sent the dollar plunging sharply today to a 22year low in West Germany, the third such plunge in a week.

title: Concern Sues to Get Giants Tickets
description: The New York Giants were ordered yesterday to appear in State Supreme Court Thursday to explain why they should net be required to sell six reservedseat tickets for each liome game to a 15year customer.

title: Rally Planned to Insist Rockefeller Quit
description: One of the major sponsors of last spring's huge antiwar demonstration in Washingtonthe People's Coalition for Peace and Justiceannounced plans yesterday for a protest they hope will be of similar magnitudein Albany on Thursday.

title: Argentina Utilizes 2 Exchange Rates To Save Reserves
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 20Argentina introduced a twotier exchange rate for the peso today in a new move to save scarce foreign currency reserves and solve a critical balanceofpayments problem.

title: Miss Martha B. Taft Is Bride Of Michael Golden in Scotland
description: Miss Martha Bowers Taft, a greatgranddaughter of President William Howard Taft, was married in St. Andrews, Scotland, yesterday to. Michael Golden. The Rev. Ian Paterson performed the Church of Scotland ceremony in the Collegiate Church of St. Salvator, official chapel of St. Andrews University, where the bride is a candidate for an M.Sc. degree.

title: Rights Groups Oppose Poff for Court
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20Civil rights groups are preparing to fight against Senate confirmation if President Nixon selects Representative Richard H. Poff of Virginia to fill the Supreme Court seat vacated by Hugo L. Black.

title: A House Interior Subcommittee Appears to Be Cool Toward a Complete Ban on the Strip Mining of Coal
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 20Militant conservationists, determined to bring a halt to the rapid growth of strip, or surface, mining for coal, were given a cool reception today as Congress began considering demands for Federal regulation to curb the environmental impact of such mining. But less sweeping measures drew strong support.

title: RESERVE SETS RULES FOR BANK HOLDINGS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 (Reuters)  The Federal Reserve Board said today that bank holding companies would be permitted to acquire ownership or control of shares of companies in which Edge Act corporations may invest.

title: Argentina Plans Peking Tie
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 20 (UPI)  Argentina's Foreign Minister, Luis Marfa de Pablo Pardo, said in a surprise announcement tonight that his country and Peking would hold talks aimed at establishing diplomatic relations. He said at a news conference that representatives of Argentina and Peking met in Bucharest early this month.

title: Mayors to Meet in Boston
description: BOSTON, Sept. 20 (UPI)Mayor Kevin H. White announced today that he would be the host for a meeting of 13 bigcity Mayors on Thursday. He said he hoped the meeting would focus attention on the problem of tax exempt properties in the nation's cities. Mayor Lindsay of New York will moderate the session.

title: Lutz Defeats Olmedo, Wins U.S. Hardcourt Tennis Title
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Sept. 20 (UPI)Bob Lutz defeated Alex Olmedo in straight sets for the singles title at the United States national hardcourtcentral California tennis open today. The scoresswere 64, 64, 63.

title: Proxmire Demands Gas Price Rollback
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20Senator William Proxmire urged President Nixon today to reverse a gasoline price increase established by the oil industry just before the Administration's price freeze was imposed.

title: U.S. JURY ACCUSES EXWALLACE AIDES
In This I Believe
description: Every Secretary General brings to the office his own personality, ideas and methods. The efforts and experiences, achievements and failures, of successive Secretaries General are the raw materials out of which the office has developed over the years on the basis of the very general description which is given in the U.N. Charter. Whiles the fundamental objectives of the Charter remain, circumstances change, new opportunities for development present themselvesand sometimes mew obstacles appear.

title: Kiner to Be Mets Hitting Coach
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 20  Ralph Kiner, one of the most prolific homerun hitters in history, will step from the broadcasting booth into a new role this fall: batting coach for the New York Mets.

title: 4 Aboard Private Plane Missing in Lebanon. N.H.
description: LEBANON, N. H. Sept. 20 (AP)A private plano owned by veteran., woman pilot and former newspaper executive disappeared while making a landing approach with four persons aboard tonight and was believed to have crashed on 2,740foot Moose Mountain.

title: New Orleans Jury Chosen For Trial of Gremillion
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 20A jury was selected here today to hear the perjury trial of Louisiana's Attorney General, Jack P. F. Gremillion, in Federal District Court.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Pakistan May Ask U.S. and Soviet to Take Hand in Seeking Dialogue With Mrs. Gandhi
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Sept. 20 A Karachi newspaper, quoting authoritative sources, said today that the Soviet Union and the United States would probably be asked to take a hand in peacemaking efforts if leaders of India and Pakistan could not be brought together.

title: Barber and Auto Worker Pose Productivity Issue
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20Two workers, one a barber and the other an automobile worker, each work about the same hours and currently receive about the same weekly income, $175.

title: Athletes'
description: TRENTON, Sept. 20 (AP)High levels of air pollution, not pesticide poisoning, caused the illness last Thursday of 34 junior high school football players at Quibbletown Junior High School in Piscataway, the State Health Department said today.

title: NEW CITY IS SEEN FOR STATEN ISLAND
description: A comprehensive plan for the development of a triangular section of South Richmond on Staten Island into a middledensity city of about 12 communities to provide potential housing and business opportunities for 420,000 people will be the subject of a two day public hearing starting tomorrow.

title: Sports of The Times
description: After the Giants had scraped the absolute bottom against the Philadelphia Eagles with the shabbiest of all their shabby exhibitiongame performances, one of the Eagles coaches found himself walking off the field with Emlen Ttinnell of the Giant staff. The Philadelphian was almost embarrassed because the lowrated Eagles had hooked like Super Bowl winners against the helpless and hopeless New Yorkers.

title: Glass Workers Strike
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Sept. 20 (AP) The American Flint Glass Workers Union struck six plants in three states today and said the walkout virtually halted production of fine table and art glassware in the United States. More than 2,000 glass workers are affected in Ohio, West Virginia and Pennsylvania.

title: SEX BIAS CHARGED IN TEACHERS SUIT
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Sept. 20Five women teachers filed suit today in Federal Court charging the Alabama school authorities with sex discrimination. They cited policies that either result in the dismissal of or force the resignation of pregnant teachers.

title: Enemy Commandos Kill 21 South Vietnamese
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Sept. 21 (AP)About 600 enemy commandos, attacking yesterday in darkness and supported by a mortar barrage, hurled explosives into a large base in South Vietnam that is used in operations in eastern Cambodia.

title: Atlantic Acceptance Offer Approved by Noteholders
description: TORONTO, Sept. 20 (Canadian Press)Unsecured noteholders of the bankrupt Atlantic Acceptance Corporation voted today to accept a settlement that will give them five cents on the dollar for the principal amount of their notes. The total involved is about $20million. The $150million corporation foundered in 1965 with a loss to creditors of about $55million.

title: West German G.N.P. Climbs
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Sept. 20 (AP)West Germany's gross national product hi the first six months of 1971 was 11.5 per cent higher than in the yearearlier period, the Federal Statistics Bureau reported today.

title: 13 Seized on East Side In 2 Narcotics Raids
description: Thirteen persons were arrested by narcotics detectives last night in two coordinated raids on an East Side hotel room and on a loft apartment around the corner. The police said they had confiscated more than four pounds of heroin, a quantity of amphetamines, three pistols and a knife.

title: ... Holding the Wrong Line
description: The rescue of varsity football in Philadelphia's high schools is a case of last things first. For any student it provides a revealing insight into a community'sand perhaps a nation'spriorities. The civic conscience the City of Brotherly Love had apparently slept through the imposition of severe cutbacks in the high schools educational programs and the virtual elimination extracurricular activities much more intimately related tothe learning process. But the prospect of a season without varsity football aroused the cityand its mayoral candidatesto righteous fury.

title: ROGERS WILL MEET GROMYKO ON FRIDAY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 (UPI) Discussions between Secretary of State William P. Rogers and Foreign Minister. Andrei A. Gromyko of the Soviet Union, beginning in New York Friday, will place emphasis on the Middle East and disarmament problems.

title: Bands in Nostalgic Night
description: Monday evening at Philharmonic Hall was a night for nostalgia. On stage were two bandleaders who have survived more than 30 years of the ups and downs of the big band business  Stan Kenton and Lionel Hampton. And on hand to introduce them was the legendary Symphony Sid, whose retchededged voice extolled various great gentlemen of jazz on the air and in concert halls all through the nineteenforties and fifties, but who has switched allegiance to Latin music during the last decade.

title: Miss Torna Bride Of Dr. D. J. Kurth
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., Sept. 21 Miss Rosaly Torna, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Nicholas Torna of Yonkers, was married here today to Dr. Donald J. Kurth, son of Mr. and Mrs. Donald J. Kurth of Rye. The Rev. Joachim Snyder performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of the Transfiguration.

title: Dr. Bernardo A. Houssay Dead; Won '47 Nobel Prize in Medicine
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 21Dr. Bernardo Alberto Houssay, whose discovery of the role of pituitary hormones in sugar metabolism won him the Nobel Prize in medicine in 1947, died today at his home here. He was 84 years old.

title: Youth Is Indicted For Fatal Beating In Park in Bronx
description: Bronx District Attorney Burton B. Roberts announced yesterday the indictment of 18yearold Michael Falco on charges of murder and possession of a dangerous weapon in connection with a fatal beating in a Bronx park last July 20.

title: Cowboys Acquire Caffey, Give Bears Draft Choice
description: CHICAGO, Sept, 21 (AP) The Chicago Bears traded the linebacker, Lee Roy Caffey, to the Dallas Cowboys today for an undisclosed draft choice.

title: Arms Meeting in Helsinki
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Sept. 21 (Reuters)tlnited States and Soviet negotiators met at the Soviet Embassy today for the 91st session of the talks on limiting strategic arms. There will be another meeting Thursday and the negotiations are then expected to resume in Vienna in November.

title: 1945 PLEAS BY HO REVEALED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21The Nixon Administration released to Congress today censored 7,800page version of the Pentagon papers. The text will be available to the public next week.

title: New Security Device
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 21A small California company, the Astrophysics Research Corporation, introduced a small device today that may make big difference in the $1billion a year in thefts of securities, bonds and other valuable documents.

title: HOUSE UNIT VOTES WIDER TAX CREDIT FOR BUSINESS AID,
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21The House Ways and Means Committee today voted major changes, mainly liberalizing ones, in the Administration's proposal to give businesses a tax credit for part of their expenditures on new equipment.

title: Executive Changes
description: Monsanto Company's president, Edward S. Bock, announced a new structural organization for the company to achieve worldwide growth and profit goals. The plan which becomes effective immediately, calls for the establishment of four worldwide operating companies each headed by managing director, a new executive position within Monsanto. The four companies are: Monsanto Polymers & Petrochemicals Company, to be headed by J. R. Eck; Monsanto Industrial Chemicals Company to be headed by C. P. Cunningham; Monsanto Textiles Company to be headed by Louis Fernandez, and Monsanto Commercial Products Company to be headed by Tom K. Smith Jr.

title: Canada Gas Plant Planned
description: CALGARY, Alberta, Sept. 21 (UPI)The Amoco Canada Petroleum Company, Ltd., a subsidiary of the Standard Oil Company (Indiana),. plans to build an $8million gasdehydration plant in the Northwest Territories to handle approximately 188 million cubic feet of raw gas daily from the Pointed Mountain field near Ft. Nelson, British Columbia.

title: Bullins, the Artist and the Activist, Speaks
description: Ed Bullins is a playwright and activist. He is one of the most prolific of America's younger playwrights, having already written 30 works for the theater including four plays toward his ambitious 20play cycle about blacks in America. He is now finishing No. 5, Home Boy.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Sept. 2I (AP)Vic Edwards said today that his remarks about an offer to Miss Goolagong had been misinterpreted. She did not. receive a $56,000 offer, he said.

title: SHIP OWNERS SEEK EASED SALES CURB
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21The owners of four American ship lines and the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Maritime Affairs urged a House committee today to approve proposed legislation that would permit ship owners under the Government's constructionsubsidy program to sell unprofitable vessels to foreign buyers.

title: All U.S. Units in Vietnam Being Tested for Drug Use
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 21 (AP) The United States command disclosed today that it was conducting unannounced urinalysis testing of all American units based in South Vietnam in an expansion of the drug counteroffensive.

title: Tension in Catskill Prison
description: NAPANOCH, N. Y., Sept. 21 Guards at the Eastern New York Correction facility in this Catskill Mountain community today described the prison as tense in the wake of last week's uprising at Attica.

title: Ulster Gunmen Plant Bomb In Police Station in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sept. 21 (Reuters)  Four gunmen shot their way to a police station in downtown Belfast tonight and exploded a bomb. One policeman was slightly hurt.

title: I.C. Industries Plans Deal;
description: Illinois Central Industries, Inc., announced yesterday it had signed a memorandum of intent to acquire Lincoln Consolidated, Inc., a financialservices holding company, through an exchange of stock.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
U.S. JETS ATTACK IN NORTH VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Sept. 22United States jet fighterbombers struck inside North Vietnam yesterday in force, dropping 200 planeloads of bombs on military positions in an area extending 35 miles northward from the demilitarized zone.

title: Soviet Firm in Opposing 2China Plan
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 21  The Soviet Union today affirmed its opposition to any formula for dual representation for China in the United Nations and called for universality of membership in the world organization.

title: Passengers Robbed Aboard Bus in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 21 (UPI) A young man wearing a blue velvet cap and carrying a pistol robbed several passengers aboard a Greyhound bus today as it rolled along a busy Chicago expressway during the afternoon ursh hour.

title: RAILBIRDS BLINK AT OTB TOTE. ODDS
description: When I Ching became the early favorite for the first race at Belmont Park yesterday, some of the railbirds started blinking back at the tote board.

title: Doctors Find No Injuries at Attica Since the Rebellion
description: ATTICA, N.Y., Sept. 21The chief doctor of the State Department of correctional Services said today that an independent team of nine doctors had examined all of the more than 1,400 inmates of the Attica Correctional Facility today and had found no wounds or bruises inflicted since the inmates revolt was crushed week ago.

title: Bank Merger Accord Set
description: The Manufacturers Hanover Corporation, parent company of New York's thirdlargest bank, announced yesterday agreement in principle to acquire the First National Bank of Bay Shore, L. I., in an exchange of shares worth about $12.5million.

title: WALLACE O. FENN, PHYSIOLOGIST, 78
description: ROCHESTER Sept. 21Dr. Wallace O. Fenn, a leading physiologist, died yesterday at his home here. He was 78 years old.

title: Resigning Harvard Educator, Fight Won, Says a Healer Is Needed
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Sept. 20 For the last two years or so, Harvard's School of Education. one of the most respected and influential in the country, has been riven by a sharp and bitter internal argument over what kind of a school it should be.

title: Knicks Top Bullets, 10492; Frazier Scores 15 Points
description: ALENANDRIA, Va., Sept. 21 (AP)Walt Frazier scored 9 of his 15 points in the fourth quarter as the New York Knicks pulled away from a 7573 thirdperiod lead to whip Baltimore, 10492, in a National Basketball Association preseason game.

title: ALBATROSS GETS AN OUTSIDE POST
description: DELAWARE, Ohio, Sept. 21 (AP)Despite an outside post position, Albatross rates a 65 favorite to win Thursday's $102,694 Little Brown Jug and wrap up pacing's triple crown.

title: Devine Meets With Team
description: GREEN BAY, Wis., Sept. 21 (UPI)The Green Bay Packers coach, Dan Devine, his fractured left leg in a hiptotoe cast, left his hospital room briefly today but was kept off the practice field by orders of his doctor. Devine met with the team in the locker room before practice and returned to St. Vincent's Hospital.

title: The Lopsided House
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21The House of Representatives this year has new Speaker and operates under new voting procedure, but it remains an unreformed institution which frustrates many of its own members and does not carry its full share of the burden of governing the nation.

title: The Administration's Vision of the World
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.Ever since Vice President Agnew asked President Nixon to remove me from the Scranton Commission, I have followed the statements and actions of Mr. Agnew in a perhaps hopeless attempt to understand what vision of the world motivates this Administration. Because Mr. Agnew speaks more frankly than Mr. Nixon, I had thought that his views might reveal the deeper philosophies that underlie the policies and directions of the President. No statement of the Vice President has more troubled and confused me than his recent denouncement of the leadership of black America during his trip to Africa last summer. Since that extraordinary condemnation of our black leadership, I have waited for some evidence that might explain this bitter attack by the Vice President.

title: France Planning to Urge Devaluation of the Dollar
description: PARIS, Sept. 21 (Reuters)France will urge a devaluation of the dollar at the forthcoming meeting of the International Monetary Fund, Finance Minister Valdry Giscard d'Estaing said tonight.

title: Japanese Government Drafts Plan for 10% Export Surcharge to Replace U.S. Import Levy
description: TOKYO, Sept. 21The Japanese Government has begun drafting a plan to impose a a 10 per cent export surcharge on selected goods in an effort to negotiate an end to the 10 per cent American import surtax.

title: Judge Enjoins Tennessee Canal Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 A Federal judge ordered the Army Corps of Engineers today to stop construction of the $386.6million TennesseeTombigbee Waterway until he could rule on whether the Administrationsupported project would damage the environment.

title: PRONE UNION HERE BREAKS OFF TALKS
description: The Communications Workers of America charged yesterday that the New York Telephone Company was refusing to bargain, and it broke off negotiations aimed at ending the 10weekold strike by 38,500 craftsmen.

title: Tribal Leaders Call for Direct Control by White House Over Indian Bureau
description: WASHINGTON; Sept. 21Indian tribal chiefs called today for the Bureau of Indian Affairs to be removed from the Department of the Interior and placed in receivership in the White House to enable Indians to gain justice and protection of their land and resources.

title: Savings Units Are Merged
description: The Serial Federal Savings and Loan Association, Manhattan, and the Prudential'Savings and Loan Association, Staten Island, announced yesterday that they had, completed their previously announced merger.

title: HEALTH CARE PLAN SET FOR PRISONS
description: The city's Health Services! Administrator, Gordon Chase,! acknowledging that medical care in the city's prisons had been very, very inadequate, announced plans yesterday to improve it.

title: REP. REUSS ASKS DEVALUED DOLLAR
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21A leading member of Congress on world monetary matters switched position today and advocated a devaluation of the dollar through a modest increase in the price of gold.

title: East Germans Get Bleak Economic Data
description: BERLIN, Sept. 21The East Germany Communist party leader, Erich Honecker, and his colleagues have given their countrymen a sobering report on current economic difficulties.

title: TRIAL OF ALIOTO IN A SLOW START
description: VANCOUVER, Wash., Sept. 21A civil damage action with political overtones opened here this week with all the speed of a tortoise race. After two days of questioning, three jurors have been accepted tentatively. It is predicted that the trial will last from two to four months.

title: Beyond Protective Reaction
description: For the second time this year American military aircraft have gone beyond the dubious doctrine of protective reaction to strike against military targets North Vietnam. The targets, according to official spokesmen, include supply depots and truck parks as well as the missile and antiaircraft sites that have been the avowed objectives of most earlier punitive raids.

title: Bronx Man Dies in Crash
description: A Bronx man was killed and a woman from that borough was injured this morning when their car crashed into a divider on the Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive. The police said that the car, driven by William Barkley of 730 East 163d Street, burst into flames when it struck the divider near the Brooklyn Bridge exit. Barkley's passenger, Dolores Kelly of 1030 Bryant Avenue, was rushed to BeekmanDowntown hospital.

title: Beirne Opposes Transfers
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 (UPI)Joseph A. Helmet president of the Communications Workers of America, asked utility commissions in 10 areas today to stop the transfer of telephone company supervisors to New York.

Salomon, a retired scout official and landscape architect, died on Sunday of a coronary occlusion while visiting friends in Bloomington, Ind. She was 68 years old and lived at 1 Sky Meadow Road.

Tass said that the satellite was orbiting the earth once every 89 minutes at maximum altitude of 185 miles and a minimum altitude of 131 miles. Its angle of inclination to the Equator is 65.4 degress.

title: Stores'

Three of the storesA.&P., AMart and WEO are operated by the Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company, Inc.; the othersFood Fair, Pantry Pride and Wholesale Cityby Food Fair Stores.

Internal Issues Cloud Israeli New Year Mood
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 21 The Israelis entered their New Year today in a mood of muted celebration, with far more questions than answers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It is surprising to see The Times express regret that the Oct. 4 election in South Vietnam will involve only one general instead of perhaps two or three generals as candidates [editorial The ThieuBunker Tragedy, Sept. 4]. Your premise seems to be that a meaningful free election is possible in that devastated and militarily occupied country. But the only legal and wellfinanced political force in South Vietnam is the huge militarypolice establishment, on the payroll of the United States, and appropriately headed by military men trained and formerly, employed by the French colonial power.

title: Humphrey Asks Clarification
description: BOSTON, Sept. 21 (AP)Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, Democrat of Minnesota, recommended today that representatives of the White House be scattered around the country to help local governments decipher Washington red tape. We must find ways to bridge the gap between Washington, bureaucracies and the local citizens, and we cannot expect our hardpressed local governments to do the whole job themselves, Mr. Humphrey told the International Association of Assessing Officers.

title: Rising Crime Stirs Fear On the Lower East Side
description: There are roaches in the apartment building Miriam Pinto lives in, and heaps of garbage too and not long ago she was feuding with her husband about the situation he wanted to stay there, in the decrepit buliding at 282 East Seventh Street, and she wanted to move across Avenue D into the Jacob Riis public housing project.

Y., Sept. 21 The Westchester senior golf championship, rained out last week and rescheduled for today and tomorrow, had to be postponed again today because heavy rain had caused the Quaker Ridge Golf Club course to be closed. The 36hole event was rescheduled for Oct. 12 and 13.

LOUIS R. NETTER

title: TONY VENZON
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 22 (UPI) Tony Venzon, a National League umpire since 1956, died yesterday in Shadyside Hospital after openheart surgery. He was 56 years old.

GATT Modifies Study
description: GENEVA, Sept. 21International trade experts were expecting the world's commerce to expand by 5 to 7 per cent in volume this year when President Nixon upset their calculations with his shock program for bolstering the United States economy.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 (UPI)A group of East European expatriates urged Congress today to approve a bill to provide continuing Government financing for Radio Free Europe and Radio Liberty broadcasts to Communist countries.

description: The National Football League's 13game program Sunday and Monday drew 733,065 fans, a record for a seasonopening schedule. The previous record was 705,111 last year.

description: The Federal Government succeeded last week in undoing several years of public education on the harm that detergents do to the nation's waters. In an action as unnecessary as it was sudden and confusing, four of its top health and environmental officials urged a return to phosphate detergents on the ground that alternative cleansers were worse.

description: Companies that transport 116,000 publicschool children to and from school will continue to operate today, despite a ruling by the Federal Cost of Living Council late yesterday denying their request for an exemption from the President's wage and price freeze.

description: Madison Avenue resumed its Tuesday evening Magic Promenades yesterday, with stores opened and the street closed to all but buses from 61st Street to 72d.

description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., indicated yesterday that it had placed the largest order in history for electronic stockmarket quotation devices with the newest competitor in the fieldthe International Business Machines Corporation.

title: 2 Democrats Urge Nixon To Name Woman Justice
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 (UPI)  Two more potential Democratic Presidential candidates urged President Nixon today to nominate a woman to the Supreme Court to succeed Justice Hugo L. Black, who is retiring.

title: FORMER CITY AIDE SENTENCED TO JAIL
description: A former antipoverty official who was once characterized by former Controller Mario A. Procaccino as a hardened criminal was sentenced yesterday to 20 years imprisonment for armed robbery.

title: Houston's Best Game as a Giant Earns an Encore for the Receiver
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Sept. 21 Ask Alex Webster, the New York Giants coach, what his team has to work on after Sunday's 4240 cliffhanging victory over the Green Bay Packers and he begins:

description: DORCHESTER, N.H., Sept. 21 (AP)A woman pilot was killed in a plane crash on a mountainside here, and an unidentified rescue worker died today when he fell from a rope lowered from a rescue helicopter.
