description: AMHERST, Mass. Sept. 25  Rick Klupchak, a sophomore halfback, scored on an 82yard run and on a 24yard pass from Bill Pollock today as Dart mouth opened its season with a 317 victory over the Univer sity of Massachusetts.

title: Cheesebox Callahan Goes Straight in Queens
description: The Cheesebox, a small es tablishment in a quietly re spectable section of Flushing, Queens, Is not a gourmet food shop.

title: At Least the Homo Sapiens Had a Wonderful Time at the Primate Ball for the Zoo
description: LOS ANGELESA pride of lions, a school of socialites, a galaxy of movie stars, a clutch of conservationists, and a 7,000pound elephant named Modock teamed up here Friday evening in the Theme Building of the Los Angeles County Zoo for a $100aplate romp to raise money for a new education center and new housing for the zoo's primates.

title: NEBRASKA ROUTS TEXAS A. & M., 347
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Sept. 25 (UPI)Johnny Rodgers, Bill Kosch and Bill Olds ran for touchdowns of 98, 95 and 67, yards respectively, today as No. 1 ranked Nebraska rolled to a 347 victory over Texas A. and M.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Down On the Farm in Queens
description: Summer ended last week in Queens, not exclusively to be sure, but there were the usual borough signs that the fun season was over: Some people who left their downtown offices in daylight reached home after dark, the kids were not on the streets too much after supper and Charlie Klein was bringing in the last crops of the year on his twoacre farm on 73d Avenue.

title: Dr. Sophia Kleegman, 70, Dead; Gynecology Professor at N.Y.U.
description: Dr. Sophia J. Kleegman, clin ical professor of obstetrics and gynecology at the New York University School of Medicine and a pioneer in human fertil ity, died yesterday of cancer in University Hospital. She was 70 years old and lived at 201 East 62d Street.

title: FOR JOHN SERVICE, A RETURN TO CHINA
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 26John Stewart Service, a State De partment specialist on Chinese affairs who ran afoul of McCarthyism after the war with Japan, returned to China today after an absence of 27 years.

title: Athens Trial Starts Today
description: ATHENS, Sept 26 (AP) Five persons, including Lady Fleming, 62yearold widow of the discoverer of penicillin, and two Americans, go on trial here tomorrow on charges of at tempting to help free a man convicted of trying to assassi nate the Greek Premier. The other defendants include Mrs. Athena Psychogious of Minne apolis, John Skelton of Yard ley, Pa., and Constantine An droutsopoulos of Athens.

title: Bridge:
description: An experienced foursome headed by Lew Mathe of Los Angeles and including Don Krauss of Los Angeles, Ed gar Kaplan of New York and Norman Kay of Philadelphia rallied to win the Interna tional team semifinal playoff match at the New York Hil ton yesterday.

title: Today to Cover Festivities On Persian Empire's Birth
description: The 2,500th anniversary of the founding of the Persian Empire by Cyrus the Great will be marked Oct. 15 by live cov erage of the festivities from Persepolis, Iran, by the Na tional Broadcasting Company.

title: MINISTER IN ULSTER RESIGNS IN PROTEST
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sept. 26  The Northern Ire land Minister of Community Re lations, David Bleakley, re signed today in protest over the Government's policy of intern ing suspected members of the Irish Republican Army without trial. He was due to retire from the Government on Friday be cause he does not have a seat in Parliament and nonelected Cabinet ministers can hold of fice for only six months.

title: Israel Is Firm
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 26Israel proclaimed tonight that she would not negotiate implemen tation of the Security Council resolution calling upon her to undo measures taken in Jeru salem.

title: MURIEL KIRKLAND, ACTRESS, 68, DIES
description: Muriel Kirkland, an actress who last appeared on Broadway a dozen years, ago as Abby Borden in The Legend of Liz zie, died yesterday of emphy sema and complications, in Beth Israel Hospital. She was 68 years old and lived at 360 East 55th Street.

title: Bears Down Vikings, 2017
description: If Kent Nix, continues to pull out lastquarter victories for the Chicago Bears, he might be elevated to the secondstring.

title: 2 Protesters Are Arrested Outside Soviet Mission Here
description: Two women were arrested on charges of disorderly con duct yesterday afternoon, in front of the Soviet Mission to the United Nations, on East 67th Street between Third and Lexington Avenues.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: FRENCH BULLDOG IS BEST IN SHOW
description: GOSHEN, Conn., Sept. 26  A 4yearold seal brindle French bulldog, Ch. Chaseholme Mr. Chips, owned, bred and handled by Mrs. Lavender D. Lovell, won his first bestinshow award today at the Northwest ern Connecticut dog show and obedience trial on the Goshen Agricultural Fairgrounds. There were 1,398 dogs in the show.

title: City Hall Notes
description: District Attorney Burton B. Roberts decided after some City Hall nudging that he would not accept a State Supreme Court nomination, thus saving Mayor Lindsay acute political embarrass ment. But there may be a Roberts on the bench in the near future, anyway. The prosecutor's brother, George, a Lindsay ap pointee as direc tor of legal af fairs in the city'sCorrection Department, is said to be in line for appoint ment to the bench by the Mayor.

title: Morton to Delay Decision On TransAlaska Pipeline
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (Reu ters)Rogers C. B. Morton, Secretary of the Interior, said today that there would be a further delay before he decided whether a transAlaska pipeline would be constructed to carry oil from Alaska's North Slope to the icefree port of Valdez on the Gulf of Alaska.

title: Thant Faces Tough Decisions on Jerusalem Issue
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 26 Secretary General Thant faced a series of diffi cult decisions today as a result of Israel's declared intention to defy the Security Council's call for a basic change in her hous ing and population policies in Jerusalem.

title: Small Business
description: Courtly, grayhaired Ben jamin M. Hines was 52 years old back in 1965 and the Cobra Pit was getting to him. He had been with sev eral major companieshe was, for example, director of marketing for a Richardson Merrill subsidiary and after that new products manager, then director of corporate services for General Foods and he found himself tied down, filing scores of boring reports and attending endless committee meetings.

title: Belgrade Accord Called Compromise
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Sept. 26The new Belgrade declara tion is seen by Eastern Euro pean observers here as a com promise intended to alleviate recent strains between Yugo slavia and the Soviet Union without seeking to solve the basic differences between them.

title: ARGENTINA EASES CURB ON IMPORTS
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 26 The Government's ban on im ports, imposed two weeks ago in the face of Argentina's worst balanceofpayments crisis in a decade, has all but been swept, aside by concessions and ex emptions.

title: JARMILA TACKOVA
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Sept. 26Jarmila Tackova, former Czechoslovak actress, the wife of Andrew Marton, motion pic ture director, died today in St. John's Hospital. Her age was 59. Also surviving are her mother and a daughter.

title: Comment by Douglas
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Sept. 26 (UPI)  Justice William O. Douglas has no objections to women on the Supreme Court even, he said jokingly, to seven of them. But not eight, Mr. Douglas added. I need a man to talk to.

title: Lindsay, in Arizona, Criticizes Johnson's Consensus Politics'
description: PHOENIX, Aria., Sept. 26 Mayor Lindsay Journeyed to this conservative heartland to day to begin three days of po litical barnstorming by address ing a fund raising barbecue for the Arizona Democratic party.

title: Hundreds of Quebec Police Walk Off Jobs in Pay Dispute
description: DRUMMONDVILLE, Quebec, Sept. 26 (Canadian Press)  Hundreds of provincial police men left their posts tonight to atend a study session follow ing their rejection of a govern ment offer aimed at settling their dispute over extra shifts worked last October after Que bec separatists kidnapped James R. Cross, the British trade com missioner.

title: Reform Democrats Pick Guenter To Oppose Rossetti for Post
description: Raymond Guenter, district leader of the New Chelsea Re form Democratic Club, was named by Reform Democrats last night to oppose incumbent Assemblyman Frank G. Rossetti in Thursday's election for New York County Democratic Leader.

title: Wilderness in the East
description: The word wilderness calls up mental pictures of the rugged and remote West where there are vast stretches of desert, forest and mountain land. But in the crowded, intensively developed East, wilderness areas do exist.

title: Radioactive Building Sand Stirs Dispute
description: DENVER, Sept. 26A con troversy involving nine states, Congress and the Atomic En ergy Commission is coming to a head in Colorado over the health dangers of leftover radioactive sands used by builders in thousands of locations.

title: RICHARDSON WINS DRAMA DESK PRIZE
description: Sir Ralph Richardson last week won the Drama Desk Award for the top performance in David Story's play Home, of the 197071 New York sea son. He edged out his costar, Sir John Gielgud, in the bal loting.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Statement by Humphrey
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (AP) Senator Hubert H. Humphrey said President Nixon's nomi nees for the Supreme Courb should be absolutely devoid of any tinge of racism  and be dedicated to equal oppor tunity and equal justice.

title: MRS. FRANCIS G. ROSS
description: Mrs. Marjorie Black Ross, wife of Francis G. Ross, retired executive vice president of the Chase Manhattan Bank, died yesterday at their home, 520 East 86th Street. She was 65 years old.

title: Marjorie Sims Wed
description: SALEM, Conn., Sept. 26 Miss Marjorie Joanne Sims was married, here this after noon to Scott Walker Law rence. The Rev. Joel Baehr of the Unitarian Universalist Society of Stamford per formed the ceremony under a maple tree at the home of Mrs. William M. Lieserson, grandmother of the bride. The couple's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Albert G. Sims of Greenwich and Mr. and Mrs. William C. Lawrence of White Plains.

title: FARRELL ELEVEN TRIUMPHS, 187
description: Monsignor Farrell, a Catholic high school independent foot ball power, extended its un beaten streak to 21 games (one tie) yesterday by defeating St. Joseph's of West New York, 187, on its home field in Staten Island. It was the 10th succes sive victory for Farrell.

title: U.S. Doctors Leave Peking
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 26 (UN) Two American doctors, Paul Dudley White, the heart spe cialist, and E. Grey Diamond, a cardiologist, and their wives left Peking for home by air today with a stop scheduled in Canton, the Chinese press agen cy Hsinhua reported.

title: U.S. Loses in Water Polo
description: HVAR, Yugoslavia, Sept. 26 (AP)The Yugoslav National water polo team defeated the United States, 106, yesterday, in the second round of an eight nation tournament.

title: Tutwiler Wins Crump Golf
description: CLEMENTON, N. J. Sept. 26 Ed Tutwiler Jr., trailing by three strokes with five holes to play, captured the 47th annual George Arthur Crump. Memorial Cup tournament today by beat ing Jimmy Sykes at the Pine Valley Golf Club, 1 up.

title: Sowells of Jets Starts Tonight Against Cards
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 26With an opportunity to make up ground in the Eastern Division of the American Conference, the New York Jets will start a rookie, Rich Sowells, at left cornerback against the Cardi nals here tomorrow night.

title: Mahalia Jackson Is III
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 26 (AP)Mahalia Jack son, the gospel singer, Is ill with a circulatory ailment and is being treated in the intensive care unit of the United States Army hospital here. Her condi tion tonight was described as satisfactory. The 59yearold singer was on a concert tour of West Germany and Switzer land.

title: Squires Wins 4Mile Run
description: Pete Squires, a 20yearold student at Manhattan College, running unattached, won the fourmile crosscountry run con ducted by the Road Runners Club of New York yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park. Squires, clocked in 20 minutes 10.4 sec onds, finished 10 yards ahead of Chris Mason of the New York Athletic Club.

title: TV in China Promises Special Report Tuesday
description: TOKYO, Sept. 26 (AP) Peking maintained, silence to day on unexplained develop ments in the country, but Canton television said it would carry a special and important news report on Tuesday night about circum stances of the commemora tion of National Day on Oct. 1.

title: MOSCOW DEMANDS LONDON CALL OFF EXPULSION OF 105
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 26The So viet Union called on the British Government today to revoke its ouster of 105 Soviet repre sentatives as intelligence op eratives and warned that, other wise, Moscow would have no choice but to retaliate against Britons living here.

title: Arts Abroad
description: AMSTERDAMThe people of the Dutch province of Zeeland, originally fishermen, farmers and dikebuilders, in the main still devoted mem bers of the Protestant Church and rigid in the teachings of Christ, must have had quite a shock when they heard of the discovery and salvage of a number of sanc tuaries of the for gotten heathen goddess Nehalen nia from the sur rounding waters.

title: GUARDS AND STATE PURSUE PACT TALKS
description: ALBANY, Sept. 26 (AP)An other meeting between dissident prison guards and representa tives of Governor Rockefeller's office is set for Wednesday here in an effort to conclude an agreement that would head off the correctional officers' threat to lockin prisoners at the state's correctional facilities, starting Oct. 7.

title: Reporter Who Came In From the Cold Leaves It to the Russians and British
description: PARIS, Sept. 26  Foreign newsmen occasionally catch a glimpse of the workings of British counterespionage, espe cially newsmen who have made professional and social con tacts with Soviet Embassy per sonnel.

title: The Right to Vote
description: Unless New York's election law is changed, over half of this state's 900, 000 18to21yearolds may find them selves without a vote in next June's Presidential primaries. The reason is simple. The state's archaic laws re quire voters to register and enroll by Oct 2, 1971some nine months before the balloting.

title: Chile Won't Enforce Ban On American News Agency
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 26 (AP)  The Government an nounced today that it had de cided to allow United Press International to continue oper ating in Chile.

title: StockFee Rise May Stir Fight on Salesmen's Pay
description: Wall Street's brokerage houses may be confronted with a major labor problem as a re sult of the Securities and Ex change Commission's decision to approve the new commission rate schedule proposed by the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Kidnapping of Priest in Panama Is Called Threat to Canal Talks
description: PANAMA CITY, Panama, Sept. 20The kidnapping and presumed murder of an obscure young Roman Catholic priest in a remote village in western Panama last June has sent shock waves through Latin Amer ica and may even threaten the continued control of the Pana ma Canal by the United States.

title: Books of The Times
description: The device of retelling Grimms' Fairy Tales is not an original one. After all, Donald Barthelme rewrote Snow White only a few years ago. Nevertheless, the device yields handsome returns for Anne Sexton in Transformations, her fifth and latest volume of poetry. For one thing, by retelling stories that are familiar to every one, she has produced a delightfully acces sible book. So Transformations should win her an even wider audience than have her previous four booksTo Bedlam and Part Way Back (1960), All My Pretty Ones (1962), Live or Die (1966), and Love Poems (1969)much praised and honored though these have been. For an other, more important, thing, by whisper ing her often terrifying visions into fa miliar and commonplace sounds, she has taken a long step toward solving a prob lem that has recurred in her earlier work.

title: DR. BLUMENFELD, 59, SURGEON, TEACHER
description: Dr. Emanuel Blumenfeld, an orthopedic surgeon, died Friday lof a heart attack in Ellenville, N. Y., while away for the week end. He was 59 years old and lived at 137 Claremont Avenue, Mount Vernon, N. Y., and in Glenford, N.Y. His office was at 1777 Grand Concourse, the Bronx.

title: 10 NATIONS TAKE STEP TO RESOLVE MONETARY CRISIS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26  The Group of 10, an organiza tion of leading Industrial na tions, took a first step today toward resolving the world's monetary turmoil.

title: GREAT DANE WINS AT VALLEY FORGE
description: COLLEGEVILLE, Pa., Sept. 26 Ch. Heidere's Kolyer Kim bayh, a fawn Great Dane owned by Dr. and Mrs. James Gribbin of Trenton, earned his second bestinshow title today at the 24th annual Valley Forge Ken nel Club event, which had an entry of 850.

title: RANGERS, WINGS IN GAME TONIGHT
description: Two of the National Hockey League's most touted rookies will make their first Madison Square Garden appearance to night when the Rangers face the Detroit Red Wings in an exhibition game, starting at 7:35.

title: Sadat to Visit Soviet
description: CAIRO, Monday, Sept. 27 (AP) president Anwar elSadat will pay an official visit to Moscow by midOctober at the invitation of the Kremlin leadership, it was announced today. This would be his second visit since he became President last year. The previous visit was made last March.

title: Pope Paul Observes His 74th Birthday
description: ROME, Sept. 26Pope Paul VI was 74 years old today, and Italian newspapers speculated that he might resign before his next birthday.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Sept. 26When he set out to reorganize the Supreme Court in 1937, Franklin Roosevelt had just won the most onesided election vic tory in modern American history. The Court seemed a feeble antagonist: Its invalidation of New Deal economic measures, at a time of disastrous de pression, had brought upon it both popular criticism and the scorn of legal scholars.

title: QUEBEC IS WOOING FOREIGN BROKERS
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 26In an effort to strengthen Montreal as a financial center, the province of Quebec is about to hang out a qualified welcome foreign ers sign at Place Victoria, the 44story building that houses the Montreal and Canadian stock exchanges.

title: East Berlin Guards Shoot And Capture Man at Wall
description: BERLIN, Sept. 26 (AP) East German border guards shot and apparently wounded a man trying to escape over the Berlin wall early today. Some of the bullets struck a house of the West Berlin side.

title: Dental School Here Aids Many With Its Low Fees
description: Although Gerald Berenson has no license, he performed dental work on dozens of pa tients last year, doing every thing from filling cavities and extracting teeth to forming dentures and implanting bridges. And there is a long list of patients waiting to see him.

title: Bowery Savings Appoints
description: The Bowery Savings Bank an nounced that Robert B. O'Brien Jr. will rejoin the bank as vice president in charge of business development. Mr. O'Brien left the bank in January, 1970, to accept the appointment as di rector of the Federal Savings and Loan Insurance Corpora tion in Washington.

title: Victim of a Shootout In Critical Condition After an Operation
description: A bystander who was wound ed Saturday during a shootout between two Housing Authority Patrolmen and a robbery sus pect in Brooklyn was reported in critical condition yesterday in the Brookdale Hospital Cen ter at Linden Boulevard and Rockaway Parkway.

title: EXREP.N.J.GREGORY OF KENTUCKY DEAD
description: MAYFIELD, Ky., Sept. 26 (AP)  Former Representative Noble J. Gregory, secondrank ing Democrat on the House Ways and Means Committee in the 1950's, died today. He was 74 years old.

title: Harlem Fire Destroys an Uninsured Store and a Man's Dream
description: A little more than a month ago, 33yearold Ronald Holly was one of the most successful black businessmen in Harlem. His halfmillion dollar  a year Clothing storeRonnie's Casu als on 125th Street near Sev enthwas doing so well, in fact, that he closed his other store In Queens and put all my pies in one basket.

title: Hulme Wins CanAm Race After Stewart's Car Fails
description: EDMONTON, Alta., Sept. 26 (AP)Denis Hulme of New Zea land won the 80lap Canadian American Challenge Trophy series auto race over a rain soaked track at the Edmonton International Speedway today in a McLaren.

title: OREGON WARMS UP FOR '72 PRIMARY
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Sept. 25 Just as others have for more than a half century, the cur rent crop of potential Presiden tial candidates has started to drop in to visit old friends in Oregon.

title: Birth Control in the Wilds: I
description: ROMESelfregulation of animal numbers has been one of the more dramatic revelations made by stud dents of animal behavior in recent decades. Contrary to all of our as sumptions since the days of Thomas Malthus, animal populations do not build up their numbers to that point where they encounter the veto of ex hausted food supply. A remarkable repertory of builtin mechanisms, be havioral or physiological, compel the normal species to keep the numbers of its young well within, the carrying capacity of its habitat.

title: More Negrees Hold Betterpaying Jobs
description: Negroes continued to pro gress up the occupational lad der last year despite the na tion's economic slowdown, ac cording to the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: Reverse Pressure in Saigon
description: Having refused to use the leverage of American aid to assure the South Vietnamese people a meaningful choice in their presidential election next Sunday, the United States is now employing that leverage bluntly to try to block the most likely alternate means for changing the leadership in Saigon. Administration offi cials have passed the word to South Vietnamese generals that any coup d'tat against President Nguyen Van Thieu would lead to the ending of American support.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: T. C. Jones, 50, Impersonator Of Famous Actresses, Is Dead
description: DUARTE, Calif., Sept. 26 T. C. Jones, the female imper sonator who, in theaters and night clubs and on television, burlesqued feminine foibles in general and mimicked famous actresses in particular, died yesterday of cancer at the City of Hope Medical Center. His age was 50.

title: BLACKS END PARLEY ON A 72 CONVENTION
description: NORTH LAKE, Ill., Sept. 26 (AP)A meeting of black po litical leaders ended early to day with a decision to expand discussions of a possible na tional black political conven tion early next year.

title: Bethpage Beats Westbury, And Wins Polo League Title
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Sept 26 Bethpage defeated Westbury, 43, today at Bethpage State Park and won the Metropolitan Polo League championship.

title: November's Steel Orders Indicate Trend to Normal
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 26Steel producers were approaching a critical order period last week. Customers were beginning to place orders for November de livery, and if mill calculations are right, many users should be in a normal inventory position by that month.

title: Nixon's China Trip Helpful, North Korean Leader Says
description: TOKYO, Monday, Sept. 27 (AP)Premier Kim Il Sung of North. Korea has said that he believes President Nixon's planned Visit to China will ease temporarily international ten sion, a Japanese newspaper re ported today.

title: Isaac Wins in Virginia
description: MARTINSVILLE, Va., Sept. 26 (AP)Bobby Isaac of Catawba, N. C., drove his 1971 Dodge to a onelap victory today in the $36,000 Old Dominion 500 NASCAR Grand National stock car race. Isaac averaged 73.681 miles an hour for 262 miles on the 525mile Martinsville Speedway. Bobby Allison of Hueytown, Ala., was second, Richard Petty of Randleman. N. C. finished third.

title: Indeterminate Sentences, Once Urged as Reform, Now Attacked
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Sept. 26The indeterminate sentence once the pride of California prison reformers  is coming under increasingly heavy criti cism as unrest smolders in the state's penal institutions.

title: Maralin Niska, in Tosca Debut, Interprets the Role Theatrically
description: The title part in Puccini's Tosca is a diva's delight, rich enough in subtleties of charac ter and shrewdly manipulated theatrics to give any intelligent soprano and her director all space necessary in which to create a real woman without bending the libretto out of rec ognizable shape. The famous Roman actress Floria Tosca is deeply religious, but also pas sionate enough to kill to defend her honor and her lover's life, possibly in that order.

title: Leslie Maddin Has Wedding
description: MASHPEE, Mass., Sept. 26 Miss Leslie Maddin, daugh ter of Dr. and Mrs. Robert Maddin of Philadelphia and Mashpee, was married here this afternoon to Robert Sieg fried, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Siegfried of New York and Patchogue, L. I.

title: Soviet Is Reportedly Yielding On Agenda for Europe Talks
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Sept. 26 The Soviet Union has given Finland a strong indication that it no longer wants the question of a balanced mutual reduction of European armaments to be taken up at the proposed Euro pean Security Conference, a Finnish source said over the weekend.

title: City Is Tightening The Administration Of New Relief Law
description: New steps are being taken to tighten the administration of the state law that since July 1 has required employable relief recipients to pick up their twiceamonth checks at state employment offices and to take available jobs.

title: Girl's Body Found in Jersey
description: MANVILLE, N. J., Sept. 26 (AP)  The body of a girl was discovered near a landfill site in this Somerset County com munity today and tentatively identified as that of Gail Ann Kalinowski, 13 years old, who was reported missing 18 days ago. Raymond A. Trombadore, an assistant county prosecutor, said positive identification would be made when an au topsy was performed tomorrow.

title: Unfreezing the Docks
description: President Nixon's personal intervention in the three monthold dock strike on the West Coast could provide the key to preventing a disastrous shutdown of all the nation's waterfronts this week.

title: Myopia Poloists Win, 158
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Sept. 26 Myopia of Hamilton, Mass., piled up an 113 lead at the half and coasted to a 158 vic tory over the Fairfield County Hunt Club polo team today in a game for the benefit of the New England Institute. Mike Andrew paced the winners with five goals. Butch Butterworth and Bill Whitehead had three goals each for Fairfield.

title: Theater Fund Will Allot $650,000 to Help Shows
description: The Theater Development Fund, the nonprofit corpora tion that provides financial assistance to Broadway and Off Broadway productions of artistic merit, has set aside $650,000 to help shows this season, according to Hugh Southern, the fund's execu tive director.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Role of Budgetary Curb In Attica Revolt Debated
description: ALBANY, Sept. 25  Cor rection Commissioner Russell G. Oswald maintains that the prison system is fiscally starved, but at least one of his associates is convinced that budgetary restraints were not a major factor in the Attica uprising.

title: Miss Mary Pleshette Married To Jack Willis, Channel 13 Aide
description: The marriage of Miss Mary Pleshette to Jack Willis, pro gram director of Channel 13/ WNET, took place here yes terday. Rabbi Philip Schech ter performed the ceremony at the home of Dr. and Mrs. Norman Pleshette, parents of the bride. Mr. Willis is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Willis of Los Angeles.

title: Advertising:
description: Norton Simon Communica tions, the new house agency of Norton Simon, Inc., is staffed up and ready to go and last week got its first as signment, some $5Million in billings from the HuntWes son subsidiary.

title: Candy Corp. Joins Venture
description: The Candy Corporation of America has joined nine Irish based concerns to create in Ire land new types of candies aimed at American tastes. Highly com petitive in their own domestic market, the companies have banded into a consortium, known as the IrelandAmerica Candy Corporation, in which the Candy Corporation holds a 38 per cent interest.

title: Man In the News
description: Dr. Lowell E. Bellin, the city's first deputy health commissioner, is a medical man with no illusions about medical and healthcare serv iccs in New York City. For many of the city's aging and poor people in need of care, he believes the qual ity of mercy these days is strained. He has seen too many occasions in which the vic tims of unethical practitioners and institutions seeking to de fraud Medicaid suffer un aware of the greed behind the masks of concern that go with their shabby, often un necessary treatments.

title: A Tax Form in Spanish Ruled Out by the I.R.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (UPI)Even though Spanish is the most widely spoken foreign language in the United States, the Internal Revenue Service has decided against writing a set of in come tax rules in Spanish.

title: Scribner Threatens to Remove Harlem School Board if Economy Orders Are Not Enforced
description: The chairman of a Manhat tan community school board, that has been ordered by Chan cellor Harvey B. Scribner to end its defiance of his economy orders by tomorrow or face removal asked for a threeday extension of the deadline yes terday to reassess our posi tion.

title: 3 STABBED BY MAN AT PENN STATION
description: Three men were stabbed out side Pennsylvania Station last night by a panhandler who the police said became enraged when passersby had refused to give him cash.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by the United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: MachineTool Orders Holding Steady
description: New orders for American machine tools, an important in dicator of the future capital spending plans of the country, remained virtually static in Au gust as buyers waited for a clarification of the proposed investmenttax credit.

title: Statehood's Not the Answer
description: The steady accumulation of city problems, aggravated by the State Legislature's harshly antiurban actions at its last session, has given new direction to citizen frus trations. It is, however, a wrong direction. The apostles at statehood for New York City are diverting attention from more realistic and urgent goals.

title: Sickle Cell Center Opens
description: MILWAUKEE, Sept. 26 (UPI) The Southeastern Wisconsin Sickle Cell Center, believed to Up the nation's first metropoli tan screening and treatment center for sickle cell anemia, was opened this weekend. The center will try to identify indi viduals with the hereditary disease, which afects Negroes only, and establish a registry for the sevencounty metro politan area.

title: Newark Transforms OnceWhite Suburbs
description: NEWARKWe're no longer a suburbwe've become part of the central city, said Mayor William S. Hart of East Orange, a once allwhite suburb just west of Newark that now has a majority of blacks.

title: GONZALES IS VICTOR; 2 WOMEN QUIT FINAL
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 26 (UPI)Pancho Gonzales gave his protege a lesson as he de feated 19yearold Jimmy Con nors, 26, 63, 63, in the final of the $73,000 Pacific South west open tennis championship today.

title: Senate Crime Hearings Set
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (AP) Organized crime's infiltration of business will be the subject of a long series of hearings by the Senate Commerce Commit tee, its chairman, Senator War ren G. Magnuson, Democrat of Washington, said today.

title: G.N.P. in 2d Quarter Is Revised Upward To $1,043.1Billion
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 The nation's total output grew somewhat more rapidly in the second quarter of this year than had been previously reported, the Commerce Department has disclosed.

title: 4 Uptown Art Dealers Set Up in SoHo
description: The invasion of SoHo, the grubby artists' neighborhood downtown, by a group of ele gant uptown galleries was rousingly celebrated Satur day afternoon in a refur bished loft building at 420 West Broadway. Three estab lished dealersLeo Castelli, Andr Emmerich and Ileana Sonnabendand John Weber, former director of the de funct Dwan Gallery on West 57th Street, officially opened quarters in the building, firm ly establishing the presence of Madison Avenue in SoHo, the area south of Houston Street, and giving it its first multigallery complex.

title: ROBERT HARRISS, COTTON BROKER
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Sept. 26Robert Mallory Harriss, a retired cotton broker and in vestor and a prominent patron of conservative causes, died to day in Southampton Hospital. He was 81 years old and a resident of Palm Beach, Fla., with a summer home here.

title: Plastic Surgery:
description: When I first began my practice, cosmetic surgery was almost on the same level as performing abortions in a garage on Sunday, said Dr. Dorothea Weybright, a West Palm Beach plastic surgeon who opened her office 11 years ago.

title: RICKOVER FEARS SECONDRATE U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 Vice Adm. Hyman G. Rickover in his annual lecture before the House Appropriations Com mittee, saw the United States becoming a secondrate world power unless what he de picted as the decline in its naval power is reversed.

title: Advertising:
description: Cox & Pare is beginning its second week in business on the right footannouncing a first client with $3.5mil lion in billings. It is the SaabScania of America, importers of the Swedish Saab car, the agency for which has been Kracht, Ryder, Minicus.

title: MRS. G. D. RICHARDSON
description: Mrs. Annie Bennett Richard son, widow of G. Darlington Richardson, organist at St. James' Episcopal Church for many years, died Saturday at the McCutchen Nursing Home in North Plainfield, N. J. She was 85 years old. Mrs. Rich ardson had been a piano teacher and organist.

title: A Jerseyan's Quest for Ecology Faces Default
description: HEWITT, N. J., Sept. 26 Fred Ferber and the State of New Jersey are in trouble.

title: BOND OFFERINGS AT RECORD LEVEL
description: The volume of taxexempt bond financing this week will total $950million, the heaviest weekly schedule in history.

title: Talks in Dock Strike to Resume Today on Coast After Nixon Plea
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 26 (AP)Negotiations in the three monthold West Coast long shoremen's strike resume to morrow after President Nixon personally urged both sides to reach a quick settlement.

title: 76ers Cut 3 Players
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 26 (AP)The Philadelphia 76ers, trying to make the 12man limit by their Oct. 12 opening game in the National Basket ball Association, placed three players on waivers today. They were Fred Crawford, Dick Hood and Wilbur Kirkland.

title: THOMPSON TAKES SAILING LAURELS
description: Emory Thompson Jr.'s 18foot catboat, Beerbubble, won over all honors yesterday in Douglas ton Yacht Squadron's seventh annual 10.7mile Windjammer race for vintage yachts to Prospect Point and return in Eastchester Bay.

title: Hirohito's Journey to U.S. Ends an Ancient Tradition
description: TOKYO, Monday, Sept. 27 Emperor Hirohito broke with 2,600 years of tradition this morning when he left by air liner for an unprecedented meeting with President Nixon in Alaska and a sentimental goodwill tour of Europe.

title: Dental Patients Cautioned On Overexposure to XRays
description: Dr. Mary C. McLaughlin, the city's Health Commissioner, has cautioned Medicaid dental patients against overexposure to radiation through repeated Xrays taken when patients go from dentist to dentist in the hope of expediting approval of dentures.

title: BROADWAY TO GET PAPP PRODUCTION
description: The New York Shakespeare Festival's musical production of The Two Gentlemen of Verona, one of three presen tations this summer at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park, will open Dec. 1 at the St. James Theater.

title: Detention Power and NoKnock Warrants Used Little in Capital in First 7 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26In the nation's first experiment with preventive detention and noknock police warrants, pros ecutors, judges and police offi cials here are making scant use of either one of the contro versial crime control measures.

title: 14 Planes Join Hurricane Seeding Tests
description: ABOARD STORMFURY AL PHA over the Atlantic, Sept. 26  Ginger is something of a dis appointment. She's lethargic, indecisive, and, alas, bereft of that classical form  the clear eye and welldefined cloud features characteristic of the more potent hurricanes.

title: Harris Captures $100,000 Robinson Golf by Defeating Yancey in a Playoff
description: ROBINSON, Ill., Sept. 26 (AP) Labron Harris ended a sev enyear victory drought when he scored a birdie on the third extra hole of a playoff with Bert Yancey and captured the $100,000 Robinson open golf tournament today.

title: ProRegime Demonstration
description: SAIGON, Monday, Sept. 27 (AP)  Twentythree disabled South Vietnamese veterans staged the first proGovernment demonstration today in South Vietnam's election campaign. Police broke it up after an hour.

title: Coast Savings and Loans Find Change to Stability
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 26 The California savings and loan industry, pitched and pulled by the tight money market of 1969 and early 1970, has found an unfamiliar trend of stability this year. The change bodes well for the availability of home fin ancing, not only in California but also elsewhere in the na tion.

title: MRS. OPPENHEIM JR.
description: Mrs. Frances Tenney Oppen helm, wife of Laurent Oppen heim Jr., a business manage ment consultant, died Saturday in their home at 700 Park Ave nue. She was 63 years old.

title: NIXON IN ALASKA TO SEE HIROHITO AT U.S. AIR BASE
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska, Sept. 26President Nixon arrived tonight for his historic meeting with Emperor Hirohito of Ja pan after a twoday, 4,200mile journey from Washington.

title: Lloyd's to Drop Polluter Protection
description: Lloyd's of London has noti fied hundreds of American companies that officers and di rectors insured against stock holder suits for wrongdoing will no longer be protected against suits as polluters of the air and water, it was disclosed here yesterday.

title: FELLOWSHIPS GIVEN BY KENNEDY SCHOOL
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Sept. 26 (AP)Don K. Price, dean of the John Fitzgerald Kennedy School of Government at Harvard Uni versity, announced today the appointment of 10 Fellows and Research Fellows at the Insti tute of Politics.

title: Expulsion Order Stands'
description: LONDON, Sept. 26 (UPI)A spokesman for the Foreign Of fice said today that the Gov ernment rejected the Soviet de mand to rescind the order for expulsion of 105 Soviet repre sentatives and that the Gov ernment was prepared to meet any Soviet retaliation.

title: 200 Cars Collide in Brazil
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Sept 26 (AP) Two hundred cars col lided in heavy fog on the An chieta road near here Saturday, leaving three persons dead and dozens hurt.

title: White Copters in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 26 (UPI)Six American Army medical  evacuation helicopters will be painted white and em blazoned with large red crosses in an experiment to try to res cue the number of such heli copters shot down while on mercy missions, the Army said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SERVICE HONORS BABI YAR'S DEAD
description: An overflow audience of 1,000 filled an upper East Side Orthodox synagogue yesterday to note the 30th anniversary of the Nazi massacre of thousands of Jewish men, women and children at Babi Yar, a desolate ravine at the edge of Kiev in the Soviet Union.

title: Blessing Angelica Wins as First Season of Sunday Racing at Delaware Ends
description: STANTON, Del., Sept. 26 Delaware Park's first season of Sunday racing ended in the rain today with the Hobeau Farm's Blessing Angelica winning the $124,400 Delaware Handicap at $25.40 for $2 and the manage ment expressing optimism over the track's future.

title: Patman Says He Fears U.S. May Be Near a Depression
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (AP) Representative Wright Pat man, chairman of the House Banking Committee, said today that he feared the United States might be heading into a de pression.

title: Coal Talks Reported Moving Toward a New Contract
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 Negotiators for the United ?? Workers and the nation's soft coal mine operators reportedly were moving toward an agreement over the weekend on a new contract for 80,000 miners.

title: Marlboro 300 at Trenton Postponed to Next Sunday
description: TRENTON, Sept. 26 (AP)A morninglong drizzle forced a Week's postponement today of the running of the $75,000 Marl boro Championship Trail 300 race for United States Auto Club cars.

title: Prisoners File Suit
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Sept. 26 (AP) Five inmates and former in mates of the Indiana Reforma tory at Pendleton have filed suits asking a half million dol lars in damages from the State of Indiana and 15 correction department officials. The suits stem from the disturbance at the institution Sept. 26, 1969, when two inmates were killed and 45 wounded by shotgun blasts fired by guards.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Mr. Davis, who is 45 years old, quit his Government post in June of last year after criti cizing the Administration's trade policy, particularly with regard to textile imports.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Diron Talbert is a 6foot5inch 255pound defensive tackle from Texas with a brush mustache, twinkly eyes, black cowboy boots and a massive physique, and you get the impression he isn't an easy target for the flimflam man. But Talbert has one weakness. And, though it will come as a surprise to Bernie Parrish, his weakness is a football coachhis own.

title: Corn Husking Winner Named
description: OLIVIA, Minn., Sept 26 (AP) Ellis Reay of Montdvideo, Minn, won the National Hand Corn Husking contest today by picking and husking 320.4 pounds of corn in 20 minutes. The contest was sponsored by the Olivia Jaycees and the Na tional Corngrowers Associa tion.

title: The Mule Is Following His Master Off the South's Mechanized Farms
description: BENSON, N. C., Sept. 26 The farewell grumble of most every Southern plowboy who left home in the thirties, for ties and fifties to seek a new life in the big city went like this:

title: Sierra Club Demands Logging Halt Near Redwoods.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26  The Sierra Club, a leading con servation organization, is de manding that the Department of the Interior put a halt to peripheral logging operations said to be jeopardizing the un completed Redwood National Park in California.

title: Personal Finance
description: Divorce American style usually involves the payment of alimony to a wife contin uing while she remains un married. The settlement also usually provides for support payments to the children until they reach a certain age, such as 21 or when they finish college.

title: Miss Robohm Wed To John Brownley
description: SOUTHOLD, L. I., Sept. 26 Miss Dorothy Robohm, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Claus H. Robohm, was mar ried here this afternoon to John Forrest Brownley, son of Mr. and Mrs. John W. Brownley of Cleveland. The Rev. Ben Burns performed the ceremony in the First Presby terian Church.

title: College Upsets Hit Near and Far
description: Rutgers's 3813 victory over Princeton was the most satis fying triumph we've had here, said Coach John Bateman, who has directed the Scarlet 12 years. Rutgers rolled up its highest score in the history of the oldest football rivalry for only its 11th victory in the 62 games played.

title: Wilder Winds Enliven Washington Jazz Fete
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 Several refreshing winds blew through the second day of jazz performances yesterday at the House of Sound Festival at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.

title: Giants Win, 125, to Stay 1 Up
description: CINCINNATI, Sept. 26Four white towels, the Giants' ver sion of the redcarpet treat ment, formed a path to Dick Dietz's locker this afternoon.

title: Taylor Tallies 2 as Victors Get 427 Yards
description: All the apprehensions stirred by their sixdefeat exhibition season, so happily dissolved in last week's openinggame vic tory at Green Bay, returned full force for the New York Giants yesterday as they were soundly beaten by the Washington Red skins, 303.

title: Miller's Boat Is Victor
description: OYSTER BAY, LI., Sept. 26 David Miller's Cuckoo II from Toronto won today's first race in the Soling Class world sail ing championships on Long Island Sound.

title: Plastic Surgery:
description: An old movie studio makeup trick, which instantly lifts undereye saggy skin, is finding its way into beauty sa lons.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Douglas Dillon Returns To Investment Concern
description: C. Douglas Dillon is return ing to the investmentbanking firm of Dillon, Read & Co., Inc., as chairman of the exec utive committee and a direc tor, it was announced for mally over the weekend.

title: Seaver Wins 19th on OneHitter As Mets Subdue Pirates, 3 to 1
description: Tom Seaver flirted with a perfect game and his season's 19th victory yesterday at Shea Stadium. He didn't quite make it to the former, losing the per fect game and shutout on three pitches in the seventh inning.

title: SCRIBNER ALTERS DROPOUTS POLICY
description: School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner said yesterday he would seek a major policy change in the city's high schools to give the 30,000 drop outs from the system each year a second chance to obtain a diploma through credit for out side work.

title: General Instrument Elects Executive Vice President
description: The General Instrument Cor poration announced over the weekend that Kenneth N. Davis, Jr., a former Assistant Secre tary of Commerce for Domes tic and International Business, has been elected as executive vice president, systems and services.

title: 12 Guards Said to Refuse Order to Let Attica Inmates Exercise
description: ATTICA, N.Y., Sept 26At tica prison guards refused to obey instructions to let prison ers out of their cells to exer cise on one occasion last week, a source close to the prison administration said to day.

title: Dodgers Hang On3 to Go
Mitch Leigh Weds Abby Kimbrough
description: Miss Abby Kirnmelman, an actress known as Abby Kim brough, was married here last evening to Mitch Leigh, who wrote the music for Man of LaMancha. Rabbi Ronald B. Sobel performed the ceremony at the home of the parents of the bride, Mr. and Mrs. Milton A. Kim melman of New York and Quogue, L.I. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. David Michnick of Miami, Fla., and New York.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Baseball Highlights
description: Baltimore became the sec ond team in major league history to boast four 20game winners yesterday when Jim Palmer hurled a threehitter and defeated the Cleveland Indians, 50.

title: GIBRALTAR SHIFT BY BRITAIN SEEN
description: MADRID, Sept. 26The deadlock between Spain and Britain over Gibraltar shows signs of easing slightly, ac cording to diplomatic sources her.

title: Foe Hits 11 Allied Bases Along Cambodian Border
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 26  Enemy forces today launched their heaviest attacks along the CambodiaSouth Vietnam border in nearly four months, hitting 10 South Viet namese positions and one United States base, according to field reports.

title: THIEU FOES TAKE A STEP FOR UNITY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 26  The fragmented op position to President Nguyen Van. Thieu's oneman presiden tial candidacy, acting after the apparent failure over the week end of planned mass demon strations, finally made an open gesture of unity today, a week before the elections.

title: FlatFeet Epidemic Here Halted as a Welfare Ruse
description: An epidemic of flat feet that had built up to prescrip tions for 17,000 pairs of ortho pedic shoes a month here, paid for under Medicaid, has been halted by the City Health De partment.

title: Bomb Kills 2 Americans
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 26 (AP)Terrorist bombs shat tered a quiet Sunday in Pnom penh, killing two American em ployes of the United States Embassy and wounding 13 at a ball game. Ten ?? the wounded were Americans, sev eral of them dependents of embassy workers.

title: Out of Sight
description: Operating on the out of sight, out of mind theory, the Administration has put on a skillful political per formance in dispersing and defusing the war on poverty.

title: The Nonwar War
description: The uncontested nonelection next Sunday for the South Vietnamese presidency has its counterpart in cre ative fantasy for over 200,000 Amer icans there: from the Delta to the DMZ and beyond they are shooting and be ing shot at in an unofficially unde clared nonwar.

title: A Theoretically Retired Commager Teaches On
description: Prof. Henry Steele Com mager, who has spent 45 years teaching history to col lege students, writing, and occasionally lecturing Con gressional committees, is call ing a halt of sorts.

title: Chess: Swiss Victory Puts Holes In Legend of Superpowers
description: The annual world junior championship in Athens was won by the unheralded 19 yearold Werner Hug of Swit zerland, as previously report ed. The result caused a mild sensationfor only the sec ond time in the history of the event did the title go to a representative of a country that is not one of the chess superpowers. The first time was 1967, when Julio Kaplan of Puerto Rico was the win ner.

title: DR. L. H. GIPSON, HISTORIAN, DIES
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Sept. 26 Dr. Lawrence Henry Gipson, the historian whose major work was the 15volume The British Empire Before the American Revolution, died in his sleep today in a nursing home here. He was 90 years old.

title: French Regime Claims Gain of 14 Senate Seats
description: PARIS, Sept. 26The Gov ernment claimed a gain of 14 seats in the senatorial elections today.

title: LITHUANIANS CITE CURB ON RELIGION
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 26  Some 2,000 Roman Catholics from a single parish in the Lithuanian Republic have charged in an Open letter to the Soviet lead ership that freedom of religion is being curbed by the local au thorities.

title: Chase Urges Nationwide Adoption of New York Abortion Law
description: The city's Health Services Administrator, urging yesterday that New York State's liberal ized abortion law be adopted throughout the country, dis closed figures indicating fewer illegitimate births and criminal abortions in the city since the law went into effect.

title: Meany Warns Nixon on Court Nominees
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (UPI)George Meany, presi dent of the American Federa tion of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, urged President Nixon today not to fill the two vacancies on the Supreme Court with reaction ary nonentities.

title: Cleveland to Hold Primary for Mayor
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 26On Tuesday voters here will take their first step toward choosing a successor to Mayor Carl B. Stokes.

title: Plastic Surgery:
description: Armed with the above quote, Mrs. Dorothy Uris, a Manhattan speech expert, has rushed to the defense of American women, whose voices were criticized on this page last Monday as being harsh and hardand almost always nasal.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: News Analysis
description: WALLA WALLA, Washington, Sept. 26President Nixon, who likes to recite his own historic firsts, is dominating the head lines and television screens all over the Northwest this week end with an innovation that was presented merely as his natural and necessary duty: personal intervention, backed by threat of action, to end the painful West Coast dock strike.

title: Ailing Woman Critic of Regime Held in Saigon Police Hospital
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 26Mrs. Ngo Ba Thanh, an antiGovernment and anti war intellectual, is again being held by the police over the protests of her lawyers and other Vietnamese liberals who oppose the oneman presiden tial elections next month.

title: Gains Seen in Arms Talks
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Sept. 26 (UPI)The Soviet Union's chief negotiator, Vladimir S. Sem yonov, said on his departure today that the fifth round of talks with the United States on limitation of strategic arms, which ended Friday, had been useful. The round opened up certain prospects for discus sion when the talks resume in Vienna Nov. 15, Mr. Semyonov said.

title: Bolt's 279 Total Captures U.S. Senior Golf by 5 Shots
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Sept. 26 (UPI)  Tommy Bolt captured his fourth straight United States senior open golf tourna ment today with a final 70 and 72hole total of 279. Bolt over took Pete Cooper, who was ahead by three strokes at the 54hole mark, to win by five shots. Cooper carded a 78 today and tied for second with Marty Furgol and Harvey Breaux at 284.

title: Text of Soviet Protest Note to Britain
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 26Fol lowing is the text of the Soviet note presented to Sir John Killick by the Soviet Foreign Ministry and later carried by Tass, the Soviet press agency:

title: Hadfield Paces Rangers
description: KITCHENER, Ontario, Sept. 26 (Canadian Press)The New York Rangers scored two goals in the third period to defeat the St. Louis Blues, 65, today in a National Hockey League exhi bition game.

title: Negro Teachers in South Seek to Protect Rights
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Sept. 26 Negro teachers in the South, whose professional edu cation associations have been merged with their white coun terparts in all but two states, are setting up blackcontrolled organizations or are turning to national organizations to pro tect the rights of black teach ers.

title: Smithsonian, Swept by Change at 125, Still a Haven of History and Folklore
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 It has been called the octo pus on the Mall, the nation's attic, a temple of learning and a lot of other things by those groping vainly to de scribe the indescribable.

title: Cowboys Crush Eagles, 427, Capitalizing on 7 Pass Interceptions
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 26 The Philadelphia boo birds are alive and well. These rabid fans have merely been relocated, from. Franklin Field to Veter ans Stadium. They booed and sang goodby here today as the home team, the Eagles, was routed by the Dallas Cowboys, 427, before 65,358 in the home opener.

title: Robert Zalisk Weds Eileen Lois Gordon
description: Miss Eileen Lois Gordon, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Morris Gordon of Yonkers, was married yesterday after noon to Robert Frank Zalisk, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Zalisk of Westchester, III. The Rev. Davis Lee Fischer and Rabbi A. Bruce Goldman of ficiated in the chapel of Co lumbia University.

title: Yanks Top Tigers, 32, on White's Homer to Snap FiveGame Losing String
description: DETROIT, Sept. 26 (AP) Rusty Torres, a rookie, hit a single, tworun homer and a pair of doubles today in pac ing New York to a 32 vic tory over the Detroit Tigers. The triumph snapped a five game Yankee losing streak and ruined Mickey Lolich's bid for his 26th victory.

title: GERMANHUNGARIANS TOP GOTTSCHEE, 51
description: At Metropolitan Oval, Mas peth, Queens, yesterday, some 2,000 soccer fans, mostly refu gees from Southeast Europe, were served frankfurters, sau sages and hamburgers by peo ple in the stands and six goals by players on the field.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Rule by Bulldozer
description: Governor Rockefeller is now throwing into high gear the propaganda machinery designed to induce the voters of New York City and State to approve on Election Day his latest supercolossal construction scheme: the pend ing $2.5billion highway and transportation bond issue. In its present form we do not see any overwhelming reason for accepting the Governor's proposal and in fact we think it would be a healthy indicator of discrimination on the part of New York's voters ifin the absence of concrete changesthey turn down this plan.

title: New Border Tensions Seen
description: PEKING, Sept. 27Diplo matic sources here indicated that an important development may be near in the Chinese Soviet border negotiations.

title: Mail Service Is Began On Last of Riverboats
description: CINCINNATI, Sept. 27 (UPI)A custom almost 100 years old was reborn today when the sternwheeler Delta Queen inaugurated riverboat mail service on the Ohio and Mississippi Rivers between Cincinnati and New Orleans.

title: ATOM GROUP ELECTS NATIONALIST CHINA
description: VIENNA, Sept. 27The Chi nese Nationalist Government on Taiwan was elected today to the governing council of the International Atomic Energy Agency.

title: Books of The Times
description: The biological remembrance of things past: This quotation from Ren Dubos sums up the burden of The Imperial Ani mal. The evolutionary history of the species both determines our present and coerces our future, for a species is what it is because of the pattern of successful adaptation built into its genes. It is pro gramed to grow and develop in a highly specific way.... To understand ourselves as a specieswhat authors Tiger and Fox call biogrammer is the first step in for mulating any plan or theory of social be havior. Plans are necsssary because our history may not have prepared us for our future. Altered circumstances may make our inherited pattern or strategy obsolete and even detrimental. Though the adapta tional strategies of the human species have been highly successful, this success now seems in danger of backfiring. The circum stances we have created are getting be yond our controlthe hydrogen bomb be ing only the most obvious example.

title: Buckley Chides Press, Too
description: ROCHESTER, Sept. 27 (AP) United States Senator James L. Buckley told New York news paper editors today that he was greatly disappointed by the way much of the press han dled the Attica Prison revolt.

title: SINEW UNREST EASES IN PAKISTAN
description: HYDERABAD, Pakistan, Sept. 12The clamor for independ ence in West Pakistan's prov ince of Sind has been muted almost completely, apparently as a result of the failure of the secessionist movement in East Pakistan.

title: Executive Vice President Elected President of I.0.S.
description: Milton F. Meissner, executive vice president of I.O.S., Ltd., has been elected president, the l'enevabased mutualfund group said yesterday. He suc ceeds Robert E. Slater, presi dent and chief executive officer, who will become vice chairman of the National Liberty Cor poration on Oct. 1.

title: U.S. CARDIOLOGIST DENIES HE SAW MAO
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 27Dr. Paul Dudley White, the Ameri can heart specialist, deflating speculation that he had been in Peking attending Mao Tsetung for a heart attack, said here today that he never even saw the Chinese leader during a 12 day stay.

title: U.N. Urged to Act on SouthWest Africa
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 27  The President of Mauritania, Moktar Ould Dad dah, who is also president of the Organization of African Unity, demanded today that the Security Council enforce its or ders to South Africa to give up control of SouthWest Africa.

title: Appointment Assailed
description: ALBANY, Sept. 27The ap pointment of the state police captain who ordered troopers to retake Attica prison as the head of a state police agency investigating the Attica episode, was denounced today by State Senator Samuel L. Greenberg.

title: I.M.F. HEAD URGES FINANCIAL CHIEFS TO WORK WITH US,
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 The world's finance ministers heard today an appeal from the managing director of the International Monetary Fund that they make every effort to cooperate with the United States in solving the long standing problem of the deficit in the American balance of in ternational payments.

title: PRO GOLP CHANGES TO CUT PENALTIES
description: The rule of golf that annoys many touring professionals the most is headed for oblivion. Effective Jan. 1, 1972, a player no longer will be penalized if his caddie rakes a bunker be fore he plays a shot from the hazard and such action does not assist him.

title: Copper Range Chairman Retires for U.S. Position
description: James Boyd, chairman of the Copper Range Company, announoed yesterday that he had retired from the com pany to take a new position as executive director of the National Commission on Ma terials Policy.

title: Lindsay Is Willing to Run in Primaries
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 27  Mayor Lindsay said today that he had no hesitation about running in the Presidential pri manes.

title: Brifge: Play Pleasing to Spectators Is Trying for Participants
description: The international team semifinal playoff match here during the weekend main tained its tension until the end, which was satisfactory for the spectators but had for the nerves of the participants. The final 18 deals began with Lew Mathe's team leading by 3 international snatch points the amount of a hotly de bated penalty for slow play assessed against their oppo nents early in the match.

title: 700 at Mamie Eisenhower's Jubilee
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 There was Ray Bolger sing ing Once in Love with Mamie, and Lawrence Welk reminiscing and leading the orchestra in The Yellow Rose of Texas, which was played countless times in the Lyndon Johnson years, but there was an Eisenhower favorite, too, and the Mili tary Wife of the Century award (a surprise) and a birthday cake on stage.

title: INSPECTOR FOILS ALLEGED BRIBER
description: An alleged attempt to bribe the secondranking officer in the police unit that enforces gambling laws in the city was disclosed yesterday by Man hattan District Attorney Frank S. Hogan.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Latest Rulings, PayPrice Freeze
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 Following is Policy Statement Number 25 issued by the President's Cost of Living Council on the latest rulings relative to the 90day freeze on wages and prices:

title: RoundtheClock Care Centers Envisioned by New City Aide...
description: If Georgia McMurray has her way, the city's child care programs will be vastly expanded and in some ways rev olutionized. And if past performance is any indication, the 36yearold head of the city's new Agency for Child De velopment has a very good chance of getting her way.

title: 9 Hurt in Springfield, Mass., As Racial Violence Flares
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Sept. 27 (AP)Racial violence that sputtered in the schools here last week spread to the streets today as officials met with stu dents, their parents and black leaders. Nine persons were re ported injured.,

title: '67 PLEDGES KEPT, THIEU DECLARES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 27  President Nguyen Van Thieu delivered a campaign speech this evening defending his four years in office.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: African Snail Reappears As Peril to Florida Crops
description: MIAMI, Sept. 24  A rein festation of the giant African snail in Miami's suburbs has raised concern that the large terrestrial mollusk, a tenacious and prolific pest in Asia and Africa, has established a foot hold for the first time in the United States mainland.

title: NORTHROP SHOWS LAG IN EARNINGS
description: Lower sales and earnings were reported yesterday by the Northrop Corporation for the quarter and fiscal year ended July 31.

title: Patman Criticizes Reserve's Expenses
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 Wright Patman, the chairman of the House Banking and Cur rency Committee, accused the Federal Reserve System today of spending money improperly on items ranging from enter tainment in Playboy Clubs to bonuses for employes who join a sort of agencysponsored mu tual fund.

title: I. M. F., Founded in 1944, Faces Test of Its Viability
description: Can the International Mone tary Fund find agreement on a way to piece together the shattered relationships among the world's currencies?

title: Soviet Nuclear Blast, 2d Biggest, Detected
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (Reuters)  A huge Soviet underground nuclear explo sion, the World's second big gest, was recorded today, the Atomic Energy Commission reported.

title: Nine Denominations Hear Protestants Must Regain SelfConfidence
description: DENVER, Sept. 27The or ganization that is seeking to unite nine major Protestant de nominations was warned at its 10th annual meeting here today that its goal would be mean ingless unless American Prot estants regained selfconfi dence.

title: ATTACKS PRESSED ON SAIGON ROUTES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Sept. 28 (AP)North Vietnamese troops reportedly kept up heavy pressure yester day for a second day against South Vietnamese forces guard ing the western and northern approaches to Saigon.

title: Albano Renamed G.O.P.Head
description: Vincent F. Albano was elected to a sixth successive twoyear term as president and chairman of the New York County. Republican Party last night. Mr. Albano ran un opposed for the position and was elected without argument by 1,400 city committeemen at the party's convention in the Hotel Roosevelt. Elected with Mr. Albano were Vice Chair man Mrs. Sheila Mosier, Treas urer Ervin Kirschenbaum and Secretary Raymond Shaffer.

title: State U. Is Divided Into Eight Regions To Spur Efficiency
description: A major reorganization of the State University, including di vision of the university's 72 campuses into eight regions that would carry out academic and other programs on a sec tional basis, is scheduled to be approved today by the univer sity's board of trustees.

title: AGNEW CRITICIZES MEDIA ON ATTICA
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 Vice President Agnew accused the radical left and news media today of seeking to transform the Attica Prison re volt into yet another cause clbre in the pantheon of radical revolutionary propa ganda.

title: Hirohito in Copenhagen at Start of Tour
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Sept. 27After 50 years, Em peror Hirohito of Japan re turned to Europe today for a nostalgic but whirlwind tour of Seven countries in 16 days.

title: DIMITRI ROMANOVSKY
description: Dimitri Romanovsky, an art ist known for his portraits, flower paintings and nudes, died Saturday night in St. Clare's Hospital. He was 85 years old and had had a studio in Carnegie Hall.

title: Expanded Power Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP) Senator Jack Miller, Republi can of Iowa, proposed today a bill that would expand jurisdic tion, of the TaftHartley Act to regional walkouts such as the West Coast dock strike.

title: Lawrence of Arabia Documents Sold at Book Fair for $24,000
description: LONDON Sept. 27Previ ously unpublished armed forces documents belonging to T. E. Lawrence that appear to cor roborate the statement that he was flogged by a friend while serving in the Tank Corps were sold here today for $24,000.

title: RemoteControlled Space Device To Be Built to Imitate Operators
description: BRUSSELL, Sept. 27 The desperate gunman is holed up on the second floor shooting at anything outside that moves. Suddenly a spiderlike device rushes to the door and up the stairs imprevious to the shots, and releases an incapacitating gas.

Miert, who is associated with Scholastic mag azine, died yesterday in Green wich Hospital of a cerebral aneurism. She was 41 years old and lived at 115 Putnam Park.

title: PACT ON PAY FLOOR ELUDES SHIPPERS
description: Negotiators for the Interna tional Longshoremen's Associa tion and the New York Ship ping Association met briefly yesterday but failed to re solve differences over the guar anteed annual wage issue.

description: The two most obvious features of the 303 licking the New York Giants took Sun day from the Washington Red skins have less obvious im plications.

title: PENNSYLVANIA BACKS VOTING AT CAMPUSES
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 27 (UPI)A threejudge Federal court affirmed today an agree ment by opposing counsel that Pennsylvania's 390,000 college students had the right to regis ter to vote from their campus residences, if qualified.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27Before President Nixon's meeting with Em peror Hirohito, many persons here had feared that the two men would find nothing to talk about because of the probability that no Emperor of Japan Will have anything at all in common with any President of the United States.

title: Milk Money
description: Last March 11, after careful review of the situation and the provisions of law, Secretary of Agriculture Hardin announced that for the marketing year beginning April 1, Federal price supports for milk would be pegged at $4.66 a hundred pounds, the same as last year. Dairy farmers angrily complained. On March 23, President Nixon met with a dozen representatives of the dairy industry. Two days later Secretary Hardin announced the price support, level would be 27 cents higher.

title: Scribner Bids Districts Abide By Budget Trims Slated Today
description: School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner refused yesterday to extend today's deadline for compliance with mandated budget cuts by the community school board of District 5 in Central Harlem.

title: IN THE NATION
description: Like the policeman, the prison guard is a muchmaligned man. To prisoners, they are all pigs; to many others they represent everything brutal and insensitive in American society. No doubt that view is warranted, in many cases; but as a general indictment is grossly unfair.

title: Player's Death Under Study
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., Sept. 27 (UPI)The University of North Carolina faculty athletic committee is investigating the death of a football player, Bill Arnold, Chancellor J. Carlyle Sitterson announced today. Ar nold, a sophomore guard from Staten Island, died last Tuesday after suffering a heat stroke during practice 15 days earlier.

title: A Charter Bus Service Is Suspended for 30 Days
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (UPI)  The Interstate Commerce Commission suspended today for 30 days Safeway. Trails's right to operate charter buses. The bus company was accused of violating safety regulations.

title: SCRIBNER MAPPING VOCATIONAL UNITS
description: A new approach to compre hensive education, enabling some students to take academic subjects at their home high schools and vocational courses at centers to be established, is being planned by School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner.

title: I.D.S. AGAIN SEEKS TO JOIN BIG BOARD
description: Investors Diverisfied Serv ices, Inc., the nation's largest mutualfund organization, has reactivated its application to join the New York Stock Ex change through Jefferies & Co., an I.D.S. brokerage subsidiary.

description: News Analysis

title: MISS DAVIS'S TRIAL OFF UNTIE NOV. 1
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., Sept. 27 (UPI)  A judge delayed Angela Davis's murderconspir acy trial today for five more weeks, until Nov. 1, to allow her attorneys time to wind up their arguments on pretrial mo tions, including a request to move the trial to San Fran cisco.

title: Right Words for Japan
description: President Nixon said the right things in welcoming Emperor Hirohito to Alaska On the first stop of the monarch's unprecedented foreign trip. Indeed, Mr. Nix on's words about the close ties forged by the two countries over the last quartercentury, and their deter mination to work together in friendship for peace and prosperity, furnished a most striking contrast to the Administration's recent roughhanded treatment of Japan.

title: Yom Kippur to Start At Sundown Today
description: Yom Kippur, the Day of Atonement and the most sacred holiday of the Hebrew calendar, begins at sundown today.

title: WELBY, M.D. TOPS NIELSEN RATINGS
description: Robert Young's starring vehi cle, Marcus Welby, M.D., finished first in the season's intial A.C. Nielsen rating survey released yesterday. Not one of the regularly, scheduled new series appeared in the top 10.

title: Dissident Poet in Turkmenia Is Reported Sent to Hospital
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 27A young Woman poet from Soviet Cen tral Asia was reported today to have been committed to a mental hospital after having sent to the Communist party's Central Committee in Moscow a 56page illustrated report complaining about conditions in her native Republic of Turk menia.

title: Steel Production Last Week Gained By 2.7 Per Cent
description: Production of steel in the week ended Saturday rose by 2.7 per cent, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yes terday.

title: Kenny's Jersey Mayoral Choice Has 2d Thoughts
description: JERSEY CITY, Sept. 27  John V. Kenny, the indicted Hudson County Democratic leader, has chosen John M. Deegan, the indicted Hudson County Supervisor, as the or ganization's candidate in the special mayoral election here Nov. 2.

title: Kennedy Bids Youths Vote
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Sept. 27 (AP)Senator Edward M. Ken nedy, Democrat of Massachu setts, called on American youths tonight to register, cam paign and vote this fall to avoid stewing in the juice of your own electoral decisions.

title: Harry J. Gray
description: The United Aircraft Corpora tion went outside the company yesterday and picked Harry J. Gray, until now senior execu tive vice president of Litton Industries Inc., to become United's president and chief ad ministrative officer.

title: Funds for Indians Allocated
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP)The Labor Department announced today an allocation of $8.4million of emergency employment act funds for pub lic service jobs for Indians.

title: Panther Trial Is Postponed
description: WINSTON  SALEM, N. C., Sept. 27 (Reuters)The trial of three Black Panthers came to an abrupt stop today when a Superior Curt judge ruled that grand jurors who had indicted the trio and veniremen who would have tried them had been selected unconstitutionally. The ruling of Judge. James M. Long postponed indefinitely the trial of the three Panthers on charges stemming from an alleged theft of menat last Jan. 12.

title: Urgent Moscow Meeting Of Politburo Is Reported
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 27Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Com munist party leader, reportedly held an urgent meeting today with other members of the rul ing Politburo at Vnukovo Air port immediately upon his re turn from a visit to the Balkans.

title: High Schools Are Urged To Assist Birth Control
description: Three New York City stu dents pleaded yesterday tor sex education in American high schools and readily available contraceptive information and devices for anyone who wants them, regardless of age.

title: No Swiss Revaluation Seen
description: DAVOS, Switzerland, Sept. 27 (Reuters)Swiss Finance Minister Nello Celio ruled out today the possibility of a furth er Swissfranc revaluation be cause of pressure from the present monetary situation, Ad dressing delegates attending the annual conference of the Swiss Bankers Association here, Mr. Celio also reiterated his call for a return to fixedexchange rates, adding that flexible rates could only be a temporary situation.

title: S.E.C. TAKES ACTION AGAINST J. H. RAPP CO.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission revoked today the brokerdealer registration of the. J. H. Rapp Company, Kenil worth, N.J., which had been ac cused of selling unregistered stock at artifically inflated prices.

title: Ford's Theater Cuts Its Ties to Circle in the Square

title: U.S. Force in Vietnam Now Down to 213,900
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 27 (AP)  American troop strength in Vietnam dropped by 1,600 men last week to 213,900, the United States Command announced today.

title: SOYBEANS MOVE UP ON HARVEST FEARS
description: The recent heavy rain over the Midwest that may have im peded the soybean harvest was believed to be the major factor in the buying of soybean fu tures on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday and their price rise of three cents to four cents a bushel.

title: Municipal Loan Inspectors Say They Played Role of Scapegoats

title: U.S. Judge Finds Detroit Guilty Of Planned School Segregation
description: DETROIT, Sept. 27  A Fed eral judge found today that Detroit's public school system had been deliberately segre gated, and he spread the blame to practically all of society.

description: The Continental Assurance Company announced yesterday a special. qualified pension plan designed for small, close ly held corporations and pro fessional corporations. Paul Green, vice president, said the plan could be added to fringe benefits without violating the guidelines of the present wage price freeze.

title: Mrs. Leland Hayward Is. Quietly Wed to Harriman.

description: Merger News

title: Plea by Nixon Fails to Spur Dock Talks
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 27 (UPI)  No progress was re ported today in the West Coast dock strike despite prodding from President Nixon for the parties to end the crippling waterfront tieup.
